Reviews.Title: “Perfect French Quarter base”
Reviews.Author: Lutz-Lady
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel is the best. Chandelers to knock your socks off. Dining room fit for a King or Princess. It is such a pleasure to enjoy a place with so much history....the city and especially this hotel. The rooftop pool was an extra surpise. A very good place to get away from the crowds and relax. Every evening at 10 pm they serve hot chocolate and peanut butter jell sandwiches....if you can't get enough food in New Orleans. The staff was very friendly and it was a treat. I left my computer in the room (I know how could I do that?) and they had it for me when I called. I was thrilled and very greatful. Some employees are getting up there in age at this family owned business and how special to see them treated as family. This is how America used to be. Just lovely. I hope I can stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff, old property”
Reviews.Author: jerrywesterby
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in Le Pavillion. Pros: 1) Friendly and helpful staff. I ended up asking for a few things during my stay there, and for the most part they came through. 2) Beds were comfortable Cons: 1) Asked for a wake up call - not done. 2) Breakfast was not great. They have a fairly expensive breakfast buffet that is mediocre, and they also charge you extra for drinks including coffee. 3) Rooms are small, old and mine had an unpleasant odour to it. 4) I found 2 plug points in the whole room. I lived in darkness as I had to unplug their lamps to plug in my phone charger and laptop charger. In this day and age, not really acceptable for a hotel in this price range. 5) Bathroom was small, old and had plaster flaking all over the place. All in all, it wasn't a bad stay. However, at $180-$350 dollars per night, it just didn't make the mark. I have had equivalent if not better stays in budget and mid range hotels for a fraction of the cost. I would probably give it 2.5 stars if I could rather than 2.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Again”
Reviews.Author: dld50
Reviews.Content: I took ladies to New Orleans for a short visit, the week after Christmas. What a great time to see the city! We stayed at the Le Pavillon Hotel. Our accomodations were updated to a suite, and I can't say enough about the beautiful hotel or staff. They know what they are doing. It's french themed, and done tastefully. Peanut Butter Sandwiches and hot chocolate was enjoyed even though we weren't even all that hungry. I highly reccomend New Orleans and Le Pavillon for your next stay. The holidays were extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property!”
Reviews.Author: sarlaura
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the first time this past weekend. I always stay in the Quarter but could not find a room. Our stay was fabulous. The staff is the best and our room was quiet and beautifully appointed. We had a jacuzzi tub in our room!! We ordered room service breakfast and it was great. We'll go back!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: kfred0726
Reviews.Content: While we certainly enjoyed everything the French Quarter, and the rest of New Orleans, had to offer, the elegant Le Pavillon was a welcome oasis at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Jenn_DC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Pavillon over Easter weekend and really enjoyed it. The location is great - you can walk into the quarter easily but not have to put up with the noise or ruckus of the quarter in the middle of the night- and the lobby is really gorgeous. The most memorable part of the trip was the hotel's easter celebration- very nice touch! I will say that the rooms could use some updating, but that shouldn't put anyone off because they're clean and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: Tripseekers15
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Nola for French Quarter fest and this was a great location. Also, be prepared to wear some comfy shoes because there is a lot of walking needed if you REALLy want to se Nola. After a night of partying, the rooftop was great because there's a hottub and heated pool to help your sore dawgs after walking/ dancing Bourbon Street and all. We met some really fun people in the hot tub AND continued to drink. Nobody from the hotel got on to us after being there after hours too. Yay!! P & J sandwiches are ok but I can see them being a lot better if you have been drinking. All in all, we had a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding reception at le pavIllon”
Reviews.Author: alice913
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step into this beautiful, historic hotel you will be impressed. The lobby area is very French Provincial and very very well kept. Every staff member that you come in contact with is friendly and professional. The wedding reception that we attended was in the lobby bar area and the main floor ballroom. The food was incredible rivaling any first class wedding in New York. The service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariaVG
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. It is a lovely old hotel and the grand entry is gorgeous. The rooms are a little small as is the bathroom, but the prices are very reasonable compared to other hotels. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. We love the location since it is away from the hoopla of the French Quarter but within easy walking distance. Trolley cars are a block away to take you to the Garden district and onwards. A very pleasant stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, wonderful atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: jandd315
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time visiting Le Pavillon! I had a conference and brought my boyfriend with me for our anniversary. When the staff found out we were celebrating, they were wonderful. We got a fabulous room and were surprised with champagne and strawberries our first evening of the stay. The rooftop pool and deck area were a great place to enjoy our peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and hot chocolate that are available in the lobby every night. We will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Sheets weren't clean, but excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Akito M
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a charming atmosphere and excellent service, however I did hope for clean sheets. The location is fairly good and I did enjoy the PB&J sandwiches. When I arrived at the hotel, I was impressed with the ornate lobby and courteous staff. The first room we were in was nice but as I was reading some brochures on the bed, a roach ran across the bedspread. At this point, I am thinking that this may be an isolated incident so I just dispose of the roach and continue reading. Later that night, as I pull the covers I notice a lot of "stuff" on the linens. Okay, this really bothers me. I can deal with some dirt and grime on the walls and even in the bathroom, but I have to have clean linens. Its really late and I don't feel like changing rooms. Fortunately, we got double beds. (My gf has the tendency of taking the entire bed. Even in a King, I always end up on the edge of the bed nearly falling off) I checked my gf's bed and it appears to be clean; since it is very late and we didn't feel like packing everything up, we decide to sleep in the clean bed (closest to the window). Although we didn't sleep well with the both of us in there, I think the beds would have been comfortable. So in the morning, I let the front desk know and that there was a roach in the room and the linens weren't clean. They were very understanding, apologized, and let me change rooms. Unfortunately, the second room we were in, had the same problem. It was odd that the bed closest to the door was always unclean while the one near the window was cleaner. I think our room was booked as non-refundable. I might have been able to talk to them and go to another hotel, but I'd rather spend my time exploring New Orleans than changing hotels. I would have given this hotel a 2.5 but I rounded up since the staff was excellent and even sent up wine, fruit, and other snacks as an apology for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Older Elegant Hotel w/ Great Location right outside French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Livewild
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early in the morning at around 2am and we were promptly checked in. Our room was 721. The room was very elegant with dim lighting which set a very nice mood in the room. Our room had no real view. You looked across the street at the building next to the hotel. This was not an issue for us. The hotel had a very nice ambiance. We really enjoyed staying there. Room size: Adequate Bathroom: Small but updated nicely. Not much counter space. Bed: Very comfy. Pillows were extra high loft, non-allergenic, polyester fiberfill. I asked for soft feather pillows and they brought them to us within minutes of our request. Hotel restaurant: Did not eat there Hotel bar: Very nice. Has at least one nice chess set, if you, like to play Hotel terrace: Small dipping pool, hot tub and about six lounge chairs around the pool. Very small area. There is also a couple of cabanas with lounge chairs off to side away from pool and a few two top tables. It is a very relaxing area. We went up on a Friday night at 11pm and the terrace was all ours! Amazing! Noise level: Our room was across from ice maker closet and the guest in the adjoining room were very load (shouting, etc.) the first night. We turned down the air conditioner temp and turned up the fan and it seemed to drown out most of the noise. I would recommend bringing ear plugs. Location: We were there for the final four games and I think this hotel had one of the best locations! It was an easy walk to the Superdome and, trust me, traffic was hell even if you were trying to drive 4 blocks to the game. Being able to walk was a huge plus. The hotel is also only about a 5 minute walk to the edge of the French Quarter. Night time snack: PB&J sandwiches and hot cocoa severed at 10 pm in the lobby are a nice touch. Service: Staff was not overly friendly. This may bother some people but it did not bother us. If you are in New Orleans to party in the French Quarter this may not be the hotel for you but for our purpose it was great! We paid an average of $477.17 a night which is crazy however this was during the final four games and we booked last minute through Orbitz. This was a steal as other rooms where going well over $1k per night a few weeks earlier and on the day I booked there were no other hotels with rooms available in NOLA! I had been checking daily for hotels to open up so to get one for this price so late was awesome! If I was to stay here again I would say that anywhere in the $180-$250 range is a reasonable price for this specific hotel depending on the season.

Reviews.Title: “Historical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: primejester
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the NCAA Final Four and championship. The hotel is an older building in the center of down town New Orleans. The dÃ©cor is very colonial with huge crystal chandeliers. The room was small but clean. The bathroom was also on the small side and only one person could fit in there at a time. The service was excellent and the location was great. A few blocks from the French Quarter, Super Dome, casino, World War II museum and the river front. You could walk to almost all the areas that you wanted to within 10-15 minutes. The street cars can get you to the same places. The Garden District is a little further but the street cars can get you there. The concierge helped us out tremendously with booking tours and suggesting restaurants. Breakfast buffet was great and the fried chicken was my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bushed77
Reviews.Content: We went back to Le Pavillon for a second stay because the staff was so darned nice the first time. The price is very reasonable compared to other choices in New Orleans, and the hotel is within walking distance to the French Quarter, but far enough away from the nightly noise and mayhem found there to get a good night's sleep. We feel "at home" here and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, pleasant, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Upbeatlady
Reviews.Content: Lovely place. Helpful staff. We did have difficultly finding the usual book pertaining to room service and charges for incidentals, finding it tucked away on the last day. We appreciated the portico during the rainy days!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Margaret P
Reviews.Content: For an old world ambience and attentive service, I recommend Le Pavillion. It was a quiet and classy place to stay during the NCAA tournament. I especially enjoyed the nightly PB and J and hot chocolate in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Colin52
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le Pavillon in March of 2011. It is a beautiful old building, exquisitely decorated and full of class, character and charm. We found the location perfect for our purposes. It was within easy walking distance of the French Quarter and yet far enough away to ensure some peace and quiet in the wee hours of the morning. The service was friendly and our room was clean and comfortable. The free high speed internet was a bonus. Having said all that we would probably stay somewhere else if we visited New Orleans again. For one thing, the hotel offered more amenities than we really needed. Although the weather was very warm during the day (+78 F) we were too busy sight-seeing to spend much time in the roof top pool and hot tub. We were there one afternoon and frankly found the pool area a little messy and unclean. The water quality was poor in both the hot tub and pool. Another "claim to fame" is the evening hot chocolate and peanut butter sandwiches. Only once in the whole week did we make it back to the hotel in time for this nightly event and we were so stuffed from our evening meal that we couldn't eat a thing. One another minor complaint was the price of the morning breakfast in the hotel restaurant. We don't eat much for breakfast so we immediately ruled out the extremely expensive morning buffet. Instead we chose toast and coffee and still paid around $20 for two people. Needless to say, other mornings we found our way to some of the many nearby coffee shops and restaurants where you could have a decent breakfast for under $10. We didn't eat another meal in the hotel restaurant all week since there are so many high-quality, reasonably priced restaurants everywhere we went. We celebrated my birthday in a fabulous upscale restaurant called GW Fins that had excellent food and service. Anyway, Le Pavillon is a great hotel with all the charm and comfort you could want. I definitely recommend it. However, next time we'll stay in a less expensive, more pedestrian hotel and spend our vacation budget on all the fabulous food and entertainment New Orleans has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: PerkiAngel
Reviews.Content: When I booked my hotel room (HYATT REGENCY) with priceline, they guaranteed savings. Wow a whopping 19% at a hotel that originally did not show up on the priceline map as a 4star hotel and it is in the north western most area of the map of where I want to be. I couldn't be farther from where I wanted to be. All of the other 4star Hotels are in the middle and centralized. Looking at the recent reviews from travelers at Hyatt Regency, this deal SUCKS!!!! I now not only have to pay $72 for transportation to and from the 4star (laughing because the reviews don't sound like a 4-star) and the airport because they have no shuttle, but I also have to pay to go everywhere in a cab because I am so FAR AWAY FROM EVERYTHING!!!! Reviews from recent travelers talk about how the air conditioning and plumbing don't work properly at this facility and how costly drinks and other things are. Thanks so much Priceline for making my first experience with you my LAST EXPERIENCE!!!! Thanks for helping me to spend more money than I wanted to after all!!!! DON'T USE PRICELINE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This IS New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: rhcNM
Reviews.Content: From the minute you walk in, this hotel exudes New Orleans, From the doormen in tuxedos and top hats to the high ceilings, crown moldings, velvet drapes and overstuffed furniture, it is old style New Orleans. The check-in was seemless and the room was beautiful. Overstuffed and a bit shabby chic. Beds were comfortable. The bathrooms were updated in marble and granite but small. Had a problem with th hairdryer and slow drain in the sink. This was the one place service lacked. We advised them and it was not fixed. I can understand them having issues due to the age of the hotel but not fixing them was not a good thing. We had the brunch which was excellent but were quite surprised that we were charged $3 for orange juice on a $20 brunch. The bar was excellent and the appetizers were great. My husband absolutely loved the gumbo and he ate it all over town. Kept comparing it the Le Pavillion. The location is perfect. Two blocks from the Charles St Trolley and about 3/4 blocks from Bourbon St but quiet. Overall, I would go back despite the few minor problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & SEC Basketball”
Reviews.Author: kysailor
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this "Grand Hotel" and were welcomed at the door by Cedric who was so helpful and friendly--remembering our names when we needed umbrellas or directions. We were able to check in a couple of hours early and our room was small but lovely. The staff was helpful, from the bartender who brought us a late lunch to the dining room staff when we wanted breakfast. The concierge gave us great dining and jazz recommendations. We were in walking distance to the arena, French Quarter, trolley, and St. Charles St. We would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not four star service!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia718
Reviews.Content: We prefer to stay in interesting, non- chain hotels, and were so excited to get a good rate at Le Pavillion, a four star, four diamond hotel. We stayed for two nights mid-week with two kids in March. It would get a higher rating from me if the service was better, but my opinion overall of the hotel is that it used to be four stars, has lost much of its glory, but still has most of the trappings. The lobby is very formal, with grand chandeliers and beautiful antique furnishings. The rooms are decorated in what used to be beautiful window treatments and bedspreads, but now are just old looking, but with beautiful antique desk and chairs. The room and bathroom were clean. One of our beds had fabulous high thread count sheets, but the other had thread-bare sheets that barely covered the mattress. There were only two pillows (one per person) on each queen sized bed. Not a huge deal, but its the little extra touches (like lots of plump pillows) that make a hotel four star to me. That pretty much describes our stay- it was not bad, was not great, but had moments of both. We arrived at 9:30 pm to no doorman and a driveway full of parked cars. After walking in to the front desk to ask about a bellman to help with our bags, one apathetic staff member said "he should be out there". We waited in the street for about 20 minutes, then unloaded and self-parked. Finally making it into our room, we tried to order room service, which was open until midnight, but no one would answer the phone. Repeated calls to the front desk and housekeeping to bring more pillows (only two per queen size bed) went unanswered as well. We finally walked down to the lobby to ask for room service and housekeeping, and they called us back in our room shortly. Room service food was hot and delicious, though, and arrived quickly after we ordered. The very popular PPJ sandwiches and cocoa from 10-11 pm in the lobby was a really great touch, and a welcome fun treat. More service issues at the pool the next day, however. The pool itself is awesome. It is a small little jewel tucked up in a corner on a roof deck/garden with loungers surrounding. It offers a rooftop view of New Orleans and is high enough off the street to be a quiet retreat frim the noisy city. The deck is open until 1am, so the night view was pretty incredible! The deck area was a mess, though, littered with towels, glasses and trash, and there were no clean towels. Overall, not a bad stay, but we left feeling the hotel was understaffed and needed a refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Great business trip”
Reviews.Author: wovermyer
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous traditional hotel with a long history. I attended a conference here and wasn't quite sure the hotel would be anything great -- but I was wrong! Friendly staff. Beautiful updated bathrooms with large tub. The room was spacious and quiet, even though I was close to the elevators. No real view to speak of from the room, but the rooftop pool is amazing. The waitstaff in the restaurant were so friendly, even though the food is just your standard ok hotel fare that is pricey. I only ate lunch there by necessity before a flight, because why eat in a hotel in New Orleans? The area is kind of dicey and I recommend taking a cab places (most fares were only $8). Easy shuttle available to and from the airport and a business room available to print out tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: canela62
Reviews.Content: My family and I just spent a few days at this hotel during Spring Break and we had a fantastic time! We had a room on the 8th floor (so we didn't hear any noises at night). This beautiful antique hotel had chandeliers everywhere and was just so impressive to look at. The staff was very friendly, and the food in both the Lounge and the breakfast buffet in the main dining room were very good. My husband ordered an omelette with everything in it and he absolutely loved it. The hotel was quite close to the French Quarter, so we just left the car in their parking lot the entire time we were there and walked everywhere. In such a historic city we thought it was perfect staying in a quaint hotel dating back to 1907!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel close to the French Quarters”
Reviews.Author: T.michelle
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire and weren't sure what we'd get, but we were pleasantly surprised by the Le Pavillon. It's decorated in old world style, so you may not like it if that's not your taste. But, the staff was very accomodating and attentive, the rooms were clean, and the beds were quite comfortable. As for the location, it's close enough to easily get to the French Quarters, but far enough away from the noise and crowds. As an added touch, the hotel has a daily nightcap of peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and hot chocolate - at no extra charge. All and all, it's a good hotel choice if you can find a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JudyCohen
Reviews.Content: I agree with one of the other reviews. I booked this hotel on short notice and did not realize there were some playoffs in town so I had a high rate. I stayed in a 4th floor room with 2 double beds and it was very comfortable. I agree that the hotel is older but they have done a good job at maintaining it. I would stay here again the staff was very nice and I think the distance to the quarter was perfect, within walking distance but far enough to keep the noise away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: mdlubsu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this trip during a busy weekend in New Orleans. As a result of the relatively short notice, we paid A LOT for our room. Since we overpaid to stay during this busy time I can't say it was a "good value." However, the hotel itself is nice. Smaller than I expected, a bit less grand than the Monteleone in the quarter. The rooms were spacious, and our bed was divine! The bedding/mattress was perfect for a relaxing, deep sleep. Both of us slept exceptionally well. Unlike the hotels in the quarter, the halls here weren't busy with rowdy guests or randomly loud and noisy when elevators opened. I was disappointed about the small bathrooms; little counter space beside the sink and only a tub/shower. I had hoped for a bigger tub to take a bath in. There is a drawn bath menu, but I wouldn't even consider having a bath drawn in such a small tub that doesn't allow enough room for relaxing. This hotel is old and the bathroom reflects that. Oddly enough, our room included a large closet size. Peanut butter and jelly service in the lobby was nice at bedtime.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Charming and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: irloyal
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. It is consistently ranked at the top 100 of Historic Inns and Lodges. Here is why: Pros - Incredible staff; very courteous, helpful and friendly. From the maids to the wait staff; front desk and everywhere else. Comfortable rooms, some are a little tight, but the decor is very nice and the internet is free, 2 bottled water each day, 2 free home-made peanutbutter and jelly cookies (more about this later);40 inch HD TV and REALLY COMFORTABLE BEDS Good Food. Breakfast and Lunch Buffet have a great assortment of fresh fruit; great pastry and breads; really tasty gumbo at lunch. Heck, even the locals come here. The place gets pretty full at lunch Quiet location - Get away from the craziness of Rue de Bourbon A nice pool and Cabana area on the roof. A great place for the evening glass of wine with a cigar Cons Bring a BIG WALLET. No bargains here. You pay for a great experience. Breakfast - A Jackson Lunch - A Jackson Dinner - A Hamilton This is per person without drinks or tips A long walk to the French Quarter. It's six blocks to Canal street Hints: Go to the creperie about 3 blocks away. Great Coffee/Espresso and crepes for a good meal New Orleans Cigar Company is about 4 blocks away and it has a great Humidor. Closes at 6 though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old style hotel”
Reviews.Author: yaatrik
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel, which I had got through hotwire. Easy to access by shuttle from the airport. It is just the right distance from the French Quarters- not too far and not too close to the rowdy crowds. It is a charming old world hotel. I wish they had upgraded the bathrooms a bit. I don't care for valences in the bathroom and the light fixture in the bathroom could have done with a fresh coat of paint. The bathrooms and rooms with their old world curtains and heavy furnishings seem a tad bit musty. The staff was very helpful. Wish they would add a coffee /tea maker to the rooms. I asked for one and they promptly sent it to the room. On the whole a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Beautiful Hotel In Perfect Location * Ask for an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: tripgal926
Reviews.Content: this is the perfect location to be close to both the french quarter and central business district, plus the street cars. the hotel is beautiful. booked on hotwire and they upgraded us to the castle suite, which is huge and classically pretty. the staff was very friendly and the bell hop helped us with our luggage and storing it while we went sightseeing for our last day. we truly enjoyed our stay, especially the great deal and beautiful room!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oriane86
Reviews.Content: Amazing historical opulent hotel with modern conveniences and excellent customer service. The roof top pool and the workout facilities were a pleasure to use. The lunch buffet was an extremely good value and delicious. I spoke with other guests who had dinner at the hotel and found it to be extremely good value and excellent quality. The setting is more beautiful than in the pictures. It was a couple of blocks from the French Quarter but it was a short easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer J Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on your site, was amazed when we drove up to see how beautiful it was, they acutally have door men in suits with tails and top hats! The room was very nice, beds filled with many pillows and painting on the walls. Found out they have a roof top pool/ lounge open til 1 am!! This hotel is well worth the money and I recommend to anyone visiting the city of New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Be very very wary of the buffet breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: G T
Reviews.Content: Am currently staying in le pavillon and relaxing after the February Maris GRAS. We went down to breakfast for a buffet breakfast which should have been 19.99 each. However when we got the cheque back, we noted that we had been charged individually for orange juice and a cup of tea. This Put our bill up by around another 12 dollars. Bit of a surprise. Definitely read the small print on the buffet. Seems a bit unpleasant trick to pull in what is otherwise a beautiful place to stay and a real departure from the sheratons and other chained hotels. Definitely feel a bit conned though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with more than excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: dalto27
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated in an Old World elegance.....lots of beautiful chandeliers and appointed first class! The desk clerks were very professional as was the concierge. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and what a treat the late night peanut butter & jelly sandwiches were along with the hot chocolate. My daughter had stayed there previously and wanted me to see it. Because this was a second stay for her the manager sent up a basket of fruit & cookies! I HIGHLY recommend this hotel for it's class, convenience to sights in New Orleans and service...worth the higher price!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay For A Mardi Gras Visit”
Reviews.Author: krwade
Reviews.Content: Our daughter wanted to go to Mardi Gras for her 21st birthday celebration so I decided to bring the entire family. I ended up using Orbitz and found when I arrived that all 3 rooms were Deluxe Kings instead of 2 doubles and 1 king. The desk clerk was more than helpful in finding us the double rooms needed and was more than accommodating. The The hotel was amazing, from the beautiful lobby to the hallways and finally the rooms. The cleanliness, turn down service and of course the PBJ sandwiches at night made the stay even more enjoyable. The room my wife and I were in (Deluxe King) did have a few minor issues with the bathroom, the sink would back up, the toilet would remain running at times and the shower leaked, though not enough to take away from the over all experience. Another great feature was the shower water pressure and the almost instantaneous hot water! The hotel is within walking distance of the French Quarter and The River walk. Valet parking is a bit high at $35.00 a day but it does offer in/out service 24/7. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New Orleans and even locals that want a weekend out.

Reviews.Title: “"Old School"”
Reviews.Author: stepstra
Reviews.Content: I am a New Orleans native and returned for a three-night business trip accompanying some foreign official visitors. I selected Le Pavillon for location (short walk to any business in the CBD and easy walk to French Quarter) and its â€œold schoolâ€� feel. It truly is a class act â€“ they donâ€™t make hotels like this anymore: a magnificent and beautiful building, elegant interior decoration, and well-constructed with solid walls with crown molding in both public and private rooms. I read some of the negative reviews below of the rooms and thus almost did not stay here, but I am glad I ignored the comments. All four of us really liked our rooms â€“ reminded me of some of the grand old hotels I stayed in New York City as a kid with my parents. The worst I can say is that the beds and pillows were merely ok. The staff is classic New Orleans friendly. My visitors loved Le Pavillon, as did I, and they came away from New Orleans with a positive feel for the city in no small part due to our delightful stay at Le Pavillon. My only negative comment is over the breakfast buffet. The dining room is magnificent, but my advice is to skip their breakfast and walk down the street to any of the wonderful New Orleans cafes. The buffet costs $20, yet it was just a mediocre quality breakfast (rubbery fruit, cheap bread, low quality cheese, dry pasteries, basic cereal, etc). To add insult to injury, one is charged five dollars extra for the coffee and orange juice. The waiter innocently asks, â€œWould you like coffee and juice?â€� and the surprise comes when you sign for the bill. Sorry, Le Pavillon, but that is really a nickel and dime move on your part. Yet, bewilderingly, free coffee is offered every morning by the bar as you walk into the dining room. Go figure. Needless to say, I only ate there once.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Randy_Ward
Reviews.Content: I have been shopping for a hotel to call my "home away from home" in New Orleans. I have intentionally booked dozens of different properties in the downtown area looking for just the right hotel. The Le Pavillon is exactly what I have been looking for! The property is outstanding; very clean, well preserved building with a history, it's centrally located and the staff is professional and friendly. It's a very comfortable feeling; the surrounding, the staff and the location, it's just the perfect stay. I often travel to New Orleans on businesses but I enjoy a weekend getaway with the family. This is the perfect place for any stay; for business travelers it convenient to any location downtown, easy to find and access, but you need to consider the statement made from conducting business at such a beautiful and well preserved history building, the staff is very professional and and it make quite a statement. For pleasure it cant be beat, again convenience is important, but to surround your love ones with the splendor of this historic site and interact with the friendly and professional staff, you just can't go wrong. I'll become a regular, I've finally found my "Home away from Home" for New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, old-world charm”
Reviews.Author: lferguson1
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our short stay (three nights) at this hotel. It's a very narrow building with grand flourishes inside. There were lots of surprising things - the late snack of PBJ and hot chocolate, the relaxing bar area, the drawn bath options (I didn't take advantage of that one). But for me, the best part was the service. Amazing, incredible service. Sure, people are nice down south. It's expected. But I felt like a royalty here. Every question, need, whim can be taken care of. And there's something grand about having everyone greet you with a warm hello, and mean it. The bathrooms were incredibly well appointed. The opulence of the decor isn't to my taste, but it suited this lovely place. The rooms could have used a coffee pot/tea, but that's a minor complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place”
Reviews.Author: Janet B
Reviews.Content: The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The hotel is beautiful, clean, well-maintained and well-located in a quieter and "saner" part of town but is only a short walking distance to the wild times. It is located close to the street cars so you can get to ant part of NO quite easily. The price is very resonable for this magnificent facility. This is definitely our new "go-to" place when we are in NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Old world, with new world sophistication”
Reviews.Author: Monthlytraveler09
Reviews.Content: This is by far a 4-star hotel, it is complete with excellent concierge service, beautiful rooms decorate with 18th century New Orleans charm. Walking down the hall, is comparable to being in The Buckingham Place---I would assume!! It is centrally located on Poydras, so a short walk to Superdome, Canal, or French Quarter....and a very short walk to Mother's!!! Overall, great hotel, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: brooklawatran
Reviews.Content: Positives: wonderful classic look, fun peanut butter + jelly tradition (they have PB+J's at night for free), really great and helpful staff Negatives: depending on your taste rooms may be a bit 'dated', location - it's in walking distance of bourbon street (10-15 mins), but there really isn't much else going on in the direct vicinity. Overall - if you are looking for a good value hotel and don't mind not being in the immediate area of bourbon street/french quarter - then this is a fantastic choice.

Reviews.Title: “old world charm”
Reviews.Author: pinotnoir22
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with every aspect of this hotel. It is within a short walking distance to Bourbon St., St. Charles Street trolley, the Superdome and many wonderful restaurants. The rooms were large and the bathroom was contemporary. The decor was new with an old world charm. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only thing we would do differently is park in nearby city parking instead of their valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Old but nice.”
Reviews.Author: Hokie69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Pavillon during this year's Sugar Bowl. Reserved rooms through Hotwire and got a $120 a night rate which was a steal. The hotel is a little stuffy (not the people but the decorum) but it reminds you of going back to the Victorian era - heavy drapes, over stuffed lobby furniture, lots of gilding. Our room was very nice and clean and the king bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel was a 20 minute walk from the French Quarter but only a 5 minute walk from the Superdome. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Peanut butter sandwiches and hot chocolate in the lobby from 10 to 11 was a nice touch. Seems that back in 1987 a guest was talking to the manager about how when he was at home he shared a glass of milk and peanut butter sandwich with his daughter every night before she went to bed and he missed that when he was traveling. Upon hearing the story the manager had a chef bring the guest some milk and a peanut butter sandwich. Other guests saw the man enjoying it and ordered it for themselves and the tradition was born.

Reviews.Title: “Room was nice and spacious, older decor though”
Reviews.Author: choz_man
Reviews.Content: I found the location of this hotel to be pretty good, still within walking distance to bourbon street, but far enough away to not get any noise etc. The room itself was quiet interesting, it is obviously in an older building, and the room had a bit of a 70's feel to it, but was still very neat and comfortable, and also quiet spacious. Staff were very helpful, and overall it was a good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes up for a somewhat threadbare and stained room...”
Reviews.Author: HDell13
Reviews.Content: Certainly: the staff was lovely. Truly enthusiastic and engaged with us when we had any questions or concerns. The woman who checked us in and out was amused that we'd heard some of the ghost stories already and gave us a little packet of papers that gave some more detail of paranormal investigations of the hotel and its history. It was an interesting historical landmark. PB&J bar at night was cute as all get out. Encouraged some sense of traveller's community and the whipped cream for the hot cocoa was a nice touch. Doubtful: a four star rating on this hotel- the amenities were "eh" and the mini bar was a drag because although wwe did not use anything in it, we could also not use the refrigerator to store our goods without disturbing the $8 bottled water inside and momentarily incurring a bill- this was of course sorted out immediately by the truly charming and kind staff, however. Just worth noting that the mini-fridge is fully stocked and any disturbance to it is sensed and recorded, so if you even open it and breathe hard, you'd better go down to the front desk and let them know. The bathroom was well, kinda mildewy, rusty and musty. The humidity just stuck. Now, I do realize that we were in New Orleans, but truly, I was glad we chose December and not July because I can only imagine how humid the room would've been then...there were obviously past complaints regarding the cooling system as there were handprints and smudges all around the vent in the ceiling. Just looked sloppy. The carpet was fairly threadbare in high traffic areas, and no lie- there was crumbled up granola under the desk when we checked in, so it didn't seem like the room had really been cleaned well between us and whoever had been there before us. There were weird stains on one of the lampshades next to the bed...conjecture ensued...and then was disregarded, because really, we were there to enjoy ourselves and not nit-pick the place to death. So, we decided to enjoy ourselves. With some effort, but hey, you don't come to New Orleans to moan and complain- you come to have a good time, so while we did initially debate about asking for another room, we decided to just overlook some of the jankier parts of our room...our reasoning was that the rest of the rooms were probably in similar repair- weird wiring that had rolled out in stages, super dated and peeling wallpaper in the bathroom, marble flooring that was raised like an inch to step up into the bathroom from the bedroom...the hotel is over 100 years old, and we realized what that meant and just decided to not be distracted by it that much. It could use an organized renovation for sure, but that would easily take millions and millions of dollars. So, yeah, just know that and you won't be disappointed, you'll be realistically positioned in a pretty good hotel with an above average staff. The rest of the hotel was lovely. Really engaged my imagination and I could see how it must've been quite the grand hotel in its day. And as I said, the staff was great. No ghosties, but plently of fun making noises and playing around about it. 5 to 10 minute walk to the French Quarter and beyond. Close to the trolleys, though we never used one. Close to the river and French Market. Overall, it's a well positioned place to be for a first timer.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Janice V
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an affordable hotel for a long weekend in New Orleans. We learned quickly that one's definition of affordable has to be adjusted for New Orleans. But the Le Pavillon Hotel worked for us. It is a hotel with an 1800s feel to it. There are beautiful Chandeliers in the lobby area, and couches from the time period. The front desk and concierge were friendly and helpful. The rooms were a comfortable size with a large (regular) TV and mini bar in the room. The closet was a comfortable size for our 5 days of clothes, and the interior closet light came on when you opened the closet door. Simple but so helpful. The shower was large with shampoo and shower gel in the shower. Lotion, shoe shiner, shower cap and Q-tips were available on the bathroom counter. The hotel does have peanut butter sandwiches and hot chocolate every night at 10pm. It was fun and tasty. The hotel is one or 2 blocks from the St. Charles street car line (depending on which direction you are going) to make it easy to get around New Orleans. Although we found it just as fast to walk to the French Quarter area. The dampness (humidity) in January did make the air feel cold in January, so pack accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “So much more than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: koli89
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Pavillion for a conference. It was a superb stay and I plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't care about the room and just want a lobby, this is your place.”
Reviews.Author: camerons38
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old hotel in desperate need of a renovation. I was excited web we walked in because the lobby was old and beautiful and the people were really friendly. Now, I appreciate old, antique type places. I've stayed thousands of room nights in my life at all sorts of hotels. When I opened the door to my room, I actually said the word: yuck. It's really bad. They cannot do anything about the size of the rooms but they could certainly update them. The TV is still an old picture tube television. The bed spreads look like they haven't been changed/washed since the 60's. The bathroom products are cheap, made in China lotions and soaps. The room is not clean and not at all inviting. Do yourself a favor, if you care more about the room than thr lobby, avoid this grand old hotel til they are willing to spend some money on a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans favorite”
Reviews.Author: __David__192837465
Reviews.Content: Such a great hotel that I and my wife love to stay in when we're in NOLA. Echo most other comments on the good things. Only complaint is the $35 a day parking that is nearly $40 after taxes. Parking rates near the French Quarter are typically expensive, but I thought this was a bit ridiculous, especially considering I'm already paying to stay at the hotel. Why not give guests a small discount? Would feel much better about tipping the valets.

Reviews.Title: “A few issues but overall a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: petitprince2000
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed out stay in this historical hotel, dubbed "la belle of New Orleans" as it once was. Now it is a bit dated, the rooms are a bit small and the mattress very very saggy. The hot water from the shower takes ages to come and breakfast is not included and very pricey. The pluses include the lovely swimming pool, the elegance of the building, the helpful and kind staff, the location -close to the quarter but far from the quarter noise- and the 10pm peanut butter sandwiches. Not perfect but I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “The service was exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Simon A
Reviews.Content: This hotel has so much personality! Even though they were super busy, everyone there made us feel really welcome. The property is beautiful and the service was, top to bottom, beyond our expectations (Especially Aaron). Hope to be back soon!!! Thank you guys

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judy W
Reviews.Content: Anytime I go to New Orleans I stay at Le Pavillon. It is luxurious, warm and welcoming. I've stayed at Le Pavillon many times and have never had a bad experience. The hotel is within walking distance to the French Quarter, Superdome and Canal St. I always look forward to coming back to the hotel around 10:00 pm to indulge in peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and homemade hot chocolate in the lobby. The hotel is beautiful and the beds are so comfortable. It's the favorite of my two children and their families. Also, around Christmas, the Papa Noel rates are great. JWilliams

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in business district.”
Reviews.Author: doctorbubba
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a blind bid on Hotwire so the price was good. Shared a room with family - it was small, as was the bathroom, but adequate. While parts appeared dated, it was very clean and the staff were all very helpful throughout our stay. One housekeeping problem was constant poor drainage in the shower & sink - ick to taking a shower in standing water. We did not report it since we were there only a few days. I was unable to use my IPad in the room due to weak signal. Others have commented on the nightly PBJ's which is a nice touch. We did not eat at the restaurant & only ordered dessert through room service. It was good (especially chocolate mousse cake) & nicely presented. You need to be prepared to walk or taxi some blocks to get to the French Quarter, restaurants, Bourbon Street, streetcars, River Street, WWII Museum, etc....as you are not in the heart of things. So, I cannot complain due to the price, but would've preferred a more convenient location. I would also disagree with the 4 1/2 star rating that Hotwire applied - that is too high.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TigerFan119
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during an incredibly busy weekend in New Orleans, with a Saints playoff game and the BCS National Championship all going on. Even with the hotel fully booked, we were still made to feel special. The staff at Le Pavillon seems to anticipate your every need and makes sure it is handled before you even have to ask. The hotel is beautiful, their Sunday brunch is delicious, and the PB&J sandwiches and hot chocolate each evening are a unique and fun treat. The only downside to this place is the high price tag, but you do get what you pay for here. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Gracious establishment”
Reviews.Author: joyceGlenview
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days in December for his 70th birhday and my 68th. There was from the start friendliness, politness, a desire to make one feel at home. We were rewarded with a tray of fruit and crackers and cheese for the special occasion-free of charge, and you are able to use their computers gratis as well. The room, while small, had everything we needed and we slept very well due to the airconditioning/heating unit blocking out outside noises, comfortable beds and clean environment. I cannot say enough good things about Renee who faciliated a refund on the cost of the room after the initial price had declined, and the concierges who went out of their way to plan constant activities for us. Our only complaint was regarding the cost of eating in the dining room, which while elegant is too expensive for breakfast, but there are places close by we were able to walk to, and sometimes we did so-a special favorite was Deanies a seafood restuarant about six blocks away. The hotel location was excellent and we were able to get around easily by walking or using a trolley for as little as 40 cents a senior ride. You just need to show id signifying your age. Another friendly gesture is the hot chocolate and peanut butter and jelly sandwiches ofered at 10pm free to all guests, where the kids came down in their jammies and I also did in the robe provided by the hotel, and felt perfectly at ease doing so. I love architecture and the old style graciousness of the hotel appealed greatly to us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: cpatraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire and we were very happy with the accommodations. It would be a good deal even if we had paid a higher price. It is very convenient to the French Quarters, about a 10 minute walk. The restaurant seemed pricey, so we did not eat there. They had an all you can eat salisbury steak night for $20. Who goes to New Orleans to eat salisbury steak? There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The room was very clean and they told us they gave us an upgrade because when we checked in they did not have a room available that was reserved for us. Overall we would stay here again when we are in New Orleans. They also have from 10pm-11pm the fixings to make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich, along with cold milk and hot chocolate. Very different so we took advantage of this offer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: swapna k
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon Hotel is truly one of a kind, and you will know this the moment you step in. The prices are of course exorbitant so be careful to check before you order room service or any of that stuff. Valet parking is $35/ day. Small rooms but totally worth it if you are in the mood to splurge!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time had!!”
Reviews.Author: D D
Reviews.Content: All was perfect for our stay. We needed a getaway, and a short trip to New Orleans, with a stay at Le Pavillon was the backdrop. Shane and the others were so thoughtful and made our stay memorable, to say the least! We were able to take in the city's festive atmosphere just a few blocks away, returning to a very comfortable room, with wonderful service. I will be back. Of course the south is known for this kind of hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: Globalkid
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on trip advisor, and I just wanted to say that this is a marvelous hotel. Beautiful old building, very wellmaintained and absolutely charming. within walking distance of the river, French quarter, and just a few blocks from the streetcar. At the same time, away from the partying and noise of Bourbon Street. Plus nightly pb&j and hot cocoa in the beautiful lobby. The best thing about the hotel for us was the staff. We have traveled extensively and I must say that this was the kindest, warmest, andost helpful staff of any hotel I have ever visited. Amazing guest services! Thank you for a fantastic visit.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptions are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: Don't be misled by this property. The walls in this grand old hotel are paper thin, if you want any sleep, STAY SOME WHERE ELSE. I had to get out of bed at 2:00am and go wake up the security guard to go get the Manager and lodge a complaint. Don't get me wrong I love to party and have fun like most others, but there is a time and place, and this hotel does not present itself as an all night party house. That was one of the reasons we chose to stay here. If you want to sleep in your expensive room, stay at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No second chances.”
Reviews.Author: stephanie j
Reviews.Content: This is my 1st time staying at this hotel. I have always seen this place and wondered what it would be like to stay a few nights. BEAUTIFUL PLACE! It was built in 1930's and still has a lot of the original intact. I was impressed by the elevators being that they are still original. Rooms and lobby were very clean. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Location is perfect. Taxi cabs are everywhere and were cheaper than a parking garage. Was not impressed by the actuall room. The bedding and drapery was ugly. The beds were SOOOO uncomfrotable. The pillows are flat and the mattress is hard. The bathroom is VERY small. The high ceilings are a plus bc all I needed to run was the ceiling fan and it was cool enough. My favorite spot of the hotel was the rooftop. There is a heated pool and jacuzzi that is to die for. Take my advice, if you decide to stay bring your own pillows for a better nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel in Louisiana, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: WorldExplorer50
Reviews.Content: College trip, visiting Tulane. Arrived when a wedding was in full swing, asked for a quiet room. Were given a room on the 8th floor, perfect location. If you like modern, Marriott-style hotels, this is not it. The room was fairly small, and the decor ornate/heavy. The bathroom was very nice, however. Service impeccable, and the concierge even advised not to go to Bourbon Street on a Friday night with a 16-year old, and we should have definitely followed that advice (it was gross) - the location is simply superb, walking distance to the French quarter, yet in the quieter business district. They boast a PB&J and chocolate in the foyer till 11pm, but the chocolate was not that good and you need to make the sandwiches yourself. Service was excellent, however, starting at reservation. Be sure to ask to be upgraded to the better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Elalo
Reviews.Content: This a lovely hotel - very grand! It's has great facilities like a gym, hot tub and pool. It has nice touches like fruit at the gym, and a late night snack of peanut butter and jelly sandwiches with hot chocolate - nice touch! The bath wasn't as clean as I would have expected - some hair from the previous guest. The front desk staff weren't the best, we asked for a 5am wake up call and a 5:30 taxi which the lady wrote down. They called us at 4:30 and said the taxi was coming at 5 - not very good service to wake your guests up at 4:30.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful classic hotel; Excellent bell service”
Reviews.Author: northerngrandpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pavillon one night prior to a cruise and would willing return to New Orleans to stay there in the future. If you can't stay here it's worth a peak inside to see just how immaculately a 100-year-old property can be maintained. We thoroughly enjoyed our night here - and the selection of breads and jellys for the late night peanut butter and jelly sandwich buffet "made" the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Le Classic”
Reviews.Author: Joe C
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Le Pavillon for a 3 day business trip. The hotel is graced with old, period charm found in many classic hotels. The staff is extremely friendly starting with the doorman who greets you in a top hat and uniform which serve as a reminder of the opulence of days past. The foyer is graced with chandeliers, columns and oil paintings. I happened to be there in December so it was beautifully decorated for Christmas. The rooms are spacious and comfotable. The hotel is reportedly haunted which created some intrigue with my 9 year old son back home. It is perfectly located to all area sites (including bourban street). If you travel from the North and are used to everyting fast paced this hotel or anywhere in the South is not likely for you. Although if you want to experience New Orleans and a bit of history this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1inamillion
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is located steps away from Bourbon Street, the Superdome, and tons of other places. The service is impeccable, and the PB&J sandwich reception is a nice touch. I also loved the rooftop, heated pool & spa. My only complaint was the small room and bathroom size.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Run Down”
Reviews.Author: UnShopper
Reviews.Content: This place has a very impressive facade and decor. However, once you look beyond the surface and check in, you discover that this is a very run down and tired property. TWO rooms they put me in had black mold growing on the windows and window sills. The third did not but the AC and exhaust vents were covered in dust. Moreover, their restaurant, Crystal Palace, is a poor excuse for anything but a Denny's. Do not stay here until extensive renovations and cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveMBinLA
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great service, very nice rooms (a tad small but well appointed), great roof-top pool and jacuzzi, beautiful lobby. The only thing to consider is that it's just a little too far from the French Quarter to walk there so you need a cab every time you go anywhere. There isn't much to see or do in the CBD where it's located, unless you want to gamble t Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable weekend in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: JillWendy
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful hotel with a wonderful staff. I had written ahead about our family celebration and everyone was very accommodating and went way out of their way to make it a very special weekend. It was hard to leave the gorgeous room but the location was great. Breakfasts were wonderful. And every night at ten o'clock there is a tradition of providing peanut butter and jelly and hot chocolate. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “This is a hard one...”
Reviews.Author: toohip2cool
Reviews.Content: I had seen the mixed reviews, but I was hopeful. It was my Husband's first time in NOLA and I wanted him to grasp the essence of NOLA. I thought this Hotel would be perfectâ€¦historic, classic, old world charmâ€¦. I was disappointed. While the lobby is very beautiful and the door man in top hat and tails sets the tone when you first enter the Hotel, it is all downhill from there. There was a lack of cleanliness throughout. The shower had mold build up in between the tiles. The hot tub had a ring of dirt around the ledge. The towels in our room smelled musty. The room size was good. The dÃ©cor of the room looks more outdated than classy. The mattress was very uncomfortable, seemed old and the mattress sheet would slip off all night. Quality of the toiletries was mediocre. Service was subpar. We were left without towels for an entire day, staff answered general questions but it seemed you had to pull the information from them. Like a previous poster described, not sure what role the doorman plays other than for show. During our 4 day stay, he opened the door on our arrival and that was it â€“ not that we want someone to open the door for us anyway but he would watch us approach and turn the other way â€“ go figure. We made it back to the PB & J snack bar once â€“ it was ok. We did not try the restaurant. Location was ok. Itâ€™s about a five minute walk to canal and a 30 minute walk to CafÃ© du Mond. We walked from the French Quarter back to the Hotel every night and we felt pretty safe. Street car is two blocks away. However, with all of the Hotels to choose from, I would definitely pick one closer to the French Quarter. This Hotel was not worth the price we paid. Maybe if it would have been lees in price, we are expectation would have been lower. Definitely have breakfast at Motherâ€™s and try the Restaurant Luke nearby â€“ Great Food!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but don't necessarily believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: destinationxtrme
Reviews.Content: Very cool looking hotel with some great amenities. Great rooftop and nice complimentary late night snacks. But...for the price....the quality of customer service is not up to par (rude night desk staff/ carried all of my own luggage inside) The rooms are nice but I couldn't help being reminded of a 19th century brothel....but in their defense - I understand they were going for French influence. Really, if you stay here, I am sure you will enjoy it but my advice is...there are so many other NOLA places to choose from that far exceed the "reputation" Le Pavillon apparently has.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: SMJCal
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at and have travelled around the world. The main lobby is beutiful as well as the dining room. We ate at the restaurant one night and they always have a special of the night for $18 which included salad and bread pudding. The food was great including the breakfast buffet. My son said his omelet was the best he had ever had. The pool on the roof was a bit windy while we were there but the water nice and warm and a hot tub as well. We made sure we had a room on a higher floor and its a good thing we did as the outside windows were older and unsound proof so may be an issue with traffic on the lower floors. The doors to the hallway were also unsound proof but we were away from the elevators so no issues. It was a big hit with the kids having hot chocolate included with peanut butter and jam sandwiches at night from 10-11, would have been a bit better to have it start at 9:00 though. The amazing thing about the hotel is the service, everyone is so friendly and helpful and not uptight. This is what made the stay. My niece who was 7 told the front desk there was no more chocolate milk at the peanut butter buffet and within 2 minutes came out with more, now thats service.

Reviews.Title: “Involve yourself in a Piece of History... Le Pavillion !”
Reviews.Author: BatonRougeFamily
Reviews.Content: Hubs had always wanted to come Back to Le Pavillion... so this quick 3 Day New Orleans Weekend was the opportunity. I found a SUPER rate via Tripadvisor.com... We arrived 3pm on Saturday and checked right in... stayed in Room 705. Positives: A Beautiful Room in a Luxury Hotel... with amenities I do not normally experience. Wet bar can't be touched unless you plan to pay. But the decor is absolutely fabulous. The Bathroom was resplendant with Bath Wash, Shampoo and Lotion (no hair conditioner). Soap was top notch. A closed door closet provided 2 Robes and an Umbrella (if needed). Plus safe. There is no refrigerator or microwave. There is no coffee maker in the room. The "Greatest Hotels of the World" book was provided to peruse. Bedding was adequate and our (hubby's) only source of complaint. We enjoyed breakfast at the Breakfast buffet... that was our most wonderful meal of our whole visit ! (Which included Emerils and Palace Cafe)... The Breakfast cafe included ($39 each) CarvingStation, Omelet Station, Fresh lump crab meat, smoked salmon, eggs benedict, fresh steel ground grits, and much more... we WILL Be back for this. I would suggest to the hotel... that they provide a Housekeeping Management that checks all things including seating in the tub to see if cleaning is needed in the bathroom... Overall we LOVED this hotel and certainly would plan to return...... The Peanut Butter and Jelly is served 10p-11p and we loved it.... The ambience is wonderful. Pam in the Bar served us Gumbo and soup when we first arrived and was a SUPER hostess. We just loved this hotel... and plan to be back......

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, and great location.”
Reviews.Author: DeAnna T
Reviews.Content: We went to Mardi Gras 2011 and spent the majority of our stay in a rundown motel outside of the city center. Due to last minute planning and budget it was the best we could get. We decided to change our room on the last day and it was the best decision ever. Since most of the city had died down rates were back to a normal price range and we were able to quickly book a room at Le Pavilion. The bed and bedding were amazingly comfortable and the room service was perfect. During the trip I had become ill and the last place you want to be is stuck in a hotel. This hotel made me feel like a pampered princess! 5 stars

Reviews.Title: “One of the most beautiful hotels in the South”
Reviews.Author: LoisLane1028
Reviews.Content: And it should be. My Great-Great Grandaddy built it. We were met at the beautiful, collumned front entrance by a doorman in full livery, complete with top hat, tails and white gloves. We found the front desk staff and concierge to be extremely helpful. The lobby, bar and dining room are all absolutely gorgeous, resplendent in velvet draperies and hand painted trim and mouldings. The decor is heavily Louis XIV. The walls are decorated with original oil portraits everywhere you look. The location is perfect. A short walk down Poydras to Harrah's Casino and up Poydras to the Superdome. Also, quite close to the Riverwalk and the French Quarter. The rooms are also decorated beautifully, but our room was extremely small. No coffee in the room, but the hotel's coffee is divine! Rich and dark the way New Orleans coffee should be. A bit pricey, but worth the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice classic hotel with the nicest staff”
Reviews.Author: Jasonleg
Reviews.Content: I understand that a hotel experience is personal and about preferences. For those who prefer a modern more sleek hotel, this may not be your first choice. The hotel has charm, the lobby is grand and classic and a meal in the Crystal room restaurant is fun and left me smiling thinking about the grandness of it all which is over the top but exactly what one would hope for in a hotel like this. My room on the third floor was comfortable, clean and smelt fresh (other reviews complained of musty smells). The bed was comfortable, the room was spacious and the marble bathroom was clean and welcoming. The bath products were great too. The wifi is free throughout the hotel which is a big bonus. They also serve peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and hot chocolate between 10-11pm which is a lovely touch. Overall I really enjoyed my experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Gooey_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Pavillon for a birthday weekend celebration. The lobby and common areas were lovely and hearkened back to the grandeur of an earlier time - it was appropriate for New Orleans. The room was clean and spacious, the bed comfortable, closets convenient and roomy, and a very nice bathroom. We did not get the opportunity to take advantage of the complimentary peanut butter sandwiches, but I love the fact that they offer such a unique treat. We did get a chance to stop in the bar near the lobby and it was quite nice, with an old carved wood bar. Good Pimm's cups too! The location was very convenient and walkable to most of the sites, including Bourbon St. All in all, I would recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Just gets better with time!”
Reviews.Author: HarryDiggs
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Le Pavillon before so I was really excited about getting back and I wasn't disappointed. The feel of it is like being thrown back in time to a more elegant period and everyone there is extremely friendly! Justin the concierge was very helpful in helping us find something chill in the area to do where we could just be casual and get a little day-sloppy without being on Bourbon St. Dinner at The Crystal Room was pretty incredible and really added to that luxurious and elegant feel of an era in our rear view mirror. For me, dinner was punctuated by being seated by these very formerly dressed, older French chicks who really took dining seriously. Miss Pam who is the bartender at the lounge was especially amazing. She really engaged us in conversation and seemed like a very genuine, attentive, and likable person. I really wished I had spent more time at the lounge talking yo her. Everything about the history of the hotel, to the food, to the staff is what takes me back and I'm already planning my return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: gavwell
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Le Pavillion and were overall very happy with the hotel. When you walk in to the lobby you do feel like your stepping back in time it is quite special. Unfortunately our room needed to be updated the room felt over used the top blanket and towels felt old. The carpet and bathroom also felt like it needed replacing and the water pressure was weak. We did stay at the hotel over Halloween so I guess that was why the prices felt a little expensive. Saying that though the staff were amazing and went out of there way to make us feel welcome one of the friendliest hotels that I have stayed at recently. The roof was very nice a bit tacky but charming, the pool and jacuzzi was a nice surprise being open to the early hours. The hotel is also slightly creepy but added to the Halloween experience!

Reviews.Title: “Historic, but dated and in need of freshening up”
Reviews.Author: midger23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not far from the French Quarter, but it is far enough that you have to walk through a few desolate business district blocks at night. The staff advised us (three females) to take a cab late night. The ambience is nice at a first glance, but when you look closely, you see how much work the place needs. The rooms are not impressive, and the bathroom, with its dark marble and older accessories, makes you question how clean it really is (what you can't see). The mauve and forest green comforters and heavy curtains (though maybe historically accurate) are dark and obstruct the little light that the room gets (at least on the side of the hotel we stayed in). The staff was very friendly and helpful, and making/changing reservations was efficient and easy. I agree that it is not a 4 star hotel. It is a 3 star hotel with the potential of being a 4 star, if they can sink some money into updates.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mover1111
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really beautiful. The service was outstanding. Within walking distance of the French Quarter and Bourbon Street. We had a very pleasant stay. There was talk of this hotel being haunted, not sure about that but I have no explaination for the room phone at 2 in the morning turning on the speaker phone and going to a dial tone like someone was going to make a call. Nice time in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JOhanne8_11
Reviews.Content: It's a landmark, so yes it's old, but very charming. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is convenient; walkable distance to French Quarter, trolley and delicious restaurants and yet not noisy at night. We didn't think we'd go for the peanut butter and jelly sandwiches in the evening, but we did on our last evening and wow that peanut butter was just unbelievable! Yumm! The restaurant in the hotel is a bit pricey for what you get. I recommand eating elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Charmer”
Reviews.Author: billyraymond
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at Le Pavillon Hotel last week. We love the property, our room was spacious, immaculate, bathroom was gleaming, housekeeping unobtrusive and flawless. The common areas sparkle as does the entire staff! We ate in the Crystal Roomâ€”$15 for all-you-can-eat meatloaf dinner. It was absolutely delicious and the Hotel has these well-priced specials almost every night; the service was superb (our tuxedoed waiter, Andy, was a charmer). Most of all, the service at this Hotel was impeccable, from registration to housekeeping staff, restaurant and bell staff to the conciergesâ€”each in his or her own way was a perfect ambassador for the Hotel. And the tradition of offering peanut butter and jelly sandwiches every night from 10-11pm is absolutely homey. Despite the grandiose (and positively SPARKLING) chandeliers, sensational French furniture, Tiffany clocks, ubiquitous oil paintings throughout, the Hotel is authentically a warm, homey place to stay. It has a super location a few blocks from busy Canal Street and is very quiet at night with no noise evident inside one's room. They even have a convenient business center for checking in for flights, printing boarding passes and conducting business. The WiFi signal was strong and reliable! Overall, we had a perfect stay here and highly recommend Le Pavillon for any and all people visiting New Orleans. There is really nothing more they could have done to make our stay more enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very beautiful. The decor is very old but still lovely. My friend had a rooftop wedding there, and from beginning to end. Every detail was impeccable. The staff was friendly and went above and beyond. Especially the housekeeper Ms. Yolanda. She totally rocks! A genuine smile that will bring light to your darkest day....

Reviews.Title: “Not my thing!!”
Reviews.Author: Danyale W
Reviews.Content: You people out there that like antique and old may like this hotel. And when I say old I dont mean just the decor. The blankets, towels and all the furniture!!! The smell of must was out of control! The bed spread was this stinky, old and scratchy. It was also an ugly floral pattern that I would imagine finding in my grandmas attic. Just plain scary. The room was tiny and extremely cramped. The bathroom was gross and small as well. The lobby is absolutely gorgous and the staff were all top notch. Very friendly!! If the rest of the place was elegant and clean like the lobby I would have stayed. I checked in and checked out the next day and ran like hell to the Westin on the River! I used the reconmendations on this website and I find them to be way off in my opinion. If you like clean and new dont stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “At $200.00 a Night Peanut Butter & Jelly....Really????”
Reviews.Author: felicianatl
Reviews.Content: This hotels pictures misrepresents the reality of the hotel. We stayed for my birthday over the weekend and I was sooooo dissappointed, but I tried not to complain since it was a birthday present from my boyfriend. The rooms linen looked like it hadnt been cleaned in years. Sheets were clean but the comforter was horrid. The bathroom had old fixtures that fell off as I was trying to run the hot water. There was slow drainage in the bathtub and sink. The shower curtains had mold on them. It was sooo cold in the whole hotel. The TV was a old TV from out someoes basement. This is not an exageration, it is not a hotel that should be price over 69.00 per night. Oh and dont let me forget the $35 valet parking charge and the African American who work there acted rude to other African Americans but were slave ready to the Whites....Worst hotel I have ever stayed in.....Never again....

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Setting for a Big Easy Wedding”
Reviews.Author: UtahTravelgirl17
Reviews.Content: We attended our friends' wedding at Le Pavillion and were amazed at how seamlessly the event unfolded. From the ceremony on the rooftop to the gathering in the bar and then the reception in the gorgeous Crystal Room, every detail was attended to with grace and professionalism by the amazing staff. There was beauty and tradition yet plenty of room to party with a huge band. Our room at the hotel was also lovely and comfortable. An unforgetable event in a great location (close to the St Charles trolley).

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Brian H
Reviews.Content: Staff was amazing and the property is beautiful. I would suggest this hotel to anyone looking for an unforgettable experience! Plus you have to enjoy the PB&J sandwiches and milk from 10pm to 11pm in the main lobby every night.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest staff ever, luxe & charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: jvbi
Reviews.Content: It is stunning how warm and friendly everyone, and I mean every single person, on the staff is. The doorman, the bellmen, the waiters - everyone greeted us with smiles. When we drove back to the hotel, the parking attendants & doormen said "Welcome back" with big smiles. The genuine niceness of the staff is terrific. It's such a comfortable pace - board games in the fancy lobby. The food is very good. Pretty rooms, fancy bathrooms. And who can resist such significant spoiling? Loved the peanut butter & jelly at 10:00pm, the cookies by the bed each evening & even the recipe!, the delicious smelling soaps, the fruit, all the many kindnesses. Le Pavilion has true New Orleans charm and hospitality. This was our third time to stay and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Historic and tired”
Reviews.Author: Lostandfound1968
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming, but needs sones serious updating. Air conditioning, carpeting and general repairs are overdue. The staff is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Charming & Sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: nanaof2girls
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and loved every minute of it! The lobby is breathtaking and everyone who works there was so helpful and friendly. Pamela at the bar makes the best French Martini I have ever tasted!! Our room was always spotless ,and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom could use more counter space but we made it work. We took the trolley or walked our way around the whole town. Dinner in the hotel were so-so , but the breakfast were delicious. Dinner at The Grill Room at the windsor court hotel was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: AlleyCatFaery
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Le Pavillon in Sept 2011. The staff is amazing (very helpful with directions and dining suggestions) and the hotel and rooms were beautiful. It's located 2-4 blocks from 2 trolley lines and Bourbon Street (far enough away from the noise, but close enough to walk to). This was a combination Business/Personal trip. Make sure you try their lunch buffet during the week (it was great) or the Sunday brunch (didn't have time to try it, but others told us it was the best in NOLA). We would definately stay there again. Make sure you eat at Felix's, Mother's, Royal House, Dragos, and Johnny's (all were delicious). Get the Charred Oysters any chance you can (they are amazing).
