Also, buy a trolley pass for $3 (lets you ride all 3 lines, all day and nite, unlimited on/off stops). We also did the daytime Haunted City/Graveyard walking tour. It starts at Rev. Zombie's Voodoo Shop and takes you on a nice walk through the French Quarter. It's only $20 for 2 hours and was VERY informative about the history of New Orleans (and Yes,we got to see Marie Laveau's gravesite). Bourbon St was really crazy and fun (loved it and we are in our 40s). Also, I felt safe the whole time we were there. Have a great time in New Orleans. Give her your love and I promise she will love you back!

Reviews.Title: “Grand and sophisticated, yet casual elegance”
Reviews.Author: Xena498
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and LOVED this hotel. Loved the atmosphere from the first moment we stepped into the lobby with the magnificant crystal chandeliers and to the ornate windows and magnificant furnishings. Staff was very professional and friendly. Our king sized bed was comfortable and clean. It is 0.8 miles to Cafe du Monde which to us is a short walk or trolley ride. We also ate in the hotel restaurant and the food was outstanding. This was a really fun and remarkable experience for our first visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: TrevellingDuo
Reviews.Content: We only had one night in this very nice hotel but loved every but of it. From the time we pulled up to Valet we knew it was going to be a good experience. The hotel is very nice, staff was exceptionally friendly, and room was great! Walked to Bourbon Street- even back in the dark and didn't feel insecure at all. If we do not stay in the French Quarter - this will be the place on our next visit to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Bosoxlvr
Reviews.Content: From the minute I arrived I was spoiled by the staff of this hotel. This hotel is the epitome of full service. From the doorman to the front desk to the waitstaff to the housekeeping department everyoone is professional and top notch. The decor brings you back to an earlier time that you don't see anywhere these days. The peanut butter & jelly in the evenings was AWESOME and the rooftop pool was an unexpected bonus. We sat up there in the evenings and it was beautiful. Sure some of the property is a bit dated but the hotel is over 100 years old and full of antiques and original flooring and artwork. I would definetly return :) Just a tip, the restaurant across the street (On Bayonne -P&G) is diner style and extremely affordable and DELICIOUS for breakfast and true New Orleans style cooking.

Reviews.Title: “Just meh. We won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: KateJigs
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here, and it's going to be the last. The lobby is lovely, and the rooms are quite pretty at first glance. It's not until you notice the dust-encrusted vent in the bathroom and, oh, the fake ladies' nail adhered to the throw pillow on your bed that you start to have questions about the overall cleanliness of the hotel. The staff walks down the hall at all hours of the day and night either having LOUD conversations with each other, or with their walkie talkies on full volume. The ice machine is directly across the hall from us and I have listened to people loudly get ice every hour on the hour. There has been a traffic cop outside blowing his whistle continuously for the last 36 hours. Guests were running down the hall at midnight last night yelling "Who dat?!?" I get that we are in New Orleans but we deliberately stayed out of the quarter for a little peace and quiet, and to avoid some of the general a**holery that the quarter offers. We seem to have failed. The roof pool is nice but there are not nearly enough chairs. For every pro at this hotel there's unfortunately a more glaring con. We'll be trying elsewhere on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ajimsojka
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The details are amazing. It was built in 1907 or 1910, in belle epoque (I think) style. It looks like you are walking into history. The service was fantastic. From the front desk staff to the restaurant, thumbs up. Unfortunately, we did not get to try the famous PB&J late night snack. Seriously, I am bummed about that. Strange how I want to go back just to eat a sandwich I can make at my house. But that is the ambiance of this place. The room was kind of small, not European small mind you, but not huge. However, it was big enough to still be comfortable. The bathroom was neat, full of decoration and a nice shower. My only complaint, why I didn't give it five stars, is that it looked a little tired. The room could have used a little updating or a fresh coat of paint. The bed was OK, but not a 5-star bed, the matress was probably ending its useful service life. But, don't let that little thing dissuade you. The bed was still comfie, the room was still beautiful, the food great. I would stay here again. And if you are coming in for a Saints game or anything at the Dome, it is really close. You can walk with ease. The Quarter is a bit of a walk, but you can do it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here!!!”
Reviews.Author: lbegley
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and elegant hotel. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The best part was the peanut butter and jelly and hot cocoa buffet every night at 10 pm! The pool on the roof is beautiful and you get a great view of the city. Everyone went above and beyond and we loved it. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey M
Reviews.Content: The ONLY place that I love to stay in New Orleans! Amazing, personal service, gorgeous accommodations ripe with history and old world decadence. You absolutely cannot go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great finish to a great vacation...”
Reviews.Author: Phil N
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel! We had just departed from a returning cruise and had arrived at the hotel hours before check in time. We were confident that we could store our luggage until 3PM, but much to our surprise, they had available space and allowed us an early (and much welcomed) check in. The staff is wonderfully accomodating. The peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and hot chocolate are a nice touch to the end of the day too! Our only regret is that we were only there for one night. Next time in New Orleans, there is only one choice: Le Pavillion!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, convenient, great people, extra touches.”
Reviews.Author: vacaters
Reviews.Content: We came into town to run the Rock and Roll marathon and chose this hotel because it wasn't your run-of-the-mill chain and its great location. We got all that and then some. They had a wonderful "runner friendly" breakfast all laid out at 5:00 AM...totally unexpected and unadvertised. We ate in the hotel restaurant almost everyday because of the high end ambiance and budget prices (they had specials most days that made it very affordable). We loved everything from the doorman in the top-hat to our beautiful room. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience; would absolutely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Epictrip11
Reviews.Content: This place is great! It's rumored that the third floor is "haunted", and by chance that's the floor we were placed on. No ghost sightings or paranormal experiences, though, so don't let the ghost tales spook you. Haha! The hallways are lined with great paintings that are very versatile; if you're in a creepy mood they seem really creepy! And if you're in a normal mood they're just interesting paintings. The rooftop pool area is lovely, with a lovely view, and the evening peanut butter and jelly bar is just sweet and fun. Instead of mints on your pillows when they turn down your bed, they place house made shortbread cookies with little dabs of pb&j, and they also give you complementary water. The location is great, too; you're within easy walking distance to the French Quarter, without the hassle of being IN it; we also stayed at a hotel in the French Quarter and trust me... you're paying for LOCATION when you stay in the French Quarter, not an excellent hotel experience. Couldn't rate Le Pavillon higher, in my book! It's a great hotel, and I absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Old New Orleans Charm”
Reviews.Author: jlcates
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night, as this was a waypoint to our destination. The lobby was strikingly beautiful and the entire hotel embodied old New Orleans charm, from the decoration of the hotel right down to the friendly, curteous staff who more than eager to assist you. It has a very nice pool located on the rooftop which provided a nice view of the city. This is one of the features that we were looking for in a hotel, as there are limited selections when looking for a place with a pool close to the Quarter. Furthermore, it was only a short walk to the Quarter itself. They also have a fantastic late-nite PB&J buffet, which the kids really loved. I would definitely stay here again and certainly recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby and entryway but rooms are lacking”
Reviews.Author: camalabbla
Reviews.Content: The entry area and downstairs are beautiful. The rooms are small/cramped, and the lighting is poor. I was trying to work in the room and had great difficulty. I had to use the laptop on the bed as the outlet by the desk didn't work and the lighting was not good. Problem is the mattress was old and in bad shape. It had a quilt like comforter which had clearly seen better days. All that said, the food was excellent albeit a bit pricey, both in the restaurant downstairs and room service. The staff was also superb--very friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: arabianfancycom
Reviews.Content: We were 2 ladies traveling together for a concert at the New Orleans Arena. Safe walking distance to and from Superdome, New Orleans Arena. A bit of a walk to Bourbon street but they provide maps etc. Amazingly elegant hotel. Superb service, from the valet parking to the door man, to concierge desk to check in. Elegant rooms in this 100 year old hotel. Plenty of space. Gorgeous bathroom, comfy beds, could have been a little newer mattresses. I felt a spring or too. Hair dryer sparked up at me, but I called front desk and they offered to replace quickly. That can happen anywhere. Did not visit pool area etc. Beware of $35 parking fee, no street parking. Taxes are high in New Orleans. 1 night, 2 queens, ran $208! NO DRINK Machines, high prices for in room drinks snacks. Overall amazing experience , Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A nice and unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: april77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice. Decor is what I would call historical. They have a lot of neat touches including the evening PB&J reception. In the room I found that they offer a bath service. They will come in and draw you a bath, you can pick a relaxation package that would include a bottle of wine or they have a ghost package where they will tell you stories of the property's ghost while running the bath and then leave you with a voodoo doll for protection. What a charming idea. Any way I thought everything was very nice, my only issue was that I tend to be noise sensitive and although they honored my request to be in a quiet room toward the end of the hall, I could hear every door slam on the floor as people came and went from their rooms. Might not be a problem for most, but when you are trying to sleep off drinks from the night before and half the hotel is checking out between 10 and 11 it can get a little frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oceansmith
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels I've stayed at in a long time. Very nicely appointed rooms. Terrific staff. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute nicest place to stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: horseromeo
Reviews.Content: Free upgrade into a suite upon arrival, friendly staff, beautiful pool deck and comfee beds. I am a big fan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia L
Reviews.Content: Great attention to detail, incredibly helpful staff, exactly what you imagine Southern Hospitality to be! The concierge is very helpful with everything from dinner reservations, directions and general things to do and see information. Got a great rate on Priceline and was impressed with how nice the hotel was. The rooms are well decorated with hand-painted motifs on the ceiling as well as the hallways and the elevator doors. Some people may think this is dated but it adds to the charm and history of the place. The peanut butter and jelly sandwiches along with hot chocolate and milk are fun, and for someone allergic to peanut butter it was nice that you could make your own too, I just wish people would not double dip their spoons and mix the peanut butter in the jelly!! The dinner special is a great deal if you don't want to go too far or spend too much. Parking is a bit expensive, but there are cheaper lots about a block or two away.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place, from another era”
Reviews.Author: wrightdda
Reviews.Content: This is not your average hotel, but we loved our stay here. Don't let the "store front' scare you, it's a wonderful old historic hotel with a old time service attitude that you just don't find any more. It's historic, so not everything is Marriott corporate finish, but it's lovely and full of charm. Had breakfast, lunch and dinner here and enjoyed it all. It's a very cool place, with friendly helpful people....we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place . . . but is it haunted???”
Reviews.Author: JosephSloboda
Reviews.Content: OK so the hotel is beautiful, no doubt about it And from the moment you walk in you are impressed by the giant chandeliers and old furniture, definately a throw back to the 19th century The staff is super nice and very helpful and the hole PB&J snack time thing they do every night is pretty cool too The rooms are small, but they are comfortable and nicely appointed. The bathrooms are tiny and cramped and the showers are set up very strange with no curtain and only a partial glass door so the floors always get soaked (you guys should do something about that) The restaurant was decent and the breakfast was good, but expensive Fitness center was hard to find on the top floor but good treadmills and decent universla machine. You just have to get off at the top floor go down the hall and then climb some stairs to the roof and go around a corner (totally confusing but you can eventually find it) Then we find out the place is supposedly haunted and that freaks out my wife and my friends wife. We think it is all BS but then the couple at the tabel next to us in breakfast starts talking about how their shower turned on during the night and they mean turned on full force, not a drip . . . very strange stuff but it won't keep me from coming back. I loved the place and its still close enough to the quarter that you can sort of walk or take avery short taxi ride. Great place that I was very happy with . . . Joe Sloboda

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: couscousthedog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Pavillon for three days in late August. This hotel is beautiful and staff is very pleasant and friendly. The rooms are a tad smaller than in most modern hotels but very comfortable. Bedsheets are high qualiity. This hotel is conveniently located: close enough to the French Quarters to walk within 10 minutes yet far enough to spare you from the noise later at night. The hotel restaurant has a $15 menu daily which consists of mainly comfort food which is perfect if you tend to travel a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Pat0820
Reviews.Content: Awesome location with beautiful old world charm. Staff great and food excellent. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Adoreable, Authentic and a great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Electra1116
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel coming back from a cruise for 3 days to take in New Orleans. The hotel is beautiful and has quite a history. It is a little bit of a walk to burbon street but honestly not bad at all. The staff is fantastic and friendly. The pool is very nice. All in all a great place to stay no complaints. Definately do not miss eating at NOLA, Cafe Bignet, a night out on Burbon Street or the Plantation excursion!

Reviews.Title: “excellent in every way!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: daisy123616
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were treated so well.Love this Hotel and will not stay anywhere else! THE BEST!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - Love the peanut butter sandwiches! :-)”
Reviews.Author: Nellan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. The staff are all very helpful and nice. Rooms were nice, spacious and clean. The bathrooms were renovated and modern. The lobby is gorgeous - elegant and stylish. We took a cab from the airport for $33 total for 2 people. Every night at 10pm, they serve peanut butter & jelly sandwiches in the lobby and also hot chocolate (Since we were there in the summer, the hot chocolate wasn't too appealing, but I'm sure it would be different in the winter!) Special mention should be made of the fabulous bartender Pam: She is SUPER nice! She also had some great ideas where to go etc. The concierge was a great with maps, ideas and assistance should you want to get ideas where to go for lunch etc. Easy to walk to the French Quarter and the shops at Canal Place (Saks, BCBG, etc.) - Location couldn't be beat: Close enough yet not inside the noise of Bourbon street. We did have dinner at the hotel one night - and for $15 they had lasagna, veggies and then bread pudding; Quite a bargain and great food. If I had any complaint it would be that I think a "Leading Hotel of the World" should perhaps stock conditioner in their amenities. "Moisturizing shampoo" doesn't quite cut it for women with long hair.... Also, it would be nice to have a coffee machine in the room, but room service was super fast with great coffee, so it was ok. Will stay here again. Thank you everyone at this hotel for making our stay great!

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: omeleko
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel. The location was pretty good and it looks so elegant and clean. The rooms were just the right size and the bed's and sheets were amazing quality. I usually have a hard time falling asleep in hotel beds, but that was not the case w/ this one. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful older property”
Reviews.Author: dms1878
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with a great staff. The common areas are amazing with marble, antiques, etc. and the hallways are stunning. Every night at 10:00 they serve peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, a sweet tradition. That being said, people should also understand that it is a really old property and the rooms are small, the bathrooms are small and our room smelled - well, old. The pool is on the roof and there is a great view up there but they let people smoke around it and that was a negative for me. The fitness center is okay. There are a lot of things I liked about the place but a person who stays there has to really be into appreciating history or the other stuff will be a turn off.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous! And Southern hospitality at its FINEST!”
Reviews.Author: NolaBound13
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I stayed at Le Pavillon for a few days while in NOLA. While it was stunning, was very clean, had a fabulous staff, delicious restaurant, rooftop pool overlooking the city and much much more, the only two downsides I could find were that it was just a tad too far from the French Quarter to walk at night and a little too pricey. I loved so much about this place, but cannot forget the PB & J sandwiches and hot cocoa every night! What a way to end the day!

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon is a wonderful place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: GagaSmitty
Reviews.Content: Even if you're from New Orleans... take time out for a stay at Le Pavillon. The hotel is just beautiful ... filled with the character of the building. The staff is "Southern Hospitality" at its best!!! I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, classy, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bolts
Reviews.Content: We were in the middle of a road trip, and staying at Le Pavillon was a real treat. It was elegant, the staff was extremely helpful (the concierge gave us incredible tips) AND we got upgraded to their suite. Thank you Le Pavillon!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with free penut butter sandwitches”
Reviews.Author: JonathanCC
Reviews.Content: The is a lovely hotel which has nice rooms and very friendly staff. It is also only 5 mins walk from bourbon street and the french quater. Also the reason this hotel caught my eye origionally is the review which mentioned free penut butter and jam sadwitches. They are served from 10-11 along with hot chocolate and fruit. The hotel would still have been lovely without this but I thought this was a really nice touch. Definitley worth staying here if you are in New Orleans. Also the roof top pool and hot tub were very nice as well. Parking is quite expensive at $35 though.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant”
Reviews.Author: Mec224
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed mystay at le pavillon. It was near the french quarter without it being too close to the craziness of bourbon street. The service was excellent and the rooms had a very elegant feel. The pool is beautiful as well and has a great rooftopmview. The only negative comment i have is that the room was a bit outdated but it was still very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Dreams from Room 217!!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2sta
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Le Pavillon and I can assure you that this is a first class hotel all the way. Sure the nightly snack of PB & J are nice but the staff, the warmth of the hotel, and the feeling of security is second to none. Clean room, clean and crisp linens, car service was very speedy, excellent breakfast in Crystal Room. Contacted Ed Morin the Manager to share our experience and he was super nice as well. I would recommend thus hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely adored this hotel!"”
Reviews.Author: CarrieAntigua
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon far exceeded my expectations...The staff is by far the friendliest ever and we felt so completely comfortable. The hotel restaurants are excellent ! It is perfectly situated in the business district and within walking distance to many fine restaurants and of course the French Quarter. I plan to return next year and can hardly wait!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with that wonderful southern charm & hospitality”
Reviews.Author: LuvsTheCaribbean
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this lovely hotel. From the peanut butter and jelly sandwiches to the awesome concierge staff, you're family when you stay here. My husband and I stayed here for our 12th year anniversary & instantly fell in love with the beautiful architecture, the wonderful staff, the charm. Friends who have been to New Orleans recommended not staying on Bourbon St due to noise - they recommended staying blocks off of the french quarter. You're 3 blocks from 'must eat at' Mothers restaurant; 4 blocks from the French Quarter; 2 blocks from Dizzy's (THE best Sunday brunch I've had); on the NORTA; 2 blocks from the very lovely LaFayette Square - sooo wonderful! During our stay, the <free> Crescent City Blues and BBQ Festival was ocurring at lovely, historic LaFayette square, a mere 3 blocks away - it was fabulous!!! Excellent food from all over the city, awesome music and the nicest people I've ever met - 2 couples bought us the wonderful Abita beers when they heard we were celebrating our anniversary!! I'll never forget!) If you want to stay at an absolutely gorgeous historic hotel that is in the heart of everything, but not too noisy (ie, French Quarter), this place is for you!!

Reviews.Title: “A classic, not to be missed.”
Reviews.Author: NOLASIA
Reviews.Content: Located in the CBD. Not convcenient for walking to the French Quarter. No problem, the hotel is a destination in itself with its rooftop pool and lovely historical decor. The rooms are relatively small because the building is dated. However the furnishings are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Love the look, feel and little extras here”
Reviews.Author: TexasVacationer09
Reviews.Content: So my favorite thing about this hotel is the peanut butter and jelly time! Every night they offer hot cocoa and a PB&J bar for the guests at 10pm. The hotel has a great staff, clean and cute rooms and a fantastic lobby. It is a little bit of a trek to Bourbon St but still walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angela H
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a beautiful, comfortable hotel with wonderful service, this is it. The staff is friendly and helpful and go out of their way to get what you need. The building is beautiful and just a short walk to the French Quarter. The trolley runs about 2 blocks away. We loved the peanut butter and jelly and hot chocolate every night and the turn down service with peanut butter and jelly cookies. The rooftop area with the pool and hot tub is a nice place to sit at night and see the city.

Reviews.Title: “overall fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bwilder00
Reviews.Content: almost perfect stay here just a couple of small things kept it from perfection a maid entered my room at 8 am to clean thats way to early for me on vacation and my minibar was broken and all the drinks were warm other than those very minor things this is the best hotel i have ever stayed at and would reccomend it very very highly we will be back for sure!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best and then some... Perfect Hotel for your family”
Reviews.Author: angelairlines17
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best hotels I have stayed in, the best in the United States so far... I love this hotel; I appreciate the staff, the warmth, and the friendly staff and overall feel of it. I wanted to recommend this Hotel for anyone who likes to take a trip to New Orleans and experience the best. Pros... Hotel Staff, Feel, the comfort BED, PB and J's... now the Cons. the only thing I might say I did not like was the $35 charge for parking a night, but o-well least it was gated, and it's not on Bourbon St. 5 blocks away but o-well cab it or Trolley it and Ice machine was out of order on our floor that it.. But allot of it, I did not mind at all, so no cons...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheranj
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed last year on a fun trip to New Orleans. The hotel and our room were very nice. And the location was good. Not a bad walk to the French Quarter. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: craftyfoxmob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Pavillon as part of a touring trip of the southern states and were blown away by the quality, charm and value for money from this splendid old world hotel. Nothing dissapointed and nearly everything was a delightful surprise from the quality of the decor to our enjoyment of a swim in the rooftop pool. Eat in the dining room , we did on five occasions and we can only" send our compliments to the chef ". The Hotel is ideally located for a short walk to the French quarter or shopping on Canal Street, the superdome is also within easy walking distance. We loved New Orleans and will return to Le Pavillon as our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs?”
Reviews.Author: OMSBEQAJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Pavillon April 14th through the 18th. Memorial Day weekend -- about 6 weeks later -- I started getting bitten and discovered bedbugs beginning to take root in my mattress. I had exterminators come in with a bedbug sniffing dog and the dog barked at the bed, my couch, dressers, and my luggage. Luggage I had not used since New Orleans and Le Pavillon. And luggage I had not used in ages prior. I can't say at all for certain that Le Pavillon was the source of the bedbugs, I won't make that claim at all. But the room we stayed in was dingy, dark and old. It smelled musty and felt dirty. And the time-line fits that this is where it happened. As a now savvy bedbug traveller, I would only suggest that anyone staying at Le Pavillon take precaution. One other thing to note: I called Le Pavillon to tell them what happened. The next day they asked me to send them the receipts for all of my expenses - I wound up spending about $2000 on esterminators, laundry, cleaning supplies, throwing away clothing, etc. I asked them if they'd found bed bugs, but they would neither confirm nor deny. Several days later, I got a call from their insurance agent who GRILLED me; I felt like I was being deposed. I guess it's a liability thing, but I never asked them for money, I only called to tell them what happened and ask them to check the room. If they had found bedbugs, then I would have asked them to pay my out of pocket costs. They sent their insurance agent after me and I wan't very happy about it. When I pressed them about bedbugs in the room, I was told that they did a "visual inspection" of my room - room 431 - and the adjoining rooms. Personally, I don't think a visual inspection is sufficient. And while the staff of Le Pavillon was fantastic, this experience has soured me on the hotel. Again, I have no direct proof that I got bedbugs from Le Pavillon, but travelers should take precautions. As a now savvy bedbug traveler, I will take precautions with any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JulieVA
Reviews.Content: I had booked a 5-night stay at Le Pavillon from the end of June into the first weekend of July. Unfortunately, due to airline problems (thank you SO much, USAir!), I was not able to check in the first night of my reservation. I called the hotel to keep the staff updated on my progress, and was constantly assured that I could check in whenever I arrived, and that my resservation would not be cancelled, even though I was not checking in on the first night. When I arrived 22 hours late (again, USAir, I just can't say enough about YOU), the front desk had notes from my calls & made me welcome from "hello". Even though I had not checked in as scheduled, it was the 4th of July weekend, and Essence Fest was starting, the type of room I had reserved had been held for me. I was whisked through check-in, and taken to my beautiful room for a much-needed bit of rest. This is definitely a 4-star hotel. The room was gorgeous, the hallways and lobby were beautifully decorated, and the service was excellent. I had drinks in the bar one night, and they were not overpriced - the prices were comparable to any bar in New Orleans, and the polite and friendly service was more welcoming. The bartender even sent me back to my room with a bowlful of cajun snack mix - a nice touch. The view from my window was nothing to write home about - just the pizza parlor on the next block. The toilet paper was chintzy - one-ply in spots, two-ply in others (how is that even possible?). The hotel got much busier over the weekend, with the holiday & Essence, so the room price went sky-high for those two days. Those are the only negative things I can say about Le Pavillon. The bed was comfortable, the room is well-furnished & lovely to be in, the bathroom was elegant in all black marble, and every person I encountered was friendly and helpful. It's clear that the staff understands that their job is to enhance your experience, and it seemed as though each employee took that mission to heart. The doormen are great! The location is within walking distance of Canal Street, which you can cross to get into the French Quarter, or stroll along to the riverfront & the casino. The St. Charles streetcar line is a block away, which you can take to Canal if you don't want to walk the five blocks. Lafayette Square is within walking distance as well. If I were only going to be in the French Quarter, I might choose someplace different. For an overall convenient location, and a wonderfully indulgent stay, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “5 star staff with 3 star accomidations”
Reviews.Author: ShreveportDoc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well appointed, in the Lobby. (It is truly stunning). I frequent NOLA often and have stayed in many hotels here. The hotel was a good deal at about $130 on hotwire, but not worth much more. Our check in was seamless, the bellhop and parking staff were very friendly and cordial (as were all the staff). The $35 parking is overpriced, (I am originally from NYC, parking costs less there). Upon our arrival we were infromed that the fridge was fitted with an IR sensor, this presented a problem as my father had medications that required refridgeration. I called the front desk, they delivered a fridge in minutes that was clean and worked well. The staff was OUTSTANDING, but the building is in disrepair. The carpet in the rooms is old and worn, the bathrooms are cramped, the iron provided is cheap and left a stain on a shirt. The TV had poor reception and is clearly from the 1980's. The rooftop pool area is very nice. The hotel is considerably farther from the french quarter when compared to canal street (this matters if you opt to walk around in the Louisiana sun).The PB&J is a nice touch, but really only matters if you are traveling with kids. Overall, if you get a good deal, worth a stay for a night or two. If paying full price you are better served at Loews or the W.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: reddogsrule
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. Decor is classic French and you feel elegant from the moment you enter the lobby. But this is not a stuffy place! Staff exceeded expectations honestly in all areas making you feel at home. Our room had a 4-poster bed! Restaurant offered a really inexpensive dinner special that was a great option for us having driven all day in the rain. Fitness center and pool are on the top floor with great views of the city. Don't forget the complimentary PB&J sandwiches at 10 PM in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years Trip to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel10000
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great hot tubs on the roof, right in the middle of the city with easy walking access to Bourbon Street, Cafe Dumond, and a bunch of great sites. Loved the peanut butter and jelly sandwiches with hot chocolate every night at 10PM. Awesome trip. Also, we accidentally took everything out of fridge and got auto-charged for it on our bill. Service desk immediately fixed it and put a fridge in our room for our own water and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel .You would think you stepped back in time,but bring warm clothes”
Reviews.Author: nonrevlga
Reviews.Content: What a find and bargain . I got this hotel from Hotel. com .Paid $103.00/nite. beautifully decorated all over. My room was very small and the A/C made alot of noise. The dining room was fabulous and you must try the specials. For 15.00 one nite its all you can eat Lasagne with a side of string beans and salad. Comes with the dinner rolls and topped off with bread pudding. All very delicious. With food this good and at the special price we didnt have to go out to eat dinner. Food staff even went above and beyond by making a banana foster right there pan, flame and all and it was not on menu. I asked the concerige prior to dinner time where we could get a good banana foster close by. There was no place close . she picked up the phone and called food dept. She said they will do it for us . What service!! The hotel was very well airconditioned >>>too well, had to wear lightjackets even at din ner time as well as in the business center. As good of a place as it was, that could possibly deter me from this hotel in the future . If you plan to give this a try stay away from the corner rooms, they are very small. I guess for the money I paid that was what I got Location is good....10-15min to Bourbon st 25 min to WWII museum 25 min to French Qtr All pleasant walks

Reviews.Title: “Charming and comfortable. No regrets.”
Reviews.Author: LBoyer57
Reviews.Content: I agonized over my booking at this hotel. It was my first experience using Hotwire, and I thought, "How could I go wrong with 4.5 stars for $99"? After finding out what hotel I got, I read the Trip Advisor reviews and got really scared. Hotwire is non-refundable, and I was reading about dirt and mold, possible bedbugs, and horrible threadbare linens. I wanted out! But I went. People, let me put your minds at ease. Le Pavillon is a charming, even (dare I say it) beautiful hotel. The service staff was wonderful. It was clean and comfortable. No, it is not a 4.5 star hotel. But it is hard to put this hotel into star categories. It is far beyond 3 stars. There is something unique about it that's very likable; perhaps it's the "old world" feeling people talk about, or the regal, over-the-top decor. For many reviewers the decor is a turn-off, and I acknowledge that it's not tasteful in any sleek, modern way. But if you have a little sense of humor and can handle a wee bit of kitsch, Le Pavillon is lovely. I took two 18-year-olds with me to New Orleans for Spring break, who have not travelled extensively (but both have at least been to Europe and New York City). When we walked into Le Pavillon's lobby they were wide-eyed and breathless. "I've never seen anyplace so beautiful," said one of them. For me, that was worth it all. The downside is, as you will see in many of these reviews, that this hotel could really use new beds and new bedding. (The bed was comfortable and clean, but not luxurious.) For me, bedding is one of the most important things in a hotel room, and if Le Pavillon wants to keep and increase its business, it will have to make this investment in the near future. The baths could use a sprucing up as well. One thing we appreciated was that the hotel dining room offered a 3-course nightly dinner special for just $15 (approximately). Of course, in New Orleans you want to sample the city's many dining experiences, but on our first night we were tired from a long day of travel, and eating in the hotel was all we had energy for. It turned out to be one of our favorite meals. We got salad, main course, and dessert for the price; our waiter was very personable, and there was a fire in the fireplace (which was good in March). All in all, we enjoyed our stay at Le Pavillon very much. I did not find it to be dirty or moldy, and the bedding did not suck. We did not get any bedbug bites! It just may be a bit over-rated by Hotwire. After all my worries, by the way, Hotwire turned out to be a great deal. I wouldn't have enjoyed the hotel so much if I had paid much more for my room. (Just don't book this way if you want a refundable fee!)

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lthale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 10th anniversary trip at Le Pavillon and were very pleased. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, and the housekeeping was some of the best and most prompt I've ever experienced. At 5 blocks from the French Quarter, it was a comfortable walk there, close to all the museums in the Arts District, and quiet enough to get a good nights sleep. We would recommend it to anyone! Oh! And you can't beat the 10:00pm PB&Js served in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel at the right price - but wouldn't pay more”
Reviews.Author: wtracing
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Hotwire for a little over 100 a night with tax. First, Hotwire lists this as a 4.5 star hotel, which is not accurate. No other website seems to list the hotel as 4.5 stars, and the hotel itself is nowhere near a 5 star hotel. However, I am not sure this is really the hotels fault. On arrival the front desk was very friendly. The lobby is beautiful and has old world charm. We were given a room on the 2nd floor - which I would advise against since all of the banquet rooms are also on this floor. The room itself was not really representative of the pictures we saw online. I would presume the deluxe guest rooms are better appointed - but this room really just felt a bit cheap. The furniture was not what I would call 4 star quality and while the hotel goes for an old world vibe - you don't actually want a room that looks like it hasn't been updated in the modern era either. The bathroom was the best part of the room however. The large walk in shower was really nice and had great water pressure. The bathroom had a marble sink and floor and was well appointed. The bathroom did have an elegant look to it. However, like other areas of the hotel - a few details seem to have been forgotten. There were paint chips on the door missing and some soap scum around the glass wall for the showers. Neither of these things are a huge problem - but once again, if the hotel was billing itself as 4 or 4.5 stars - are details that should not be missed. The pool area on the rooftop was also nice. It is contrary to other reviews, not the best rooftop pool in New Orleans. The W, the Westin and the Roosevelt all have better deck pools and there may be others too. However, when we tried to call for room service to bring a pitcher of beer to the rooftop, they seemed confused someone would order a pitcher of beer. Room service said they weren't sure they had pitchers but would figure something out. They eventually brought beer in a metal milk or juice pitcher and some Styrofoam cups. For this pitcher of beer they charged $36.00. Do NOT order a pitcher of beer! I've ordered pitchers of beer from rooftop pools in Miami and paid half of that with all of the delivery charges and tip included! I would recommend bringing your own drinks or waiting to drink later! Overall, the stay was good. The bed was soft and comfortable and the staff very friendly. While we're happy with the stay because of the price we got on Hotwire, I would have likely been a little upset had we paid the rack rate. The hotel does have charm and I believe some of the rooms are probably quite nice. I would recommend springing for the deluxe room if you do stay because if our room was typical of the standard room - you could do better in New Orleans. I've also noticed comments on the outrageous parking fees. There is a parking garage on the other side of Poydras & O'Keefe St. in a funky modern steel building that is $10.00 for 24/hrs. I strongly recommend just parking there and walking the 2 blocks to the hotel if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Old and out of date, but it does have chandeliers”
Reviews.Author: DoubleOJosh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very old, and apparently this means they can charge you enormous amounts for everything. The room felt extremely old and out of date, but not in a quaint or charming way. The rooftop pool had great views and was the best part of our stay, but the cockroaches running around the warm (not hot) tub dampened the experience. $35 parking and IR sensors in the fridge mean you get charged $4 for simply picking up and looking at a bottled water. Oddly enough, one of the experiences they boast are their free PB&J sandwiches in the lobby from 10-11pm - sorry, wasn't excited enough to try these.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay with a nice surprise - want to go back”
Reviews.Author: ExpeditionMan
Reviews.Content: I booked the Le Pavillon via a discount website for a trade show in New Orleans. Stayed two evenings. What a great stay. I was about a mile away from the Convention center which was an easy and safe walk and the temps were perfect. The hotel was rich in tradition and I really felt at home. I typically stay at the chain hotels and this has helped open my eyes to other options. The room was perfect for me, internet worked quickly, although I didn't utilize any of the bath services available I thought they were interesting. They serve peanut butter and jelly sandwiches at 10am as part of a storied tradtion. I thought it was a little corny but happened to be returning around 10pm and what a great time that was. A real sense of community and activity. I loved it and made it a point to go back the second evening, I loved the hot chocolate with the fresh whipped cream also. My bed was pretty comfy, lots of pillows. I felt relaxed at this hotel and I was on about two straight weeks of travel and it just felt right. Walked down to Bourbon street one evening and it was about a 10 minute walk. Pretty secure accept for one block. As a guy I felt fine walking there, I wouldn't have wanted my wife to do it though. The dining room has great specials and the food was quite good with an attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “TRUE NEW ORLEANS DECOR AND OUTSTANDING SERVICE!!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda5505
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel! We go to NOLA once a year but this was a first at Le Pavillon. Far exceeded our expectations. BEAUTIFUL doesnt even begin to describe this place. Lots of chandeliers and historical paintings. Rooftop pool is a tad on the small size but very relaxing atmosphere. I will only choose this hotel from here on out! Walking distance to French Quarter but also away from the hustle of it all! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Went Beyond my expectations”
Reviews.Author: starmd2002
Reviews.Content: I just spent five days in new orleans, LA at this hotel. During my search I was hesitant but I have to say that the hotel surpassed my expectations. Let me begin by saying that if you enjoy the old school, renaissance type design this is the place for you. I loved the high ceilings and chandeliers of the lobby. And although my room was small, the bed was comfortable and the temperature controls were easy so I had no issue spending time in my room. The only thing is the TV was a large tube rather than a flat panel. That could use some updating. When I was looking for hotels I initially chose one in the french quarter. Let me say that the location of this hotel is much much better. The french quarter/bourbon street is pretty rowdy at night and the location of Le Pavillon allows you to be away from that but within walking distance of the french quarter and its attractions. We were even able to walk down to the garden district from here. And last but not least the staff of the hotel are pleasant and helpful. All in all, I enjoyed my stay here and wouldn't mind coming back.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have stayed and will return”
Reviews.Author: CSINGALLS2010
Reviews.Content: You must try out this hotel. It is great! The classic styling and marble just make the entrance a teaser. All of the staff, all of them are friendly and professional. The hotel as said in other reviews is dated but well worth the stay. Pictures, magnificent styling and friendly staff make this hotel a keeper. You must try the PBJ sandwiches at least once, at 10 PM. Grab the chocolate milk first as it goes quick. I have stayed at many hotels and the relaxing atmosphere and terrific staff make this hotel a keeper. Try the breakfast buffett, which has the best French toast and warm syrup.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent, disappointing and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Dena E
Reviews.Content: This is my first cautionary review. We researched this hotel and decided to stay here to have a more authentic or historical New Orleans experience. Unfortunately we were in a very small, dirty room with thin walls. We could hear our neighbors' conversation. After discovering more evidence of poor cleanliness in the room, we called the front desk, let them know the situation, and were moved to a nicer room. The new room felt like a different hotel! However, I would still not recommend this hotel given it's price point, even in the junior suite. Disappointig experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller Is Friendlier”
Reviews.Author: Skye7144
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel, the hallways are done in mint, cream and gold, and my room was also quite nicely decorated. However, the hotel is much smaller then the accomodations I usually book, and I wondered if this would turn out to be a problem for me (no snack bar/coffee shop, no gift shop). However, I have to say that the friendliness and attention of the staff more than made up for those other conveniences. I was always greeted by name, which made me feel very welcomed and which I found pleasing. In particular, I would like to note how wonderful the concierge desk was, especially Lou. Unlike my experiences in many bigger hotels, I NEVER saw the concierge desk unmanned. There was someone there at all times. Lou went out of her way to make sure I had exactly the arrangments I was seeking, and offered several valuable suggestions on things to do and see. The rooftop pool was small but clean and had a nice view of the city. And I also LOVED the free WIFI..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Celeanor
Reviews.Content: Would stay here again. The lobby is beautiful. Staff was all very friendly and helpful. Cedric the doorman is charming. Fantastic vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Another stay--another pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Prestoni
Reviews.Content: This is my fifth stay at this hotel and I have stayed at many hotels in and around New Orleans over the last 16 years as I am there once a quarter on business. I love this hotel because it is clean, easy to access and some of the friendliest staff around. Since I have repeated stays, my staff was able to negotiate a good business rate that is lower than what I paid at much lower quality downtown hotels. My wife travels with me most of the time and thoroughly enjoys this hotel. I love the 10PM Peanut Butter & Jelly Sandwich Gathering in the lobby. Hot cocoa, milk and sandwiches are available for guests. It is an old hotel and some of the plumbing and room spacing can be challenging. I travel about 180 days a year with a visit in different cities each week (sometimes two in a week) so I am sensitive about hotel accommodations. The restaurant is sparsely occupied at night but the wait staff are attentive and friendly. The evening special can be hit or miss but I never had a significant issue with the food. I am staying there this week so this is fresh in my mind.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: WendyWa_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a horrible flying experience...so actully getting to New Orleans was a trying. As soon as we got to Le Pavillion our whole evening turned around. Everyone was so nice and getting some PBJ's and check-in was a welcome sight. To add to our evening, there was a fruit basket in our room for being a return customer....What a classy touch that made us feel special!!! Thank you Le Pavillion for everything. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “plan on spending $40 more per night for parking. Elegant older hotel.”
Reviews.Author: shandsnut
Reviews.Content: the day that I left I got a bill under my door for over $120 for parking for 3 nights. I was not told parking would cost that much. I was told that I had to use that parking no other options. I did not know how much it cost until i received the bill. The last day our room was not made up, we were gone until 5 pm so they had plenty of time. The hotel was elegant small rooms usually good service. This seemed like a good rate but was not due to parking costs. I would not stay there again. i

Reviews.Title: “Over priced... They MUST be losing money and cutting corners!”
Reviews.Author: Aaronalpine
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facility with potential... Staff friendly... Under staffed... Gym is 85 degrees... Quality of food is sub par... Pool water murky... Pb&j is cool...

Reviews.Title: “A touch of class”
Reviews.Author: Flashman7
Reviews.Content: This hotel oozes class from the moment you walk up the steps to classical music and are greeted by the friendly doorman. The decor inside is beautiful and the staff ultra friendly and helpful. The free late night PBJ sandwiches and hot chocolate was a nice touch and gives the hotel a very welcoming feel. This place is ideally situated a few minutes walk from all the sights and sounds of the French Quarter so there is lots to do nearby but is a quiet refuge to return to. We had a great stay here and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “great getaway”
Reviews.Author: 1shereeb
Reviews.Content: service was excellent, loved the peanut butter & jelly, David the doorman was one in a million he really my our stay even more pleasent...he knew directions,events,about parking etc. He's an assett to the hotel!!! I had great Bitrhday at Le Pavillion!

Reviews.Title: “Faded movie star”
Reviews.Author: DebiDJ
Reviews.Content: Like a lovely movie star, a little past her prime, Le Pavillon is intriguing and delightful. Le Pavillon is one of the oldest hotels in New Orleans. The lobby and halls are filled with delicious antiques. It's charming and quite fun to think about its history. The staff stays and stays. At first, they seem a bit standoffish. However, as you get to know the people in the hotel you come to like them more and more and more and more. It's one of the kindest and classiest places in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Classic New Orleans elegance with top notch service, no bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: susan333kj
Reviews.Content: We just recently went on a trip to New Orleans for my daughter Katie's Make-a-Wish to meet Lady Gaga. This was the hotel that the organization chose for us and it was a delightful surprise! I am very cautious about bed bugs and my husband emailed them before hand about my concerns and they were extremely nice and assured me that they take every precaution and report of bed bugs very seriously and treat the room immediately. They also informed us that no bed bugs had ever been reported in our room. When we arrived at the hotel it was a very old-fashioned classic white building. The lobby was absolutely spectacular and was very warm and pleasant. It was truly classy and elegant with New Orleans french charm. The bellhop was very kind and welcoming from the minute we pulled up. When we got to our room I was speechless. One of the concierge members at the hotel had worked for Make-a-Wish and made sure that our stay would be one we would never forget. The suite was enormous with an entryway, bedroom with two twins, master bedroom, guest bathroom, baby grand piano, huge flat screen tv in living room with two couches, and a dining area with a table that seats six! There was also an kitchenette with a sink, coffee maker, etc. We were truly blown away. The beds were comfortable enough and the bathrooms were small, but this is part of the charm of an old hotel. If you are looking for a state of the art modern luxury hotel this is not for you. But if you appreciate the old world comfort, history, and elegance and want an amazing experience that makes you feel like you are in a completely different era and you never want to leave, then you have found the right place. Great wireless internet as well. Dining room served breakfast for us even though it was time for lunch and the pb&j sandwiches in the lobby at 10pm is a great plus and sweet tradition! Loved this hotel and I did not see ONE bed bug or any sign of them on the mattress/in the room, and I know what to look for! Truly fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: JanSavannah
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. The staff was friendly & knowledgeable. The room was very pretty & clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The location is a little bit of a distance from the French Quarter but is walkable. There are also trolley cars close by.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: dixie118
Reviews.Content: we stayed 2 nights at le pavillon - the hotel is breath taking, from the lobby to the roof top pool and jacuzzi! The rooms are elegantly decorated very clean and comfortable. the service is great and all staff we extremely helpful, located a short distance from the quarter as well. excellent

Reviews.Title: “First class Service”
Reviews.Author: bill555
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week and enjoyed our stay there. The lobby is very elegant and spacious. The service there from the concierges to the friendly but professional breakfast server who told us about his family during Katrina and our breakfast server/bartender who got my wife to try grits and helped us learn more about jazzfest. Our breakfast waiter spoke very highly of the owners who supported his family during Katrina. This was probably the best staff at any hotel I have stayed at in terms of being helpful and friendly. The rooms were well decorated though I thought the air conditioner in our 7th floor room was quite noisey when on. I slept throught it but it did seem loud at first. The door lock cards had small problems but after we had to get new cards for the 3rd time they were going to tear apart the door and fix it but we told them to wait until we left the next morning. Rooms maybe a bit dated but its an old hotel but still very nicely decorated and fairly spacious. Roof top pool and hottub were a nice touch but only used once as we were so busy. Hotel is a moderate walk to teh French quarter and we did it several times.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMc28
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at the Le Pavillon Hotel while passing through New Orleans on one day business. The lobby is beautiful. The rooms are nice, older, but decorated splendidly. It reminds me of an old, charming, New Orleans style appeal. There are large walk-in closets in the rooms. The beds were very comfy. At around 9pm in the lobby they serve peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, fruit, and hot chocolate for free. Go get some! The only issue I had was with the parking (always an issue in New Orleans). There aren't many options if you didn't want to pay for parking at the hotel. Parking is expensive if I remember correctly at approximately $30-35 a day. Just be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: jet_setter092
Reviews.Content: Great hotel just 4 safe blocks from French Quarter. Excellent service, beautiful pool, old fashioned grand decor. About 4 blocks from Mother's, a restaurant that offers delicious local specialties and very friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Slept better at a Motel!”
Reviews.Author: sugar32
Reviews.Content: I've been to several events at Le Pavillon Hotel and always wanted to stay the night there so I was excited when I got my chance. However, my excitement was quickly turned into disappointment once I got settled into my room. The shower glass was dirty and hand white smugges and fingerprints all over, the TV console was covered in dust, the blankets were full of hair and very unclean, the lamps had what appeared to be water stains on the shades. And to top it off, the bed was hard as a rock and the pillows flat as pancakes. The second night was complimented by peple yelling and running in the hallway all night. I will not be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Only hotel we will stay in in NOLA from now on!”
Reviews.Author: c105
Reviews.Content: We visit New Orleans every year in April and have stayed at several different hotels. This was our first time at the Le Pavillon, which we booked and got a great deal on through hotwire.com. When making our reservation we requested a king bed instead of a double and the hotel was very accommodating (other hotels will typically not make promises on requests, particularly if you book with a third party) My first impression of the hotel was that the outside is beautiful. The inside is equally as nice with its traditional decor. If you don't appreciate antique/traditional style they don't stay here! The pictures on the hotel webpage are true to life so if you are curious- look at the pictures. If you want modern and trendy stay at a chain hotel. We stayed on the 9th floor and I know that other reviewers have complained about that floor being in need of updating but we found the room to be clean, comfortable and spacious. The 9th floor was also in close proximity to the pool, which was really convenient. The staff at the hotel were exceptional. Our room was nicely cleaned each day. Anything you requested (we had forgotten a toothbrush) was promptly brought to the room. I also thought that I had lost my wallet while out and after calling the hotel, staff went to my room, checked for and found my wallet all while I was still on the phone. The late night pb and j's were a great snack. The bread was always fresh and everything was presented nicely. The location of the hotel is also convenient. It is a very short walk to the french quarter but removed from the noise. It is also a short walk to the St. Charles Street car so there is easy access to the Garden District as well. Harrah's casino is also within walking distance. After staying at the Le Pavillon I don't see the need to stay any where else in New Orleans. We will be returning soon! Thank you for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Heart loves the charm of this place...head says need for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Kelwood
Reviews.Content: Your first impression when walking into Le Pavilion is WOW. The lobby is truly spectacular and the check in staff are professional and very helpful. We were quickly shown to our junior suite (large studio room), and settled in. The room was smallish but being an older hotel we were expecting this. The room was clean, as was the bathroom. However the bed was not great and the bed spread was very old and needed updating. The major problem with this room type is that it is directly behind the elevator and unfortunately the room is not insulated well and the noise was very loud. Most noise seemed to be coming in through the room's door which had a large gap at the bottom and around the edges. If proper seals were installed I'm sure the noise would be reduced. We were staying 4 nights so we asked if we could move to another room. Unfortunately all their junior suites are located behind the elevator shaft (the trade off for the slightly larger room). We also had difficulty with the hot water in the bathroom, it was either cold or scalding hot. As we required the extra room space due to work requirements, we decided to give the room a go for another night, rather than accepting a discounted upgrade to a full suite. We found putting pillows against the bottom of the door helped to reduce the noise! However the next morning there was no hot water. So we accepted the discounted upgrade for the remaining two nights of our stay. I must say the staff member I spoke to about our room issues was very understanding and professional and arranged for our luggage to be moved during the day whilst we were on a tour. This standard of service is what we loved about our stay at Le Pavillion. All staff we dealt with during our stay were first class and made you feel like you were very welcome and at home. The restaurant and bar areas were also brilliant. The Sunday jazz brunch is an absolute must, with high quality food and fabulous music. We were similarly impressed with dinner at the restaurant, with our server being well informed and very attentive. I cannot stress how wonderful the staff are at Le Pavillion and the restaurant, bar and lobby areas are first class luxury - you pay the extra to stay at a luxury hotel and these areas all deliver to the standard expected. However the rooms need improvement. Even the last two nights of our stay in the full suite were not without problems. The drapes on the bedroom window were broken and would not close, a light switch wouldn't work and the bathroom had no room for your toiletry bag even though it was a bigger room. Ultimately, the maintenance of the guest rooms is not good enough for a hotel that markets itself as a luxurious place to stay. The rest of the hotel is at a luxury standard, which is what was so frustrating about our stay. We loved the charm of the building, the spectacular common areas, the restaurant and the staff, but the rooms do not meet the same standard. I would recommend Le Pavillion to friends for a short 1 night stay so they could experience the restaurant and wonderful attentive staff, but until the rooms are improved I would not recommend a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and outdated”
Reviews.Author: Clackman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two-bedroom suite, with a sitting room between the bedrooms. The darkest, gloomiest sitting room you have ever seen. That is consistent with the decor of the entire hotel, which might be described as Victorian dreary. The bathrooms had signs saying that if we wanted to re-use our towels, don't hang them in the shower. Problem was there was no tower rack in the either bathroom, except for the one inside the shower. Only hotel bathroom I have ever seen that had no towel rack. And the counter space in the bathroom was hardly big enough for a tooth brush. Bed was comfortable, but again, the overall feel of the room was one of gloom. And the price was absurdly high -- more than a night at the Copacabana Palace in Rio, or the Covent Garden in London, or the Park Hyatt in Milan, or the Four Seasons in Chicago, Cairo, and Sharm el Sheikh (to name some of the hotels I've stayed in during the last six months). The location is nothing to brag about -- on a nondescript street well removed from shopping and restaurants and the main points of interest in the city. (It's 4 or 5 blocks from the French Quarter, which was fine with me -- can Bourbon Street get any sleazier?)

Reviews.Title: “awesome, but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: arkansastraveler2011
Reviews.Content: the hotel was great! the service was great! the only thing they could really improve on is putting a coffeepot in each room. Watch your bill--we found a charge of 11.65 on our bill for liquor from the the room's mini bar. We got nothing from the mini bar. the charges were removed. Our $135 room ended up costing $194 after taxes and parking....they should offer free parking for hotel patrons!

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest.”
Reviews.Author: BeladonaUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after walking out on a dirty B&B so did not get too much time to review it. It is a lovely hotel, very elegant.The roof top was very pretty with a pool and jacuzzi on top. (We also stayed at the Drury Inn across the street earlier on our trip and preferred that). The bed was so so with extremely soft and flat pillows. We had dinner there the first night in the Crystal room. The service was very slow and was later told there was only one guy back there, (in the kitchen I presume) the waiter was rather pompous and brought out the bread but never came back with a plate for it. Also my husband had to wait ages for his second glass of wine, we ended up not getting charged for it. Parking was $35+$4 tax= $39 per day extra, plus all the tipping to the valet guys. it was only $17 at The Drury Inn. I also opened the fridge and did not realize you get charged for opening and looking at something. Could not bring myself to pay $5 for a small Gatorade so put it back immediately. Got that taken care of at check out. There was pros and cons but a niceplace to stay a day or two, but probably would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bit Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CyndyJoy
Reviews.Content: We were very excited when we booked a "mystery 4.5 star hotel" on Hotwire and learned it was Le Pavillon as we have stayed several times in the past and really enjoyed our stays. While the lobby was still beautiful and our bellman, Albert, ever so gracious, we were very disappointed in the quality of the room we were given-Room 907. This room was in dire need of a makeover- old lumpy mattresses, worn bedding, noisy AC vent. The worst was the bathroom-while clean the bathroom floor looked dingy as did the bathmat--the tiles were cracked around the rub faucet and the tub NOT inviting at all. Pavillon now offers a "drawn bath" service but I wouldn't spend an extra penny for a bath in this room :( I believe the whole 9th floor (top floor) is of this quality. When I spoke with the front desk at checkout I was told I had the "standard room" as we had booked online through another source (not Le Pavillon website) If we had booked through them we would have been given a "deluxe room" This is a shame as the quality of our room was certainly not what I would call standard for Le Pavillon--extremely sub standard is more like it. Their brochure describes the hotel as the "Belle of the South"--this Belle needs needs some TLC--she's showing her age on the 9th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great location, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: remeh2
Reviews.Content: I love NOLA, I'm there alot and have stayed in hostels, BBs, and the luxe places. My husband and I, along with our 5 year old stayed here, booked through Hotwire.com. We arrived and David the doorman assisted right away...this is classy as it gets and he's a super nice guy(who probably deserves a raise). Pleased we had a 4.5 star hotel, we checked in...they didn't have our reservation. It was at least quickly remedied and we got an upgrade to a Deluxe King. Our room was very nice, the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was nicely appointed, but small(old hotel). Problem with the bathroom also is the WATER. The water went from scalding hot to freezing cold about 10 times in a 10 minute shower, this is NOT luxury...we were on the 6th floor(not certain if that makes a difference). We enjoyed the rooftop pool/jacuzzi. There's no bar on top though, so your only option is to order from a phone and pay dearly for any drinks/food(gratuity+fee+food/drink)...for me, it would be more reasonable to outfit the top with a working bar. The rooftop must be walked up one flight, no elevator after the 9th. The gym is small but nice, it only had one elliptical, which someone hogged the entire 45mins. I did floor work...only after I was leaving did she ask "oh, were you waiting on this?", nope! Service is the key to this place, PB&J's with milk served at 10pm...this is awesome and very nice/good(different breads, etc). A reasonable all-you-can-eat meat lasagna dinner was also one night for 15 bucks!(we didn't get to partake). There was also a breakfast buffet for 20 bucks(didn't get to that either but the menu looked good). Someone was willing to help at every turn, the staff was super accommodating. You returned to your room at night with turn-down service--robes, cookies(kinda plastic-y), water...nice gesture. If we hadn't gotten a good deal on the room, I probably would've stayed elsewhere with working hot/cold shower. There was FREE Wifi in room, which is rare. It's a nice downtown spot, you can walk everywhere, it's near alot and getting in/out was easy...the valet had your car there in a snap if you needed it...the parking is 35/night though!!

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel has charm but needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: threeday2
Reviews.Content: We were a little disappointed with Le Pavillon . We had read the previous reviews and as I like the Victorian charm we went . Our room had 2 queen beds was quiet , very well kept and reasonable in size for a hotel of this age, but the quality of the bedding, in particular the pillows need attention. We had stayed at a Hampton earlier on our trip and there was no comparison . Staff were attentive and helpful but the inexpensive fixed priced dinner in the dining room was a case of "you get what you pay for" and you can eat out locally far better. Take the street car out to Commanders Palace for lunch and pick up their walking tour guide for a very interesting walk around the Garden District. The old cemetery is directly opposite. Location wise Good if you don't want to be in the middle of the lively French Quarter and enjoy walking as the top end of the French Quarter is not so far.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: ictfatboy
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I chose this hotel at random from a list of brochures at the Louisiana travel center. The location is very close to Bourbon, 5 minute walk. The rooftop pool and hot tub is fantastic in the evening. The peanut butter and jelly sandwiches at 10pm in the evening is unique and should be tried at least once to say you did it. Be sure to check at the visitor center and ask about the Visitor Center rate. We got this hotel from Sunday thru Wednesday for $69 per night with free parking! I will definitely stay here again on any future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Experienced the Heart and Soul of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Rick-Rozzi
Reviews.Content: Went here for Spring Break. Wonderful Historic Hotel. Family loved it. Close to the French Quarter. Rooms were large, good view of downtown and a terrific bathroom

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in better, for less.”
Reviews.Author: terribluefire
Reviews.Content: We go to New Orleans for leisure a few times a year. This was a splurge, to stay at such a highly regarded hotel, and I personally was disappointed. The historical value of being in a hotel you know some of the rich and famous have passed through was the best part of the experience. Looking at the chandeleurs, paintings, decor and realizing what actual art you were viewing was stepping back in time. I tried to consider that in feeling that in some ways I had to take into account the age of the hotel. It was definitely clean and the staff was amazingly friendly. No matter where we were, if staff was present they always spoke and made it very clear that they were there for us, if needed. I imagine some of the larger rooms and suites are probably exquisite. We stayed in a queen deluxe. We were told we were "upgraded" from a standard because they were out of standard queens when we checked in. If we were in a deluxe, I would hate to have stayed in the standard. The room was comfortable in size and the decor was true to the period of the hotel. The bed was so uncomfortable and hard. My hip hurt most of the night and neither of us had a good nights sleep. The bathroom was a comfortable size...and that's it. The shower head gave a horrible spray of water, from a ceramic head. I can't believe an adjustable spray head wouldn't be more prudent, not to mention it meant we had to shower that way - nothing to adjust to fix the spray. They have a nice rack for you to read a book, if you choose, in the tub. It was so rusty, I would think for a $300-plus room, they could afford a new one. The brass in the bathroom need polishing...bad. Walking the halls and going up to the rooftop pool was nice. Again, I tried to envision this hotel in it's heyday, and loved seeing everything decorated period. The rooftop pool give an exceptional view of the city, all the way to the Mississippi River. Very nice. The hotel has some of the better parking, valet only in a lot right next to the hotel. Leaving the car behind is not a problem, because there is so much to do within walking distance. I'm glad I was given the gift of the stay at this hotel, by my husband, but next time I think we'll return to some of our regular hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, warm, gorgeous and friendly”
Reviews.Author: lzuviv
Reviews.Content: We were not expecting such a beautiful hotel. It was gorgeous, old world feel, romantic and very friendly. Service was excellent. Room was comfortable. Not in the heart of the French quarter but easy to walk to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with extraordinary customer service”
Reviews.Author: ABPhx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend in Dec 2010. The hotel lobby was beautifully decorated for the holiday season, which created a remarkable ambiance when first entering the hotel. The best part of this hotel was the top notch customer service. We were always met with friendly smiles and employees who were eager to help us. Thanks to their stellar service, this was far and away one of the best hotel experiences we've had. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “I am a discerning customer, and nevertheless without reservations recommend this hotel for location, staff, and value.”
Reviews.Author: mvgossman
Reviews.Content: Here's what I liked about this hotel: 1. Kid friendly but not "too" kid-friendly. 2. Fantastic lobby, takes you back to 1940, you expert Bogie and Bacall to walk by. 3. Breakfast buffet excellent and a good value. 4. Room was a wonderful suite, clean. 5. Staff was all 100% friendly and accommodating. 6. Value for the hotel overall is great. 7. Great location. 8. Not too busy, this is not a mega-hotel. 9. Parking while not cheap is valet, rapid. 10. Rapid response from bellman.

Reviews.Title: “little accounting problem eats up my good will.”
Reviews.Author: jinefizzh
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at LP. There were some problems (like the air conditioning that wouldn't turn off creating an icebox, and the fact that the very modern request for service button that they had updated the room with malfunctioned so that we couldn't get our room cleaned two days in a row. The sweetness and attentiveness of the staff made up for this 3 fold until there was a confusion when I checked out. I realized when I returned home that they billed the wrong card. I was partly at fault as my husband had needed to give them his card to release the room while I was out on business. They had two numbers and used the wrong one. Not a big deal. That said, I have had to call them 5 or 6 times now just to get this little mistake adjusted. It's taken 3 weeks. Finally I have just spoke to the manager and I think I am seeing a light at the end of the tunnel. It has certainly changed my feelings about this experience and if you have ever had a husband who had to carry a very high charge on his personal card for no reason, you'd know why this is so frustrating. Also frustrating is the fact that if you give them your email you will get a lot of spam where they ask you to take surveys and to friend them etc (it is too much) and needless to say, each one of those emails has been a reminder that I can't get them to address this reasonable challenge.

Reviews.Title: “past its prime”
Reviews.Author: EAC79
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks luxurious in the picturesâ€”I found it very average in person. The bathroom in my room was updated and clean, but the rest of the room really needs some work. Instead of duvets, there were quilts on the bed, which I always suspect in hotels never get washed. I could feel the springs in the bed, which made noise every time I turned, almost like a sofa bed. The mattresses definitely should be replaced. The carpet and curtains similarly did not look new or particularly clean. Even the walls and doors had dirty spots. But my biggest complaint was the lack of free coffeeâ€”no coffee maker in the room, and none in the lobby. Who can stay up for a peanut butter and jelly sandwich at 11pm when thereâ€™s no coffee in the morning?! I stayed at this hotel for a conference and felt that the conference rooms and catering left a lot to be desired as well. Overall this is a mediocre hotel. I wouldnâ€™t discourage anyone from staying here if they got a great deal, but I wouldnâ€™t give it a recommendation either.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon was great except for...”
Reviews.Author: Hanson05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Le Pavillon while in NOLA the weekend of 02-18 to 02-20. We have stayed at the Le Pavillon previously, and really enjoy the hotel.
