Living in WI as we do, we like to feel immersed in the culture and feel of whatever city we travel to, and the Le Pavillon really makes you feel like you have arrived in New Orleans! It is absolutely beautiful, most historic, and has a mild aroma of cigars/tobacco/or what I have come to think of as a delicious "Southern" smell in the lobby, which I love upon arrival. Don't worry, it's very mild and I'm sure most people don't even notice anything, but my keen Northern nose picks up on the different scent that we don't experience at home. An early check in was accommodated with no issues (arrived at 11:00 AM), we were given a very nice room, had a fruit basket delivered later due to the fact that we were repeat guests, enjoyed the PB&J at night, room service for coffee was very quick, location to the FQ/river/Canal/shopping was perfect, etc. All was great! We love the hotel and it seems as if, for the most part, all of the employees work really hard to ensure their guests comfort. Except...... The morning of 02-20 we were in a hurry to shower and get out the door because it was our last day in NOLA and we wanted to make the most of it. Well, there was no hot water. NONE. I called the front desk and they said they would look into it and call me back in a few minutes. They never called back. So, I called again about 45 minutes later, and they said that the hot water was out on our floor. I asked if they knew when it would be on again, and the women said she didn't ask the engineer when it would come on, but she would call me back to let us know. She never called back. We called again, and this time they said we could shower on another floor, but then called back almost immediately after the arrangements were made and said that the water was out in the entire building. The estimated time for it to return was "30 minutes" so we made the decision (the wrong one) to wait for the water. Now, I understand that things happen and everything is not always perfect. That's the way it goes. Ultimately, all totaled, we ended up being in our room for an additional 2.5 hours longer than we wanted to with all of the back & forth with the staff (who weren't extremely helpful) regarding the water and when it would be on. By the time we left at noon, there still was no hot water in the entire hotel. We decided to just take ice cold showers and get on with our day. In the end, lesson learned. The next time I'm at a hotel and there is no hot water, I will alert the staff, but I will just take a cold shower no matter what they say as to when the problem will be fixed. Who wants to waste any of their time on vacation?

Reviews.Title: “It was nice”
Reviews.Author: DriggsTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was friendly and helpful, we were given some great restaurant suggestions. Although the hotel wasn't in the French Quarter is was an easy walk to just about anywhere we wanted to go. After a night of partying we were thankful not to be woken up by housekeeping in the morning. The bar had great Bloody Mary's and the rooftop pool was an excellent place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Jelly sandwiches, and a old world room”
Reviews.Author: wick1979
Reviews.Content: Location is good but a couple extra blocks outside of the quarters. Hotel is wonderful inside, service is exceptional, rooms are nicely appointed and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Classy but not stuffy”
Reviews.Author: Vegas-Chris
Reviews.Content: I admit I am nostalgic about this hotel. It is quite lovely and relaxing. It is the first place I stayed in NOLA and is still my favorite. Some suggest it is a bit far from the quarter, but I prefer the distance. This hotel is better suited for people who prefer a respite from the action for a bit. As an added bonus the breakfast buffet is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Ante-bellum classic, funereal”
Reviews.Author: danD04
Reviews.Content: Arrived in time for the run up to Mardi Gras, and this hotel hits the right dark notes. Walls hung with the portraits of long-dead grandees, grandes dames; huge crystal chandeliers in the mirrored lobby, uniformed bellmen in top hats and cutaways. But rooms small, and cramped, filled with dark furniture and dark from elaborate window treatments. Location is good: about a ten minute walk to Canal Street and the French Quarter, a half hour from the Lee Memorial and Ogden Museum. We booked through hotwire, and got excellent rates, but had trouble sleeping in the cramped-seeming room. Good bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Historic Hotel, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: batonrougefan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a weekend trip. The place is very nice and has a great location, but the rooms are very cramped for the price. Can get a little claustrophobic. The peanut butter and jelly sandwiches every night was very unique and fun. It seemed like everyone was down there. I would stay here again, but not for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “My very favorite New Orleans hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mpigott
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay here all the time for business and pleasure. It's elegant, historic and always staffed by friendly local folks who have stories to share if you're interested. Our family has been coming here for years. All those years when the Saints were the "aint's" we stayed here with all the other disappointed but ever loyal fans. The location is quiet, (Just far enough away from the late night rowdiness on Bourbon street) and convenient ( easy walking distance to Saints games, the streetcars on both Canal and St. Charles and of course the French Quarter.) Don't miss out on breakfast and if you happen to be there on Sunday check out the delicious brunch and wonderful music provided by a long time local entertainer. He's the best! Be sure and pick up his CD - you can listen to it on the way home and sing along.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuvVacation123
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. From the moment I arrived I was treated with upmost importance. Upon entering, you are immediately overtaken by the view of historical art and decor and the view is really nice and elegant. The greeter dressed in tux w top hat opened door and was very courteous. The front desk staff have great customer service skills. Wow. It was just nice to have people whom are actually treating you like you are important and appreciative that you came to their hotel to visit. My children loved the PBnJ sandwiches with milk. The hubby and I loved being able to walk to everything. We were even able to walk to bourbon and get some drinks for a bit. This hotel in centrally located so that you can still walk to bourbon without being in the center of the party and loud music associated with bourbon. This is good for children, the area is more laid back and calm. We walked at night safely. We walked to aquarium with kids which wasn't so bad. The hotel bar was really good and the bar tender has excellent skills. The roof top pool is beautiful especially at night and the view that you get at the top of the hotel is amazing. I would definitely recommend and use this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “If We Weren't Walking to the French Quarter, We Were Eatin'”
Reviews.Author: Brisas
Reviews.Content: I was kind of worried the hotel location would be far from the French Quarter, but it took about 10-15 minutes of walking to get there. We planned on taking streetcars around the area, but ended up walking everywhere. We walked back at all times of the night and did not encounter anything/anyone unsafe. Perfect walking distance to the arena. Lots of nearby restaurants for breakfast (Lil Dizzy, Mother's, Cafe at the Square) and Luke (on St. Charles) has a great (and affordable) oyster and drink happy hour. We made it back to the hotel one evening for PB&J-fun to relive a childhood fav and a great start to a night out. Two double-bed room was ok. Nothing spectacular, but it was comfy. I wasn't too thrilled about the walk-in shower stall. Hotel staff were courteous and always willing to help us figure out where to go out to eat. One evening, we came in with large cups in hand (maybe we looked confused). The bellmen thought we were there for pictures and/or using the bathroom. They were very polite and invited us to come in and feel free to look around. We just said we had a room in the hotel and that was that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: GetnThere
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in New Orleans, and this hotel made the visit perfect. It's just close enough to the "action" to be convenient, but not immersed in the frenzy that is Bourbon St. I can't say enough about the staff - everyone is smiling, eager to help and so, so friendly! Pam in the lounge is bartender extraordinaire, and full of ideas on how to experience New Orleans nightlife like the locals., and went out of her way to get us the story of the hauntings in the hotel.. Georgia, who served us breakfast in the Crystal Room has worked with the hotel for 34 years! She welcomed us in the morning, and remembered how we drank our coffee and how we liked our eggs. The food in the Crystal room is wonderful - watch out for the very large servings! We had a King room, it was lovely, the beds are comfortable. The bathroom is small, but that's to be expected in a hotel of this vintage. If large bathrooms and coffee makers are what you're looking for - there are chains everywhere around New Orleans... this hotel is a different experience. I will recommend this hotel to my friends - and everyone should make it down for the PB&J and hot chocolate at 10pm - the hot chocolate was creamy, rich and topped with freshly whipped cream. We will definitely return to New Orleans, and when we do, we will stay at La Pavillion.

Reviews.Title: “Service great, other things not so great”
Reviews.Author: pcintx_8
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Le Pavillon, and enjoyed it, with reservations. The service is really excellent, and I love the decor. That being said, there were some issues. One was that my room was not ready until after 4 pm, and on top of that, when I finally got the key and went up to my room, the bellman was showing someone else into it! They'd already assigned the room to another couple. I had to go back downstairs and get another room. There are no coffee makers in the room. When I called and asked, I was told there was complimenty coffee in the lobby, but I like to drink coffee while I'm getting dressed, and I found this very odd, given that coffee makers are pretty standard in most hotels these days. The mattress needed to be replaced, it was old and the springs were evident. And when I removed a bottle of beer from the mini-fridge in the evening (which I put back in the fridge the next morning) to put a bottle of water I had in it (there was no room for it otherwise) to keep it cold, I was charged for the beer on the bill slipped under my door during the night. I didn't realize that the fridge had a sensor in it. I've never encountered that before. The desk was very nice, they took the charge off, but that was an extra thing I had to do before I left. The location is great, and it's not your cookie cutter chain hotel, but this wasn't as good an experience as I have had in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon- Truly the Belle of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Beau_Mabrey
Reviews.Content: This past weekend I hosted 22 former employees and friends at your hotel for the Super Bowl Sunday weekend. By my estimates we spent over $10 thousand dollars in your hotel for lodging, meals and drinks. The performance of your staff was fantastic! By way of background, I have been the Commanding Officer of a Guided Missile Frigate, and established three multi-million dollar Energy Services, as General Manager, for companies like WESCO, Honeywell, and PHI. I retired in July 2010. I think I have some knowledge of organizational excellence and customer service. I feel I understand the core values you are charged with instilling and cultivating in your organization. To begin with, Ms. Paula Purvis orchestrated all of the details perfectly. She coordinated with the Concierge staff (Mark), and the bar staff (A black lady that called everyone Baby). Mark, and his group set up 4 sets of reservations at Pascal Manalli's, Court of the Two Sisters, Arnaud's, and Brennen's. They worked from a list I gave them with times and restaurant preferences. They worked over three days working the times and alternatives. Ultimately, everything was perfect and executed without a hitch. The lady in the bar started at 1:30 on Sunday getting the tables arranged for optimum game viewing. Her recommendations for appetizers was spot on. She had everything arranged perfectly when my guests arrived at 5PM. Throughout the weekend (and in truth the week prior), your staff demonstrated tremendous attention to detail, clear and concise communications, follow through, and the highest standard of customer service. The glue that held all of this together was Ms. Purvis. I know the secret to growing and building a business is to gain one or more new customers each day. By all accounts each of the 22 guests say that whenever they are in New Orleans for business or pleasure, they will make Le Pavillon their base. Again congratulations to you for building a fabulous organization, and my compliments to your staff on their flawless execution.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located grand historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: claudia50207
Reviews.Content: This hotel was centrally located to the French Quarter and the Garden District. The hotel is beautifully retored and it is a treasure from the past. It maintains its membership as a "Leading Hotel of the World". The service was impeccable. While the bathrooms are small they are very nicely appointed with a warm air fan that comforts as you step from the shower. It has more than enough towels readily available at your fingertips. Each room has a doorbell! It feel like home on a grand scale! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Fourchon1
Reviews.Content: We brought our wedding party to the hotel. Every need was catered to by the entire staff. They go to the trouble to know and remember your name. The bed was super comfy. The location is good and is within walking distance to the French Quarter. They can't do much about it but the bathroom was a little tight. The lobby makes a beautiful backdrop for pictures. Five stars from me..no problem. I highly recommend this hotel and plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: jackinola
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married here 11 years ago in Jan. 2011. We stayed in one of the suites on our wedding night and it was amazing. On our 11 year anniversary we decided to go back and spend the weekend. I booked a standard room but upon our arrival we were upgraded to the very same suite that we had stayed in on our wedding night, without an up-charge, and had champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries delivered to our room courtesy of the staff. The hotel staff just went out of there way to make our stay, and u,s feel very special. And peanut butter and jelly and milk in the lobby at 10pm is not something to miss. I promise you! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff helped to lift this historical hotel over the top”
Reviews.Author: LRJAM
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with New Orleans, and a great deal of this love was because of the warm welcome this hotel provided. It's a perfect reflection of the city itself: full of history, culture and warm and friendly service. They took care of us in every way....and it was wonderful! I would definitely go back in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing hotel we have ever been in.”
Reviews.Author: mrsdeason
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, beautiful facility. There was peanut butter and jelly sandwiches with hot chocolate including hand made whipped cream. Roof top jaccuzzi and pool out of this world. Have the best times of our life at this hotel. About 10 minute walk to acme oyster house, 20 to cafe du monde and 10 to mall.

Reviews.Title: “My very favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lous22
Reviews.Content: I was born and raised in New Orleans, and have always enjoyed Le Pavillion. My husband and I were actually married here, and our wedding day was simply amazing. We have stayed here many times since then (its our go-to spot for "staycations") and we're always sad to leave. The rooms are beautiful, and the food is amazing. Plus, there's PB sandwiches and hot chocolate in the lobby every night! What more could you ask for? I highly recommend staying here- its a true gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service response!”
Reviews.Author: PRWeezer
Reviews.Content: This may be an unusual review as I have never stayed at this hotel, though I did try. My husband and I had booked a non-refundable room for 1/11/11 through Hotwire. Due to a snowstorm and the virtual shutdown of the ATL airport, we could not get to New Orleans. I had called Hotwire on the 10th to see if we could get a refund; the first rep I spoke to made it sound like that would not be possible. We chalked it up as bad luck and money lost. The day we were due to check in I called the hotel directly as a courtesy to let them know we could not make it and they could release the room if needed. The representative I spoke to said, I see you booked this through Hotwire, you should call them to see if they will refund your trip due to the extreme weather circumstances that prohibited travel out of ATL. I told her that an attempt to do so had failed. She basically said I should not take no for an answer, agreed to approve the cancellation, and noted it on my reservation. Next call to Hotwire was successful based on that information. The rep put me on hold while she called the hotel to confirm what I had told them. Refund was approved immediately. Kudos to reps on both sides who went above & beyond. We have not used third-party sites such as Hotwire very often, not sure if this was a typical experience or not. Bottom line, if this is the level of customer service one gets from this hotel without even staying there, we really look forward to an actual visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: santhony
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Pavillon while attending the 2011 Sugar Bowl in New Orleans. As soon as the SEC Championship Game concluded, and it became clear that our team would be invited, I immediately began planning a family vacation around the event. As you might imagine, rooms were tight and I decided to splurge by booking the Presidential Suite at Le Pavillon. The location of Le Pavillon is ideal for attending events at the Superdome, as it is an easy stroll up Poydras. And while it is not immediately adjacent to the French Quarter, it is an easy four block walk to Boubon Street. It is likewise a short walk to the river (where the Aquarium, Harrah's and Riverwalk mall can be accessed) and to the WWII Museum downtown (MUST VISIT!!). All in all, an excellent location for what we had in mind. The Suite itself was very spacious and well appointed, though the bedrooms and bathrooms themselves were no larger or nicer than those in the rest of the hotel (I imagine). Since the sitting area and dining room were so spacious, we were able to host a pre-Sugar Bowl cocktail party for some of our friends attending the event. I found the staff to be very accomodating, though in arranging for a selection of simple hors d'ouevres for our cocktail party, I felt I got gouged by Food and Beverage (partially my fault for not hammering down the details in advance). Being in New Orleans, we didn't sample the hotel's dining options, with the exception of a room service breakfast which was perfectly acceptable. All in all, a perfectly satisfactory property. Access is tight, expect traffic at check-in and high valet charges if you bring a vehicle. If we attend another sporting event in New Orleans, I'll definitely look to stay here, though perhaps not in the Presidential Suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: rockytop321
Reviews.Content: Paid $79.00 on Hotwire. Spacious room on the 9th floor with a work desk, table and 2 nice chairs for sitting or in room dining, coffee maker, microwave & stocked mini bar. TV wasn't hi-def or flat screen, but was very large and lots of cable channels (no pay movies). Bed was fine for me and never had problem with sheets falling off like others claim. Huge closet with umbrella & robe. Not musty to me. Sure they could update mattresses, bedding, curtains, television, etc. but then the cost to stay would be much higher. No nickle & diming like most hotels hit you with, i.e. no "resort fee", and even free internet and choice of local or national newspaper. Plus the free P & B sandwiches, fruit & hot cocoa from 10:00 p.m. - 11:00 p.m. The pool and hot tub are open year round and are open very late (I heard the door locks at 1:00 a.m.). Great buffet lunch during the week with "Chef Pat" that had good crowds. Great Sunday brunch with live music but not cheap. I did not see nearly as many people eating dinner, but they had $15.00 specials each night with dessert included. Most of the food was very good, they know how to fix potatoes. Very friendly and helpful staff. Very close to Superdome, 1 block to St. Charles shuttle & 10 minute walk to Harrahs, Canal Street or French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: dhewitt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and has many amenities. With the fully equipped gym, I was able to work off the pounds I gained eating the wonderful food. My room was fabulous and huge! I missed the Peanut Butter and Jelly sandwiches evening snack but heard great things about how great the evening receptions were (each night I just missed!). The in room cookies were delicious! The each and every staff person were wonderful and tremendously helpful--from the front desk to valet parking. Would stay again and recommend to everyone! I travel frequently for work and stay at every hotel imaginable, no hotel chain or local can touch the Le Pavillon on customer service!

Reviews.Title: “old new orleans charm, or old new orleans grime?”
Reviews.Author: eva401
Reviews.Content: Years ago, my father used to stay in Le Pavillon on his frequent overnight business trips to New Orleans. Back then, the hotel had a reputation for being clean, cheap, convenient, and elegant. These days, Le Pavillon is trying to pass itself off as an elegant, old world, "four and a half star" hotel full of New Orleans charm. As a New Orleans native staying in the hotel for an anniversary night away from the kids, I chose Le Pavillon because of its good location & decent prices. I wasn't interested in the nostalgia (drawn "voodoo" baths, old style service). I just hoped to find a nice, clean room where my husband and I could spend a comfortable quiet night together after an evening of walking around the city & eating good food. What we experienced, instead, was one of the worst nights of sleep we'd ever had. The whole hotel is musty--from the front lobby to the elevator to the wide hallways to the rooms. But the mustiest part of Le Pavillon is their beds. Ours was covered with an outdated and grimy flowery bedspread. I removed it immediately upon entering the room. The throw pillows were equally grimy, which was really too bad because they were the only firm looking pillows in the room. The two bed pillows were so lumpy and mushy that even when squished into a ball they provided no head support. The bed was covered with a flat, not fitted, sheet, which was the only thing between us and the old blue uncomfortable mattress. Since the sheet was flat, it kept coming up throughout the night as we tossed and turned, leaving us to wake up and find ourselves drowsing on the old mattress itself, where hundreds if not thousands of other bodies had similarly lain. The only clean bed covering was an old polyester blanket between two worn sheets. I hardly slept all night, being waken continually by general discomfort and noises in the hallway. The bathroom was better than the bedroom--it was clean and the fixtures, while not at all modern, were nice and worked fine. The hotel provided shampoo but no conditioner (however, they did provide shoe polish...???). The carpets in the room and hallway were old and worn down. We weren't impressed with the PB&J bar at 10pm. It's a nice gesture--but it didn't make up for our general discomfort in the hotel. Overall, I am not a picky hotel goer. We stay at a range of two to four star hotels, mostly basing our decisions on prices. We got a good deal on Le Pavillon--$113 per night from hotwire. But even at that price, I would not recommend it. I've stayed in far better hotels in downtown New Orleans for around the same price. The car

Reviews.Title: “Pretty to look at”
Reviews.Author: yanranicm85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was eh. It's really nice on the outside and the lobby is very grand but that's about it. The rooms are descent but the beds are highly uncomfortable, especially for the price. I would of much rather paid the 250 to stay at a Marriott or Intercontinental. I don't plan on visiting the city again but if I did I'd choose somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Far beyond expectations and enjoyed tremendously !!!”
Reviews.Author: sollybaby1
Reviews.Content: We have been on 44 trips in the past 14 years and I honestly have to say this hotel is probably the in the top 5 we have stayed. The service is second to none, spotless and the classic victorian decor is beyond words. Approx. 10 minutes walk to all amenities re French quarter, casino or shopping district. They cater to any wishes or info you may desire. The peanut butter sandwiches at 10:00pm very unique...we only attended once as we retire early. Our room on the top floor was very comfortable with all toiletries including shoe polish provided at n/c. The dining was excellent and the pub food was reasonably priced and tasty....especially the clubhouse sandwich. The business/tech room re internet, fax, copier all free and very efficient and spotless. If any posters find fault with this hotel, then they will find fault with any hotel on this planet...Congratulations Le Pavillon and your staff on providing a first class establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: grace:)Vancouver
Reviews.Content: We were at the Pavillion Dec 23 for 7 nights..We were happy with the Hotel until we came home with alot of bed bug bites !!..an enjoyable time has been replaced with itching and misery..if you've never experienced bed bug bites we hope you never do and if you have you will know how miserable we are..:( On a positive note New Orleans is a blast...

Reviews.Title: “Soundproofed rooms would make it perfect”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysPacked2Go
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at his hotel several times over the past few years. Most recently, we stayed for only one night because the hotel was booked for football game the next night. Room was obviously recently renovated, with very comfortable bed, automatic window shades that made the room dark, and counter space in the bathroom (unfortunately rare these days when we carry more toiletries!). The room was an "upgrade" but still quite small. Concierge was fabulous as usual. Only drawback is that you can hear every conversation in the hallway as if the other guests were in the room with you, and the maids vacuum the carpets starting around 9 am, which is not so good for a late night city like New Orleans. No street noise, and just enough distance to avoid French Quarter rowdies.

Reviews.Title: “Needs desperate room remodeling”
Reviews.Author: Denno29191
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to New Orleans for years...I am a former native, but the "old world charm" seems to be an excuse for old, outdated style and comfort. I have to agree with other's comments that the bedding (both matress and outdated bedspreads) are awful. We, too, were booked into a room on the top floor of the hotel, but once inside we couldn't stay. The bathroom tub was moldy and rusty in places, the shower head was covered in hard water lime, etc. We transferred to a different room for a $20 per night upgrade charge, but it wasn't much better. Will not be coming back. Sorry, Le Pavillion.

Reviews.Title: “Love Le Pavillon Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlDva
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Le Pavillon for the first time, and I would definitely go back. I thought the service was top-notch, and our room (709) was larger than I expected. The room decor is a little dated, but it goes with the charm of the "old world" style of the hotel. The bathroom was small, but the shower was great (and I loved the shower gel). It was a little further out of the quarter than I normally stay, but the walk to the quarter was not bad (under 10 minutes), and there is a great little coffee shop a block away (Dee's Coffee House) that I loved. Overall, I throughly enjoyed my stay at Le Pavillon, and I would highly recommend it - a New Orleans classic! *Don't miss the PB & J sandwich buffet that they serve nightly at 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, character, courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: bethy2120
Reviews.Content: Two colleagues and I stayed at the Le Pavillon for three nights in early December. We were in New Orleans for a conference/convention, but wanted to stay a little closer to the French Quarter rather than the Convention Center. The hotel is about 4-5 blocks (10 min walk) from Bourbon Street and 1 mile from the Convention Center (20 min walk). The location was great for the purpose of our trip. There is not much in the immediate vicinity, but as mentioned, the French Quarter is just a short walk away. The outside of the hotel is quite grand as is the lobby. It was decorated for Christmas/Holidays and was truly lovely. The old, Victorian style may not be for everyone, but regardless of your personal taste, the hotel is undoubtedly pretty. We arrived at around 11am and were able to check in right away. Paula, at the front desk was very warm and welcoming and very efficient in getting us squared away. We were all given double rooms on the 5th floor. While the floral bedspread and window treatments are a bit dated, they seem to fit the character of the hotel. The bathroom, while small, was â€œgrandâ€� in terms of dÃ©cor/marble/mirror, etc. My co-workers had similar rooms, though I noticed one had a coffee maker and microwave. I am a big coffee drinker, so called the front desk and asked whether I could also get a coffee pot/set up. In no time, a nice Keurig â€œone cupperâ€� was delivered. The free wireless & high speed internet was a plus, too. The bed was reasonably comfortable, but I did find the pillows to be a bit lumpy. I did appreciate the little touches like an umbrella in the room for use, robes and plush towels. The staff in both the dining room and bar was extremely friendly and efficient. (NOTE: the evening bartender makes a mean dirty martini!) In fact, I noticed that everyone we encountered in the hospitality â€œindustryâ€� were absolutely pleasant and genuinely welcoming; which speaks volumes about the people of New Orleans. Overallâ€¦ this hotel gets high marks for character, charm, the little touches and amazing staff. However, the rooms could use some updating. Itâ€™s not impossible to achieve the same â€œold worldâ€� affect with new bedding, duvets, pillows, etc.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Boris072
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Le Pavillon (I usually stay at the Royal Sonesta). Right from when you drive up, you know you are in a first class hotel. Decor is very ornate, with oil paintings, sculptures, wall carvings, chandeliers, etc. You really get that "New Orleans" feel when you stay here, sort of like the Monteleone, but much more affordable. PB&J at 10PM was very nice. Turndown service, nice pool on room with sculptures, although the pool at the Royal Sonesta is nicer. Although not right in the French Quarter, it is only a couple of blocks away (or a short cab ride). A lot quieter than staying in French Quarter. Lunch at the restaurant was excellent. WIFI was free and worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place: Classic New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Sasso74
Reviews.Content: Amazing place, great location. 10 min walk to French Quarter. Staff were very friendly and helpfull especially the concierge. Not for someone looking for the newest and trendiest of hotels. Has a very old world/ 1920's feel to it - but this goes hand in hand with the culture of the Big Easy. Great value- went from nov 24-nov 28. Paid on avg of $110/ night.

Reviews.Title: “superb experience”
Reviews.Author: nolaluvr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Halloween weekend for the Saints/Steelers game. This is a superb hotel. Exceptional service, romantic, elegant atmosphere. Proximity to the French Quarter and Superdome is perfect. If you're going to an event in the Superdome, this is the place to stay. If you just want a weekend getaway in a unique, charming atmosphere- this is it. Take a cab to and from the French Quarter. Felt safe walking but its not a short trip. Again, I can't compliment the hotel enough. May not fit the budget for every trip to NOLA, but its great for special occasions. The game was awesome too. WHO DAT!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: 95magnum
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at La Pavillon. National historic hotel with beautiful furnishings and an excellent staff who responded to all requests and questions promptly and efficiently. Will be staying there on my next rip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Would Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: jl_1018
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through an 'well known' on-line travel site. This hotel was rated as a 4.5 star hotel. Upon arrival, staff is very friendly. Lobby is a little dingy and worn looking. Checked in and on to our room on the top floor. We were horrified once inside the room. It was small, musty, dingy and just horrible. Mold all over the walls, ceilings and bathroom. Water bubbles in the walls. The bed looked and felt like it was picked up from a dumpster. The decorating is old victorian - that hasn't been dusted in years. My boyfriend is like - 'I can't stay here ... I'm creeped out and I won't sleep!!' We immediately called the on-line travel site and indicated that we couldn't stay here. This IS NOT a 4.5 star hotel by any means. I'd compare it to a crummy truck stop - 1 or 2 stars AT BEST! We were asked to at least be moved to another room. Which we did - but had the same result of a musty, dingy, moldy room. We checked out, got our money back and booked the beautiful and lovely Waldorf - a true 4.5 star hotel. Anyways, I am not trying to be negative towards the hotel. It seems some people enjoy their stay here - it was just not our typical standard of hotel. If it was advertised as a 2 star I would understand. I am more upset about the on-line booking agent and false advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Can't agree with the other reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Cinnam0n
Reviews.Content: The hotel definitely has old world charm and the staff we interacted with were very nice but for the price I felt I could have gotten better elsewhere. Location was fine, but there were definitely nicer looking hotels closer to the action of Bourbon Street and French Quarter. The rooms (booked a jr. suite) were old and dingy. I get that the hotel is trying to maintain a certain feel, but the bedspreads and furniture looked like something from a Motel 6.The beds were uncomfortable and the two pillows we were given were limp and flat and they put some sort of plastic-y material under the fitted sheet (to protect from stains!?!?!) that just added to the Motel 6 feel. Add to that the fact that our non-smoking rooms smelled overwhelmingly like smoke didn't help the situation either. Little touches like robes, slippers, turn-down service, and nighttime cookies were nice but not enough to make up for the general unpleasantness of the room as compared to the rates we paid for the room. Next time I'm in New Orleans, I'll be staying elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - a great choice - a jewel.”
Reviews.Author: igbg
Reviews.Content: As well as a first class hotel, splendid service, well appointed rooms, the wi-fi is free!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Pam0309
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best places to stay based on location, price, staff, amenities, and everything else. The staff is excellent, friendly and professional. We used the congiere to book a restuarant reservation and his suggestions were correct, we enjoyed each place he sent us to. Also, the attendant that does the turn down service was excellent, they give you water, cookies, and place the robes on the turned down bed. She was so nice and friendly. Our doorman took care of arranging a cab for us to arrive at 5:30 am since he would not be on duty at that time. The nightly PB & J was great and the hot chocolate to die for! The story as to how that tradition started makes you smile. I can not think of anything bad to say about our stay and we both have decided we will return to this hotel when we come back to NOLA!!! You will not go wrong if you decide to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, beautiful lobby & pool, but shabby rooms”
Reviews.Author: AMBUWS29
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the staff who work at this hotel are lovely, knowledgeable and completely helpful. Everyone we dealt with was charming. And the look of the lobby is largely very nice - old-fashioned. The roof garden and pool / hot tub are clean and pleasant. But the rooms leave something to be desired. Our room on the top floor had definitely been cleaned, but the tub was funky - it felt like it had been resealed but the sealant was coming up. And the room smelled musty overall. It was tiny. Walls were cracked and peeling in spots. If they revamped the rooms, I'd definitely recommend this hotel, but given this, I just can't. The location is pretty good, but still a solid walk to the Quarter or Fauborg-Marigny.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: TeeZeeOntario
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend Le Pavillon to anyone who comes to NOLA for any reason. The entire stay at the hotel was the highlight of our trip! The service, amazing. The staff, welcoming. The PB&J tradition, charming. The room, clean and comfortable. High end, with out being stuffy and dripping with southern charm. Stay here, treat yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Fading Grandeur, Dirty Around the Edges, Nice Staff, Somewhat Tacky”
Reviews.Author: jackiemarvel
Reviews.Content: I want to like this place. It looks beautiful from the outside and without my glasses on when you enter, it looks very French rococo-fancy. But....the chairs are saggy and dirty in the lobby, the carpets are dirty, my room smells extremely musty, the 'fancy' is faux - cheap polyester curtains, bedspreads, swags, etc. that actually end up looking somewhat tacky and lowbrow. Tons of dust on the doorframes and behind the beds - goodness knows the last time these rooms have actually been cleaned. There is black mold on the wall of the bathroom above the door. The rooms are downright damp and humid. The staff is great - very nice and accommodating. Definitely the best part. Location is good. Just no where near the four stars/diamonds that it is advertised to be. It is not a fancy NOLA hotel. It's either past its prime, or just a wannabe. For the same price, you get less cachet, but more clean...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Night's sleep, Great Bar”
Reviews.Author: sswing23
Reviews.Content: We drove 10 hours, and arrived around 11 p.m. We were greeted by PB&J sandwiches and hot chocolate. My dress was accidentally ripped by the bell service, but within ten minutes they took it and sent it to the tailor, free of charge, and delivered it the next day. They were really wonderful about it. Our room was cozy, but pleasant. Check out the heated pool and hot tub on the roof. The bar has great food and drinks, for a relatively low cost.

Reviews.Title: “Near enough to French Quarter;Far enough to feel like France”
Reviews.Author: mwvillage
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 3 night stay there as we we were visiting our daughter at Tulane. It is the perfect location, near the French quarter but not in it, and not too far from the Garden District. It's the perfect oasis--a beautiful hotel overall with a great lobby--chandeliers and huge oil paintings. The rooms are all tastefully decorated. Has a nice bar and a restauraunt that is good for dinner--though the Sunday brunch is not to be missed! Also has a pool on the roof, with waiter service. And of course, the tradition of peanut butter & Jelly sandwiches for a late evening lobby snack is charming. You will not be dissapointed with a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The staff are amazing”
Reviews.Author: gater10
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in New Orleans our cab driver took us to the wrong Hotel and left. Thankfully, my husband had asked for his card and we were able to get back to Le Pavillon. I must say the staff at Hotel Provincial showed us how friendly the people of New Orleans are....while waiting they offered us coffee and something to eat and gave us a tour of their facilities. When ckecking in at Le Pavillon, my husband mentioned that it was our 32nd wedding anniversary and this was our first trip to New Orleans.... much to our delighted surprise, a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries were delivered to our room - compliments of the hotel! What class! The hotel is located in the business quarter, so it is a couple of blocks from the French Quarter but an easy walk. The beds are comfortable and the bathroom is spacious. We had the buffet breakfast one day and our waiter couldn't have been more gracious. Hearing that it was our first visit, he prepared some tradional food that he thought we should try - grits, biscuits and gravy, bananas foster - we had the works! The breakfast is a bit pricey but delicious. As it was very hot, we did spend some time at the rooftop pool but we found it much too hot during the daytime. It would be nice if there were some tables with umbrellas and although they offered room service, it would have been nice to have a bar up there. On the positive side, the pool was clean and there were plenty of towels and comfortable lounge chairs. We loved exploring New Orleans and the trolley is a great way to see the sights. You can purchase a full day (hop on and off anytime) for $5 per person. We found out too late that you could get a 3 day pass for $12 per person. There is also a really great pizza place across the road - it was so good that we went there twice. Reginelli's was brand new, quite reasonable and very good. http://www.reginellis.com All in all, we loved New Orleans and loved Le Pavillon!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let The Exterior or Lobby Fool You!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dalocopa
Reviews.Content: We selected Le Pavillon because of the grand exterior and public spaces. Unfortunately, the rest of the hotel did not measure up. The faux antique room decor is extremely dated. I doubt the polyester quilted bedspread and throw pillows are laundered between guests. The pillows are hard and thick. The bed is dressed in one sheet and one microfiber blanket...no down to be found on this bed. The room service is a joke. We ordered drinks and a cheese/fruit plate up by the pool and were delivered a take out styrofoam container with wet fruit leftover from bkfst and literally a ball of boursin cheese with fingerprints on it and two other huge hunks of packaged cheese along with a styrofoam cup with packets of busted up ritz crackers (what you would receive with your soup in a diner). The gym is a joke. There are 5 pieces of cardio equipment. Four of them are in direct sunlight under a skylight (one machine's tension is broken so you can only go at level one). The only decent newish piece of equipment is a treadmill. There is only one TV and it is set to CNN. Many morning the 5 pieces of equipment were taken so we could not work out. Do not be fooled like we were with the big statues out front. The service is terrible, and the hotel desperately needs a facelift!!!! We will never return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious hospitality without attitude.”
Reviews.Author: demolitiondish
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend had a conference and I accompanied him to New Orleans. We decided not to stay with the rest of his colleagues and found ourselves at the Pavillon. At first we were concerned that we were not closer to the French Quarter, but as it turned out, it was wonderful to be close to the action but not in it - a mere five minute walk. The staff was accommodating and friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel was lovely and had all the amenities we could have desired - particularly enjoyed the roof deck pool and gym. Our only complaint is that we were not able to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great! It was very clean...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was great! It was very clean and the people were very nice! They have a late night snack where they put out peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and hot chocolate, it was a nice little feature. We really enjoyed our stay and I would recommend this place in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kimberly321
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very friendly staff. We had a great stay. The highlight is the peanut butter and jelly sandwiches! We love that!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, opulant, falling in love, home away from home”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl63701
Reviews.Content: Our first trip away with each other (for a 40ish and 50ish couple). Not our first rodeo so this was a "test". The hotel was fantastic. We checked in and the beauty of the lobby was breathtaking. The room was cozy and bed was comfortable, just perfect. The bathroom was wonderfully appointed (the faucet on the sink was set back a bit too far making it difficult to use, but with everything else, who cares) . When we arrived back in our room the first night we found complimentary champagne and wonderful cards welcoming us. The hotel is walking distance to the french quarter, which we visited each night. Having traveled all over the world this hotel is on the top of my list of good ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great value.”
Reviews.Author: MonicaReeves
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Le Pavillon was exceptional. We had no complaints whatsoever. The service staff when above and beyond with their good old fashioned Southern hospitality. The room we stayed in was exquisitely furnished and was clean and roomy. The location is perfect for a Sunday football game at the Superdome and a fun weekend at the French Quarter. Both are within easy walking distance. If you can get a room at Le Pavillon through Priceline "name your own price," you will get an even better value for your money. We will definitely stay at Le Paviilon during our next visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for children”
Reviews.Author: Natasha38
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite. It is the art deco suite, room number 530. First off, the beds were queens which was fine for the children, but for adults that have stayed at other hotels in New Orleans, we expected a king. Plus, the bed was not comfortable. The room was nice and decorated appropriately for the era, but our bedroom had no lock on the door which greatly affected any adult time. Turn down showed up at 10pm which is too late especially with the children. When housekeeping came to clean the room, they did not even take away our room service items. I had to empty the melted ice from the ice buckets and put the dirty dishes outside the door before they would take them away. I had to ask for more coffee and shower gel. The housekeeping staff did not seem to sweat the small stuff like most hotels that we have stayed at in New Orleans. The restaurant was closed both nights because of a wedding. The services at the hotel were more focused on the weddings than on the hotel guests. The hotel is beautiful, but we will go back to our usual hotels in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly right to end a stressful day”
Reviews.Author: Carlisle6
Reviews.Content: I got in late in the evening, tired, stressed and hungry. The staff were very kind, gracious and completely lacking in pretension. PB and J in the lobby were heaven sent. Room was very comfortable. Decor is over the top but beautiful. Amazing chandeliers. Terrific breakfast the next morning - great food and very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance personified”
Reviews.Author: Flyti
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for five nights to celebrate my 40th and found it a relaxing haven away from the hustle and bustle of the French Quarter. The staff were so friendly Dallas made me a 'special' desert on my birthday as we ate in the Crystal Room, Drew was extrememly chatty and helpful and the receptionist was very accomodating along with the female concierge. I wasn't that impressed with the view from the first room and wanted to be a little higher up so we swapped without a problem. The rooms are a little on the small size however, it's what you should expect from an older historical building. Roof top pool and hot tub were fantastic at night we had it too ourselves most nights and it's such an amazing feeling to look around at all the lights and building. The distance from Frenchman Street etc. was a little further than we would have liked in the heat but being able bodied it wasn't a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Best part of our New Orleans trip!”
Reviews.Author: IzziGirlAbroad
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to New Orleans, and initially I was disappointed that this hotel was a few blocks from Bourbon Street. Then I saw Bourbon St., at which point I was very, very glad to have a bit of a buffer from the noise and stickiness. It was about a 5-10 minute walk to all the main attractions, which really was perfect. The rooftop pool was absolutely wonderful, what with the heat. The rooms were a bit old-fashioned, but clean and comfortable. The staff was incredibly helpful. They sat us down at the beginning of the stay and asked what we were interested in, and then helped us plan dinner and our sight-seeing agenda-- it was like having a free travel agent. They also had one of my fav hotel perks-- a bath menu. I ordered the $30 relaxation bath, and omg, they absolutely transformed the room. They laid out robes and slippers, fruit, tea, a little booklet on the ghost stories of the hotel, covered the whole room in fresh rose petals, and drew a deliciously warm bath for me. This was great to come back to after the free PB&Js in the lobby. By the way, the hotel is absolutely gorgeous. All in all, this hotel had so much charm and character that it really stood out from all the other hotels we've stayed in. It's perfect for couples and those who'd like a bit of charm and a bit of calm away from the party scene at the end of the night. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff rude and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: Hal76
Reviews.Content: Some of the staff were rude, not up to the standard of many good hotels I have stayed at. Guessing some rooms in the hotel are better than others, because mine was average with bad plumbing. The gym is sparse with old machines. Finally there are better hotels in New Orleans closer to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “the most gracious, glamorous, enchanting hotel! without being a bit stuffy!”
Reviews.Author: patg
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon Hotel is an absolutely exceptional place to stay in New Orleans. We travel a lot for pleasure, and hotels usually are only a place to drop off our bags, take showers and sleep, they rarely impress me. But this hotel is different. From the moment we entered the gorgeous lobby of marble and chandeliers, the welcoming staff greeted us with a sincere, gracious Southern style. The rooftop pool area, complete with a romantic view of the city, has a jacuzzi and private cabannas. Little touches impress me; the pool is open all night! The bathroom mirror has a 'steam-free' section, they serve peanut butter and jelly sandwiches at 10:00 each night based on an old tradition and marvelous story.They are thirsty white terry robes in the closet, and umbrellas in case it rains.A JOY!

Reviews.Title: “Second time here, would not stay any where else!”
Reviews.Author: Schiffers
Reviews.Content: Amazing personal service, high quality food... you have to do the Sunday Brunch, unlimited champagne/bellinis. Service is obviously #1! Pool and hot tub are amazing on the roof..

Reviews.Title: “We have found our New Orleans hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuvMyVacation
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's and my best hotel experience ever. While the hotel is absolutely beautiful, what makes it the best is the service! Everyone we encountered was lovely and went out of the way to make our anniversary long-weekend trip amazing. From the responsiveness of the reservations staff prior to check in, to the friendliness/helpfulness of the doormen and bellmen, to the front-desk staff who checked us in early and took care of us :), to the kindness and efficiency of the room service and turndown staff, we were impressed. They definitely went out of their way to make our special occasion even more special. As my husband said, we will be back to New Orleans and we know where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME & Delightful”
Reviews.Author: HeatSeekingTraveller
Reviews.Content: I love this place! Excellent staff, they mailed an item we forgot - after phoning us to see if we were still in the area. Wonderful rooftop pool with poolside service, breakfast was absolutely decadent and the ambience incomparable. I cannot say enough about this hotel the furnishings (antique) are in excellent condition, the beds are super comfy, and the room we stayed in was fit for royalty. It's all in the details and they've certainly taken care of all the details here!

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints - always a joy”
Reviews.Author: annempk
Reviews.Content: We have been to NOLA many times over the past 7 years visiting our daughter, both as an undergrad at Tulane and now as a med student there. We travel a lot. My husband is a user experience designer, so comfort and a welcoming environment is very important to us. Here is why we always go to Le Pavillon and recommend to our friends. It's very clean. I hate to say this, but that's not always easy to find in NOLA. The bed is comfortable. Lots of pillows. The bathroom is small but gorgeous. I love the luxurious soap. The location. It's two minutes from the quarter and 5-10 from the Tulane campus in the Garden District. There's parking adjacent to the hotel. The furnishings are very NOLA; "antique" but nice, not musty. The restaurant is very lovely, with a nice fireplace. Peanut butter and jelly and cocoa at 10 PM in the lobby. Nice way to meet your fellow guests. And, finally, I absolutely adore Albert. He is the doorman who greets me as if I he is truly happy to see me again... even if it's been a year in between visits.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: chhtravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Pavillon for several days in late July/early August. We got a great deal through Hotwire and could not believe that we got this nice hotel at such a cheap price. I think the Hotwire rooms are probably the smallest in the hotel, but the room was still very nice. The bathroom is small, but again it was nice. The Wifi was a plus. It is a hike to the French Quarter. We had no problems during our stay and the staff was very courteous. I would recommend this hotel to visitors who do not want to stay near the noise of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional experience at an incredibly elegant and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfulone
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at Le Pavillon when we moved my daughter to Tulane University for her freshman year. The welcoming staff, impeccible accommedations, and caring and attentive service were just what we needed. Our room was beautifully appointed and comfortable. We ate at The Crystal Room and had a wonderful meal...elegant and comfortable surroundings, delicious food, and truly memorable service. Our experience was terrific and we're making Le Pavillon our exclusive hotel choice when we visit our daughter at school and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “cozy and charming little place”
Reviews.Author: valmeras
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Pavillon for 2 nights at the end of July. The lobby looks really nice and fancy, however, the hallways and rooms are rather old-looking. The furnishings and walls are rather fancy and elaborate, but rather old and worn. While the room and bathroom were small, we enjoyed our stay and thought it was a charming and comfortable hotel. The service was generally good, except at the front desk where we were a bit disappointed by some of the employees' lack of customer friendliness. Pluses: +cozy and comfortable +free wired and wireless internet in room +free PB&J sandwiches with milk and hot chocolate every night in the lobby Minuses: -small room and bathroom -rather old room interior -hallway noise carries through the walls

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: blf12
Reviews.Content: I love the Le Pavillon. I've stayed here several times and I always found my way back here. The hotel is beautiful. I stayed here on my honeymoon back in 2004 also. They were so nice, they left us a bottle of wine by our bedside and chocolate covered strawberries. Roosevelt, at the bar, was really friendly. We always make it a point to talk to him everytime we visit. The same people seem to be working there for many years because I see them everytime I go. If you are going to New Orleans for a romantic getaway, the Le Pavillion is perfect. Just let them know ahead of time and they will make it special for you. If you are here to party, a cab ride to the French Quarter or a walk is good and safer. I love Le Pavillon.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - Didn't Miss a Thing”
Reviews.Author: nyseaport
Reviews.Content: We checked into Le Pavillon after a few days on the road -- a treat to ourselves, and the hotel kept its promise. The room was old-fashioned and fancy, which we loved, the interior of the hotel lovely, clean and cool (wonderful during the summer humidity) and the staff thorough, helpful and kind. But the real superstar was Grace, who works in the bar and restaurant and enthralled our 7-year-old daughter with ghost stories and maraschino cherries. When she discovered our daughter had Celiac disease, she called the chef in the early evening, asking him to pick up some gluten-free bread for her breakfast in the morning. He did, our daughter had toast (!) and we will never, ever forget the extraordinary kindness of Grace, the chef and the staff. We will absolutely be returning to Le Pavillon and New Orleans, and recommend the hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Rhoda1961
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler so my taste is very discriminating. My expectations are very high and the LePavillon Hotel in New Orleans met and exceeded all of them. This is service, at it's BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: RSJ1955
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Le Pavillon Hotel starting from the drive up service on. The check in went flawless and the hotel was gorgeous. Every staff member greeted you warmly and welcomed us to the hotel and New Orleans. You could feel they were sincere in their attitudes. This is always a major plus for me. Had a welcome drink in the bar that was quiet and classy. The room was beautiful and very clean. The bathroom is very nice with plenty of amenities. We had a concern about our room being across from the elevator but it turned out the noise was minimal. The hotel is located within walking distance of the French Quarter. Probably the same for Harrah's casino but we opted to drive. The concierge was helpful with our needs. We had the Sunday brunch in the hotel and it was excellent. Although this was our first visit to the Le Pavillon we would look to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious hospitality from a polished but unpretentious staff”
Reviews.Author: eatdance
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel for work. I normally do not stay in the CBD but found it to be conveniently located--just minutes from the Quarter, Uptown and Mid-City. The hotel is lovely and the rooms well appointed. But the staff really sent it over the top for me. They were helpful without hovering. Very polished but never pretentious. Just great service with a fantastic attitude. They really added to the enjoyment of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “No beter a NOLA stay than the Pav...”
Reviews.Author: Splnkr
Reviews.Content: For our 15th wedding anniversary, we returned to the Le Pavillon. This was our..what...fourth stay there? We keep coming back. There really is no better a hotel stay than here at the Pav. The service--from parking to room service--is impeccable. Absolutely nothing detracted from our stay. The staff was wonderful, attentive, and polite. As this was our wedding trip, we were subject to a complimentary champagne and cheese gift upon our return from our first night in the Quarter. At night our turn down service was very much appreciated. Especially after returning from the roof top pool overlooking the city. The Pav's pool has to be one of the finest in the city. Our day ventures into the French Quarter were only a short walk from the Pav. If you are concerned about the location, fear not. In ten minutes you can be on Decatur or Bourbon. Our daily breakfast walk to Cafe Du Monde or Huck Fins was a hop and a skip. Our barometer by which we measure our content in the French Quarter will always be bench marked by the Le Pavillon. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “There's simply no way this hotel can be up to 3 star.”
Reviews.Author: El_Spirito
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? We'd only just driven 12 hrs down to New Orleans & had expected to check into our room without any problems. The valet was nice enough but the reception guy just took rudeness & incompetence to another level. Firstly, he'd jumbled up the bookings & booked us for August instead of July. He then tried to cover up his incompetence with false bravado. Gosh, the chap acted as though his father personally owned the hotel chain. His manners were just gorss and cringeworthy. He was actually actively digging well into his nose as we spoke. Plus he just had a shabby demeanour. Now surely, a hotel claiming to be 4 star could afford to place a professional, clean & polite individual on the front desk. A big disappointment. All outer facade but no inner quality. Needless to say, we changed our mind about staying there. Had to go round at 2 am in the morning looking for a place of better quality to stay. I wouldn't let my dog stay at this place, not to mention recommending it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JKRosenberg
Reviews.Content: Took us weeks to get rid of the sores caused by BED BUGS! Other than that, it was a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Cricketmk3
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon is a beautiful hotel...no doubt about that. The decor is very elegant and there are extras that I've never seen at other hotels...shoe polish, peanut butter & jelly sandwiches, hot chocolate & milk, and pb&j cookies, a card with the weather forecast, etc. However, I would have given up those extras to have had coffee in my room. It's free in the lobby but it's not available in the room. It was funny that the free coffee was located in front of the restaurant but it was not free 10 steps away in the restaurant. The pool area is beautiful but the pool is kind of small and when we were there, there was a religious convention going on (in New Orleans?) and there were a BUNCH of kids at the hotel...you couldn't get near the pool. Also, don't stay on the ninth floor because that is where you have to get off the elevator to walk up a flight of stairs to the pool and that floor is very noisy if there are a lot of kids like there were when I was there...our room happened to be the one next to the elevator. I think we had the absolute worst room in the hotel. Otherwise, the hotel is great and I'd stay there again... just not on the 9th floor.

Reviews.Title: “An intergral part of our trip!”
Reviews.Author: chrysanthemum15
Reviews.Content: We had an early flight and expected to stow our bags and move on with our day but when we checked in at 930am, M said our room was ready. It was great to know that our bags were safe in our rooms. Wayne escorted us and even filled the ice bucket when we went to the room. We loved the location of the hotel, the CBD is far enough away from Bourbon so as not to be bothered by the noise but close enough to make an easy walk to see the french quarter. Lou the concierge had great information. And the doorman was super in coordinating shared rides to destinations farther away. We really enjoyed the peanut butter and jelly bar from 10-11pm, on Saturday there was Nutella, and the hot chocolate with freshly whipped cream was fantastic. We made a point to get there nearly every night. The rooftop pool with jacuzzi was lovely, we had happy hour up there several times, meeting other visitors and getting great dinner ideas from them.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't give these people your $”
Reviews.Author: Shaunte79
Reviews.Content: My college friends and I had a mini-reunion in New Orleans for July 4th weekend. We were happy to get rooms next door to each other. I like more modern hotels, but the decor here was still very beautiful. Our problems began on the first evening when my friend pulled the comforter back as she was getting into her bed to take a nap. There was a HUGE round blood stain on the inside of the comforter. We called the front desk to tell them about the situation and asked that they send housekeeping up to our room to change both bed sheets and comforters. A VERY nice housekeeper came to replace the sheets and requested new comforters for both beds. We were supposed to get them the next morning. Of course, we didn't. While the housekeeeper was in the room, I noticed that the entire shower head (which was one of the larger ones) was completely covered in mildew. I asked her to look at it to confirm and she did. At this point I was completely annoyed. I called the front desk again and asked that a manager call our room. Someone named Justin, who I'm not sure is even a manager called to speak with us. He was so nonchalant about the bloody sheets that I was convinced this had happened before. The mold didn't seem much of a suprise at all. He offered to send the engineer up to change the showerhead. Ya think? I told him how disgusted we were with finding blood and mold on our first night in the hotel and he didn't seem to care much. A few minutes later he called back and offered us a bottle of alcohol. I don't know about anyone else, but drink didn't seem like much compensation for mold and bloody sheets in our hotel room. When I told him that we didn't drink, he offered us cheese and crackers. Really? I told him we weren't interested in that either. When the engineer came in to change the shower head with the smallest showerhead I'd ever seen in my life, he screamed upon entering the bathroom and seeing the mold. That's how bad it was. He couldn't believe it. The next evening, the lovely housekeeper from the evening before came back to check on us. When we told her that no one followed up with us or brought comforters, not only did she bring comforters to our room, but re-made our beds, which weren't made properly. Then brought us a few free bottle of water. When we received our bill on the last night, there were charges for liquor that we hadn't purchased in the minibar. Another annoyance. When we checked out, they gave us absolutely no problem with fixing the bill. I'm pretty sure they usually sneak these extra charges on their bills because there were two other guests in the lobby complaing of the same thing. When we asked to speak with a mgr about our ordeal, the woman that was checking us out said she was a mgr. When we explained to her all that happened, she responded, "oh I heard about that." I told her that it was unacceptable that no one even thought to call and check in with us throughout the rest of our 3 day stay. She stated, "you know, that's my fault. I was supposed to. I'm sorry, I didn't." This was one of the most expensive hotels I've ever stayed in and by far, the nastiest. The rooms and most of the staff just STUNK. Let me be specific... the concierage had a HORRIBLE attitude along with the front desk staff and manager. Please don't stay here. I don't care what it was rated, you can have a better stay elsewhere and spend less money. It was the ONLY unpleasant part of my first New Orleans experience. Another thing - don't buy into the pics of the hot tub and pool. They look NOTHING like the pictures. If you choose to risk staying here, you'll see that I'm not lying.

Reviews.Title: “An extraordinary hotel and an affordable price, I felt like a queen!”
Reviews.Author: Gracesmom_4
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous, boutique hotel that made me feel like I was in Europe again. I did not want to leave the hotel even for dinner. I enjoyed my room, it was cozy, homey, I felt like I was in a friend's living room rather than a hotel room. Everything was clean and comfortable. The gym had large windows, nice plasma TV screens, variety of equipment and weight machines. The breakfast was delicious. The hospitality was amazing, everyone was so friendly and helpful. It was wonderful experience. And best of all, it was affordable.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have stayed at and I have been to many”
Reviews.Author: MsTraveler39
Reviews.Content: Staffed not pleasant, informative, inviting or knowlegable. Management staffed not quick problem solvers or able to make sound decisions. I reserved a king non-smoking and was told they were not able to find my reservation and to have a seat in the lobby. After returning 30min later to say they have a large party going on and only have a double queen. So after going back and forth with the third party I booked with they called the hotel to try and get them to fill my reservation with no luck, I took the double queen because at the point it was already 8:30 p.m. After dinner and returning to my room is where I had the biggest disappointment, my room was an accessible room that you can tell was not used often. The shower curtain was full of black mold and mildew, the sink was clogged, the telephone did not work, the fridge was broken. I called the front desk from my cell phone to only be told to call back in the morning to talk to the front desk manager.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WON-DER-FULLLLLLLL!!!”
Reviews.Author: SavedOne75
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon is a truly a gem! It's a beautifully decorated historic hotel with very pleasant, helpful and accommodating staff--WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND STAYING THERE!! I surprised my husband with a trip to New Orleans for our 25th Anniversary and we can't stop telling everyone about our experience! As well as receiving an upgraded deluxe room (surprise to us upon check-in!), we were also surprised with Champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, and a "Happy Anniversary" balloon, complements of the Manager and Staff!! The room was very nice and the bedding very comfortable. Great location, close to everything and a nice walk to see the Dome, Bourbon Street, the French Quarters and other sights. The restaurant was a little pricey so we ate elsewhere, but overall the hotel stay was a wonderful experience and we would definitely stay at Le Pavillon again!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Experience at a Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WMSLT
Reviews.Content: Attending a dinner for a Vietnam veterans group at this hotel, I found the staff to be masters of their craft. The banquet hall and service were superb. The variation of the different foods that were served worked really well. All the food was cooked extremely well, The dishes served were a good example of the different Creole ways of cooking. It was a very enjoyable meal. The price was comparable to other venues and met or exceeded my expectations. It was a most enjoyable evening. Many in our group expressed a desire to DO this AGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor and ambience”
Reviews.Author: Roccox
Reviews.Content: This is a 100 years old hotel, member of the "Leading Hotels of The World"; however. it still maintains its grandeur and magnificense. The hotel is about 6 blocks from the French Quarter (Bourbon Street) on a major street. The staff is great!

Reviews.Title: “It had superior woodwork, art, flooring, crystal chandeliers, but NO ghostâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: Dashecky123
Reviews.Content: The hotelâ€™s was lavish with superior woodwork, flooring, crystal chandeliers, etcâ€¦ I picked this hotel based on the star rating and reviews and I was not disappointed. The lobby and restaurant were outstanding and elegant. It seems some people have seen a ghost on the 1st, 3rd and 10th floor, although we did not see any in our room, it made for a good time discussing it with the staff and others. The pool was first-class; even though it in was on the top floor, small and in the open. To get to the pool you must take the elevator to the 9th floor and walk up to the 10th. The workout room matches any 5 star hotel. The hotel is within walking distance of the French Quarter; we only used a cab once to the riverwalk which was less than 7 dollars (10 including the tip). The room was a small king but in great condition being that it was over 100 years old. Staff was extremely nice and more than helpful. It was delightful, historic and we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CJlovestoTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend. It was really great. The hotel had character and class. It is just a short walk to the French quarter, so it was very convenient. We especially loved the roof top pool. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful experience. They truely...”
Reviews.Author: bdg5556
Reviews.Content: A delightful experience. They truely understand service and attention to detail. Staff are extremly nice and more than helpful. Do not miss a trip to the dining room nor the nightly PBJ sandwiches and the hot chocolat is devine. I look forward to my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon-a friendly introduction to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Rhodesian
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying in the spacious and romantic European Castle suite for a week during the ATS conference. We got a great rate from the hotel, and Justin, the concierge booked us in all the fancy restaurants we could wish for, and helped us choose between them as well.Lou, his colleague, spread her southern charm everytime we saw her and everybody in the hotel was unfailingly courteous. We had booked Jazz brunch at CommanderÂ´s palace but were unable to get there because of a torrential downpour resulting in washed-out streets! So we had jazz brunch at the hotel instead. We got lovely music, a fantastic buffet, extra dishes made a la minute from the fabulously friendly female chef who actually had a name sign saying "Patty Cakes". I think we had six mimosas each. All for USD 35 per person. Wow! As an extra icing to the cake, my fiancee was given a CD from the piano player with his best songs! Everything was within walking distance. Congress, Lee Circle, St Charles streetcar and French quarter. We canÂ´t find a single fault with the hotel, except that the Central Business district is neither beautiful nor romantic. The hotel is, though. When parking Your car remember that parking is FREE on sunday nights in the street and that there is an USD 8/day garage two blocks away-so no need to pay USD 28 for parking... The rooftop pool is lovely as well. All in all a lovely introduction to a wonderfully friendly city. By the way, we felt perfectly safe wherever we walked in the city. We didnÂ´t walk in any of the Projects though.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Southern Belle a short walk from the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Terence_in_RiverCity
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon is fantastic. The common areas have a luxurious french country feel and are resplendent with art, chandeliers and antique furniture. The rooms have vaulted ceilings and comfy beds. The best feature, however, is the people. When I called the reservations department prior to our trip to tell them it was our anniversary, the woman I spoke to was gracious and thanked me for letting them know. When we got to New Orleans and checked in, everyone from the doorman to the bellhop to the woman at the front desk were friendly and sincerely interested in welcoming us to the city and the hotel. My wife went down one morning to get coffee and saw the staff setting up in the Crystal Room for a wedding that night. Noticing that she was interested, one of the banquet servers invited her to return once they had finished setting up to take some pictures. He told her jokingly that she was a "platinum" guest. The doorman (Cedric) always asked if we needed directions when we left and offered enthusiastic recommendations for the best restaurants. Check out the hotel's website. It has a section titled "Treasures" and before describing the priceless art and antiques it describes the hotel's longtime employees. Exactly right. The location was perfect for us but some might find it too far from the action. If was a five to ten minute walk to the French Quarter, so getting to some of the restaurants, Cafe du Monde, the riverfront, etc., was a bit of a hike. The upside, however, is that we had total peace at night. It was a respite from the delicious madness that is New Orleans. The roof pool and hot tub are mind-blowing. You can see the Mississippi River, the SuperDome and the New Orleans skyline. It's open until 1:00 a.m., so you can return from a full night of partying to the solitude of clear water and the night sky. One morning we started our day at the pool and ordered coffee and Bloody Marys poolside. Not bad. The late night peanut butter and jelly snack is a classy touch, but we missed it every night thanks to the action on Bourbon Street, Frenchmen Street and at the Howlin' Wolf. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Character and history, at a price”
Reviews.Author: Ashl
Reviews.Content: A bit of a mixed bag here. A stunning building, great service by all staff, very clean, good location. On the negative side, only 2 elevators and only one worked during our 5 day stay. Made for some long waits. The rooms are quiet, unless people are in the halls. Then, the noise travels freely, most often when you are just falling asleep. The restaurant has a $17.95 buffet breakfast, which we looked at and didn't find appealing. Ordering off the menu will set you back $15 to $20 just the same, which is a bit steep for a regular looking breakfast.
