We will probably try another spot next time, but I would recommend Le Pavillon to others based on the beautiful well kept building and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not worth the #3 rating”
Reviews.Author: kmadams
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Pavillon May 21-26, 201o for a convention. I chose this hotel due to its high rating on Tripadvisor (#3 at the time) and its reasonable price. The room was charming, and had a nice New Orleans-y feel to it. The hotel provided bottled water and peanutbutter and jelly cookies my first night. They did not replace these, nor did they provide turn down service again. My room had a view of the hotel across the street. Housekeeping arrived at 9:00 Saturday morning. Also on Saturday, I learned the shower was broken. Despite being told by the front desk that someone would be there "in a minute," it took half and hour for a technician to come, and hour later I was able to shower and go to my conference (quite late). The bathroom was small, and the tub only had half of a shower wall....which led to soaking the bathroom floor with each shower. The walls were very thin, and I could hear in the hallway, the adjoining rooms, and the street traffic. The hotel is charming, and provided a "late night snack" of peanut butter and jelly sandwiches with milk and hot chocolate from 10 -11 each night. The staff at the bar were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you ask for room with renovated bathroom”
Reviews.Author: originaltravelgirl
Reviews.Content: if you book on hotwire the hotel that is 4 1/2 stars for $75.00 in business district, was this hotel. at least it was when i booked it. They put us on the 6th floor and assume it was because we were hotwire customers ~ the bathrooms on the 6th floor are old. Be sure to NOT stay on that floor! The rest of the floors have renovated bathrooms according to anothe traveler i meet at hotel. The bedspreads were old florals, lumpy pillows and mattress was terrible. if they would update with with new bedding (white duvets!!!) it would totally change the vibe of the rooms. Rooms smelled musty. No coffee makers or frig in rooms but you can get complimentary coffee downstairs in restaurant. The main lobby is old world elegant and has priceless antiques, can't deny that the lobby is over the top but the rooms fall very short of 4 1/2 stars. Staff was well trained and 5 star worthy but i am the type of traveler and doesn't care about lobby as long as i have a great room. Location - not an easy walk to french quarters or anything that was for tourist. If you are there on Wednesday, make sure you walk to the lafayette for some of the best free music ever! This was the best part of our trip, alcohol and great food available for purchase. I think it starts around 5ish - 7:30pm. Across the street of hotel is a wonderful gourmet pizza shop and they do deliver to hotel ~ Reginelli Pizza. Rof top pool is grand for morning coffee. Overall i can deal with location, great staff, great lobby, but would not recommend this hotel because the rooms were bad.

Reviews.Title: “An opulent hotel in a convenient area”
Reviews.Author: puddingandpiePooleUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel withing 5 minutes walk of the french quarter can only be described as sumptuous. In the dining room they have a unique portrait of Abraham Lincoln as a young man, worth millions. The many chandeliers are breathtaking. The staff all seem to exude southern charm and the concierges are excellent. Beware of taking a car as the garage is $28 per night and you really don't need one as all excursions will collect you from the hotel. Breakfast at about $18 is expensive but be sure to get coffee and juices from their machines. If you ASK for coffee and juice it's extra! Its an expensive hotel so all extras are commensurate with the very up-market experience. Don't miss the evening snack of peanut butter and jelly sandwiches. Gorgeous rooftop pool.

Reviews.Title: “Uneasy in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: mmcek
Reviews.Content: I have stayed all over the world in all classes of hotels and motels. This is first time of have felt compelled to write a review. The hotel was shabby, but that didn't bother me. Also the room was a shoe box, and the beds were terribly uncomfortable. I left my absolute favorite sweater in the bathroom hanging on towel rack... I can almost see were I left it. No problem, I thought, I'll just call and pay to have them ship it back to me. No such luck.... I was treated miserably for trying to retrieve my own personal item. The housekeeping manager was completely indifferent and down right rude. Never have I experienced such awful customer service. The general manager was easier to talk with but just as nonchalant about my stolen item. I have no tolerance for anyones things being stolen, and especially by paid staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but stay off of the 6th floor”
Reviews.Author: gallygrad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was where I just attended a conference. The best thing I can say about this hotel is about the staff. Everyone was extremely helpful and nice. The rooms were spacious and really made you feel like you were in New Orleans. The one problem is that the hotel has renovated every floor except for the 6th. The bathrooms on this one floor do not have the black marble and other amenities that you hear about in other reviews. They do have a very good wireless connection for the Internet. The doors are fairly thin so if you are a light sleeper, ask for a room that is away from the elevator. Also, I usually left the hotel with several other people so it was not a problem but if you are going to the French Quarter at night, I would definitely come back in a group. It is not that bad but there are some empty buildings that make it a little scary. The Quarter is MAYBE a 5-10 minute walk so it is easy to get to and it is great because you do not hear the noise from the quarter from inside the hotel. One last thing, if you are coming to this hotel for a conference, BRING A SWEATER or sport coat. They keep all the conference rooms at unusually cool temperatures. The reason being is that in the afternooon, the sun hits the building just right that if they did not crank the AC, it would be sweltering.

Reviews.Title: “All the beauty of historic New Orleans with true southern hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: MSlauralee
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel anywhere! The staff were super friendly from my first inquiries to checkout. They smiled, they chatted, and they were genuinely helpful. Even when our room was double booked so they put us up in their best suite! It was truly amazing! The view from the pool is awesome and the PB&J is a unique experience. It's a little bit of a walk to French Quarter, but we felt completely safe and didn't mind it at all. I'd recommend booking through the hotel directly and getting one of the packages. They are great deals. We got the Family Fling and enjoyed the tickets they gave us for the aquarium. The included parking and breakfast really seal the deal. If you come to New Orleans this hotel is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't stop grinning - absolutely the best”
Reviews.Author: JaneButton
Reviews.Content: I'm a hotel snob and will pick apart even the nicest of places. Le Pavilion is faultless - amongst my very favourite. After rocking up to the front door looking a bit bedraggled (a long car ride and a day on a wet and windy beach), we were a bit embarrassed to dash across the lobby to the safety of our room. Instead - we were greeted with open arms by a very happy and funny concierge who insisted we tuck right in to their nightly spread of peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, with hot chocolate & marshmallows on the side. This is served on silver service in the middle of the lobby - every night. We not only got to chat with the concierge about where to head out that night (our first time in New Orleans), but got talking to fellow guests as well - and when have you ever done that!? We'd see the same faces in the elevator through the course of our stay - which made it feel all the more like home (A very elegant home at that!) My other reason I LOVE this hotel. Wi-Fi is free. You turn on your laptop and it works. No sign-in screen b.s. or 24 hour clock....it just works. What a concept. Rooftop pool is lovely. Bathrooms are lovely, ceilings are high - and yes other reviewers have mentioned the hallways can be noisy but this is New Orleans for god's sake! You want peace and quiet you go to Wyoming. Really look forward to visiting Le Pavilion in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loved the free PB&J!”
Reviews.Author: beachgal1023
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here before going on a cruise. The hotel was beautiful, great painting everywhere. It's a little old, but still gorgeous. We loved the free PB&J and hot chocolate at night. The only thing i didn't like was that it was a little snobby.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I went to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kendrash
Reviews.Content: Location: Although not everyone likes walking to the French Qtr, the location of this hotel was fine for us. We walked to Mother's for dinner the first night. We walked 1/2 block to take a streetcar to the garden district one morning. We walked to the French Qtr and were not remotely concerned about safety. Service: No issues, the staff was always accomodating. Amenities:The hotel itself is lovely. From the draperies to the towels, everything in our room was perfect. The pool, hot tub, lobby, etc. also were lovely. Of course, the hot choc. at 10 pm was great too. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4.5 star hotel as advertised”
Reviews.Author: BWHITE6132
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a lot of potential but it is unfortunately not living up to its potential. The room was large and well appointed but the furnishings were well worn and the bed linens old and not of high quality. The halls were very noisy during the course of the night; it was as if we were staying in an inexpensive casino in Las Vegas. Our concierge promised to make dinner reservations for us but failed to get back in touch with respect to our reservations. He also gave us the wrong time for a guided tour so we missed the tour all together. The restaurant is dark and depressing. On the other hand, the front desk staff was very efficient, pleasant and thorough. When we called the front desk to have a janitor sent up to the room to fix a plumbing issue, the janitor arrived within three or four minutes and fixed the problem immediately. The business center was a pleasant surprise and it provided all a business traveler would need in terms of technology.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing: Good location/service, but not worth the money; lacks class & elegance”
Reviews.Author: rpost06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Pavillon for 4 nights and selected it based on its high Trip Advisor ratings. We found a room at the Ritz Carlton for $100 less per night, but didn't stay there based on the poor reviews. Now, we wish that we had chanced it since we were disappointed in Le Pavillion. While the hotel claims to be of the â€œOld World grandeurâ€� class, it is missing a sense of class and misses the mark on elegant touches. We've stayed in plenty classy, Old World hotels (e.g., Seelbach Hilton in Louisville, Amway Grand in Michigan, Pfister Hotel in Milwaukee and the Waldorf Astoria in New York) and this one just doesn't make the cut. Our junior-suite room contained several dusty fake flower arrangements (think 1980's). In addition, we expected that a hotel of this caliber would have a down duvet and high-thread count sheets. Instead, it had a ratty polyester bedspread with the same ugly, outdated, dusty floral theme as the rest of the hotel and dining area. In addition, while I shouldn't complain about a gift, the hotel gave us a fruit basket with rotten fruit to celebrate our wedding anniversary... We did appreciate the good customer service. We called the front desk for a few items, and they were promptly delivered, and, when our bathtub drain was clogged, the hotel fixed it later that day. However, we were concerned about the cleanliness of the room. The room contained a bar sink, which was also clogged. Instead of cleaning out the drain, the housekeeper simply left it and all of the crud it contained laying on the side of the sink. Another day, the housekeeper left her wet cleaning rags behind - yuck! The hotel is located in the quiet Central Business District, which unfortunately doesn't seem to be thriving. It's immediately nearby lots of vacant office buildings, and is across the street from the Homewood Suites and a block away from the Drake Hotel. The French Quarter is a short 5-6 block walk, and we appreciated the separation from the vibrant (loud) nightlife. Overall, we do not recommend this hotel until it is updated with a touch of class and the housekeeping is improved.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to New Orleans for Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: WendyW2
Reviews.Content: Loved our trip. The beautiful hotel and the great food. Loved Bourban street

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jasmich
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days. Excellent service from the staff. We really enjoyed the PB&Js and hot chocolate at 10.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this hotel is perfect except for the parking”
Reviews.Author: indigo02
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Le Pavillon and I loved staying here just as much as the first time. The decor is unique, the staff friendly, the location great, and the rooftop pool and hot tub so relaxing. As much as I love this hotel, I almost gave it only 4 stars because of the parking situation. My husband and I rented a car for four days for $115.00, but we had to spend over $120 to park it with the hotel for four days. The per day charge is ridiculous. I expect them to charge me to park given the location, but not over $30 per day. Not only that, but I went to get my car one time and they told me it was parked on the street (not even in their lot). I don't think this would prevent me from staying here again, but it is frustrating and if you have a car, make sure you factor the cost to park it into your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with friendly workers.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyVacationsMN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is historic and nicely decorated, and all of the workers were pleasant. Parking was expensive but that is typical here. The parking, plus a small fridge, and various taxes added over $60 a night to the bill so plan for that if you have a car and want to use a fridge. They have BP&J available at 10PM, and that was fun, though I would have much rather had them available in the morning for breakfast since we didn't really need to eat anything late at night after eating all day in the city! The rooftop pool was nice, and the first time we used it the water was warm, but the 2nd time it was really cold. The wifi worked well in our room. Housekeeping could have been a little better as we had to call down the the office for toilet paper, and then we ended up just buying some at a local store so we didn't have to keep asking for it. We also had a light that didn't work, and the TV remote didn't work, but both were quickly fixed. The valet parking worked pretty well, and they usually had the car over within 15 minutes of calling. All and all, we enjoyed our stay here. It was fun for a one time deal, and was in close walking distance to the French quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Great People”
Reviews.Author: SEVUN
Reviews.Content: The people were great, real hospitable, and helpful. The room we stayed in on second floor was OK for a small room but no sleep because of the exit door for stairs, catering door and dishes clanging, a meeting going on which they should have put all of them on the same floor. Rudeness abounded standing in hall talking like they were outside on the street. Bed was hard but OK if you like a real firm mattress, pillows left a lot to be desired. I was asked by checkout personnel why we didn't ask for a new room which after unpacking and it being middle of the night we weren't in the mood for change. Recommend not staying on 2nd floor!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice room, tho tiny- great service and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: tawanda18
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed my two night stay here. It is an old hotel, but extremely well maintained. The staff was very well trained and courteous. Ate in the dining room one night- for the price- eat somewhere else, food was merely ok. Only about a two block walk to the french Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...”
Reviews.Author: SIDANDJULIAN
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel from the service, location, history. When you walk in you are stunned by the beauty of the lobby. The doorman wears white tie and tails. The concierege is more than helpful. I can't begin to imagine staying anywhere else in New Orleans. To top it off, every evening at 10pm they have a peanut butter and jelly sandwiches with hot chocolate, Fantasic!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Room Service”
Reviews.Author: HazleW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Pavillon on a business trip. The hotel is beautiful, and the people who work at Le Pavillon really made me feel welcome. The front desk manager, the concierge, the doorman, the bellhop, the room service staff - there was a cordiality and generosity of spirit there that was terrific to be around. I really appreciated it. My room was small and decorated in a quasi-Victorian manner that felt very 1900, but comfortable too. I liked the black granite bathroom and the glass shower stall. I liked that when I had to print out documents in the business center, there was no charge. And the room service was absolutely fantastic - the food was seriously delicious, and it was delivered promptly. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: Grovespeed
Reviews.Content: So, like a few of the other reviewers, I was dying to stay at Le Pavillon. Have visited New Orleans a couple of times before and stayed at the Sheraton and the Marriott on Canal but wanted something more luxurious--even though I was traveling for work, it was my birthday too so I thought it'd be fun to step it up a notch. Unfortunately, what I got wasn't quite what I expected. This hotel has a lovely staff but the accommodations are seriously DATED. My room looked dingy and was overall, lackluster. One lamp didn't work, the carpet was old, bed linens ancient too, and the bed was crooked--the base of the bed was up higher than the top. Also, chips on the wall from where furniture hit it. I was disappointed. I tried to get another room but because of the NCAA tournament, they were booked. I asked about the penalties for switching to another hotel and the manager would charge me one night's fee (even though I literally, opened the door took a look at the room and turned around and left). Still, I was willing to accept the penalty because the room was that unsatisfactory but I couldn't find another room anywhere else. Also, at first the manager was a little rude and unsympathetic, but once I was reduced to tears out of shear frustration, exhaustion (had been on the road since 5AM and have a new baby at home), and general disappointment, she tried to be nice. The staff flipped the mattress and re-made the bed and they left me a complimentary bottle of champagne. It was a decent gesture. Also, the restaurant has good food and service but in all honesty, I would not recommend this hotel, not for the price--you can stay at nicer places for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and friendly”
Reviews.Author: summerbum
Reviews.Content: This hotel is full-on baroque gorgeous--marble and crystal and velvet draperies everywhere. Even the elevator doors are painted and draped in velvet. The beds are probably the most comfortable of any hotel I've ever stayed in. But Le Pavillon is just as inviting as it is lush. The staff is welcoming and friendly, and they have a nightly Peanut Butter and Jelly buffet. Robes are provided in the rooms, too. Only complaint: no in-room coffee makers, so you have to go to the hotel restaurant for it. But, even though I was wandering into their jazz brunch in my pajamas and a post-Mardi Gras stupor, the staff greeted me warmly and helped me get caffeinated. The hotel is approximately a 10-minute walk from Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: katcsmith
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to stay at this hotel! I have admired it from the outside since I was young. My husband and I booked only one night at the hotel and thank goodness. The room was not clean (dusty baseboards, stained carpet), the decor was very dated with old appearing bedspreads. The bathroom was dissapointing with a very small bathtub, the drain would not close...I used a wine glass to plug the drain. The remote control did not work, the toilet ran, the bill was wrong when we got it the next morning. Overall, very dissapointing. Do not let the lovely facade and lobby fool you. Definitely not worth the money. There are plenty of better places in the quarter for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable elegance”
Reviews.Author: steelrgirl2
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I forgot to write a review of this place last year. We were celebrating my husband's 40th and I suprised him with the trip. I know there's so much I won't be able to remember but this hotel was absolutely breathtaking and such a bright part of our trip. The pool on the roof was one of my favorite things. It was so posh and swimming in January is always a plus for a Midwesterner. I was so excited about the peanut butter sandwiches in the evening. The hot cocoa was to DIE for with real whipping cream. Our room was huge! I had a lot of fun photographing both the interior and exterior. We walked to Bourbon Street and the Casino, down Canal, rode the street cars til they ended and turned around..and felt perfectly safe. The facade to this hotel is just absolutely beautiful. We had an amazing time exploring in New Orleans. If I return,

Reviews.Title: “"Please don't ever ever make this mistake by staying here!"”
Reviews.Author: BuddyTucson
Reviews.Content: First upon entering the hotel I was amazed by how beautiful and elegant the hotel was. Here is where the trouble started that ruined my entire trip. The front desk asked for my an imprint of my credit card...no big deal...very normal. Then the manager of accounting Bob and his assocciate Jennifer; both in Accounting, screwed up my credit card beyond belief and the two of them argued that they were right vs. CHASE bank. God forbid if you are having any problems while you are there...the minute you check out they could care less and won't return your phone calls. Please I beg you don't make this same mistake ever. For the price you can stay at the W Hotel, or The Ritz Carlton, both of which are much closer to the French Quarter. DO NOT GO HERE EVER!!! Feel free to call me for more advice or email at ccananza@gmail.com.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: PamR13
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and hotel. Best place I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: stallball99
Reviews.Content: best [--] hotel ever. love the pb&j sandwiches and milk @ 10pm. people there r the nicest ever. always go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: Starviagera
Reviews.Content: Close enough to the action and far away from the noise and crowds. Loved the nightly chocolate and peanut butter spread that gave us a chance to meet people and chat. Good amenities. Good service. Good food at the bar. Best place we ever stayed in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and great staff”
Reviews.Author: wslaugh
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel, the doorman greeting me was dressed in tails and a tophat and was very friendly. When I walked in, I was in awe of the magnificent architecture and decor. Check-in went very smoothly. After settling into my upgraded room (with a bay window), I went down and spoke with the concierge to request assistance in arranging for a tour the next morning, as well as suggestions on attractions I could walk to. He was very helpful and placed a couple of calls until we got what I wanted. My room was also impressive, clean, and comfortable. I did not make use of the rooftop pool, but did use the small exercise room which was also on the roof level. Most of the meals which I ate at the hotel were in the lounge/bar, rather then the dining room. My server there the first night was wonderful, and made me feel very comfortable, and remembered me every time I came in after that. Overall, I was happy with my entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Undiscovered/Underrated Gem”
Reviews.Author: Roaming_Grrl
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a recent Bday Girls weekend and we stayed here. The hotel and staff were exceptional. We did not want to sleep in the French Quarter, so this location worked for us. Our arrivals staggered, but we were all greeted with the same enthusiasm each time. I had emailed ahead and asked if all of our rooms could be placed on the same floor, they exceeded that request by putting all of our rooms together, across from one another. When I checked into my room, there was a complimentary bottle of champagne, tray with fruits, cheeses, crackers, and cake. There was a very kind note welcoming us and wishing me a Happy Birthday -- just wonderful and unexpected. Our rooms were extremely clean and well decorated, as was the entire hotel. We had no issues with noise whatsoever during our stay. The bar is nice and relaxing, delicious well-made cocktails. The tradition of the peanut butter spread with hot chocolate is so fun, you have to have it at least once during your stay. Whenever we made a request of the staff be it for directions to an extra pillow -- it was done without the hint of attitude. Hello, Southern Hospitality! Another plus, I started a conversation with the hotel via twitter which was so fun. The people who run the twitter account, left me a present of a rubber ducky with the hotel's name on it. Another sweet and unexpected bonus. Just stay here!

Reviews.Title: “This is one outstanding historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: HospitalityCritic
Reviews.Content: This is one outstanding historic hotel, from the friendly greeting of the staff to the outstanding service to the dÃ©cor and the complimentary PB&Jâ€™s at 10 pm nightly. We book the Le Pavilion through Hotels.com; we want to be central to Bourbon Street and the waterfront. Both are with in easy walking distance. This hotel would meet the needs of the business traveler, couple and familyâ€™s. Our room was very clean and comfortable, you need to take a trip up to the roof for the Hot Tub and pool, an outstanding view and a great place to have a cocktail and watch the sun set. We are all ready planning out return trip with friends and we will be staying at the Le Pavilion

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: c_star
Reviews.Content: Riding up Poydras Street to the hotel, I saw the columns and thought "Could that be our hotel?" It was! We were warmly welcomed by three different employees before even getting to the front desk. The lobby makes you feel like you've walked into a French Palace, while the treatment by the staff makes you feel like you're royalty! It was a whole different world after staying at the Hilton Riverside for three nights for a conference. Our first night was the Superbowl, so the hotel was full of Saints fans. The lobby, hallways, and rooms are furnished with antiques, our Bath was done out in black marble -- if felt dark at first, but was actually light enough to read in. (And we did have a towel bar.) In the room were wonderful little touches like terry robes, umbrellas, a shoehorn and a special bath menu. The rooftop jacuzzi was worth getting back to the hotel for -- and you could even order drinks and food to be brought up. (we didn't, as it was too cold to sit around). The hotel bar is inviting and the bar staff very courteous. We watched the superbowl there, as other nearby bars were standing room only. It was great fun and the service was great! Note: you can get the bartender to "spike" your hot chocolate or milk from the PB&J spread. We had gotten a really good deal on Hotwire, so didn't mind that we had a small corner room on the street. The only noise we heard from our room was from the celebrations in the French Quarter a few blocks away on Superbowl night. Unlike the Hilton, we had no problem with our cell phones or the wireless internet access that is free.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and a Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DB129
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Pavilion in December for 2 nights - what a great experience! We weren't quite sure what to expect after booking on Expedia (for a VERY good price), so when we drove up, we were surprised to find such a unique hotel, beautifully decorated for the holidays. We had chosen it for the central location to the Superdome (tickets for the Saints game!) and Bourbon Street, and we were not disappointed. The service was excellent, rooms were clean and the lobby was beautiful. And, when the Saints game ended at 1030pm, the hotel kept the PBJ and hot chocolate out in the lobby for the rush of guests returning around 11-1130pm. What a yummy treat! We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel for a girls' weekend”
Reviews.Author: LL80
Reviews.Content: I planned a bachelorette party weekend in New Orleans and chose this hotel for the ambiance and location. It did not disappoint! The hotel is beautiful, and the service is excellent. The staff make sure you feel welcome the moment you pull up to the door. The rooms are very spacious, especially for being close to the French Quarter. And it is a quick, 10 minute walk to Bourbon Street. I will stay here again next time I go to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip”
Reviews.Author: Aussum
Reviews.Content: We came to New Orleans for the weekend. Just so happened to be here for the NFC playoffs with the Saints and Vikings! What an awesome game. Anyway, Le Pavillon was a wonderful experience from the time we walked in the door. The staff was super friendly. The person who brought our bags to the room was super friendly and gave us wonderful recommendations for our first night. The check was quick and efficient. The next morning we had breakfast in the Crystal room. They have breakfast/buffet every morning. The waitress was so gracious and pleasant and wonderful service. When your coffee got a little cool she was right there with a fresh cup. Her name was Lucy. The room was a little small but comfortable. The decor was lovely. I would highly recommend staying in Le pavillon. It is a little bit out from the French Quarter but within walking distance and away from the madding crowds and noise. I would definitely stay here again. We got a rate of $99 which included the breakfast! PB&J every night at 10PM if you happen to be around. We had it one night and it was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old Hotel with lots of Atmosphere and Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: 3Terriers
Reviews.Content: Totally enjoyed our stay. Short walk to French Quarter and other sites. Service was outstanding. Room was comfortable and serviced every day before we returned from breakfast. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “How Suite it is.......”
Reviews.Author: aa6nz
Reviews.Content: As a member of the LWH Leaders Club, I was able to get an upgrade to a Suite. The trip was a birthday celebration for my spouse who as a New Orleans native wanted to celebrate her 40th Birthday with family and friends in her Home town. Also we were married in NOLA 16 years ago. We had the eight floor executive suite, when I opened the door of the suite, my wife who was conducting last minute telephone work details said, "oh my God". First the suite was a two bedroom suite with 2 1/2 bathrooms, with a 60 inch flat screen HD TV, full surround sound,baby grand player piano, full dining room with a fully loaded lighted china cabinet and a 10 chair dining room, marble foyer, full bar, ice maker,microwave, ice maker, refrig,etc. Heck I did'nt feel like I left home. The suite was probably 2500 sq ft. marble foyer area, fireplace 3 additional TV's. It exceeded all of my expectations. The decor of the hotel is Old World, like a hotel in Europe, oil paintings, heavy drapery, marble, opulent trim and gold leaf every where just like I like it, New Orleans style . As a benefit of my Leaders club status, we we welcomed with vouchers for the buffet breakfast every day of our stay and a bottle of french red wine with a fruit tray and truffles all of which were delicious. The breakfast buffet included grits, fruit and an omelet station which all were delicious. I have to send a shout out to the hotel staff, Paula (16years) and Mrs. Georges(35 years) who made our visit feel like home instead of a Hotel Stay. Yes the hotel is old but not in a bad way, but very unique and charming. The Christmas decorations were still up upon our arrival and they were outstanding, so much we had several of the same ornaments on our two trees at home. I must say my only complaints was that the room service was a little slow as compared to our other visits to hotels such as the Pennisula hotel in Chicago. But overall our stay was a lot of fun and I'm sure my friends and family that visited us at the suite were very impressed,as were we! We also had the chance to meet Mayor Ray Niagin at Breakfast as he and the Police Chief enjoy Breakfast there, in the Crystal Room. If you like unique, non chain, Hotels this is the place for you especially if you can get a Suite :) ! I believe Go Saints!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: PhillyVoyager
Reviews.Content: Stepping into Le Pavillon is like stepping into one of the grand old hotels of Europe. Other reviews accurately capture this hotel well, so I'll try not to repeat items. Like other "Leading Hotels of the World", the emphasis is on courteous service and anticipating your every need, with every employee not only being helpful but trying to anticipate where they can be helpful. Its location is ideal for the central business district and is a bit farther from the French Quarter waterfront area, but well worth the walk (`15 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scoutdad100
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week. Beautiful restored historic hotel. Staff was very friendly and informative. The bar and restuarant served the best food in town and trust me we tried many different restaurants during our stay.My only complaints are that room housekeeping always came around 4:00PM to make up the room, right when we would get back from a day of exploring New Orleans. Also the bed was a little uncomfortable but the room was clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Flavor of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: PnM53
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights, weather was freezing for NOLA but you can't control that so why complain. Staff is wonderful, everyone offers their own little tips to enhance your stay. Rooms are a little small but rather elegant, they give you a feel for where you are as opposed to a chain that is the same in every city. Location is great, you can walk everywhere (easier when its not so cold) around the city. Harrahs is just a few blocks away which worked out great for us as we like casinos and it was warm in there at night. Only got up to the hot tub once but it was really nice and cozy up there with a beatiful view of the area at night. The bar staff are warm ,fun people, good drinks, good snacks and a nice place to catch the football playoffs. Overall, a really nice hotel with charm and great staff, I would absolutely stay here on another visit to New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday at La Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: KPatterson-Smith
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Pavillon from 12/25/09 to 12/31/09. Got a great deal for $99 a night with free parking (or breakfast). What a great deal and hotel. The hotel was wonderfully decorated for the holidays. The staff upon arrival, and the whole time was great. I took the advice from another traveler to get a card from the hotel chain, but unless you book directly through the chain site they donâ€™t give you anything. Since we flew in on Christmas day, not much was open. We ate at the bar and the bartender was great! She noticed I was blowing my nose so she brought me over a box of tissue!! Love Southern hospitality! We were in room 431, which is near the street. It never bothered me, but my husband woke up every night around 3:00 a.m. from music. We think it was from the entrance where they pipe classical music upon arrival. If you are easily disturbed by noise, pick a room near the rear of the hotel. The hotel was close enough to the French Quarter to walk, but far enough away to be quiet and peaceful. We walked to the WWII museum and The River walk (p.s. donâ€™t eat there, it gave my husband food poisoning) as well. The rooftop hot tub was great! After a long flight or all day of walking it really was nice. After about the 2nd day we finally got the turn down service. It was so nice because they left you bottles of water, cookies w/ a recipe, pulled out the robes, gave you a card with the next dayâ€™s weather and put down a little mat in front of the bed. It was no big deal that we didnâ€™t get the service for the first couple days, but if your super picky that might bug you. The pillows were also great, very comfy along with the bed. There was a Saints game during our stay and the place got real full of fans, but everyone was nice. We only made it down once for the 10 pm peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, but it was great. If possible, make it yourself as the readymade oneâ€™s might not be to your liking. The hot coco was so yummy! They even offered fresh fruit. Thy only thing I really didnâ€™t like was there were no towel barâ€™s in the bathroom. This is really not a big deal, but wanted to mention it. Overall this hotel is amazing. I overheard some localâ€™s saying they only stay there and as far as they are concerned itâ€™s the ONLY place to stay in New Orleans. I would have to agree. If I ever go back, I would most definitely stay at La Pavillon!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and room, good location, super roof-top view,nice exercise room.”
Reviews.Author: happitrails2me
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with lovely rooms, agreat location and wonderful, helpful staff. There is a nice roof-top pool and exercise room with a great view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Nola”
Reviews.Author: WalkinthruNola
Reviews.Content: Impeccable service. Perfect location to downtown restaurants & close enough to uptown shopping. They need to upgrade televisions. Beds are a little better than average, but I've slept in much nicer beds at equally nice hotels. We stay in Nola almost weekly & this is our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not really my style”
Reviews.Author: chinBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year's because it was the best deal we could find. The hotel wasn't really our style. We prefer to carry our own bags, etc. The staff was very friendly and attentive, but I get annoyed having to give everyone in sight a couple of bucks to do things I'd rather do myself. When we checked out, I only had two singles left, and I split them between the doorman and the valet. The valet made a face because he only got a dollar, and a bellhop who helped with one bag (we carried the other five) made a face because he didn't get anything. Also, the rooms are a little small and decorated in a grandiose, stately manner that I didn't like that much. And parking was more than $30 per night. This is a good hotel, and I don't regret my stay, but next time I would probably look for something a little more low-key.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: lotsoluck
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Located close to Bourbon St. and all the action, yet far enough away to feel relaxed. Within walking of all attractions, museums, etc. Most excellent staff, and don't miss the Sunday brunch - the live music and the piano player make a great start to any day. The pool and hot tub on the roof are a plus with great views of the city. Great dinner in the hotel restaurant. 1st class. Not a bad word for this place. Without a doubt, the best hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous lobby. Grimy room”
Reviews.Author: MsZie
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous Lobby with crystal chandeliers and furnishings of opulence and I thought we were in for a real treat. EXTREME let down when made it to the room. The smell was past old and more like mildewy and damp. The linens appeared to be original from the hotels opening in early 1900s. We were travelling with newborn and were afraid for her health. My allergies warned me that we had to pack up and find another hotel. In it's prime I am sure this hotel was striking but that was many years ago. If you don't have allergies and love truly traditional decor- this is the place for you. I hear they have a nice rooftop pool but we didn't make it that far.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Old Hotel - But not great”
Reviews.Author: BIG_SOS
Reviews.Content: Got a great deai on a one night stay for a Saints game. Interesting old hotel, but not in the best of shape. Very close to the superdome, so good in that respect. Bed was hard and linens not to good. My room was very small. Would stay again, but only for the right price. Not 4.5 stars, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Great service.”
Reviews.Author: cookiegirl1
Reviews.Content: I planned a trip to NOLA for my husband's 60th birthday which included our 3 adult children flying in from different cities to surprise him. We loved everything about this hotel. Location is perfect - just far enough away (walking distance) to the noise and grit of the city but quiet and quaint. Exercise room is small but clean and adequately equipped. PB&J sandwiches each night = a nice treat. The staff went above and beyond to be courteous and nice and we felt well cared for. When our junior suite did not have the sofa sleeper needed for our daughter, the manager on duty, Jared Hernandez, was most helpful and had our room changed and luggage moved without ruining the surprise for my husband. The buffet breakfast was excellent and had every kind of food imaginable. I highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “elegant”
Reviews.Author: Sadie941
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here and were able to get a great price. The downside is it is a bit of a walk the quarter (just not right where all of the action is) but completely manageable. The bathrooms are incredible. i also really like the soap on a rope they give you. another negative is the fact that it is 28 dollars a night to park there. try to self park in the area garages if you can. The hotel reminds me of a very nice hotel in europe. beautiful antiques, chandeliers galore, ... but still a little old. I still give it a 4 though and would recommend this hotel to you. Oh, and the beds were extremely comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: LLA-TMBA
Reviews.Content: Just a great hotel with a total New Orleans feel! Staff that really care - excellent service - reasonable rates - good food - convenient location and the heated roof-top pool and hot tub should not be missed!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: LyleL
Reviews.Content: Historical building, beatifully maintained, close to French Quarter. Free hot chocolate and PB & Js every night, what could be better?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice to feel the heartbeat of New Orleans!!!!”
Reviews.Author: solafide71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our pre-honeymoon cruise stay. As we checked in we found we had already been upgraded to a suite and later that evening where given a complimentary bottle of champayne. The staff where very friendly as well as helpful with helping us plan activities. The rooms where clean..perhaps smaller than expected but very cozy and romantic...almost like a bed and breakfast feel. Even the guests where friendly and equally pleased with the hotel. The decor was classic, french elegance and very different from the average corporate hotels, the elaborate drapes statues french inspired furniture high ceilings and lighting certainly was of four star quality. Excellent choice if you want to feel the beat of thid city even while you are in the hotel. My husband and I will stay at this hotel on our next visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “I loved everything in Le Pavillon!”
Reviews.Author: Rasasthali
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend there. We are on a tight budget but the prices were affordable. I loved everything about the hotel, especially the decorations, wonderful staff that took care of everything we needed, free sandwiches with peanut butter and hot chocolate at night. Jakuzzi and swimming pool on the roof were amazing - beautiful views, especially at night. We also used the gym - it was so quiet and relaxing there! At the end of our stay we got complimentary coffee from friendly staff. It would be nice if parking was free, but other than that I can recommend Le Pavillon to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant charm”
Reviews.Author: hoopjnky
Reviews.Content: So I really wanted to stay at the Roosevelt, BUT Le Pavillon offered pricing, location and amenities that I just could not resist. And what a deal it turned out to be. I stayed on the "haunted" floor (no ghosts for me but that happened at Disney World too so I think it is my karma). The bed was wonderful, the paintings on the ceilings marvelous and the bathroom was a sensual adventure. I took advantage of their bubble bath special and, honey, I was so sad to have been alone. The PB&J buffet at 10 PM was a real treat, too. The only negative was a slight smell of the past that lingered in the place. Everything else was fabu.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 1/2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: elheffay
Reviews.Content: Have just checked in and the overall entry experience is poor. Sloppy area around checkin desk and room quality is low. Room is small, not modern amenities for plugs, etc. Furniture layout is cramped and the bed and bedding are very old and overdone with drapery, etc. I'm sure the service will be great, based on other reviews, but even if it is, it cannot be good enough to make up for the decay of the rest of the facility. I did get the rooms for a steal on an online service, but I'd rather pay a little more and get a little more. I selected the hotel in the blind, on the basis of the 4 1/2 star rating...

Reviews.Title: “Old, not all that charming”
Reviews.Author: Crazygurll
Reviews.Content: I like to consider myself a pretty experienced traveller and like to stay at mid range to higher end properties. This was my third trip to New Orleans and I decided to avoid the corporate hotels and go somewhere classic, somewhere that would really live up to the historical atmosphere that pervades New Orleans. After seeing the high reviews here, and seeing the modest prices at hotels.com, I decided to book Le Pavillon. This is not a huge opulent hotel. The lobby is modestly but comfortably sized, with furniture like you'd expect in a French home and large chandeliers. When I arrived, the hotel computers were down, so they signed me in manually, based on my printed email of the reservation. There was no bellhop to be seen, and no one offered to get me one. It was about 730pm. I ordered room service and because the computers were down, I had to pay with cash or credit card, rather than charging to the room. This puzzled me, since I had just checked in by giving my credit card number, but I was tired and hungry so I didn't argue. The hotel food/room service was pretty consistently good. I tried club sandwich, burger, gumbo, beef burgendy, fried oysters, and the stir fry during my lengthy stay and all were quite adequate. The deserts were bad: a very dry brownie and a waxy piece of cheesecake. I got a standard 2 queen bed room and will say it is smaller than it appears in the pictures at the hotel website. The bedspread and curtains are just as dated as they appear in pictures and I suspect they aren't cleaned very often. Each day I came back to the room after my conference, I promptly stripped the bed of the bedspread and numerous decorative pillows, just so I felt like I was sitting on something clean. There was a ceiling fan which was nice on days I came back after lots of walking in the humidity. The AC worked better than the heating. Beds were comfortable but the pillows were extremely "mushy" and I had to stack up two just to get good support. The bathrooms are small....pretty close to unacceptably small. Not near enough counterspace for 2 people to put out all their toiletries. The shower was fine in terms of water pressure and height for the shower head. The half glass door shielding the room from the water spray was a bit dodgy but adequate from leaving the room soaked. For the most part, the room was quiet. I did check out the pool on the roof which is smaller than it appears on the hotel's website, but a nice touch. The fitness room seemed well stocked with equipment. The staff at the hotel seems to regularly get high praise here and it seemed mostly deserved. The girl who served room service a couple of times was very sweet, though not terribly competent, forgetting numerous items and failing to bring everything on her return trip. The front desk was friendly, and kind enough to loan me an ethernet cable to take advantage of the free in room internet service. I heard towards the end of my stay they will even loan you a MICROWAVE, in case you have leftovers from dining out! Overall, I wouldn't say this is a bad hotel. I certainly do not think it is worthy of being in the top 10 or even top 20 hotels in New Orleans though. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place - just what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: WanderingAcademic
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to NO and this was certainly my best hotel experience in the city. If you want a chilly and characterless modern hotel wasteland - go somewhere else. This place is a delight. The staff are delightful and maximally helpful. Location - I walked everywhere including Congress Centre, French quarter, Superdome for a football game and I took the tram along Charles Avenue. The interior is very special and distinctive - I loved it. Breakfast was excellent and the room was fine. My colleagues were also happy here. I will certainly use this place again and recommend it to you.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in N.O.”
Reviews.Author: ghalm00
Reviews.Content: I traveled across country with a good friend of mine back in the mid-1990's and we stopped off for 4 days in N.O and stayed in this fine hotel. VERY old South and stylish...I felt like I was stepping into some movie set...all sorts of fine French styled furnishings and the staff was, of course, polite and helpful beyond belief. If you go to N.O., get a room here. Not cheap, but what 5 star hotel is...take a dip in the roof top pool too. Outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff overcomes old structure”
Reviews.Author: TXnatives
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old. It has updated but you can still tell that it is old. When we arrived we were greeted by the valet and the doorman who helped us out of the car and loaded our luggage to a cart. The check-in process was speedy and I was really happy that even though I reserved through a "discount" website they didn't stick us in an ugly room. The room was directly across the elevator which I though would have been a problem with noise but the 9th floor was quiet and relaxing. When we tried to go out in the rain the doorman offered to get us a cab but due to the heavy rain we decided to stay and eat in the hotel. The service was good and the food was OK for hotel restaurant food. The hot chocolate was good and a nice touch. The only problem I had was the water draining from the bath tub. It was slow to drain so it was a little gross to stand in yucky water and wait for it to drain before someone else can shower. The parking for the valet is very secure so after reading some other reviews about security I was really happy that Le Pavillion takes car security serious. They have a lot next door to the hotel which has a gate so it is very safe. Very happy with our stay so next time we head to NOLA we will consider staying there first.

Reviews.Title: “Old New Orleans Charm”
Reviews.Author: phillyphan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in mid-October for our first visit to New Orleans. Hereâ€™s an overview of our experience: Room We stayed in a standard room with a queen bed. The room was comfortable and clean upon arrival. The decor was a mix of French and Southern, the furniture was in good shape. Regarding noise - I don't think we heard another guest the entire time we were there - a definite plus. Housekeeping kept the room spotless, and the towels provided were plentiful. The air conditioning was quiet and worked well, which was great with temperatures in the upper 80's/low 90's. Service/Staff The staff we encountered were all wonderful. Everyone from the front desk to bellhop to doormen offered advice and greeted us with a smile. We didn't have any problems with the room or our stay that needed addressing. In fact, the only service we needed was a wake up call, which was on time. Overall Le Pavillon was a great experience, and the price was fantastic considering the opulent feel of the hotel. The Central Business District location is great - the side street leads right to Bourbon Street, if you're interested. The farther reaches of the French Quarter were an easy walk away. We felt safe walking in the area at all times. The hotel is also only a block or so away from both the Canal and St. Charles street car lines, and cabs were easy to get for farther trips. We didn't check out the bar or the food, so I can't offer any feedback in that respect. The rooftop pool was a delight after the high temperatures and humidity, and we were the only people there the two days we used it. Overall, Le Pavillon is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Old South Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AFTAC
Reviews.Content: Our stay was truly an enjoyable one. This was our second visit to the hotel, and if possible, more enjoyable than the first. The entire staff from the door person, to receptionist, to the dining room waiter were all very gracious and helpful. Our room was beautiful and comfortable and decorated in period antiques. Don't miss the breakfast buffett; it's awsome! The Crystal Room is a showcase of European elegance and style. I'm sorry to say we were so tired from touring the city we couldn't participate in their traditional "peanut butter and jelly sandwich hour". Next time for sure! Our thoughts and memories of this hotel will always be of how they have kept the Old South Tradition of charm, grace and elegance alive. A truly beautiful and elegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond Expectations, A+”
Reviews.Author: Rz72801
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed the hotel for my birthday. We had 2 rooms for 3 nights, and the hotels gets the highest marks for everything. On arrival, we received a fruit and cheese tray, chocolates and wine, and a very warm note from the general manager. (Joining the 'Leaders Club" at www.lhw.com provides one with extra attention). The lobby is very impressive, it is reminiscent of a old, elegant Parisian hotel but with Southern touches like velvet drapes. Two of us had never been to New Orleans, and the other one there had been 40 years ago, but the concierge was most helpful in recommending the best places for music. Even the bellboy was very helpful in getting us booked on a city tour when I asked for help very early on a Saturday. One could not ask for nicer people, everyone in the dining room was so friendly. We especially were impressed with the buffet breakfast, for $!8, which included more than anyone could try. The highlights were the made to order omelettes by Ms. Pat, biscuits and the bananas foster waffle. We were not hungry for the the 10 pm peanut butter sandwich snack, but it looked really good, The rooms were extremely quiet, and everything worked well. The TVs are upgraded, however there are no in-room movies available but plenty of free stations. We were very appreciative of the thick towels to use after a day of sightseeing. The hotel is small enough that we did not have to walk very far to our rooms, and we got instant service whenever we asked for anything. Nightly turndown service was very complete, with ice replenished, bottles of water, little peanut butter shortbread cookies, and the weather forecast. As an example of how customer oriented they are, we lost 2 of their umbrellas, but Le Pavillon waived any charge. The last day we took a quick look at the pool and exercise area, and they offer an impressive rooftop view. If we had more time we would have worked off a few more beignets. The location is in the business district. We took cabs to the French Quarter (about $7) and the Garden District (about $10). During the day its an easy walk but at night its easier to take a cab. We walked to the Crescent City Farmer's Market on Saturday morning. This hotel impressed us with its European inspired staff and amenities, and I would go back to Le Pavillon without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaptDad42
Reviews.Content: We were going to a NY Jet football game in New Orleans and researched TripAdvisor for a hotel in the area of the Superdome. Le Pavillon was one that kept coming up with wonderful reviews, so we chose it. Every review was accurate. The moment we arrived, we were treated with the highest level of service possible, from the bellhop, front desk, maids, dining room, etc....... The hotel itself is beautifully decorated in french decor, with amazing antiques in the lobby. The rooms were immaculate, with every amenity one could ask for. Every night at 10 p.m. they put out peanut butter, fruit, hot chocolate, and more for anyone staying there. This just compliments the theme of the hotel. The Sunday brunch was amazing, with a nice gentleman playing the piano and singing. In fact, he saw we were Jet fans, he incorporated some words into his song about the Jets, just making us feel right at home. The pool and hot tub on the roof provide a wonderful view of the city. And lastly, you are only a short walk away from the St. Charles & Canal St. trolley, the Riverfront, and of course, Bourbon Street. It is clear to see why this hotel is listed in "Amazing Hotels of the World". Clearly I would not hesitate about staying here again, and hope to in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is historic southern charm, close enough to the action and far from the noise!”
Reviews.Author: JinGermantown
Reviews.Content: We debated staying at one of the larger, five star chain hotels that we are familiar with but decided to try something that represented New Orleans and the south, and we are so happy we did so! This hotel is older but charming. Clean and quiet. The staff was always there, ready to help with anything! Our king size room was comfortable. Not much of a view but there really isn't a "view" in the CBD! We relied on the consierge for directions, restuarant suggestions and tours and were never disappointed with their suggestions! We walked to the French Quarter, Bourbon Street and Jackson Square easily the street car was a block away. The rooftop pool and workout area was a nice place to relax! The artwork around the hotel was beautiful and the peanut butter/jelly sandwiches and hot cocoa each evening was a fun touch! The hotel restaurant had great food!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: debmedia
Reviews.Content: We loved Le Pavillon. I booked this on Hotwire and got a great deal. We it thought it was the Ritz given the location on the Hotwire map, so I was dissapointed when I found out it was not. The wonderful people and the building totally changed my mind immediately. What a great time we had. NICE room, great view, a pleasant little walk from canal street. Slightly off the beaten path, but away from the noise of the French quarter but so close. Loved the peanut butter sandwiches and hot chocolate in the lobby at the end of a fabulous day in New Orleans. Loved it! Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best parts of our entire (amazing) trip!”
Reviews.Author: travel1880
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided that for our trip to New Orleans, we would "hotel hop" and experience a few different places while we were there; we stayed at Le Pavillon our last night there for one night, and wished we had stayed there the entire long weekend, hands-down. It's located just across Canal St. (basically "on Bourbon", though Bourbon changes names) from Bourbon St., but is about 4 or 5 blocks down and in more of the business district. We were able to safely and quickly get to everything from Harrah's Casino, to the Aquarium, to everything up and down Bourbon St, on foot no matter what time of night or day. The staff there, from the Bellhop to the Bartender were impeccable and welcoming and more than helpful - they even let us BORROW two of their brand new $40 umbrellas for the afternoon during the ridiculous downpour, even though they already had a few used ones open...small detail, but it was the icing on the cake after being completely wowed and enchanted from the moment we walked in the door. The roof-top pool and jacuzzi were incredible: romantic, amazing view, and beautifully "landscaped". Everything about the hotel: carpet, walls, windows, bathroom (even the shower head was SPARKLING!) was so clean you could have eaten off of it. The bathrooms had an abundance of towels and washcloths, and the hallways to the rooms felt like you were in an old historic home, not a hotel at all...each room even has it's own doorbell! You will not see "can lighting" or "modern touches" here...everything from the elevator doors to the recessed ceilings around the amazing chandeliers is done in beautiful murals, and you will be amazed at some of the massive antique pieces throughout (and the stories that go with them!). An absolute gem, and we WILL be back...for more than one night!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vacationista50
Reviews.Content: We were planning a trip to New Orleans and came across a really great deal to stay in a 4 star hotel in New Orleans for $79 a night. We were very leary of the deal and tried to read every review we could find to make sure that this was the place that we should stay at. After all the price was the best we could find. Well we were so pleased that we did go and stay there. We have stayed at most of the major chain hotels over the years and there have certainly been some beautiful places that we have stayed. None have compared with the hospitality that we experienced at Le Pavillon Hotel in New Orleans.EVERY SINGLE EMPLOYEE was there to make our stay just wonderful. There pool is very small but very clean and the restaurant was very beautiful and the food was top notch and really priced well. The service was absolutely great and you felt like royalty. I would highly recommend this hotel and we are looking forward to the next time we can go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty by all the staff of Le Pavillon New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: DefLepRocker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated a birthday with a night stay at Le Pavillon. All of the staff and management treated us like royalty. I've never experienced such personal service from a hotel staff. The accomodations were upscale French-inspired furnishings and wall decor. The rooftop pool/hot tub area is like escaping to a Greek spa. We greatly appreciated the complimentary room service to welcome us to the hotel. The late night room service food was fast and fresh, we enjoyed every aspect of the hotel immensely. Looking forward to our next stay, we now have a new standard of customer service for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Get a good night's sleep but be close enough to enjoy Bourbon St. at beautiful Le Pavillon Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: marykath1
Reviews.Content: Probably the most helpful and accommodating staff we've encountered in many years of traveling. Beautiful interiors, complimentary late-night snacks, old-world style with high ceilings and antiques, but comfortable furniture and relaxing atmosphere. Everyone feels comfortable there, from kids to older types. We 3 sisters had a reunion in NOLA, and the staff put us in a suite so we could spend more time together -- it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORT PLUS ELEGANCE”
Reviews.Author: dag144
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a recent pleasure trip along with a friend. We were there for four nights. The hotel was recommended by a friend from New Orleans, but the reviews in Tripadvisor convinced us to book. (Since I live in a major tourist location myself, I think that locals may not be the best source of information since they don't usually stay at the local hotels.) Checked in about 8:00PM after a 30 hour Amtrak trip from New York. The room was ready and check in was a breeze. I love the fact that the hotel gives guests at least double the number of towels etc. usually left in a guest room. That way, if the hotel does not offer turn-down service, there are enough fresh towels for two showers per day. That in itself endeared Le Pavillon to me, since I was able to shower before exploring the French Quarter that night. The hotel is beautiful. Decor is a combo of 17th, 18th, and Belle Epoche styles all very French. The room was big with an armoire, a desk , three chairs, a table plus a large closet. The bathroom was resplendent with its black marble and loads and loads of goodies -- over the top. The room was also made up very quickly and always ready when we returned before or after lunch. We had dinner in the beautiful bar the evening before we left. The food was good although we had simple pub fare. Didn't eat in the dining room but it looked beautiful. I was surprised that the prices for food are so reasonable. This is often not the case for hotel food. At first I did not like the location which is a few blocks from the French Quarter (perhaps 10 minute walk to Bourbon Street). The Pavillion is on the other side of Canal Street from the Quarter. However, after my first day in the French Quarter, a continual party, I began to appreciate the more subdued location. It is also close to the St. Charles Avenue line which goes to the Garden District. There is really nothing to complain about regarding this hotel. There is a very nice and large rooftop pool. The place is classy, but the prices to me at least, seemed very very reasonable, even low. If I could make one suggestion, it would be to offer coffee in the lobby so I would not need room service to get me started for the day. However, they do have a wonderful evening tradition -- hot chocolate or milk and you make your own peanut butter and jelly sandwich each night in the lobby between ten and eleven PM.

Reviews.Title: “True French New Orleans Perfection”
Reviews.Author: bagspacked205
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Le Pavillon Hotel was the wonderful! The service and accomadations are truely 5 stars! The staff made sure that every whim I could think of was taken care of. I wanted reservations for one of Emeril's restaurant.....done. I wanted a day at a spa.........done. A quiet room on a quiet floor........done. Even my bath drawn.......done. This is a hotel that you must visit. The decor is beautiful. This is truely the best in New Orleans French flare. The staff remembered my name and always greeted me with a smile. I will be back. The service is worth every dime. I have stayed in lots of hotels in New Orleans, but this is the best! Oh, and if you are looking for a wonderful day spa, you must go to "Spa Atlantis" on Gravier Street. The service there was great! They have a great staff and the facilities are designed for true relaxation. The spa is a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cetatx79
Reviews.Content: Our trip started out rocky. We had a room where the a/c did not work. They quickly moved us to a different floor that had been renovated. Our room was clean and very nice. We had a fabulous time here. We will be back! The staff was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: spotf15
Reviews.Content: Reservation staff did not respond to a pre-arrival e-mail so I had to change rooms upon arrival. Beautiful exterior facade. Nice staff for valet, baggage handling,and check-in. After that all down hill. Sixth floor and my room in particular in need of refurbishment. Need a new maid as well. Excessive dust on the furniture and on top of the glasses in the bathroom and cotton ball holder. Pieces of candy rapper next to bed. Bathroom floor and tub stained. Mirror has numerous flaws. Wallpaper in bathroom peeling off. The bathtub faucet pulls away from wall when switching to shower. Bathroom countertop caulking falling off. Shower curtain full of dust, two rings broken, and mounted on rusted bar. Hard water stains on all bathroom hardware. Ordinary bed. There is no way this is a 4+ star hotel. If I had not booked through Hotwire I'd be out of here. Internet free but parking $28/night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not overly impressed.”
Reviews.Author: Lawone
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillion is a lovely old hotel. The overall decor and room furnishings are ornate and heavy (in other words, this hotel does not have a modern feel, but that's not a criticism). We stayed in a suite which was roomy, but nothing unexpected. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The nightly cookies and PB&J snacks are charming. My only complaint would be the rooftop pool. It's nice that it's there (and a main reason why we picked it), but it could use some sprucing up. When we visited in early June, the foliage around it was basically dead. There is absolutely no shade around the pool - not even a potted tree - and the pool water just bakes in the heat. The hotel is 4-5 blocks from the French Quarter, in the business district.

Reviews.Title: “Dont get what you pay for, and you pay ALOT! Long review, but worth reading!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: neworleansmama
Reviews.Content: For my husbands 40th birthday I spent months putting together the "perfect" party. I wanted him to remember it for the rest of his life! Im sure that I accomplished THAT, even though it was a Nightmare! It started the day of the party. The caterer (At a local restaurant) called to tell us that a fire had damaged all the underground electrical lines in the quarter and they had no electricity. It was expected to return that evening but they could not garantee it. I called the hotel where we had our reservations for the weekend (We live about an hour from the city) Lights were out there as well. Thats where it all fell apart. To make a long story short. No hotels were available since the people in the affected area had been moved to the outlying hotels with elect. I finally found the last room... At Le Pavillion. I was told by the operator that it was the last room and the price was 1,000.00 take it or leave it. (It was a suite so I thought OK it should be worth it) I took it since I had 30 people arriving for a candlelight dinner in less than an hour. They "made me pay for the room upfront. Like some common hour rental motel. Then after finally being checked in by the less than friendly front desk personnel. We (My Mother and myself) RAN to the room to get dressed. (We now had 45 min. till my husband arrived to his surprise party.) The room was full of antiques which had seen better days. But was hot as all getup. We adjusted the Air (MInd you we are in Louisiana, it was HOT) As I was blow drying my hair, POP the electricity went out! In the whole room. I called downstairs and someone showed up eventually. I now have 15 min. till the party. Guest have arrived. They got the electricity on and we bolted out the door! We grabbed a drink (And Lord knows we needed one) at the bar on the way out While in the cab we noticed the cost of 2 mimosas. $45.00 plus tax and tip!!!! Yikes What type of Champange did they use? Dom? Anyway we made it to the party, which was salvaged, barely! When my husband and I returned to the room that night. The Air Conditioning had gone out again. It felt like a sauna. We called down again and someone came up and put some kind of laser thing at the vent and said "Its reading 65 degrees" as beeds of sweat dripped off his nose. To hell it was we said. He shrugged his shoulders and said it was all he could do since it was 3:00 am. We then attempted to go to sleep. Not easy while your sweating profusely. My husband got up to turn off the TV (Which must have been an antique too, since it did not have a remote) and the door to the armoire fell off and hit him in the forehead! All I kept thinking was $1000.00 a night!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Somewhere around 5:00am we were awakened by the sound of the window shade falling off the window. $1000.00 a night! Im the morning, and there was no sleeping in, we ran down to the front desk to complain to the Manager and we were told they didnt know who that was at the time. They said they would have him call. (Never did get that call!) We complained to our credit card company and when they called LePavillion to investigate they were told "The manager had gone up to hear our complaint about the electricity and the air and had found 25 peop[le in the room. Making it impossible for the AC to keep up. WHAT?!?! What a bold face LIE! Everyone I knew was at the restraunt WAITING for us!!!!! These people are rude, money grubbing liars, who have NO customer service skills whatsoever!!!! So, if you want to stay at this hotel, better bring 3 things... Your wallet, a flashlight, and a fan! And be prepared to go home exhausted!!!!!!! And Angry!

Reviews.Title: “Great, quiet and safe location”
Reviews.Author: MalibuStace
Reviews.Content: Doug Poulos the Reservations Manager at this hotel was the #1 reason I chose Le Pavillon. I had sent out requests to several properties, and Doug's responses were the most prompt and informative. I also wanted to stay somewhere away from the Bourbon Street noise (I am so glad I did). The location was ideal, I walked everywhere from the hotel to Fisherman street, alone, at night, and felt very safe. I was close enough to enjoy Bourbon Street and the Casino if I wanted, yet tucked away into a quiet location. The service at the hotel was efficient and professional, and the historic building was gorgeous. As a LHW I feel the beds and bedding could be upgraded, and I would have appreciated an on demand movie option on the T.V. and perhaps an IPOD docking station. The wireless internet was great and ALWAYS worked which is amazing, and the salad bar at lunch could not be beat. The P&J buffet at 10pm each night in the lobby was a nice touch. A very nice stay and the best location.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel - helpful staff - best for mid-week”
Reviews.Author: triptraveller
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon is an historic, New Orleans hotel, with grandly-decorated public rooms, and a dining room with high ceiliings and old-fashioned ambience. The guest rooms can be small - even if classified as "deluxe." The bathrooms are well-decorated and equipped. The 10 PM buffet in the lobby with complementary peanut butter/jelly sandwiches, fruit, milk, and hot chocolate is a friendly, home-style feature -- appealing to guests of all ages, and it creates a nice "family atmosphere" for guests. As other tripadvisors have noted, at the week-end, that is, beginning on Friday, the atmosphere of the hotel can change dramatically: the rooms are filled with guests for parties (often weddings), and the quiet ambience may get replaced by crowds, more noise, and heavy traffic on the elevators. If you are looking especially for a quiet, historic, friendly atmophere, that may be found mid-week (Monday-> Thursday). But on week-ends the atmosphere changes, and if this is not what you are looking for, it would be better to limit the stay to mid-week. So, I would say it is a matter of timing and what a guest finds comfortable (more quiet, few crowds - or less quiet and more crowds).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: Durwoody
Reviews.Content: The Le Pavillion hotel is situated right outside the French Quarters area (so much quieter), the Le Pavillion is an older hotel built in 1910. It is a gorgeous hotel with architectural features galore. Crystal chandeliers hang all over the lobby area. Floors are marble and granite. When we arrive, the doorman, Cedric greated us and immediately made us feel welcome. He is VERY tall and VERY friendly. He makes a great first impression to the hotel. He was helpful and courteous. Paula, was the front desk manager on duty each morning of our stay and she personified professionalism. She accommodated our request to have a quiet room away from noise and elevators. One thing, when you are asked what newspaper you would like to receive, it means for your entire stay. During our stay, we never ate in the hotelsâ€™ restaurant. It seemed really pricey and we wanted to explore what New Orleans had to offer in the way of cuisine. The room we stayed in was nice with antique furniture, a painted ceiling, beautiful moldings and gorgeous bathroom with marble counters and floor with inset pieces. There was a little gold painted shelf under the sink area because there really wasnâ€™t much storage and the counterspace was almost nonexistent. Luckily, they have this small 3-tiered shelf that you could place small items. We booked our travel package through Travelocity and it said a standard room, so I am not sure what rooms that other folks are mentioning (maybe they upgraded us and we didnâ€™t know it). We had one King sized bed which was quite comfortable. The drapes blocked out sun very well so we were able to sleep as late as we wanted AND the maids respected the Do Not Disturb sign. I never heard a lot of noise outside in the hallway while we were sleeping. There is free internet access, but you have to get a cable at the front desk. We never had trouble with speed, except the initial connection was a little slow. The lobby is beautiful if you like the Louis XIV style furniture and that kind of over-the-top grandeur, but it's not gaudy. Although beautiful, it never looked like somewhere I would sit in the lobby and feel comfortable reading a book. The pool is small, but located on the roof and cute. There was no cover at the pool, but the hot tub was in a corner of the rooftop and seemed to have some shade. There were a couple of cabana-like structures but there didnâ€™t to seem to be much air circulation in them, since they opened only on one side â€“ the entrance. Very cute rooftop terrace for those who like the sun. We had a wonderful stay here, it was only about 6 blocks to the French Quarters and Bourbon Street. I was very happy we stayed here because of the peace and quiet location. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay in 3 years - Excellent as usual”
