Reviews.Author: Aussie067
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Pavillon for my 3rd time from May 18th thru May 23rd. (I always book a Deluxe room and am not familiar with the standard rooms which seem to have a few negative reviews) From my perspective the Hotel represents great value, the staff are friendly and the rooms are great......I have now spent a total of 24 nights here since September 2007 & it is always my first choice when visiting New Orleans. On a side note if you are in New Orleans on a Thursday, Friday or Saturday night and you love Jazz I would highly recommend catching Jeremy Davenport at the Ritz Carlton Hotel.....a short walk from Le Pavillon. He is absolutely incredible. (I ended up going back the next night!) Cheers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GalFromUpstateNY
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was great. Very ellegant, was at a great location- in the business district which was close to the Canal St./French Quarter and the Garden Disctrict but with a good distance away. The concierge was extremely knowledgeable and extremely helpful when it came to restaurant and activity suggestions. They were very accomodating- our flight came in early and we checked in before noon without any problems of having to wait for a room. They e-mailed us before hand to ask for preferences we wanted in the room (location, ammenities, etc) and to ask more about us and why we were visiting- they sent information about the things we requested within a couple of hours, so we were prepared before the trip. The room itself was extremely clean, they actually have what we saw as two sets of housekeeping come through- the second one to do a 'check' and make sure everything is up to par. Everyone we incountered was extremely nice. The rooms were slightly small. We got "upgraded" which made us really think about what room we originally had. It was fine for couples, or I imagine if you are on business, but it might not be the best choice for families. It was slightly epxnesive for the weekend (We went Tues-Wed-Thurs night, and the price jumped over $100 for the Thursday night), which made me upset becuase I was in their business area and saw that the price had actually decreased since when I booked it and they would not offer a price reduction. I can not comment on the restaurant in the hotel, we never ate there becuase the hotel was so close to so many great restaurants, we didnt want to miss out on any of the local cuisine- from what we did see through it seemed kind of pricey. I would recommend this hotel for other couples or business travel, absolutly!!

Reviews.Title: “High class hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyfeetme
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely nice. We were able to get a good deal on the room rate from a friend, and glad we did! This was our first trip to New Orleans and spent most of our time in the french quarter. It's a bit of a walk from the hotel to the quarter especially if you're going to be walking around there too. Other than the location, I can only say great things about the hotel. Friendly, helpful staff. Very nice, clean rooms. I thought the decor might be a little cheesy based on the pictures I saw, but it's not. It's very well decorated- there's even detail painting on the ceiling of the room. I would Le Pavillion is top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Mort_Coyle
Reviews.Content: Small room. Moldy smell. Dirty carpet with cigarette burns. Noisy A/C. I travel a lot and stay in lots of hotels. I'd put this one at the low end of a 3 star. Fancy lobby, but who care's? I'm not staying in the lobby. Outrageously expensive parking and restaurant. At least the Internet was free.

Reviews.Title: “Overrrated”
Reviews.Author: Perdendosi
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillion is WAY overrated. It has a nice lobby, but the "regular" rooms have none of the amenities it advertises (like painted ceilings, flat screen TVs, marble bath fixtures, etc.). You must be in a "deluxe" room. Our first room ("upgraded" to a standard, two-queen room) had a pink bathtub with giant chips in it, dirty fixtures, dirty windows, stained carpet, and a terribly noisy air conditioner. You can special order a drawn bath, but who would want to pay $80 for a bath drawn in a chipped, mildewy tub? (Yes, we have pictures....) When we went to complain about the air conditioner's noise, they sent up an engineer, who laughed at my wife and said "this is an old hotel...." (Of course, the air conditioning is not as old as the hotel.) When my wife started to ask about the refund policy, they moved us to a "deluxe" room, which had a few more of the amenities promised (painted ceilings, marble bath etc) and was large enough that we could get away from the air conditioner for it not to make noise. The sink was slow running and its faucet leaked, though. Still no flat screen TV. After we threatened to leave, the staff was reasonably helpful. The doorman was not regularly present, and upon arrival, the staff was polite, but far from welcoming or friendly (which we would expect for a hotel of that purported caliber). The lobby is definitely beautiful. There's free wireless internet (but the signal seemed very weak on the 8th floor), free use of umbrellas, and a smaller, cute, rooftop pool (although it's hard to figure out how to get to the pool, as you have to go to a floor with rooms and take stairs or a service elevator, and there wasn't good signage off of the main elevator).

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel feels a bit too historic”
Reviews.Author: TTATUM
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel, but REALLY REALLY old! We booked thru Hotwire , which said the hotel was 4.5 stars. I would have to disagree. Although very elegant, i felt like I was sleeping in an old haunted house. Even the bedding looked old. The rooms are small, and not very well soundproofed. The bathroom was small and looked old with paint chipping in the tub. I will say the staff was nice and pretty helpful. We managed to avoid the $26 a day parking fee by parking in the hotel passenger zone the entire week. I would suggest eating outside of the hotel, as the food was a bit pricey in the hotel restaurant. Also double check teh prices of any items you get from the mini bar in ur room. The prices they have listed are NOT what you get charged! Overall we paid $85 per night for this hotel - for that price I'd suggest staying at the Stay Bridge 2 blcoks down - bigger rooms, good locatio and free breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - just avoid hot tub”
Reviews.Author: justtravelinthru
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay at Le Pavillon. Located within walking distance of the French Quarter and close to a St. Charles streetcar stop. Loved the nightly PB & J! Heard this hotel was haunted, but didn't see any ghosts. Friendly, helpful staff, clean and beautiful hotel. Only drawback - my husband and I spent about 20 minutes in the hot tub one evening and suffered minor chemical burns and ruined bathing suits. If you go up there to get some sun/enjoy the view and just stay out of the water, you'll have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Still the one. For some of us.”
Reviews.Author: PigsFly
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed here in May 2009. The hotel is lovely and bridges the garden district and the quarter, so you aren't in either but you are near both. This is a bustling, elegant hotel probably frequented by returning visitors. (I had stayed here years ago on business.) The staff is accommodating,, concierges are in the know, and bell staff hustle to get you where you need to go. They don't make hotels like this anymore, which is why it is one of The Leading Hotels of the World. Treat yourself. And you don't have to go to a Quarter watering hole for a Hurricane. The bartenders here will make you one and they you can go up to your room and sleep it off.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: yellowrosetexas3
Reviews.Content: Staff was great and helpful as well. Ate breakfast there as well one morning and it was good. Hotel is just beautiful and Cedrick was a jewel in helping us with cabs. Only negative i could find would be the bathrooms are small, two people won't work well in there. But i would definately go there again!! It's a 4 block walk to Canal but thats how we stayed in shape...a nice walk after our time in the quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Business Travellers who want to Get to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: SteelCityYall
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two weeks at Le Pavillon on business. The rooms are typical New Orleans- a bit gaudy with giant furniture and gold/ floral everywhere, but overall very clean and in good condition. Due to a reservation mix-up, I ended up in a handicapped accessible room, which was fine (except for the VERY low showerhead, but accessible requires that). The bathroom was very large for a hotel bathroom and there was plenty of counterspace. Housekeeping kept the towels fresh and plentiful for the whole two weeks. Even in January, New Orleans had beautiful weather so I had the chance to visit the rooftop pool and patio. It was divine- beautifully landscaped so you could almost forget you were on a roof in the business district, lots of comfortable lounge chairs, towels, and a very clean hot tub which was almost always empty. The internet service was perfectly fast, but the desk did not have an outlet for my laptop, so I ended up plugging the computer into the bathroom wall and running the cord out to the floor. The hotel has three amazing amenities. First, the tuxedoed and top-hatted doorman that whisks you in the front door and had me checked in and settled in my room before I could blink. Second, the nightly peanut butter and jelly buffet with hot chocolate which was not only set up glamorously but very delicious whether as a late night snack or a pre-party appetizer before hitting Bourbon Street. Finally, the location. The hotel is a five block walk from Bourbon Street and the French Quarter, which is just far enough that you can escape the madness and noise, but not too far to walk in comfortable shoes. I made the walk nightly, either to eat out or enjoy a drink or two, and found it generally pleasant. There are the occassional rowdy partygoers or locals along the way late at night, so people who are nervous about that sort of thing may want to consider taking the easily accessible $7 cabs back to the hotel from the Quarter if it is very late or they are very drunk. I am a 5' tall woman and never felt nervous or threatened walking alone, but I've lived in big cities before, so an occassional drunk person doesn't frighten me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and History, location could be better depending what your looking for”
Reviews.Author: ChrisM_SD
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. I loved the history and decor. The rooftop pool was great and the lobby is opulent. Rooms were on the smaller size but not a problem in the least. Bathrooms were very clean. It was kind of weird that the shower door was just a half door with no curtain but the floor remained relatively dry. I did not love the location because I really spent most time near the french quarter, which is walkable but not very close. The absolute stand out though was the people. The night manager, Dwayne, was THE MOST helpful hotel staff I have ever encountered, great information and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adamnNJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for a 3-day weekend anniversary getaway. The hotel is very elegant. In fact, initially it was a bit intimidating but the warmth of the hotel staff quickly made us feel at home. The hotel is filled with little architectural/design details from the lobby to the interior of the room that made the whole experience feel very rich. We had only a few minor complaints. The bed was way too soft (but some people might like that), the air conditioning was pretty loud (kicking on and off) and the walls were not thick enough to cover the sound of the couple next door that yelled at each other for about an hour (without seeming to be having a fight). One high point was our early Sunday breakfast (we were not hungry enough for the brunch) where we expected to be seated in the "bar" dining area due to the brunch scheduled for the main dining room, but instead got seated in the main dining room where we were able to enjoy our ala-carte breakfast (which was very tasty) and the wonderful service, piano music and decor. The beautiful surroundings, friendly service and ease of access to the French Quarter and St Charles street car made this a hotel that I would strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jazzamor
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels where I've ever stayed. Very attentive staff, spacious, elegant and sound-proof rooms. One thing would like to mention especially. The restaurant. Don't put your attention that it is not full of customers. The food is great, the service is fantastic and price is very good (less than in some trendy restos in the French Quartier).

Reviews.Title: “My all time favourite hotel - ever!”
Reviews.Author: jasminerose09
Reviews.Content: It was a while ago now that I stayed at the Le Pavillon Hotel in New Orleans, but I remember it as if it was yesterday because it was just the best hotel I have ever stayed in! I didn't know about Trip Advisor then, otherwise I would have written this review immediately after I stayed there. The building itself is just beautiful, and so romantic, I wished my husband was there with me! Unfortunately it was more of a business trip and I was there for a conference, but if ever we're lucky enough to travel to New Orleans again, I will be sure to book my husband and myself into the Le Pavillon. The staff were really helpful and friendly, rooms were clean and really the whole experience was exceptional! Very much recommended

Reviews.Title: “Most romantic weekend ever!”
Reviews.Author: maryfromhouston
Reviews.Content: My husband whisked me away to New Orleans for a birthday weekend I will never forget. Le Pavillon is the most beautiful hotel that I have ever stayed at-and I have been in hotels all over the US and in Europe too. The decor is very French and elaborate. We had a "junior" suite, which included a fireplace and a sofa (it makes me wonder how big a regular suite is). Black granite shower with great water pressure, lots of towels, impeccably clean, and quiet even though we were near the elevator. I didn't actually have the hotel staff draw me a bath and sprinkle rose petals in it, but I could have if I'd wanted to! AND a bottle of champagne in the room with a note wishing me a happy birthday! AND the Easter Bunny handing out candy on Easter morning! It's not in the middle of the French Quarter, so you don' t have to put up with a lot of noisy drunks, but it is close enough to walk . You can walk to the Riverwalk as well. The rooftop pool has spectacular views. The brunch buffet was great-I loved my made to order pecan waffle. It's the details that matter, and Le Pavillon has it all down to a science. From the in-room safe, to the full-size ironing board, to the free wi-fi in the rooms, to the umbrellas hanging in the closet, to the notes about the weather forecast, everything was taken care of. The service was spectacular. I would definitely return here, and I hope to get the chance in the future.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sandystrud
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. It was our first visit to New Orleans and we had the pleasure of attending a conference held at the hotel (2nd floor) from Feb14-20 during Carnival. The whole staff was helpful, everything from the doorman to the painted ceiling in our room was planned with beautiful attention to detail. Regular hotel rooms I've seen in the area just can't compare to the feel of these rooms. Everywhere in the lobby, restaurant, bar and even lobby restrooms were luxurious details you don't find in newer hotels. Every evening I took a nap from 9-10 so we could stay out late in the French Quarter - a 4 block walk to bourbon street. The pb&j sandwiches at 10 was a fun tradition. The rooftop pool was beautiful even if it was too cold to use. We took the advice of other reviewers and didn't touch the mini bar as it is charged by sensors, so if you move something you will be charged. Don't be afraid to ask for information and suggestions from the staff. Also, don't take the airport shuttle - it costs about the same to take a cab to the hotel and we waited almost 2 hrs at the airport to get on the shuttle because there were so many people arriving - though keep in mind it was during Mardi Gras. We also had an excellent dinner on Valentine's Day in the Crystal Room. The menu was pre-set, but every course that came out was delicious and beautifully presented. We'd love the opportunity to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “loved le pavillon”
Reviews.Author: z235e49
Reviews.Content: spent 5 nites at le pavillon and loved it-we had a deluxe king- the bed was very comfortable, the shower pressure worked very well and the room was kept clean by the staff. the lobby was beautiful with large crystal chandeliers and nice wall coverings and comfortable, antique furniture. the location was terrific- a short walk to the french quarter, a short walk to julia street which had a lot of art galleries and a short drive to the garden district, tulane and audobon park.

Reviews.Title: “Go back in time”
Reviews.Author: sridge66
Reviews.Content: my family booked this hotel for one night to stay before our cruise, our ages are 43 6 23 21 21 21 we have traveled and stayed at very fine hotels and I have to say this is one of the most charming and beautiful hotel I have had the pleasure to stay. The staff is amazing so kind and helpful. we picked this hotel for the haunted history my daughter and her boyfreind are ghost hunters (LOL) but my six year old is not so we chose this one because the "ghost reports" were not scary they were tame we did experince some unusual things but not scary. we checked in after the worst drive in history we drove from MI into the storm of the century. upon arrival we went to the bar to have a much needed cocktail. were Grace made us her special drink "amazing Grace" is what we named it so ask for it you will love it . My six yaer old orddered chicken tenders with broccoli they treated her like royalty . The hotel was not very busy it was just after Mardi Gras I had requested a sitter before arriving so me and my older children could go to bourbon st but due to the drive I was not in the mood to go out the rates were 12$ hour for min 4 hours. so they cancelled for me and we were givin no charge. We checked into our rooms we asked to be in the most haunted part we had room # 630 a standerd double the rooms were very pretty and comfortable not a modern 4 star but what it lacked in modern it made up for in everything else. so after checking into our rooms we decided to explore the hotel you can recieve upon request the history of the hotel ask Lou she will give you this lovely little history .We asked if we could see any of the haunted rooms and due to the fact the hotell was slow the conceirge Lou let the bellman take us on a tour of every suit which was very cool we saw napoleones bath tub the antiques are amazing. after our tour it was time for the hot cocoa and peunut butter finger sandwiches in the lobby do not miss it is so yummy . so we went back to our rooms and took a nice bath do bring conditioner if you have hard to comb hair they do not have but the soap is french milled and lotion very pleasant all in black and gold do look in your closet they have robes and umbrellas. the beds were comfy and we had no ghosts. My 6 year old and I got up early and went to eat in the ballroom by the fire very nice and cozy I had been in there earlier and just had coffee. My waiter Dallas one of the finest servers I have ever had do ask for him you will not be sorry . I told dallas I had to go up and get my daughter so she could eat but I did want to keep my table. he put a reserved sign on it for me and when we came back he treated my six year old like a little lady pulled out her seat and put her napkin on her lap service and treatment that was common in 1907 you really felt like you had stepped back into time . the Pancake were yummy served with real maple and fresh squezzed OJ . I would stay there again in a heartbeat I loved this hotel and more then the hotel the staff Thank you I have stayed in many 4 5 star hotels but have never been treated so well as I was by the belle of New Orleans do not miss also they have kids packs when you check in and the business center is free for guests.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience marred by the weddings all weekend”
Reviews.Author: NestorMitrea
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon Hotel is very much as promised. A grand old hotel, well maintained with lovely staff. However much of the experience is marred by a slew of weddings taking place over the weekend. This essentially put the main dining room, one of the things we'd been looking forward to experiencing, off limits for the duration of our stay. Friday and Saturday evening there were weddings going on and we were told we couldn't eat in The Crystal Room. Not yet despairing, we planned to have breakfast in there on Sunday, however you have to order the champagne brunch (@ $35. pp) to eat there so wanting lighter fare, we were relegated to the dining area by the (beautiful) bar. The weddings also made it almost unbearably crowded. When the children and I came down for the PB&J sandwiches, it was set up amidst an extremely loud carousing wedding reception. According to a staff member we spoke to, this pretty much goes on every weekend all weekend long so if you're going during the week, you shouldn't have this problem. I won't belabor the point any longer. Suffice it to say, the round the clock wedding hall feel definitely detracted from the overall experience. I would recommend this hotel from Sunday night through Friday morning... p.s. the high speed internet is free and SUPER fast!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, charming hotel but cleanliness issues”
Reviews.Author: vacationer1975
Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings about this hotel where we stayed for four nights (from 16th to 20th of March). Great staff and service - in fact all of New Orleans was great for that - from the cab drivers to the hotel staff, everyone was wonderful. However in relation to the hotel and the room itself I did have some issues. I realize it is an old hotel but you could hear people through the walls very easily. Perhaps it was the people themselves next door but, having stayed at other 4 star "older" hotels, noise was definitely more of an issue here. More problematic was the cleanliness of the room. I am a bit neurotic about it admittedly however one has to wonder when the last time the carpets were cleaned (and not just vacuumed). I would have a shower, run to get something from my suitcase while my feet were still damp and then look down and see dark footprints on the white tile of the bathroom! I'm going to chalk this up to the fact that the hotel room must have been a smoker's room back when you could smoke in the hotel but it was sorta disgusting regardless. We eventually asked the hotel staff if we could change rooms and they were more than accommodating about it. Paula in particular was of great assistance. Our new room was much cleaner and came with a newly renovated bathroom. Again however, one has to wonder when the mattress covers are changed because one could see through the (very thin) bed sheets an assortment of hairs from previous guests I guess that were still clinging to the mattress cover. This is really unacceptable for a 4 star place. Again however, a quick chat with the cleaning staff and all was well - it's just too bad that we had to have the chat in the first place. Ah well...In the end, everything that people have said about this place re: character, charm and elegance is true. Just remember that this is an old hotel with thin walls and is not as clean as it can be. It's a true testament to the quality of the people there and the other facilities within the hotel that I am still giving this 3 1/2 stars (the Tripadvisor review site won't let me put in 3 1/2 so I'll just leave it at 4 I guess)...Also free wireless in the hotel was a nice plus (didn't know if they would have it given that it was an older hotel)... New Orleans is fantastic by the way. I highly recommend Magazine Street and the Garden District as well as a few restaurants: Acme Oyster, Jacque-Mo's and Elizabeth's...Frenchmen Street down river from the French Quarter is also not to be missed if you like jazz (Bourbon Street bars play nothing but bad live rock music so don't go there if you want jazz).

Reviews.Title: “Old time charm & Southern hospitality”
Reviews.Author: measical
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed over St. Pat's and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our stay. The service here is impeccable. From the moment we drove up to the door we were treated like royalty (despite bringing a cooler in through the front door!) The bellmen, doormen, pretty much everyone went out of their way to cater to our every need--and without being pretentious. The pool on the roof is fabulous during the day-heated and poolside service available. As far as the negative reviews go, I will admit that the facilities do show signs of wear but the building is over 100 years old. Personally I thought it contributed to the charm of staying in such an historic city. The location is about 5 blocks from Bourbon street and the concierge can get you same day reservations pretty much anywhere in the city. Also-best PB&J ever!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: almosthappytraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband travels a lot for work. He had been gone for nearly 2 weeks and surprised me with tickets to fly out to New Orleans for the last 3 days of his trip. I flew out and met up with him and his 2 employees. We all agreed....This hotel is so nice! The rooms were great. I could barely hear the people next door which is unusual for an older hotel. The atmosphere was lovely. The rooftop pool area is awesome (too bad it rained most of the time I was there!) But we did get some great pictures. The location was good and within walking distance to the French Quater, restaurants and sightseeing. The only downside there is if you have mobility issues or other physical needs, it is a bit of a haul to certain areas. However, we enjoyed these walks after our large dinners and a few hand grenades on Bourbon St! HA HA I didn't interract with the staff too much but when I did they were quite friendly. The peanut butter and jelly sandwiches at night was a great touch and it hit the spot after coming back from the night Ghost Tour on Sunday evening. I mentioned the rain earlier but it wasn't too much of a problem because the hotel provided us with large umbrellas to take with us on our outings. You can even keep them (for a fee). My only negative was the low water pressure in the shower and super hot water in the sink. A very small issue in my opinion. This was my first trip to The Big Easy and I will return and stay Le Pavillion.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel w/ Character & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravelina
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just spent an extended weekend visiting New Orleans and stayed at Le Pavilion Hotel. The service was superb - they allowed us to check in early with no problems and every hotel employee we had even remote contact with offered to help us (find places, carry things, wash out our Bourbon street glasses, etc). The hotel has much more character than others we passed. The only knock is that it is a few blocks out of the way - be prepared to walk if you are there to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should be #1 on your list, not #3”
Reviews.Author: dixienana
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at more New Orleans hotels than I can count, and some have been lovely -- but this one takes the cake. It's a beautiful hotel, inside and out (when we drove up I couldn't believe how gorgeous it looked, almost like it glowed, no fooling!). The service was impeccable, from the doorman in his tophat and tails, to the gorgeous dining room, and can't leave out the cozy bar tended by our new friend Roosevelt, who can make just about any drink from any era. We had an excellent view, from the ninth floor (and didn't notice a lot of noise from the stairway, even though we were also there for Mardi Gras week -- but we were at the far end of the hall, right next to the Presidential Suite, which we were lucky enough to tour while the maid was cleaning it, and there are just no words, my friends . . . . *sigh*). To sum up, take just about every reviewer's word for it: this place is an event in itself. If I were recommending a perfect honeymoon location, or just about ANY event (I wouldn't bring kids, however, though you certainly could I'm sure). It really was perfect for Mardi Gras, we could even watch parades from our lofty window, but couldn't catch any 'throws' from nine storeys up, so went down to St. Charles where we caught lots and lots. Then were lucky enough to walk a few blocks back 'home'. Ah!! What a delightful memory!! Thanks, Le Pavillon!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: bunnywabeet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip to New Orleans. We usually stay at high-end chain or resort-style hotels, so I did not know what to expect from the Le Pavillon. It was amazing. Visually, the hotel is ornately decorated and richly appointed. The rooms are small and not extremely modern (no coffee pots in the rooms, small bathrooms, wimpy hair dryers), but other small touches make up for it. They have a nightly complimentary snack in the lobby at 10PM, and the Crystal Room dining area is breathtaking in its opulence. The staff were some of the friendliest we have run into in our travels - within one minute of entering the hotel, I was having a great conversation with a bellhop while my husband checked us in. We had the Sunday Champagne Brunch ($35) in the Crystal Room the morning that we left and it was delicious. Dallas was our server and he was great. The live piano music really made our last meal in New Orleans just perfect. I really recommend this hotel for anyone who likes art, history or beautiful places. We will definitely stay here again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Mardi Gras! Close to Parades, no FQ noise.”
Reviews.Author: MissFlowers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Pavillon for Mardi Gras, February 21st-25th. It was perfect! Even with the Parades rolling, you can still reach Le Pavillon from I-10 with no trouble. Our room was a standard, but it had a huge closet and a lovely bathroom. We enjoyed breakfast in the Crystal Room, really used the rooftop deck and pool, and found the entire staff to be genuinely kind - the type of place where they mean it when they say "enjoy your stay." Room service was great, we loved the pb&j at 10pm - after a long day of catching beads, it is very nice to nice to come home to! If you can't stand any noise, I would request that you stay anywhere besides the 9th floor - depending on the room location, you hear people getting off the elevator to climb the stairs to the roof deck and the hot tub...but this was only a problem the night before Mardi Gras - to be expected, and it certainly didn't mar our trip! The location is perfect for Mardi Gras - it is a block and a half from most parades and is 4 blocks from the French Quarter - close enough to enjoy the action but quiet enough to escape the madness. It is also one block from MILA, one of the newest restaurant sensations in NOLA fine dining.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBubs
Reviews.Content: We just visited Le Pavillon for the first time and were truly impressed and pleased with the quality of this place. From the moment you walk into the lobby you know you're someplace special. I've never stayed anywhere in New Orleans with this level of service and attention to detail. Every member of the staff we encountered from the doorman as we arrived, through the desk staff, housekeeping and room service each seemed to be doing his or her best to make sure we enjoyed our visit and had whatever we needed. We had a king bed and the room was large by New Orleans standards. The bathroom was small but gleaming marble, and spotlessly clean. The bath products smelled of grapefruit and were really nice, and the shower had the best water pressure we've experienced in a New Orleans hotel. We ordered room service each morning, and it never took longer than 15 minutes to arrive. Finally, the housekeeping staff was probably the most efficient and least-obtrusive I've seen. This was our first Mardi Gras, and the hotel was located just a block away from the Saint Charles parade route. It's only a 3 block walk into the French Quarter, and the route was well-lighted and seemed safe. The hotel is also convenient to the casino. I was really impressed with the high speed internet service in the room--it was free and really fast. We were able to send lots of pictures home while we visited. When we checked out we left our bags with the bell desk and were able to enjoy walking around the Quarter for a few more hours before our plane left. We booked the room through Hotels.com and were thrilled to get it for around $130/night. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A grande dame of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: QQ1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel has not changed over the years. It is a fine, classic, top of the line hotel with most of the extras (late night snacks, excellent check-in (fast) procedure, newspaper, amenities, room size, breakfast, large meeting rooms). And -- reasonable price. One minus -- a small minus -- the room is a bit cluttered with pillows, signs, and random junk that needs to get gathered and dumped in a corner on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Best time ever in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Midwesterntravelers
Reviews.Content: Incredible hotel only a few blocks from the French Quarter - so its quiet, but not far from the excitement. My wife and I stayed her for a week during Mardi Gras and loved it. Perfect spot - 2 blocks from the parade route. And as for service - EVERYONE was friendly. Couldn't pass a staff member without being asked if I was having a good time or if I needed anything. Over the years, I've stayed in a number of hotels in New Orleans, both in and out of the Quarter, and by far this was my best experience balancing romantic with practical.

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance of the French Quarter and the Superdome”
Reviews.Author: RNSANE
Reviews.Content: At its convenient downtown location, this elegant hotel is within walking distance of both the Superdome and the French Quarter. It is a member of the Leading Hotels of the World and, in 1991, was placed on the National Register of Historic Places. During a recent weekend in New Orleans, I got an excellent price for my two nights here on http://hotwire.com. I checked in late after an all day flight from California and was delighted with their tradition of serving freshly made peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, ice cold milk and hot chocolate in the lobby from 10P to 11P! After my lovely snack, I headed for Le Gallery, a beautiful bar where I had two perfect Sazeracs, my favorite New Orleans cocktail. My room was very nice, a little small but, then, I did not choose one of the junior suites shown on their website. The bathroom was elegant and the furnishings and linens in the room were lovely. Parking, of course, is expensive. I used the hotel valet. I imagine it would be very difficult to find street parking in that area. All staff I encountered were very attentive and what one would expect from a Leading Hotel of the World.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Outside of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Dean and Linda
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to New Orleans a few times for food, art galleries and adult fun (39 years old / no children). We got a great deal on a room at Le Pavillon. It is the 1st time we have stayed outside the French Quarter - we knew the location when we made the reservation. Despite the value, we will probably spend more for the convenience of having everything literally outside our door next time we visit. The walk from the hotel is about 3-4 long blocks - approximately 10 minutes. We did not feel unsafe in any way despite the abandoned warehouses / buildings, though the walk was a bit annoying the one day it rained (they have umbrellas in the room, a nice touch for the price). We did not eat at the restaurant. The bar was fine for a drink. The room was clean - we had one small issue with the sink drain that was fixed promptly and discretely while we were out. The bell staff was efficient and professional. We arrived early in the morning prior to check in and there were no rooms available until check-in time (we requested the front desk to call us when our room was available but they did not). Good value if that is your priority and you don't mind walking. If you don't mind paying a bit more for location and a nicer room, there are better options in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous old school splendour!”
Reviews.Author: loumcd
Reviews.Content: huge old fashioned luxurious hotel with fabulous decor and some great staff (Cedric!). good room service and yummy free hot choc every night in the foyer. bathrooms could do with some upgrading. great location for french quarter highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay, close to convention center”
Reviews.Author: smfinney
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed my stay there. The room was very clean and comfortable. When I ate breakfast in the Crystal Room, Kevin was my waiter and he was great. I've stayed in a bunch of different places and I have to say that every single staff member was extremely pleasant. It was an easy 20 minute walk to the convention center. I felt safe my entire stay and had a wonderful time in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Brian1111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and had a great time. Everyone was extremely friendly (and not just at the hotel, but all of New Orleans). The hotel is within easy walking distance to the trolley lines and the French Quarter. Although all the cab drivers recommended cabbing pretty much everywhere to/from the hotel, we ended up walking a good bit and it was fine. But we also live in a city so we're comfortable in a city environment. Had some great meals and overall great trip in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: onlyonethetor
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time at Le Pavillon. We booked through priceline and got this hotel for 55 bucks a night. One of the best deals I've ever gotten. The hotel is right on a line of the streetcar system and that was a fun ride that got us off our feet. Our room was kinda small but pretty neat considering we had a corner room and had two windows for two different views of the city. Very clean room and an absolutely wonderful and helpful staff. They have peanut butter and jelly snadwichs with hot chocolate every night for all their vistors and you can read the story why once you get there. Very easy access to Bourbon st., where we found ourselves every night. We ate at the hotel resturant...very expensive but very good...not sure if we would pay the $100 for the meal again but it was a good experience. The city still has a lot of improvements to go through, you can still see a lot of the damage from the hurricane...but the spirit is there and I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Building, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillnRoss
Reviews.Content: Imagine a French / British feel, in a building which is very grand and older than it actually is with good quality American service. That's basically what you get. When deciding to visit New Orleans everyone told us how dangerous it would be in certain areas and at certain times at night. The Le Pavillon is bordering the French Quarter and the Business District. It took around five minutes to walk to Bourbon Street at the corner with Canal Street. The hotel check in was simple and they gave us a free upgrade as we booked directly with the hotel. The room was a little dusty but had everything you needed other than a coffee maker in your room. The bathroom was lovely with a rain shower. The rooms were extremely good value and I would class the hotel as a UK 4* with some very grand features. The hotel pool on the roof was a nice touch. The dining room was very OTT but a great place to have breakfast or dinner. I would highly recommend this hotel as you are in the heart of the action without having to be over Bourbon Streeted! Dinner at NOLA in the French Quarter is a MUST! Fantastic Food and a real local feel. We went to New Orleans slightly apprehensive but left feeling pleased we visited, at no point did we feel unsafe or that we were in a dangerous area. PS. Give the trip on the Steam Boat from near Jackson Square a miss, imagine driving through an industrial estate, thatâ€™s what itâ€™s like, except on a boat! Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Gone with the Wind”
Reviews.Author: debby1986
Reviews.Content: This year has been very difficult and we needed a place to relax and enjoy each other. The LePavillon Hotel was exactly what we needed. If you have seen the movie "Gone w/the Wind" then the lobby will be a replica. Of course this is just my opinion. The lobby and the dining room was exquisite. Now I must confess that the room (King size) how ever breathtaking it was, is a little small but still very beautiful. The decor of the bathroom was chic. But you won't be in the room that much because there is so much to do. We were there for five days. Most of the time we rode the street car which is a 1.25 one way. I would also recommend that if you are going to be out pretty late take the taxi from LePavillion to the casino or to the French Quarter. It will run you around $8 or $9 dollars one way. I probably gained 10lbs because food is everywhere. The hotel offers a buffet for $18 have Pat make you an omelet!!!!. Often we would return to the hotel late and would still be hungry. The food from room service was great. It will probably run you around $50 and up. Also, please, please take the Katina tour. What you see in the tourist area is not what you will see during this tour. If while you are on the tour and they don't mention about the bridge that goes to Ward 9, please inquire. Overall we are looking to revisit the LePavillon in April. Oh, I must also tell you don't remove anything from the Refreshment Center unless you are going to pay for it. The refreshment center has a sensor and records everything you remove. I found out the hard way, but they removed it from my bill. I truly enjoyed myself and I can't wait until April (my birthday).

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Old Hotel In The Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: LY776
Reviews.Content: This is a grand hotel with tons of character. A beautiful lobby that looks like it came out of a movie set. Gaudy and over the top, just like something in New Orleans should be. The service was warm without being pushy. Particularly the staff in the Crystal Room Dining Room was particularly pleasant. I had booked on Orbitz and there was a free breakfast buffet included. This was without a doubt the most beautiful breakfast room I have ever eaten in (and I have stayed in a few nice hotels around the world). If I had not had included for free, I am not sure I would have shelled out 17.99 for the breakfast as I don't eat that much. However, the spread was impressive and a great brunch deal for those with an appetite. And unlike the other Orbitz customer who felt they had received a worse room due to this breakfast deal, I was actually given an upgrade for my room. The room itself was well appointed and quiet. The style is Victorian with tall and spacious rooms. Admittedly, this is a 100 year old hotel and not everything is brand spanking new. The bathtub and shower could use a wee bit of an upgrade. But certainly nothing was wrong enough that should put off anyone. The 37 or so pillows on the bed were probably more than I need, but that is the kind of over the top decoration choices that give the hotel its particular charm. I admit I also like a hotel that still gives you personalized terry cloth robes to use, has their own stationery in the rooms, and leaves you a welcome note in an engraved card. The hotel is in walking distance to the French Quarter. There are also some interesting neighborhoods just across the street around the courthouse and other legal buildings and alleys. Sadly, like most of New Orleans in the area you can find many buildings and businesses still waiting to recover from Katrina. Not everything in the hotel was perfect, and any hundred year old hotel has a few frayed edges. At the same time, there are wonderful ornate hallways and public spaces that you rarely find outside of hotels costing many times more. If you want austere, sterile, perfection, you probably are better going with some chic uber modern chain (and probably the New Orleans Big Easy attitude isn't going to be for you anyway). If you want something unique that seems to fit the mood of New Orleans in a grand (but not stuffy) manner - then you're going to like your stay at Le Pavillon.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty lobby, but...”
Reviews.Author: gatorwedsnole
Reviews.Content: I'll start off by saying that I got a great deal on Orbitz that included the breakfast buffet which is valued at $18pp. The food and service was great. And Miss Pat makes amazing omelets! The lobby is nice, holiday decor, etc. Because I booked through Orbitz (at a low rate), I think that we managed to get the worst room in the hotel. Top floor, right next to the entrance to the pool/roof which means we heard a lot of door opening and closing. Also, we had 2 doubles instead of 1 king. The hotel would've charged us extra for a king at check-in b/c we booked thru Orbitz. I was not impressed with the room. Way too much stuff to collect dust IMO. Fake plants, bed ruffles, lace shower curtain with fabric covering, table cloths. Also, the beds weren't comfortable. I can't help but wonder if some of the other rooms might be "nicer." The location is great, close enough and far enough from the French Quarter. We had a great rate, and that's what makes my review above average.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Junebugs29
Reviews.Content: This hotel stands alone in NO. 2 daughters went to college in NO so we have stayed at many of the top hotels over the past 15 years. The extremely friendly staff ( like the Bartender who has been there 34 years, the Doormen, Concierge, Dining Room Staff and Housekeeping ) all seem to enjoy what they are doing. The hotel over 100 years old has been restored to rival any that we have seen. Only the Hotel Regency in Florence is as beautiful ( but much smaller). Even the cab drivers had only good things to say about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “All you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: ldtrip
Reviews.Content: The staff was so courteous, friendly and helpful. Overall service was excellent. The lobby and the rooms are beautiful. It's not your typical chain of hotels - it's very unique and charming. I was there on business and it made my stay very enjoyable. I felt like I was treated like royalty. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious, tacky, and boring”
Reviews.Author: chrisarnoult
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel like you're staying in your grandmother's attic, you've found your place. The hotel tries too hard to have a renaissance sort of charm without modern amenities. The rooms are dark and stuffy, the comforters are course, and they offer such things as "hand drawn baths" for 50 dollars. Seriously, I'd rather enjoy a fridge in the room...or maybe a coffee maker, but alas, those sort of amenities wouldn't fit the hotel's motif. The hotel staff are pretentious and rude and the food in the hotel restaurant is terrible. If you want to stay in a place with great hospitality, plush down comforters, fun atmosphere, kind and helpful hotel staff, then stay at the W in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for a king/queen”
Reviews.Author: jenna4j
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel twice. Each time, we were truly treated like a king and queen. The staff go out of their way to assist you. They call you by name and recomomend excellent, reasonably priced, high quality resturants. The hotel was so cheap on hotwire.com, this is the only way we plan to book future hotels. The hotel is 4 1/2 stars, so everytime it appears on the list, we will book it.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: martypaula
Reviews.Content: We booked via Hotwire for $78 per night. We were very happy to see the location. We were in town for Tulane Parent's weekend, so the location was central to campus, french quarter, and Magazine Street. Upon arrival, we were swiftly brought in to check in. We were taken to our room by Nabeel ,who was respectful (ladies first on the elevator), informative about the history of the hotel, and just plain friendly. For the next few days, he greeted us by name every time we walked through the lobby. We had limited time for a quick lunch and he quickly pointed us to a local spot called P&G just a block away. It was a great reasonable eatery with local specials..crab cakes, jambalaya, shrimp creole. My husband went for breakfast as well . Nabeel should be commended for his representation of this hotel. It is evident that he loves this jewel in the city. Every staff member we encountered during our stay were polite and friendly. One of my favorite things about New Orleans in general is how hard they ty to make you feel welcome. True southern hospitality! The room was small, but adequate. The bathroom small as well. It was very clean and stocked with nice toiletries. When in New Orleans, I don't expect to spend a lot of time in the room, so no complaints. I found the room to be quite sound proof. Hot chocolate (delicious) and peanut butter sandwiches served each evening in the lobby were yummy. Le Pavillon tradition. Although parking was expensive, 28.00 plus about 3.00 tax, Le Pavillon is one of the few upscale hotels that offers free in room wireless internet. I have paid fifteen or more per laptop at other New Orleans Hotels, as well exorbitant parking fees.. I would definately stay at this hotel again. A few suggestions for management..... I would love a coffee maker in the room. or complimentary coffee in the lobby Many of the other upscale hotels offer cold beverages in the lobby late afternoon (lemonade or fruit flavored water), especially refeshing for dehydrated guests. Overall, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: JJCajun
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Pavillon on a number of occasions and have always been impressed at the friendliness of the staff and the high level of customer service. On my recent stay in September, it struck me that I should comment and share my appreciation for the staff and how impressed I was on my recent visit. From the time I entered the door, to the time I left, I saw lots of smiles and attention to guests of the hotel, including myself. I travel quite a bit and it is always nice to stay at a hotel where you feel appreciated. Great breakfast buffet, as well!

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillion New Orleans HUGE Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: legalwriter
Reviews.Content: ***** Parking is $28.00 a day ******** We were thrilled to see that we were booked at Le Pavillon Hotel after making reservations through Hotwire. However, our experience was anything by thrilling. Our room at the Le Pavillon Hotel left much to be desired. The bed was not comfortable at all and the pillows very cheap feeling. The walls were very thin, so we heard our neighbors, who were pretty rowdy, all night long. The sensors in the mini fridge are obviously very messed up because as we were checking out, we heard two other guests making the same complaint as us in that they we billed in error for removing drinks. Overall, Le Pavillion did not even begin to measure up to the Sheraton in New Orleans, which we also frequently book for about $30.00 a night less via Hotwire. We will not return there again. .

Reviews.Title: “One of the best experiences I had!”
Reviews.Author: victosh_ka
Reviews.Content: I LOVED it!!! Seriously, I felt as if I am a celebrity or a VIP spending bunch of money for staying at a luxurious boutique hotel. Even before our arrival, we called the hotel to ask about something and the front desk was extremely attentive. Then when we arrived from the bellman to every other staff that we met on the way to the front desk, I felt like I am Madonna or someone super famous: everyone gave us so much attention. The lobby is very antique and feels like I am at some very old mention with grand chandeliers. I asked for the ghosts stories and it was very amusing! My friend and I actually went all around hotel looking for the ghosts. Every corridor has a lot of old paintings, the rooms have very cozy feel to them with nice drapery. The restaurant downstairs has a fireplace, which made me want to go there all the time. There is also a bar next to the dining room featuring an antique cappuccino machine, which looks like an alien. :) They also serve hot chocolate at night and it is SUPER yummy. If it wasnâ€™t for the hotel, our trip to New Orleans would be a level or two down. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Firm 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: faithd58
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights July 31-August 4. The hotel is beautiful. It definitely evokes the old world French feeling that one is looking for when staying in New Orleans. Housekeeping was wonderful. Food was a bit pricey when eating at the hotel restaurants and would be described as usual hotel fare. Check in and out were great. We received the local paper daily and USA Today while staying. We had a few small glitches with the plumbing in the bathroom...the water wouldn't turn off every time...we did not report this tho as we usually were able to turn it off. The beds, although beautiful were really not that comfortable...it would behoove the hotel to bump it up on the linens (sheets, pillowcases) and perhaps check out the mattresses. Also, usually in 5* hotels, the management will contact the guest to inquire regarding the room status and to insure all is well after check in. It's a small but important detail. The bartender (I think her name is Gretchen) was very friendly. There was a piano player in the bar on Friday night and he was very good and friendly. The staff were courteous, helpful and pleasant. I was disappointed at times with little things...empty water bottles laying on the ground by the jacuzzi, milk carton left on the outside steps overnight by some guest after the pb& j treat which is offered by the hotel gratis. The PB & J treat in the evenings was great. The hot chocolate was excellent. We had originally rented a car and the cost to park at the hotel overnight is 28.00 per night, which is exorbitant and should be reconsidered for hotel guests. When we were leaving, we requested a cab. The bell hop whistled and the cabbie pulled up. His van was disgustingly dirty. The hotel should check this out. Although it wasn't a part of our stay, it was the finish and although it is a cab, the hotel should only solicit those cabbies who provide good, clean service (cabbies generally sit right outside of the hotel) Overall, I would stay here again. We had a wonderful time. The hotel needs to only focus on these few small details in order to be a true 5*.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect staff, everything else pretty good too”
Reviews.Author: Disneyprofmom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first stay. I have to say that I have never, ever encountered a more helpful staff at any hotel - including Disney hotels. We were treated wonderfully from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. That is definitely the hallmark of the hotel. The room was almost perfect as well. I did notice little imperfections - a dent on a closet shelf, out of date travel brochures, and a faucet that leaked just a little. These were little things. We also had a strange smell outside our room - maybe a strong cleaning agent - not sure. The location is the only downfall for this hotel - especially in the heat of August. It's a good little walk to Jackson Square. Also being downtown, the area was somewhat deserted on the weekend. All in all, we had a great stay and will return. The people alone make it worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Love the PB&J Sandwich and Hot Chocolate Bedtime Snack”
Reviews.Author: FL_Family_Of_005
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 wonderful nights here in early June. We have stayed in many different hotels all over the city and this one was more than memorable. We had a junior suite with a king size bed. The bed wasn't the most comfortable, but not the worst either. The late night snack of PB&J sandwiches and hot chocolate was a fun, tasty touch. There were different breads and peanut butters to choose from and the hot chocolate was probably the best I have ever had. The air conditioner worked great, which is a big plus in the summer heat in New Orleans. The staff that we came in contact with were very friendly and attentive. Several even remembered our names three days later. Impressive! The rooftop pool and cabanas were very nice. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant although we did have room service for breakfast which was very good and fairly priced for room service. We will stay here again I am sure!

Reviews.Title: “4-Star Stay”
Reviews.Author: IntricateTimes
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Very clean and well-kept. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The only down-side of my stay was the full-sized beds were not very accommodating for two adults. The rooms were a liitle small, but served their purpose.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Dame of New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: Diggadave
Reviews.Content: I haven't been New Orleans for almost 6 years when I stayed at the Crown Plaza. Le Pavillion won my business this time based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and the fact that the rates were so much better. The area is the business district, and the hotel is about 8 blocks north of the convention centre and 4 blocks from the French Quarter. The room was clean and nicely appointed, the bed comfortable. The a/c was a little noisy, but then, it was battling the New Orleans summer hummidity. The reception staff could be a little more welcoming when you arrive, but were very pleasant once I was checked in. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Exterior...But What Lies Beneath”
Reviews.Author: craldiri
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location, has a great deal of classic decor and charm and some staff are courteous. When I arrived ready to unload bags and passengers I was initially annoyed by the doorman who wanted me to somehow park further to the right than was physically possible. Recommendation - Doorman should be extra courteous and understanding to make up for a very small driveway. He ultimately amended himself. Parking fee seemed high at over $30 for one night as compared to a recent trip to Northern California staying at the Renaissance. The registration area also seems small as compared to other hotels and is further obscured by a huge plant separating the two work stations. I almost missed it walking into the hotel. Somehow their registration system had me down for two nights, when I had booked only one night. Desk person was beginning to argue how many nights I had checked in until I showed her the printed receipt clearly pointing out one night. This was the second bad impression, but she too also regulated herself and we concluded the business at hand. The young bellman who helped us to the room with our bags made a very positive impression. He was well-spoken, courteous, not overly intrusive with questions. Even when he offered to "orient" us to our room (something I never accept), I said ok. Main difficulty was that the room we stayed in (609) is very dusty, dark and smells of mold and mildew. Positively cavelike. Bath had visible signs of mold. In fact the entire 6th floor smells musty. This gives the impression of lack of care and led me to wonder whether there might be health risks in ordering food or using the hotel's other amenities like the pool. Concierge gave us some good ideas for a family friendly dinner. PBJ reception is the first I ever attended and it is a nice idea, unfortunately executed poorly. Hot chocolate was finished by the time daughter and I got there. Lack of more than one serving station meant everyone had to line up which made this nice idea a chore. Recommendation - Multiple serving stations that are staggered throughout the lobby so that only minimal lines are formed. The lack of adequate numbers of staff when checking out made it take longer than it needed to and required lining up or waiting when the only person on duty managing the desk needed to also check someone's baggage. Thankfully there was a quick checkout option. This is a beautiful historic hotel that could be great with a bit more investment in the infrastructure, staff training and better overall management.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cyanyde
Reviews.Content: Super fancy hotel with a vintage ornate feel to it. Very nice and the staff is very courteous. Doormen greet and open the doors for you or help you with luggage. Rooms are fairly large and have tie/jacket rack, iron, iron board, safe, electronic card locks, 2 phones w/voice mail (1 in bathroom), minibar, 24 hour room service, and adjustable A/C. There is a pool on the roof with jacuzzi, sun bathing chairs, and a gym. Free fruit and water are available in the gym. Large meeting rooms are on the upper floors. All rooms have access to high speed internet and on one of the floors is a public computer/fax/printer. Ice and vending machines on every floor. The lobby is beautiful and at the end is a bar along with a piano player who plays through out most of the day. Apparently it is tradition to have peanut butter jelly at night in NOLA so the hotel sets out complimentary bread, jelly, and peanut butter to make your own sandwich along with some milk/cocoa and fruit. Although i did not experience anything odd there rumor has it this hotel has some ghosts and history as well. Google "Le Pavilion Ghosts" if interested in reading up on that. Excellent place to stay, would definitely be open to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality & Service!”
Reviews.Author: Sara_in_CA
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is extremely warm, friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious, beautifully decorated, the showers have huge showerheads with great water pressure, the pool on the rooftop is open until 1am and has an amazing view of the city and skyscrapers, and the hotel serves peanut butter and jelly sandwiches with hot chocolate every night from 10 - 11pm. The helpful staff gave wonderful recommendations (Luke restaurant) and greeted us each day by name. I would stay here again, without a doubt! By far the best hotel in New Orleans and close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brenkay
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon is by far one of my favorite hotels that I have stayed in. Le Pavillon has so much character and charm. If you like old world charm and historical monuments this is a hotel you must stay in when visiting New Orleans.. It is very beautful and stunning, the employees of the hotel work very hard to keep this wonderful property in great shape and it shows. I have stayed at several Ritz Carlton's in my lifetime and this hotel comes close to those experiences. Love its location and the secure feel of the hotel and area in which it is located. Le Pavillon is a very short walk to the French Quarter, only 3 blocks. Did not feel at all threatened or fear for my security when walking to the French Quarter. The hotel staff is extremely accommodating and knowledgeable. They are very respectful, polite and very aware of their guests and their needs. They truly enjoy their jobs and that is hard to find these days, especially in the hospitality industry! I would HIGHLY recommend this property and I am looking forward to my next stay with everyone at Le Pavillon. Good luck to whomever reads this and I am sure your experience will be as pleasant as mine was.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: bjcTx
Reviews.Content: The hotel upgraded me from a standard to deluxe at check in for no additional cost. Lovely hotel. The employees all were very helpful, courteous and friendly. Our room was exceptionally nice. We did not eat at the hotel. We knew when we checked in that we would have to walk to everything but it was enjoyable. A few blocks doesn't hurt anybody or they can certainly take a taxi. Definitly will return and stay at this hotel! 5 star all the way.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel to Remember”
Reviews.Author: Terry9
Reviews.Content: A lot of nice hotels in New Orleans seem to still be at get-tourists-here prices, but our stay at Le Pavillon seemed like a steal for the Hotwire price of $74 a night. Except for one edgy desk person (we won't hold that against the hotel), the staff exudes service. The hotel's location wasn't as close to the French Quarter as we would have liked, but the concierge gave us great advice on where and when it's safest to walk there (which we enjoyed). The hotel is beautiful, not only in the amazing lobby, but also in the rooms. I've never seen such a beautiful sink in a hotel room! The beds were high end comfort and bathroom amenities were top of the line. We did miss the in-room coffee maker that the other hotels we stayed at provided, but we found free bottled water available in the fitness room. The roof top pool was pretty, but small and cold, but the view was worth going up for. Of course, not to be missed, is PB&J hour. It was worth keeping our kids up for. We decided peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and hot cocoa never tasted so good!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCtravelboy
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. Rooms are lovely. They do differ in size. We had a larger room with a walk in closet and a nice bathroom with tub. The property itself is 101 years old and very well maintained. What makes this place memorable is the staff. Each and every person we met had a smile and were outstanding employees. The main restaurant is excellent. The menu varied and the employees memorable. I look forward to returning to this gem. If you get a chance to visit, take it!

Reviews.Title: “A historic hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: TravellinwithFamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Pavillon for one week in June, while he attended a conference in NOLA. Consistent with other reviewer comments, the first room assigned, was small for the large size furniture it was expected to accommodate and it also needed some TLC. When we mentioned our concerns to front desk staff, they addressed each quickly. We had opportunity to move to a larger room, when another couple checked out, and enjoyed it immensely for the balance of our stay. The staff from the front desk, housekeeping, bar and dining room were impeccable in their service delivery and general friendliness. We enjoyed the roof top pool and hot tub, cabanas, and the late night peanut butter and jelly sandwich tradition at this fine hotel. The elegance of the hotel, coupled with the warmth of the people we met, made for an excellent first trip to NOLA, start to finish. Le Pavillon, and its staff, will remain a wonderful part of our memories of this great City still recovering "post Katrina". Tip for the Do it Yourself Traveller: Get a "ride all day" $5.00 pass for the Transit from Guest Services. Take the St. Charles Streetcar to the Garden District to enjoy the fine homes and universities. Consider getting off at Washington Avenue to visit Lafayette Cemetery, and enjoy a snack or meal at the Camellia Grill or Le Madeline at the "end of the line" before catching another streetcar back to the hotel. The stop for the St. Charles streetcar is less than a block from Le Pavillon. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “An Historic Jewel in the Heart of the City!”
Reviews.Author: anthropomom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was built in 1907 and it is located a few blocks away from Canal Street, which separates the old French Quarter area from the other parts of town. You are not in the noisy or rowdy parts of town here, and your accomodations are not strictly as "modern" as they might be at some of the newer properties, but there is a grace about Le Pavillon that is very appealing, especially if you are a grownup (of any age). Enjoy the Victorian feel of the loby and lounge with its glorious chandeliers; and the late night snacks provided in the lobby. The management and the staff are nothing but courteous and helpful. Some of our fellow visitors said that their room was too small perhaps, but we could not complain as we were upgraded quite grandly from the room we had reserved. My family especially enjoyed the rooftop pool at night. When we were there, we had it almost to ourselves with the exception of another small group with whom we shared some great conversation. It's not a kid's "splashy" type of situation- again this is an elegant "lady" of a property, a great value for its location and quietness. Valet parking is standard at Le Pavillon. You will pay a fee for it but parking in New Orleans is going to cost money any-which-way you look.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal at $100 Per Night”
Reviews.Author: mrpaladin1234
Reviews.Content: We called the hotel directly and our four-night stay cost us just $450 including all taxes -- and we were upgraded to a deluxe king room. The room was smallish and narrow, and the bathroom could have used a lot more shelf space. Still, everything was clean and dirt-free (except for a few areas which required the moving of furniture), and nicely appointed. Pros: free bottled water, turn-down service, plenty of towels, a good bed, lots of hot water and solid water pressure, shower head high on wall, room-darkening curtains, friendly and competent staff (especially the taxi starters and bell staff). Cons: bottom sheet of bed not fitted, ineffective half-size splash-guard in shower, air conditioner makes loud "pops" if fan set to "auto," bathroom door opens outward (due to sink placement), shower head is non-adjustable, we had to ask for more pillows (only got three), the usual hallway noise/talking and slamming of doors, pricey room service. The hotel is a few blocks from the French Quarter, and we took a lot of streetcars and taxis during our stay to get to other attractions. It's in a business area, which seemed quiet, well-lit and safe, even during a late-night walk back to the hotel. The rooftop pool and jacuzzi were more appealing in the photos. Overall, the place's sparkling appearance belies its age of 100 years. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the charm!”
Reviews.Author: kmcjd72
Reviews.Content: If you like historic hotels, this is place to be. The grandeur of the place wows most people. We even considered this place for our wedding! My only complaint about the rooms is that some may need to be updated. Not only is the place gorgeous, but service is impeccable.The staff is friendly, courteous, and accommodating. Out of 4 stays, we may have had a problem *once* with a slightly slooow valet. Warning: If this is your first time visiting NOLA, be prepared to pay $25-30 a night for parking at any hotel. Le Pav is a few blocks from the Quarter, but is worth the walk or cab ride -- highly recommended on a hot New Orleans summer day!

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon in New Orleans is my favorite!”
Reviews.Author: HarryDiggs
Reviews.Content: It's been quite some time since I've stayed here but it's definitely left a lasting impression. For 3 years in a row, I would travel down to New Orleans for Halloween and on this year I chose to stay at Le Pavillon. Previously I'd stayed at The Hotel Intercontinental and The Westin. Nice places but my experience at Le Pavillon far surpassed them! I took two of my friends with me as a gift to them and they were really happy at the hotel choice! We spent a lot of time up on the roof where the pool and whirl pool were ordering drinks and just enjoying ourselves. It was like being at a resort! Their fitness center was very adequate and helped me sweat out my hangover on one morning! The room, hotel decor, and staff were superior. I'm going back to New Orleans this year after few years and I will certainly be staying at Le Pavillon. I'll be the one in the whirl pool with a beer in my hand. Mike

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon- Greatest Hotel I've ever been to!”
Reviews.Author: Gypsy502
Reviews.Content: My stay at Le Pavillon was wonderful, it was a beautiful hotel and the staff was really great. The peanut butter and jelly and hot cocoa at 10:00 was a nice touch too. The hotel was within walking distance of many of the places I wanted to go and within walking distance of trolleys that could take me to the places I couldn't walk to. When I wanted to rest for awhile the roof top pool was convienently located near by. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you've never stayed in a historic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: bigd79
Reviews.Content: The Le Pavillon Hotel is very impressive place to stay in New Orleans. Its close enough to the Quarter to be a lot of fun but far away enough to avoid a lot of the undesirables. The location is in the heart of the business district/downtown. The decor is classy and the staff are really helpful. The best bonus: PB&J's and milk at ten o'clock every night. Now how great is that!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jhm539
Reviews.Content: The property was amazing and the staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was seamless. Walking through the lobby made every step seemed like a fairy tale; between the beautiful furniture and exquisitely decorated rooms it certainly surpassed my expectations. The PB&J and Hot Chocolate at night was the perfect ending an even more than perfect day. I can't wait to have an opportunity to go back and add to my wonderful memories.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, Class and History”
Reviews.Author: ChrisIsOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: Read the TripAdvisor reviews prior to our visit. Let me see if I can provide some of the clarity I was looking for before our stay. Le Pavillon Hotel is a grand, older hotel. It was built in 1907 and is (do the math) now over 100 years old. In my experience there are both advantages and compromises in staying at such a property. I like my history but I also like my latest and greatest features and technology and I'm generally not a B&B guy. Le Pavillon is definitely worth some of the compromises. The location is good if you want to be near the Superdome, Central Business District and French Quarter. The good news if you want it a bit quieter at night is that you are very near but not in the French Quarter. We booked on Hotwire and as other reviewers have suggested upgraded to a Deluxe King room. Room service was excellent and prompt. In general the service was tremendous from every staff member that we encountered. Very attentive. For example as I was ordering a snack one afternoon the phone seemed to keep cutting out. Before the snack even arrived a maintenance person was there to repair the phone.... And we hadn't reported a phone problem. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST”
Reviews.Author: michelleluvsmax
Reviews.Content: Went toHotwire to book a last minute get away. I booked not knowing which hotel. I was very nervous, I had never done that before, It was WORTH IT. Le Pavillon, was beautiful. The beds were comfy, it was very clean,. The satff was excellent. We will definately stay there again. It was an experience just staying at the hotel. The pool area was very beautiful. I have absolutely no complaints!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: biker3
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel with lots of New Orleans charm and architecture. We have stayed here a few times and have consistently found the staff attentive and excellent. Its location is central and an easy walk to the French Quarter. Its restaurant has excellent food, especially the brunch. Scott Foster Massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “A Special Hotel”
Reviews.Author: B0bL
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ll start by saying that we loved our stay at Le Pavillon. Then go on to say that this may not be the hotel for everyone. This is not a national chain hotel; it is a place that is so rich in tradition and elegance that some may feel uncomfortable in a place that it is not decorated by Cort Furniture, with gas station art on the walls, lumpy beds and stiff scratchy linens. Le Pavillon is unique. It is beautifully appointed, spotlessly clean and very gracious. The room in which we stayed was very comfortable though could have used a bit more flat surface space. Having read many of the reviews before our stay we were a bit worried about the bedding. We had no reason to. The king sized bed was almost as comfortable as our 5â€� pillow top. The room was beautiful, the chairs comfortable & the rest of the furniture was quite elegant. The bathroom was incredible. It was entirely modernized with very sexy black tiles and the wall above the countertop was mirrored from backsplash to ceiling. The shower head was a beautiful ceramic â€œsquash flowerâ€� with plenty of pressure and hot water. Nice bathrobes were provided and there were large towels aplenty. One of the best Iâ€™ve seen in my travels. We arrived fairly early in the day and were given an early check in. When we came back in from an hour stroll around the area we found a basket of fruit and a bottle of their own bottled local spring water in the room. While reading the hotel directory I noticed that coffee makers were available by calling guest services. I called and within an hour they delivered a coffee maker, oversized cups and Community Coffee. This was kept stocked for entire stay. After returning from dinner we found our bed turned down, two more bottles of water and two peanut butter and jelly cookies with the recipe on our night table. This was repeated each night. The hotel staff was fantastic. Every request that we made was granted. One of the nights was my wifeâ€™s birthday and she wanted a Muffelatta from Napoleon House but they stop serving food at 5:30 and that was too early for us so I asked the concierge if we could bring one in and have it heated up in their kitchen. â€œYes sir just ask the hostess and weâ€™ll take care of it for youâ€� was the answer. When the time came I spoke with the hostess and gave directions on the proper heating of the sandwich which meant wrapped in tinfoil in the oven for twenty to thirty minutes not the microwave.
