It was done to perfection. On the way back to the room we were the envy of all of the guest that we ran into. The Concierge staff was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. We wanted to visit a cemetery and they recommended a tour with a non profit that is involved with the cemetery rather that a crowded tour operated by one of the big companies. The same kind of recommendation was made for a bayou tour. Our only complaint was there was that the room refrigerator was filled with mini bar items. We prefer our own favorite beverages and foods whilst traveling but when we requested and extra ice bucket one was delivered immediately. All in all a very satisfying stay and we will stay again next year when we return for Jazz Fest. A big thanks to the staff of Le Pavillon

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to its own opinion of itself”
Reviews.Author: Didrick
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at this hotel for three nights in April, partly based on glowing reports on Tripadvisor. It was our first visit to New Orleans and we knew the hotel was going to be somewhat over the top in terms of presentation and decor. But behind the showy facade there was little to justify the $250 per room per night. The hotel staff mostly weren't able to live up to the expectations presented by the in-house PR team. Some were downright miserable. Yet every morning a note from management was left on the bed, written in peculiarly servile language, explaining how dedicated the staff are to "granting peace and rest while under our roof". Cool. So why vacuum the hall outside the room at 8.30am to wake us up? And why fill the room with all those decorative pillows yet provide next to nowhere to put our clothes? And why no tea and coffee making facilities in the room? The note goes on, "May every call you make, every message you receive and every person you meet add to your joy." Great. So why try to charge us six times for breakfast we'd prepaid, why charge us for parking a car we didn't have and why insist on using our first names but get them wrong in spite of repeated corrections? If you don't take this place seriously - before you go to bed they serve free jam sandwiches among the vast array of artworks in the lobby for heaven's sake - you'll enjoy this place but no way is it worth the money. And don't believe the hype.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Pavillon!”
Reviews.Author: Soes1
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon is one of the finest hotels in New Orleans. We got treated very well during our week long stay. Hotel is very clean and luxurious. Rooms are large with upscale features. We got to know many staff members by name. This was the best hotel staff I have seen anywhere. Hotel offered the following that we really liked: Evening cocktail reception, turndown service, late evening reception including ice cold milk and other good stuff, chef prepared gourmet breakfast. We took advantage of a GREAT deal. All taxes, French Quarter parking, and all of the above for the bargain price of $125 per night. I would consider that a steal for this 5 Star hotel. We will be back. Had a great time. Hotel is located just a few blocks outside of the Quarter. It really is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the lobby deceive you”
Reviews.Author: MDeRousse
Reviews.Content: The lobby looks promising, but that's about it. If you book over internet you will be given a very small room. Carpets, drapes etc smell musty. Staff is friendly, but this place needs a major overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service!”
Reviews.Author: wisgirl01
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my stay at Le Pavillion, which was wonderful. I visit New Orleans several times a year and have stayed in many different hotels there, this was my second stay at Le Pavillion. I am also a frequent business traveler. While the hotel is in a great location, and doesn't compare to other 4 stars I've stayed in bedding or amenity-wise, the stellar service is what made my experience memorable. Here is why: 1. My luggage did not arrive on my flight, and was delivered to the hotel several hours later. While I was in the check-in line, the bellman, Nabil, asked if he could help me. I told him with a smile, "No thanks, just checking in, with no luggage". He asked right away if I needed a toothbrush or anything. I said that would be great. He came back a few seconds later with a toothbrush, paste and deoderant. I did not ask for this, he was just attentive and it was very appreciated. 2. My luggage came very late that night (230am) and it was wet. The desk attendant asked if there was anything I needed as my bag was wet - again, attention to detail that was not asked for. 3. The next morning was a bit chilly, but I visited the pool anyway. I was the only one there, reading my paper on a chaise. A housekeeper came out to blow leaves off the patio with a blower. I didn't care, she was just doing her job. About 2 minutes into this, someone came out and called her away. She came back and said, "I'm so sorry to have disturbed you" and began to sweep the leaves up instead of blow them. I told her she did not disturb me, it was fine. But what?? Someone was aware that one guest was out there, so she changed her routine to accomodate. Again, I didn't care or complain about this. 4. When I was leaving my room to check out, a housekeeper had just stepped off the elevator and was going down the hall in the opposite direction. She saw me come out of my room, from quite far away, and went back to the elevator to hold the door for me. 5. When I checked out, there was a mistake on my bill from the service bar that I did not even know about. The desk agent, who was training asked if I had anything from the service bar. I told her what I had, she said, "well this is an error then, I will adjust your bill" and she credited me $56. Once again, unsolicited. I was truly amazed by the level of service exhibited by every single person I encountered during this stay. While the rooms are not the newest, or the beds the best, and there was no coffee maker in the room - that is not what will stand out in my mind. The excellent service and attitude of the employees is what made this stay most enjoyable. I would have no hesitation to return or recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Average Room at Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: Nash_Andrew
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon offers top notch service, average rooms, and a heavy dose of New Orleans charm. Overall, depending on how much you pay, Le Pavillon is a solid choice in New Orleans. Girlfriend and I booked Le Pavillon for 3 nights, April 11-14, through Priceline. Winning bid was $79 per night, plus tax. A few days before check in, I called the hotel asking what kinds of upgrades might be available. The reservations desk informed me that Priceline books into queen rooms, and that I could upgrade to a king room for $10 more per night. Done. We arrived around 8pm Friday. Service at the door, bellstand, and check in counter was beyond friendly and very smooth. We were checked in within a couple of minutes. Our bellhop introduced himself, asked our names, and every time we saw him throughout our entire stay he spoke to us by name. We were whisked to the room and given a thorough and friendly introduction to the room and the hotel. All in all, a very nice welcome to the property. Now, the room. The hotel is 100 years old and there's no doubt that it is showing some age. The room is the kind that looks great on first glance but upon closer inspection shows some wear. Things like: door stoppers that are broken, small amounts of peeling paint on the bathroom ceiling, a greasy remote control, way old school tube tv, etc. These are all small items and they didn't really affect our stay. The bed - as also indicated by other reviewers - was not as good as it should have been. I typically stay in Marriotts and their Revive bedding blows Le Pavillon out of the water, as does Westin's Heavenly Bed. The mattress and pillows felt about 25 years old - not uncomfortable, but not what is standard in the hotel industry these days. Overall, the room gave the feeling that when it was originally decorated 15 years ago, it was absolutely top of the line. Now, it's just average, maybe slightly below average depending on how much you paid for your room. Other notes on the hotel: the rooftop deck and spa looked fine, again showing some age, but a very nice amenity to have. Didn't work out in the gym but it appeared perfectly suitable if not a little small. The common areas of the hotel, like the lobby and the Crystal Room restaurant, are exquisitely appointed. When you walk into the hotel you really feel like you are stepping back in time to the grander days of travel and the truly historic New Orleans experience. I have to say that my girlfriend and I really liked that. A couple words also about the location - it's on Poydras, in the middle of the CBD. The walk to Canal St. (edge of French Quarter) is about 7 minutes. I was worried that the walk would feel less than safe after dark, but that was not the case at all. As others have said, this is the kind of location where you can walk to dinner or the bars in the Quarter, but you probably want to take a cab home at 2am. Not the location for you if you want to stumble directly out of the bar into your bed. I should note that the St. Charles streetcar is a block away, and Mother's (great po' boys) about three blocks. Overall, Le Pavillon offers you a taste of the historic grandeur of New Orleans, with all the service you would expect. With that comes facilities that are a little worn around the edges. The room was a great deal at $89 per night, but if I were paying full price I'd probably prefer the Marriott. At the end of the day, it's the service that really makes this place shine, and I probably would have rated it 3 stars were it not for the standout performances of a number of the staff members.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but not great”
Reviews.Author: Tarheel21
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews on this website at the time I was looking to make a reservation. My husband and I are here for a conference without the kids so we wanted a nice place to stay. I've been screwed before staying at hotels where the conferences are hosted so we were looking for something different. When I booked on this website, this hotel was ranked #1 of all the hotels in NOLA. Well, now I know the #1 was way over the top. The hotel is historic but I think that must mean shabby. The paint in our room is peeling, the A/C is REALLY loud and the toilets don't flush very well. The worst part is the bed - it is really old and worn out. The hotel website says the bed has luxury linens but that is a gross exaggeration. These linens are exactly like every other hotel I've ever stayed in. I consider the linens at the Ritz to be luxury and these are nothing like that. There are no fitted sheets and every time my husband turns over, the sheets come off the bed on his side and get all lumpy. The pillows are as bad as a previous poster said. We called down over an hour ago for new pillows but no one has shown up with them yet. The staff is sort of friendly but nothing like what has been described in prior posts. I don't see anyone going out of their way to assist us. The hotel is in a nice location - right between the Riverwalk and just far enough out of the French Quarter to get away from all the drunks when you've had enough. Overall, a very average hotel with a few unique historic touches.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: srstraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had planned a quick weekend getaway to New Orleans. Unfortunately because of bad weather in New Orleans late Friday night when we were supposed to get in our flight ended up getting diverted to Houston after hours of trying to land, refueling and trying to land again. We had originally not planned to get into New Orleans until after midnight and had called the hotel to let them know we'd be in late. After we finally landed the next morning in Houston we called the hotel to tell them why we had never made it the night before. We were told no problem, your room will be waiting for you when you get here. We had booked through Hotwire so we had already paid in advance. By the time we made it to the hotel Saturday afternoon when we finally got to New Orleans, we were first told our room was not ready. We asked if we could have our money back since the room was not ready and we didn't use the room Friday night. We figured the room would be ready if they were still holding it for us from the night before. We spoke to the manager to see what she could do. When we told her about the issue she informed us we had no room at all and they had given it away because we were a no show. She didn't seem to care that someone on her staff told us they were holding our room. She also told us good luck at getting our money back from Hotwire, she could do nothing for us. We ended up checking in at a nicer hotel and after much discussion with Hotwire we finally got them to refund our money. Don't take your chance on staying here!

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Crescentcityfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel has real old-fashioned New Orleans charm with its oil paintings and antiques. The hotel overall was very nice and just the right distance away from the French Quarter but what made our stay really special was the service and the staff, particulary the staff in the dining room at breakfast and the porters. The service they offer is not only better than in any other 4 or 5 star hotel I have stayed at (and I have stayed at quite a few!) but they are so charming and friendly you leave the hotel each day with a big smile on your face - I was hoping for some of the famous Southern hospitality and I definitely got it at this hotel! I can definitely recommend the Hurricaine cocktail made by the nice German bartender lady (better than the one I had at Pat OBrien's!) and Miss Pettie's Bananas Foster waffles were absolutely devine! What a charming, delightful hotel - it certainly contributed towards a very good first impression of New Orleans. I would highly recommend New Orleans and this hotel to anybody. What a contrast to the sea of miserable faces I was greeted with when I arrived back in London!

Reviews.Title: “Easter Weekend at NOLA”
Reviews.Content: Overall the Hotel was a good value for the price we paid, we booked thru Hotwire. The staff was friendly always and helpfull when asked. The rooms were clean, I did not see any problems in the bathroom but I did feel the beds and pillows very old, the pillows are very worn out and some of the mattreses feel old. The AC controls are old and dont seem to work very well. The peanut butter and jelly offered at night is good but you have to wait thru a long line because the hotel only pulls out a tray with bread and a single container with peanut butter for everybody. Overall my experience was good, I think we received what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: HopSkipJump
Reviews.Content: There's some bad but overall, it's great. First, the bad: 1. Ok, it's me. I'll admit it. I'm very picky about pillows. I can't stand skinny hotel pillows and even though there were a lot of them -- and some of them were quite LONG, they were all really flat. I tried stacking them or folding them in half but they wouldn't stay put and I thought all was lost until I decided to take one out of its pillow case, fold it in half width-wise and put it back in the case. Problem solved! Since it was such a LONG pillow to begin with, it ended up half as long but still long enough. 2. This hotel is in the central business district, 4 blocks from the edge of the French Quarter. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the center of the French Quarter or a few minutes by taxi or by street car. This did not bother us at all but if you want to be able to stumble out of a bar and into your hotel, this isn't the place for you. If you do walk, go south on Poydras (in front of the hotel) and then turn left to get to the French Quarter. If you do the opposite (go east, along the side of the hotel and then turn south to enter the Quarter), it takes longer since the streets are not in a perfect grid, there. It's also a prettier walk down Poydras than the other way, Now, the good... 1. The hotel is beautiful. The front of the building is much nicer than it looks on the website and the lobby is gorgeous as is the dining room (including its large fireplace) and bar area. 2, The room was large and beautifully furnished. (A previous poster said the room was small?!). There was room for 2 queen beds plus a desk on one side and a round table with 2 large arm chairs on the other. That's big enough, isn't it? The bath had been remodeled and the shower was taller than me at 6'3" (1.9 m). 3. The night-time peanut butter and jelly buffet with hot cocoa was great fun. 4. There was free, 24-hour internet access via a PC on the second floor (for those of us who don't like dragging our lap tops with us). Ask for the password at the front desk. 5. EVERYONE who worked there was incredibly kind and thoughtful. We were given great recommendations for a jazz club as well as a place for pecan pie. 6. The rooftop pool is on the small size but New Orleans is not really a "resort city" so we weren't put off by it. We did relax and talk on 2 chaise lounges, that are away from the pool in a little cabana, one late afternoon for about 2 hours and watched the sky get dark. 7. We got the room on Hotwire for $90-something and it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: SteveBazakas
Reviews.Content: We booked this on Hotwire. This is an older, grand hotel, which has been well-maintained, and my teenaged daughters got a kick out of the decor. The staff is extremely nice and helpful. My only complaint would be the bedding, which is very good, but it has been surpassed by the chains in the similar category. The rooms are on the smaller side, but really not a problem, unless you had four people in them. The shower was excellent, and the size of the bathroom was more than adequate. It was a ten minute walk to the French Quarter, right on to Bourbon Street. Also, you are a block from the St. Charles street car, which we easily took up to the stop in front of Tulane. We had room service one morning and it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed..”
Reviews.Author: moon99
Reviews.Content: The hotel photos on their website are misleading. The hotel must have been grand and beautiful once but it has been badly maintained. Rather disappointing actually with chipped marble in the bathrooms and century old drapes. I was also (unpleasantly) surprised by the fitness center where none of the machines worked and the pool which was really tiny (not like the picture on the web). The wireless mostly did not work of course. On a positive note, the staff was really helpful and courteous and the restaurant food was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: dwtravelbug
Reviews.Content: What a great experience! We wanted something JUST outside the French Quarter for Mardi Gras and this was perfect. Outstanding bellmen, concierge and desk attendants---beautiful lobby, bar, and rooms.........nice rooftop pool and hot tub....and peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and hot chocolate every night!! We have stayed at over 10 different hotels on our trips to this fantastic city and this was definitely one of the best....do not hesitate to book here!!!

Reviews.Title: “There's no place like home...unless it's Le Pavillon!!!”
Reviews.Author: smileyHere
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler who spends up to 40 weekends a year in different hotels throughout the country, and occasionally a few other countries, I tend to become overly picky by the end of my stays. "There's no place like home" after all, unless it's Le Pavillon Hotel it turns out! The beauty and splendor of this fine establishment is immediately recognized when one walks through the doors...the heart and soul is felt with each encounter one has with the staff! And you absolutely HAVE to have a PB&J with milk in the lobby at the end of the night! I have never been so well cared for, though perhaps the Stan Hope Central Park in NYC and the Intercontinental in Seoul have tried. I have never seen such a well-preserved and well-maintained historical hotel, though The Emily Morgan in San Antonio and The Jerome in Aspen do their best. Never have I felt so at home while feeling so pampered while traveling for work or pleasure. Since I do both in New Orleans as often as possible I promise myself to always do whatever I can to stay at Le Pavillon!

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Montremblant
Reviews.Content: We trusted Trip Advisor and booked Le Pavillon through Hotwire. We upgraded our room to a deluxe king after reading the reviews here as well. The room was lovely - with everything you need and nothing you don't. I laughed at the recent poor review where the couple requested a microwave in their room!! There is plenty of room in the armoire & closet to store belongings and housekeeping will quickly and happily furnish you with extra pillows. The sheets are not fitted ( as with most better hotels) but they are crisp & clean and stay ON the bed . The furnishings are in keeping with the grand old style of the beautiful hotel - the details are exquisite e.g. painted ceilings, crown molding etc. The bathrooms in the deluxe rooms have been renovated with granite, tile & porcelain - perfect. There is complimentary coffee available in the gorgeous dining room each morning, and PB&J sandwiches, fruit & hot chocolate in the lobby each evening. Best of all, everyone in the hotel is helpful and pleasant. The service was excellent. This was our 6th trip to New Orleans - we will definately return to Le Pavillon.

Reviews.Title: “5th visit and counting!”
Reviews.Author: violet119
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth stay at Le Pallivon in the past four years. The experience each time has been amazing! The staff is more than hospitible, from the bellhop and valet parking attendant to the housekeeping staff. We delt with two different members of the concierge staff, although the female could have taken some lessons from the other employees, the male concierge, Mark, was more than helpful in helping us choose a restaurant. The room was vintage and cozy with beautiful decor and fixtures. Overall it had all the amenities of a modern hotel and the feel of Old New Orleans. Fresh flowers and beautiful artwork lined the halls and the room. The staff greeted us in our room each night with complimentary bottled water and home made cookies! We also took advantage of the nightly complimentary peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and hot chocolate, which made us feel that much more warm and invited. We are definitely going to be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: RoseCityTexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and two teenagers (boys) between Christmas and New Year's. Had a very fine experience. The Hotel is beautiful and the staff very friendly. It was about a four or five block walk to the French Quarter -- but in some ways this is a plus as it is a much less hectic and noisy location. Easy walking distance to Harrah's Casino too. I noticed quite a few European vistors were staying there too -- the ambiance is sort of like a European Hotel (at least what I think one would be like).

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service, average room”
Reviews.Author: jimshonk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the BCS Bowl. Great location, great service, great food, wonderful lobby. When you get into your room though, the physical product is simply not in keeping with luxury tier or branded business competition. They offer two pillows per bed (we had two queen beds), and a basic mattress with an old style hotle bedspread rather than a duvet cover. They must upgrade the bedding standard to meet the standards set by Marriott, Hilton and Hyatt business-class hotels, let alone the Ritz-Carlton or W or similar competitive offerings. The location is great and every associate we came into contact was professional and pleasant. The buffet-style food we had was just fine and priced right. Whoever is managing and operating Le Pavillion is doing a great job. Their owners need to step in a bit more with respect to the physical product, especially the room and bed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service- Suprisingly Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: broadcast9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Pavillion due to its excellent rating. We booked on Hotwire for $99/night- definately worth it. The hotel lobby and property is amazing- the pictures don't do it justice. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly- everyone from the bellboys to housekeeping to front desk said hello every time we saw them. The room however was average. Certainly not on the same level as other 4 star hotels. Perhaps our room was smaller due to our price. The AC was loud and the bed was sunken in th middle. They don't use fitted sheets- so the sheets tend to run all over the place- which is a huge pet peeve of mine. The room was exceptionally clean though. The hotel is a bit far from the quarter- but we knew that going in. Excellent in comparison to downtown, the convention center and the stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: RGCT
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great, staff was friendly, warm and very helpful! Beautiful building-we loved it! Very clean too. Couldn't have asked for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: dfwtraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to New Orleans for our anniversary Dec 26-28th. We booked our trip through Travelocity and got an outstanding rate at LePavillion. Easy cab ride to the beautiful hotel. Service was outstanding from the doorman to the concierge to housekeeping. We even noticed the front desk giving out umbrellas and rain panchos on a rainy morning. The hotel must be the most gorgeous hotel in all of New Orleans. We were upgraded to a deluxe King room on the 8th (next to the top) floor. Great room and bathroom, but the bathroom was on the small side. Location wise, it was a little farther from the French Quarter than I would have preferred. We walked to the Quarter without a problem, but there was nothing really nearby unless you were in town for business. We did not dine at the hotel, but did have drinks in the bar which was very nice. We ate at NOLA which is absolutely not to be missed, had beignets and coffee at Cafe Dumonde (long line), burger at Camilla Grill (another long line...but well worth it and the streetcar now goes all the way again) and dinner at GW Fins (very good). We listened to jazz at the Howlin Wolf. Would have enjoyed it more if we hadn't spent hours walking during the day, only to have to stand (large place with very limited tables/chairs). The next night we went to bar at the Ritz and really enjoyed the quieter, laid back atmosphere and being able to sit on a sofa, listen to some excellent jazz and have a nice glass of champagne.

Reviews.Title: “You could better”
Reviews.Author: taistrike
Reviews.Content: I did extensive reviews on TA before booking this hotel, and I was extremely disappointed with the quality of the hotel. We booked from Expedia for $99/night (paid $10 for an upgraded room). Check in was fine, the front desk was cordial but not exceptionally nice. The front lobby is very beautiful and was decorated for very nicely for Christmas time. During our three day stay we encountered the following problems: 1.) Room wasvsmall and not very attractively decorated. It was decorated in a faux 1800s style, but it looked like it was done with a $100 budget. From the gaudy table cloth that hung all over the floor, to the large and noticeably plastic plant on the armoire the room was just generally ugly. In addition it was extremely small, like NYC small. I have stayed in hundreds of hotel rooms in my life and this is one of the smallest. My girlfriend and I stumbled all over each other during the stay in the small room. It would help if instead of a table and 2 chairs they just left room to walk around, or put something more suitable, like a desk. I couldn't find a working outlet in the room without unplugging the lamps, and the heat was difficult to operate (some of that 17th century charm?), the toilet screeched for 30 seconds each time it was flushed, and finally a portion of the window in our room was cracked and covered with duct tape. Not what I expect from a 4-star hotel. 2.) The staff does speak english as many have noted in previous posts, however they are not the friendliest or most outgoing people I have witnessed. We consulted the concierge as we left on Xmas Eve about what dinner options we might have without a reservation. Her exact response was "good luck" and pointed us at a couple of restaurants that might have available tables. We didn't expect a miracle (and realize that we were asking for one) but she just seemed to put forth no effort at all to help us. We ended up having a wonderful dinner at Gallatoire's which we ended up at due to our own research. The people who work the bar and breakfast were not much better, certainly all of them could have been nicer (and at times I considered borderline rude). I won't go on much as no one did anything particularly rude, but I wanted to counter the previous posts that said the staff were so exceptionally nice. In their defense, all of the people who worked the front door were really nice and helpful. 3.) Breakfast, I will just say avoid it, at $18 there are tons of better options. In all the hotel was average at best, the rooms small and not decorated well, and the staff could do better. I would rank this 2-3 stars, book at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and Class . Oh Yeah it's Great Too !”
Reviews.Author: johnadams88
Reviews.Content: If you want great and you want an original hotel where the hotel has put their long time employees first and their employees their guest first with a New Orlean's Charm . Stay Here ! It is close to everything , but quiet when it's time to sleep and comfortable as a retreat . We enjoyed jumping into the crowd on Bourbon Street and and hanging out in our hotel . Visit the bar where they have a waitress thats as cute as nice after 55 years of employment. It shows if you invest to your employees in a hotel they will become part of your family and they will above others be best at making you feel that you are right at home. May the hospitality and beauty of the hotel stay in place for another 100 Years. Enjoy your stay , we did .. Go Dawgs !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tiffyrd
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire, so our room was only $79 per night. The hotel is beautiful and gives off that old world new orleans charm. We were greeted by attentive and professional staff. Nothing like a stay that the Holiday Inn!!! Our room was very nice, clean, and fully stocked. Every night they have peanut butter and Jelly sandwiches and hot chocolate, very cute. When we walked up there was a line down the hall, but it was worth the wait. We didn't eat at the hotel besides the PB&J, but overall, we had a great time. I did read that the hotel was haunted and I get spooked easily, but I didn't feel like there were any extra guests in our room. Everytime I visit New Orleans, I will be staying in the Le Pavillon.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpfull staff, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecarrell1
Reviews.Content: From the reservation to the check-out eveything was perfect. Reservation was taken from personal at the hotel and spoke clear english. Lobby, dining room, and rooms were exqusit with many art quality paintings on doors, celings, and walls. Staff is very helpful from reception at check-in to the door-man when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good stay for the $$$$$”
Reviews.Author: ITguyinTN
Reviews.Content: My room was dirty and the carpet had a bad smell. the bathroom looked like it had never been upgraded. . The food was too expensive. My overall rating is low due to the amount of money i paid to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “It really is the "belle of New Orleans"”
Reviews.Author: HolaGatitos
Reviews.Content: I travel to New Orleans a lot and had not previously stayed at Le Pavillon---boy do I regret that. This really is a special place. The decor is wonderfully over-the-top Gilded Age everything. The public spaces are gorgeous. My room had all these amazing special touches....stenciling on the ceiling, wonderful molding, a porcelain shower head, a bathroom mirror that doesn't fog above the sink (how do they do that?), 60 some odd channels on the television, etc., etc. The hotel is elegant in every way. The bar and restaurant are beautiful and the late night PB&Js are a great treat! And the staff....the only thing I can compare them to is what you find at the Ritz...elegant without being fussy, no one acts snotty, everything seems pleasant. This was a truly pleasurable stay and this doesn't even consider the price which I thought a mistake when I booked this hotel online. What a bargain! I know I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: smokey20
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Le Pavillon twice and find it to be a remarkable value. It's an easy walk to the Quarter, but even more convenient to the Superdome. The regular rooms are rather small, but beautifully furnished with remodeled bathrooms that have showerheads to die for. The lobby is gorgeous, the restaurant is very good, and the staff is efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: debracake
Reviews.Content: I booked on Hotwire and overpaid -- another guest used Priceline and got the room for $80. Bummer. However, the hotel is beautiful and comfortable and the service is excellent. The pool is lovely and there is a terrace with tables and chairs -- you can order food and drinks served on the terrace. I had the PBJ and hot chocolate and it was a pleasant enough snack. The mini bar is well-stocked by WAY over-priced -- bring your own! Easy walk to streetcar line or Harrah's -- a bit of a hike to the French Quarter -- taxi service to the Quarter runs about $6-8.00. Room service pizza was hot, crusty and delicious. Coffee good too. Newspaper delivered to room each AM. All in all, a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel- Just Too Far”
Reviews.Author: conners107
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were delighted that our room was ready before noon. However, we were told we had an upgrade- our room though lovely was tiny. Difficult to manuever in.... We are walkers which is a good thing, the hotel is far from the heart of the quarter. When you leave for the day, make sure you have everything....Next time we come to NO, will try to stay more conveniently located. The staff is pleasant and helpful. Some of my favorite restaurants are in NO- go to Mr. B's- nice piano bar and delish crab cakes. Brennans Steakhouse was excellent. The new Bourbon Grill had some of the best gumbo I remember. Lively bar with TV's for sports fans.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most beautiful hotels we stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ARonen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in September. The lobby and restaurant have Beautiful Decor! Corridors are wide and the rooms are beautiful, well equipped, spotless-clean and spacious. All amenities are of the highest quality. Service was professional and the staff is very very kind. They recommended a swamp tour that indeed was a wonderful experience. Breakfast is not included and is a bit expensive, but the food was very good. Located a few minutes of Street-car ride to the French quarter. Note that when we stayed they had renovation works in the lobby, which made noise in the mornings. We would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Pavillon!”
Reviews.Author: whosaidso8
Reviews.Content: My friend found Le Pavillon during his travels to New Orleans for work. He raved about the service, quality of rooms, delicious breakfast buffet, and its location (downtown). He was right about everything! The service was wonderful. All the staff were very attentive, answered all of our questions and very accommodating. Our room was great - free internet service, good cable tv channels, great shower water pressure. The breakfast buffet was delicious. I have a few small complaints. We asked the staff to recommend a place for dinner. Though we should have been more specific about the type of place we were looking for, the restaurant we went to was not good at all. We were disappointed. The insulation between rooms was very good, however, we could hear everything happening in the hallway. Also, our shower had some plumbing issues - the tub took a long time to drain. Overall, if you are looking for a hotel, not in the French Quarter, this is it. Also, Le Pavillon is listed as one of America's historic hotels. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Ornate public areas, disappointing rooms, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeard
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon is an ornate, often grand hotel with gracious staff and disappointing rooms. The lobby, restaurant, bar and hallways are among the most impressive in New Orleans, with huge crystal chandeliers, high ceilings, elaborate statuary, and quarries of marble, as well as noteworthy paintings, and rich fabrics. Employees are delightful and welcoming. While name usage wasnâ€™t great, every employee with whom I interacted was enthusiastic, friendly, and helpful. As well, it is clear that the staff takes great pride in their workplace. Hotel dÃ©cor will either delight or disappoint. While the over the top decoration works in the public areas, in the guestrooms, these flourishes may be too much. Tasseled valences over the shower curtain, for example, can be offputting to the point of being irritating. That said, the guestrooms are disappointing, in size and dÃ©cor. Unlike modern guestroomsâ€”the building is over 100 years oldâ€”there is no entry alcove once youâ€™ve come into the room. So the room seems like a bit of a box, and a smallish one at that. The dÃ©corâ€”grand in large spacesâ€”seems dated and stilted in a guestroom. The armoire eats up much of the room tooâ€”a flat screen TV would increase the perception of space a great deal. Bathroom, though nicely finished in marble, is small by todayâ€™s standards, and looks as if decorated by a drag queen. There was some wear issuesâ€”a badly maintained bathtub, for exampleâ€”but overall, housekeeping and engineering staff work to the place looking good. Air conditioning works well. On the rooftop, there is a small though nicely furnished fitness center, as well as a great swimming pool, whirlpool, and sundeck. Great place to spend a sunny dayâ€”but tanners, note: There are only eight chaise lounges around the rather small pool. Overall, service is good, though one day, housekeeping overlooked cleaning our room, and for a luxury hotel, you might expect better name usage. Room service was prompt, but our name wasnâ€™t used by the order taker or server, and the tray wasnâ€™t picked up for hours. Breakfast was tasty, and room service for three ran about $63, with all of us feeling full. Hotelâ€™s location is about 6 blocks from the beginning of Bourbon Street, in the area of downtown New Orleans convenient to some office buildings, about halfway between the Mississippi River and the Superdome. While nearby to many attractions, the blocks surrounding the hotel can be a bit desolate on nights and weekends, and based upon local recommendations, caution is advised walking back from the French Quarter after dark. Le Pavillon has many nice added value features. Fitness center usage, wireless internet, and nightly peanut butter sandwiches in the lobby are all complimentary to guests. This is a member of The Leading Hotels of the World, and by comparison, travelers used to the standards of other LHW hotels may find these rooms disappointing. In my opinion, the rooms are in need of renovation and updating, for certain. At full price, this hotel may disappoint given the rooms. I reserved the hotel for $53 a night on Priceline, so all of these amenities were a great value at this priceâ€”though the rather noteworthy low Priceline rate was more likely an indication of the New Orleans hotel market and the slow Labor Day weekend than the state of the room product. Finally, New Orleans looks great, at least in the areas tourists are most likely to visit. The only evidence of Katrina damage in the downtown and French Quarter areas are a few boarded up hotels (neither the Hyatt nor the Fairmont have reopened) and a lack of tourism at times, included a once thriving riverfront mallâ€”Riverwalk--that is now 50% vacant and ill-visited. In some ways, the city is more appealing than ever for travelersâ€”and hotel values abound. If you have any doubt about a visit to New Orleans, look beyond them and by all means, make the trip. Not only will you have a wonderful time here, but nothing would hasten the recovery of this unique city than a return to previous tourism levels. . .

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: lsu-since-60
Reviews.Content: Simply put, best hotel we've ever stayed at in New Orleans. My wife and I have been going to New Orleans for 20+ years and have stayed at many excellent hotels, but LePavillon is the best of all. Not as convenient as some others located in the Frenchquarter, but close enough. Very friendly and helpful staff, though the parking was expensive at $28.00 per. The hotel was as magnificent as a work of art and even though very old it didn't smell old as is the case with some others we've stayed at. My kids (4 & 7) loved the PP&J set-up in the lobby every night from 10:00 to 11:00, especially the incredible hot chocolate. Now, saving the best for last, the breakfast. Everything was as good as I've ever tasted, with a breakfast chef to made you fresh omelets or waffles(the banana's foster waffle is worth the trip from anywhere). I will be returning for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic and romantic dream...”
Reviews.Author: Ralph82
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent two great nights in New Orleans. We booked the hotel via Cheaptickts.com and arrived after an exhausting drive from Houston, TX. At arrival, the friendy hotel staff parked our car, took care of our luggage and checked us in quickly. The beautiful lobby and crystal room reminded me of a fairytale. The room was spotless, beautifully decorated but not very spacious. The rooftop swimmingpool and jacuzzi were truly amazing. After a great first night in Bourbon Street (you must visit the Preservation Hall) we took a refreshing late night swim (1am). We enjoyed the amazing views. To conclude: friendly staff, spotless room, beautyful and romantic environment, great city. Beyond our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: MatrixKDS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Le Pavillon during the Fourth of July weekend while in town for the Essence Music Festival. The hotel was very beautiful. I broke my foot prior to arriving and was confined to a wheelchair for most of the trip. Although the hotel did not have a permanent handicap ramp, the staff was very accommodating and would quickly bring out the portable ramp. The staff actually added a bell at the entryway to ring for the temporary wheelchair ramp during my stay. Our room was very comfortable and quite. There was an issue with the air conditioning when we arrived, but it was quickly fixed. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job and the conceirge very helpful with arranging our tours. The breakfast buffett was a little pricey but well worth the money. We ate breakfast at the hotel every day. Also, the evening hot chocolate & PB&J sandwich bar was a great treat! The staff at the Le Pavillon were very friendly & helpful. The hotel was within easy walking distance from the Superdome, Riverwalk and the French Quarter. I definately plan on staying at the Le Pavillon again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: bamagrandmother
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Le Pavillon for our anniversary. We happened to be in New Orleans for my birthday the weekend of Hurricane Katrina and had to evacuate on that Sunday with the rest of the city. It had been almost 2 years since we had returned to New Orleans. I wasn't sure what to expect but the staff at Le Pavillon welcomed us back to a city that we love & had missed. We arrived by lunch time and we were given a room immediately. The walk to the French quarter was a nice stroll & felt safe. When we returned a complimentary bottle of champagne awaited us. We plan to stay at the Le Pavillon again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusanMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: While the room itself was a little dated and the hotel shows its age, we had a lovely stay. It is a wonderful hotel for couples, the concierge and other staff were extremely helpful and courteous, and the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff! Would go back”
Reviews.Author: alyson003
Reviews.Content: Was concerned that a 100 year old hotel may feel stuffy and old, but was pleasantly surprised. My room was a good size considering the age. Comfortable bed. Staff was very friendly. The decor was somewhat stuffy and dated looking, but everything was very clean. The pool on the rooftop was neat and pool cabanas were available. Went to the bar for a few late night drinks and had a good time. Don't miss the pbjs at 10pm. They really will hit the spot. Ask for the history of the hotel and you may get a write-up of all the ghost sightings! The 9th floor seems to have the most activity. I guess they were quiet when I was there, I didn't see any. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: StevenandBrenda
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our vacation in New Orleans and Houston. One night was spent at this beautiful hotel. The staff is very hospitable and professional. The rooms and baths are on the small side, but very nice with the traditional amenities. There is also a safe in the closet. The public rooms are very ornate and include a row of huge crystal chandeliers from the front entry and lobby through the dining room. The pool and hot tub are on the roof. The view from the roof is fantastic at night. There are also cabanas, tables and chairs. This is the only area of the hotel that allows smoking. I believe smoking is no longer permitted inside any hotel or restaurant in Louisiana. A breakfast buffet is served in the dining room. Pat is still there cooking omelets and singing!!! It was excellent, but expensive at $16.99 per person. Complimentary peanut butter and jelly sandwiches with hot chocolate are served in the lobby every night at 10:00 pm. There is really nothing in the immediate vicinity to do. The French Quarter is about 3 blocks away. Four of us took a cab to the French Quarter at the corner of Bourbon and Canal street for less than $8.00. Go several blocks down Poydras toward the river and there are hotels and restaurants. The Hilton and The Riverwalk Mall are at the end of Poydras with Harrahs Casino across the Street. Parking at the hotel is easy and safe. The lot is beside the hotel and is $28.00 per day for self or valet parking. This was our second visit to Le Pavillon, but not our last. The service was great from the door man dressed in his "great white hunter" outfit to Pat singing in the dining room as she prepared our eggs. We booked our 2 rooms through Hotwire for $72.00 per room. This was less than what we paid in 1994.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon's customer service makes up for its blemishes...”
Reviews.Author: DomerCajun
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Le Pavillon three or four times and love it each time. The hotel staff makes the stay enjoyable as they are all very professional and friendly. The hotel is a bit farther away from the French Quarter and Harrah's so you probably need a cab (they are easy to find) to get to most places. Although, it really is not too bad of a walk if you have 10 or 15 minutes. The only drawback are the beds (not as comfortable as a Starwood hotel but decent). The bedding could use a little updating, but the rooms are nicely decorated. The bathrooms are medium sized but have great style (ie marble). As always, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 4.5 star”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: Loud AC, room a bit musty. Sheets crisp, but bedding old. Not sure where all the great reviews are coming from, but this hotel is more like a 3+ star, not 4+. Location not ideal, and plan to pay up for parking. Bathroom and tub a bit funky. Beware if booking on Hotwire if you think you are going to get the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: misstaryn08
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice in general. The outside was beautiful, the lobby stunning, the crystal room luxurious. The room that I stayed in ( double queen) was reasonable but nothing impressive. There was careful detail to framed art, and fancy drapes, but I was not 100% comfortable with the cleanliness of the bathroom. It appeared clean but there was mildew and rust, and the tile looked far from new. I also didn't like that I could hear guest walking past my room more than I thought I should hear in a hotel, so I was a little unsure about how much privacy my boyfriend and I were experiencing. On the good side, the TV was huge, lots of channels, and free internet is always a plus. The pool on the roof is definetley something to brag about, but I was very diappointed when my boyfriend and I went up for a midnight swim and our time was ruined by roaches by the pool and hottub. We spotted more than 3 in the 30minutes that we spent up there so I'm sure there were more. Roaches are not something that I would expect from a 4.5 star hotel. All together, my boyfriend and I had a great time. He was a super fan of the pb and j! The French Quarter was kind of far, but we still walked and enjoyed the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, big room, far from french quarter”
Reviews.Author: minibargrrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Pavillion hotel for three nights in May 2007. The hotel lobby is quite beautiful, crystal chandeliers, etc. But during our stay, it was being repainted, and was mostly covered in scaffolding the whole visit. The best part of this hotel is it's people, The service it outstanding by any means, everyone is cordial and friendly! The hotel pool is a blast on the roof! The rooms are very nice, and very large. We had a view of the downtown of the hotel. The food served at the hotel is very good, even room service - yummy! They have a beautiful bar as well, but the songstress at night is pretty awful!! In a town known for it's music, I would hire someone else to sing! Cocktails were excellent. The drawback to this hotel is that it's very far from the french quarter, we took a cab there and back everyday - it's not walkable at all.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful memory at Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: alikat33
Reviews.Content: Right before Katrina, we stayed at Le Pavillon. I had been there before in the restaurant, but never stayed there. We had two rooms booked; one for me and my fiance and one for his parents. When checking in, they asked if we'd mind being upgraded to the presidential suite. Um...NO, we wouldn't mind! LOL It was truly a special memory for all of us. The grandeur, the elegance of the rooms in the suite were just beautiful. (gold sinks!!) During the aftermath of Katrina and the looting, I was heartbroken to think of the looters ruining this fabulous hotel. (I don't know if they had problems with looting or not) A truly elegant hotel I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with character, in a city of characters”
Reviews.Author: Aiko3
Reviews.Content: I wound up staying at this hotel through a recommendation of a co-worker. It's near the business district, but still close to the French Quarter. It's not "right there" in the middle of the action, but just a short walk. Definitely not one of those cookie-cutter hotels, as it definitely has its own unique feel and old time charm. PB&J sandwiches at 10pm in the lobby is an extra bonus, as are the other personal touches, and free wi-fi. The rates are reasonable too. I will be staying there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: South Of The Mason Dixon Line
Reviews.Title: “Order, Elegance, Pleasure, Peace, and Opulence”
Reviews.Author: Irishgirl1969
Reviews.Content: The words from my review title are from Arthur Rimbaud. He was a French Romantic Poet. He knew some things about Beauty and Romance. If you are interested in these things then you too will Love Le Pavillon. Le Pavillon is Gorgeous. It is full of Antiques, Antique Art, Chandeliers, Marble and Beautiful Rugs. I have a lifelong interest in Antiques, and I decided to stay in The Victorian Suite, because the pictues of it were so Lovely. It was Fabulous. The Antiques were Beautiful, and the two handcarved Rosewood beds are fit for a King and a Queen. The Food is Yummy. The Lounge is Lovely and furnishes Entertainment. The rooftop Pool is truly---off the hook----. There are a couple of Private cabanas available for those who get lucky. I was able to get one. The Pool is very, very clean, as is the entire Pool and sundeck area. I also stayed in The Mallard Suite. It has an Antique Canopy Bed and a Jacuzzi. It is smallish, but very well-appointed. The Jacuzzi was clean and in perfect working order. The Marble in the bathrooms at Le Pavillon is Gorgeous. The Wallpaper, Bedding, Drapes, and Rugs are all very nice looking. I appreciate Beauty, and I also like Beautiful Behavior. The staff at Le Pavillon is Incredibly Nice, and they know what they are doing. The place runs like a well-oiled machine. I always got my Food done correctly and served at the right temperature. The cleanliness was Very Good, and this is coming from a Nurse folks, so it isn't easy to pass my inspection. You cannot expect to stay in a 100 year old place that it full of Antiques and not find some dust here or there. I will take a spot of dust in return for what Massive Luxury Le Pavillon offers. This is a five star Hotel and it is a One Of A Kind On This Earth. I give them my official "A" in all categories. There is no better thing in America than getting what you pay for, and Le Pavillon is not cheap. You pay a high price for Massive Beauty and Privacy. Sign me up for next year too, and every year after that. I'm in Love.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diver4ab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at Le Pavillon. The hotel is beautiful but it's the staff that makes this hotel wonderful. They are very attentive and friendly. The pool and hot tub area, located on the roof is very inviting. After walking all day retreating to the pool area with a book and a "Hurricane" was just what we needed. New Orleans has something for everyone. Would reccomend an airboat ride through the swamps, a visit to the aquarium, zoo and IMAX to see "Hurricane on the Bayou. My husband and I walked everywhere in N.O. and never felt unsafe. The food is fantastic but it was the people of New Orleans that make it a great place. We will visit N.O. again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon worked for us”
Reviews.Author: Nogbad
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in the hotel in the week after Easter. It was entirely as advertised: a period hotel with many unspoilt features and helpful staff. We liked the roof top pool; the beds; the peanut butter and jelly; the dining room; the newspapers delivered to our room in the morning. The concierge service was courteous and reliable. Even the exterior repainting was handled without inconvenience to guests. Well done Le Pavillon.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillion's impressive service”
Reviews.Author: cliquot
Reviews.Content: A smaller hotel doing a fine job, Le Pavilion was a great all-around experience. The hotel is walking distance (4 blocks) from the quarter, in a safe, well-lit area of the central business district. New Orleans Arena is also walking distance. We upgraded to a junior suite for a very reasonable price ($40 per night) from the regular room that we booked. The suite wasn't huge, but was well appointed and comfortable. Toiletries were above average, and the rainfall shower-jacuzzi tub were great after a long day of walking. Didn't try the restaurant (too many great restaurants to try), but the piano bar was nice. The reason to return is the service. A frequent traveler to upscale hotels, I was still impressed by the civility, thoughtfulness, and genuine warmth from the staff. This is not a "chain" experience, and I mean that in the best sense of the phrase!

Reviews.Title: “Warm hospitality, great location and room”
Reviews.Author: MdChowhound
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay in New Orleans for a conference in March '07, and my stay at Le Pavillon was fantastic. This hotel is located in the Central Business District, with a short walk to the SuperDome, French Quarter and RiverWalk. The property is meticulously maintained, from the rooftop pool and veranda to the public spaces to the rooms themselves. The service I received was very attentive, courteous, yet warm and personal as well. Everyone we met with greeted us with a smile and helped with everything from personal accommodations for our room to restaurant reservations. One unique service this hotel provides is the nightly "snack time" of peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, hot chocolate, fruit and fresh bread. This long standing tradition is just one example of the "southern hospitality" we received on our trip. I would like to visit New Orleans again in the near future to see more of the city (I was only able to see the French Quarter and Garden District this time around) and I will have no qualms about staying at Le Pavillon again.

Reviews.Title: “Old Glory, off the beaten path but walking distance to the FQ (daytime only)”
Reviews.Author: KR
Reviews.Content: I don't have much time to write a review, except to say the staff is exceptional in most cases. This is an old hotel, on the Natl Registry of Historic Places (or Hotels, something like that). So don't expect six elevators, but DO expect an awesome buffet served up by a woman you wish you'd had as a nanny, and quirks such as peanut butter cookie treats (and sandwiches in the lobby nightly). I stayed there one night and loved the place and its history...my room had an electric fireplace and a wet bar, but with creaky floors and the noisy elevator shaft nearby, I doubt it'd be my choice for an extended business stay.

Reviews.Title: “peace, quiet, and elegance”
Reviews.Author: tomdelux
Reviews.Content: I finally found a hotel in New Orleans that is peaceful and quiet compared to the rowdy convention hotels on Canal Street and Bourbon Street! I enjoyed my one night stay and will return. The staff is truly eager to please and very friendly. The breakfast is amazing and actually worth $16.99. Wish I had time to enjoy the beautiful rooftop pool. This centurion dowager is rich with history and beautiful architectural details. To be a true five star hotel, a little freshening up is needed. Every surface in the corridors and rooms should be repainted and probably complete carpet replacement is needed too. Don't let the little imperfections pervent you from enjoying a truly unique New Orleans experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: janders36
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this wonderful hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpul, and they went out of their way to make us feel at home. It is the personal touches, like turning your sheets down for you in the evening and the PB&J's with cocoa in the lobby every night, that makes this place special. Gustave, the conceirge, was especially nice. The rooftop courtyard is so peaceful. The room we stayed in was large and beautifully decorated, as was the rest of the hotel. Check out the first two floors of the gorgeous stairwell, it is a hidden gem. Staff at the Pavillon know what they are doing.

Reviews.Title: “French Elegance at its Best!”
Reviews.Author: instyleval
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay! A friend of mine and I shared the Deluxe Double Queen room and it was wonderful!! Very well decorated and well worth the money. We had brunch in the Crystal Room which was TRULY FABULOUS! This is a must! I missed the famous PB&J sandwiches they serve for free from 10 to 11pm.. but I heard its a reall treat as well. Staff was friendly and attentive. Will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more perfect!”
Reviews.Author: shannonh12
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night Saturday, Feb. 17. It was way more than we expected! The lobby is gorgeous and the room was great! We were really impressed with the extra attention to detail in our room. It had the prettiest ceiling of any room that I have slept in! You'd have to see a picture to understand. Also, it was such a short, safe walk from the French Quarter. We were there during Mardi Gras and the largest parade was a block or two away. It was the perfect location. We couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Not at ALL what I expected”
Reviews.Author: lhusseini
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked Le Pavillion b/c a couple of friends mentioned it was a nice hotel and it was centrally located for us (quick ride from airport, 10 minute walk to French Quarter from hotel, etc.). The front desk staff was very pleasant, they even upgraded our room when we checked in. Although the exterior of the hotel looks nice, and the lobby is definitely impressive, the rooms need updating DESPARATELY. First off, the bed was extremely lumpy and old. The HVAC in our room was poor; the room was stuffy, so we turned on the AC, but it made a rattling noise the entire time we had it on (in addition to the bed, it was very difficult to sleep). When we left the room, housekeeping would turn up the heat (the weekend we were down there was unusually cold for NO) and the room would be stuffy again. The bedding was dated (blankets were cheap and our pillows were flat...literally, you could fold them in half and they weren't supportive at all) and carpeting was dingy. The bathrooms are very small and the shower fixtures are old and covered in soap scum. Overall, I was not impressed by the hotel. The service was fine, the front desk staff was the most pleasant; the conceirge could take a lesson or two from them in the personality department.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to REALLY enjoy a stay at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: lgnutah
Reviews.Content: Snazzy new hotels are a dime a dozen. It is not often one gets to be transported back 100 years to a time of elegance and pampering.....but that's how one feels beginning the minute one pulls up in front of Le Pavillion Hotel in New Orleans. I cannot remember ever staying at a hotel where the staff truly made me feel it was THEIR pleasure that I was taken care of. You WILL enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “It only gets better!”
Reviews.Author: TexasSM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Le Pavillon many times over the last dozen years, or so. Although we have been by ourselves on several occasions, once we brought one other couple, and another time we brought three other couples. We have never been disappointed, nor have our friends. The restaurant is also very good. Of course, it has to be. It's in New Orleans. We always try to participate in the evening PB&J ritual, especially if we have brought friends who are new to the hotel. The staff is outstanding. They seem to have an unusual loyalty to their owners, and want to make them proud. It's our favorite place to stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: IADDutch
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a 4 1/2 star hotel, I would give it 3 stars at best! We went for a long weekend to NOLA, and based on the reviews I expected to spend 4 nights at a grand, classic hotel with all the services that one would expect at a place like this. Well, let me tell you what I found. There is no spa. No coffee maker in the room. The 'updated' room I booked was run down and old. When I asked for another room, they suggested a room with two queens instead of a king - how romantic. The exercise room was in disrepair. The pool was closed for maintenance. The elevators were less than clean. On saturday night, the bar and restaurant were closed for a private party, only room service available. Three out of four nights, the turndown service either didn't happen, or wasn't done right. One evening we found cleaning supplies on the floor in the middle of the room. What could have been a great weekend ended up as a great disappointment. Oh, and by the way, with the current crime problem in NOLA, it is too far from the french quarter to walk. There are many hotel choices closer and probably better in service.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff and a Best Buy”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLawyerNYC
Reviews.Content: A completely-independent property like this can only survive on strong word of mouth, and after staying four nights here, I can see why this one consistently earns such allocates from TripAdvisor reviewers. I had high expectations after reading the TA reviews, and the hotel did not disappoint. La Pavillon offers old-timey essence-of-hospitality service and an irreplaceable Grande Dame decor, with suprisingly-modern amenities, like free Wi-Fi (and wired) Internet and dual-line, direct-inward-dial room phones. Hands-down a Best Buy. The superb concierges have outstanding knowlege, recommendations, and character: when my girlfriend left thousands of dollars of jewelry on the nightstand while we rushed to a swamp tour, the Chief Concierge offered personally to retrieve it and lock it in the hotel safe, genuinely-happy to have saved us hours of worry. Our four days zipped by as we explored tours and trips, the best of which were the ones recommended by the Concierges: our guide on the Cajun Honey Island swamp tour was outstanding, as was the small boat he used; our walking-tour guide in the Garden District and cemetary was the best I have ever experienced, the jazz club the concierge recommended on Frenchman's Street was first-rate. These were truly the most knowledgeable and thoughtful concierges I have had the pleasure of dealing with at any hotel anywhere, ever. They weren't trip-sellers; they were educated, articulate people who knew and loved their city and knew exactly how to help you experience it. Only a hotel that has been there for one hundred years could so consistently do everything right, including doing all sorts of little things to let you know how much they appreciate your business. When a bulb burned out in the bathroom, maintenance was there literally in five minutes. Room service was quick and delicious, a cut above what you'd find at a chain hotel. Every staff member we encountered was warm, willing, and acted like it was his or her privilege to help us, offering zillions of little kindnesses during our trip. Maid service was quick and flawless, and the extensive, quality selection of toiletries and such harkened back to when hotels really wanted you to have and use this stuff, and bring it home to spread their name. The PB&J tradition is inspired, and is a nice opportunity to share raves about this gem with other guests. Cabs are readily-available, but the location makes walking to the Riverwalk, the Aquarium, the Quarter and the CBD all very easy. I should say that the hotel does not offer stuffy, oh-so-refined-but-just-a-little-condescending service like some high-end chains. Rather, it offers genuinely-competent, genuinely-caring, genuinely-friendly service that is there the moment you seek it and sometimes even before you think to ask for it. There is no question that we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Family Holiday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: nomuggles
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 , were upgraded to a deluxe room w/ 2 queen beds. Excellent staff assistance and location convenient to all FQ and Midtown activities. Take your kids on the free ferry to Algiers for Mardi Gras World! Staying between Christmas and New Years brings the benefit of Holiday events and decor. Lobby is spectacular, the PB&J and cocoa are legendary, and the room rates a bargain at such a fabulous historic property. Parking is $28 a day, so factor that into your daily stay. Wonderful first NOLA visit for our kids, a definite consideration for future adult stays.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: dbb1845
Reviews.Content: Have been planning a trip to New Orleans since before Katrina and wanted to do our part in helping rebuild. Le Pavillon is part of the Preferred Hotel Group. We have stayed at a number of these properties and have never been dissapointed. Since we knew nothing of New Orleans we booked here and were delighted with our choice. The staff is one of the friendliest we have ever encounted at any hotel. This property is smaller than some of the larger hotels on Poydras and consequently they give you a more personalized experiece. It was a pleasant stroll to the French Quarter, Superdome, Casino or Convention Center. We walked everywhere. The restaurant is as good as some of the overpriced tourist traps in the French Quarter and Pat the chef does an outstanding breakfast. Charles our waiter was the quintessential N'Orleans southern gentlemen.

Reviews.Title: “Still rebuilding”
Reviews.Author: fmjmemphis
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel I frequent whenever I am in New Orleans and have stayed since the hurricane more than once. In February, they were short staffed but the staff that was there made up for the shortage. It is obvious that things were in short supply, the hotel's once luxurious breakfast which was an indulgence was a disappointment. Basket of breads was nothing like it used to be it looked as though the baker did not come in and they went to Costco and bought the goods. The main issue was that the valet parking lot was full. WHAT? They wanted you to find a space on the street and then hike it back to the hotel. I was travelling with a person who cannot walk distances and arrived at night. I declined this offer and forced them to find a space in the lot. They finally did and told me that if anything happened to the car then that was my issue. However, I believe in this hotel usually it is a steal at the price and the accommodations are stunning. I am sure that things kinks have been worked out and I would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: trip46
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Le Pavilion for 3 nights Veteran's Day weekend and could not have been happier. The staff was helpful, the room clean and housekeeping lightning quick. The breakfast buffet was great, too. The location was close enough to walk to the FQ without the noise of the FQ. Overall, excellent and BEAUTIFUL place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: nybill88
Reviews.Content: Having stayed there for one night our only complaint was that we couldnt stay for a week. It would be difficult to find fault with the rooms, or the staff at this hotel. The 10PM peanut butter party is unique and very clever of the staff to have this. Highly recommend this hotel should you stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: pittgirl99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip to New Orleans to celebrate our first anniversary -- and we were not disappointed. We booked a room at the Le Pavillon after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, and it was well worth it! The hotel is elegant and stately, and our deluxe room was beautiful (antique furnishings, large king bed, shower/tub combo). The concierge was wonderful in providing us many suggestions for restaurants, getting around town, and places to visit. We especially loved the PB&J and cocoa treat at night -- it's like a little taste of home. The hotel's location, while some reviewers have said it is far, is a very easy walk to the French Quarter and two blocks from the bus stop to the Garden District (the St. Charles Streetcar is not currently running). At night, we walked well-lit streets and "walked with a purpose" and never felt unsafe. We loved our stay -- and will definetly be back.

Reviews.Title: “A True Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: Scarlet27
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at the grand entrance, you know you are somewhere very unique. I was greeted by a gracious doorman and then escorted up to my room. I had booked a regular room, but quickly upgraded to a junior suite when I saw the difference. It's well worth the additional money for the upgrade. This is what you visit New Orleans for!!! Room Service was prompt and delicious, the concierge on duty was informative about the city and the hotel was simply the most beautiful I have visited. I look forward to my next visit and am thrilled to have found such a diamond in the rough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, welcoming staff!”
Reviews.Author: ursacat
Reviews.Content: I must say, I was delighted to stay at Le Pavilion. I had no idea how beautiful a Hotel it really was until I arrived for my meetings this week. But that's just the physical space. What I wanted to really say is how truly wonderful everyone from the front door to the front desk was. Not just the usual greeting but it seemed a true welcome to New Orleans spirit. We had the chance to dine out at a few restaurants off the beaten path and the same spirit was evident.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Stay....”
Reviews.Author: geohanks67
Reviews.Content: I recently had the incredible experience of spending 3 nights at the amazing Le Pavillion Hotel in New Orleans!!! From the time you arrive, you are greeted with warm welcomes, friendly smiles, and first class service. Every member of the service team is extremely professional and very willing to be of assistance. The lobby and hotel are decorated in elegant period furnishings; which along with the Southern Hospitality, really helps to bring the modern day guest back to a period in history when luxury and sophistication really mattered. One of the service team members informed me that it is Le Pavillion's 100th year in operation, but one would certainly, never know it from the modern amenities and conditions. Check out the roof top pool, the view is incredible. There is also a hot tub and private cabanas. I should have worked out in the state of the art gym, but maybe next trip. The Wireless Modem Connections made conducting business in between site seeing a breeze. The sleeping accommodations are superb!!! For the record, this reviewer, requires a good 8 hours of restful sleep nightly, and Le Pavillion hit the mark!!! Awesome sheets and quality bedding & mattresses!!! The dinning at Le Pavillion is exceptional. Breakfast and Lunch were two of my personal experiences, and they were both delicious. But has anyone every had a bad meal in NOLA??? I highly recommend Pam's Martinee's in Piano Bar Lounge, and if you want watch Monday Night Football, Pam has no problem turning on the game for you!!! NOLA is coming back strong and Le Pavillion is the place to stay!!! Close to everything, and well located to all the hot spots in town!!! I assure you, you cannot go wrong with a stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sweet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chiclunatique
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were greeted with a friendly and accomodating staff. We were shown to our room, which was spacious and well appointed. Our first morning, we eventually came down for breakfast, but discovered we missed it by 10 minutes. Lynnesa, a sweet waitress, told us she could grab a couple of bagels and coffee anyway. We were able to enjoy a quick bite, despite our late arrival, we were so grateful. The PB&J sandwich tradition was really special too. Overall a great place to stay, it felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: tgony
Reviews.Content: The staff at LePavillon was incredible. They helped us feel comfortable and made our stay extremely enjoyable. The hotel is beautiful, the food was some of the best we had in the city (and that's saying a lot for New Orleans). It was true southern hospitality! The spirit and fun of New Orleans is back at the LePavillon Hotel. I'm originally from New Orleans, but moved to NYC over 20 years ago. Going back to view the destruction from Katrina was horrible. The staff at LePavillon made all the difference. It was home again!

Reviews.Title: “A Disaster”
Reviews.Author: rohese
Reviews.Content: I came to New Orleans for a 2 month stay as a contractor working for a government agency, and long-term housing at LePavillon was provided. At first, the chandeliers and the lobby promised a luxury experience, but it only took a few hours to dispel those expectations! As other reviews have already made clear, the bedrooms and bathrooms are dirty, musty - the whole hotels smells like mold - the bedding is old and worn-out, and the temperature controls don't work. The hotel staff has obviously been well-versed as to what constitutes "southern hospitality," but in spite of this overweening solicitousness (within five minutes, staff is calling you by your first name), they cannot be relied on to execute requests for simple wake-up calls or other basic services. Rooms and restaurant are overpriced, the food is mediocre, and the hotel is generally half-empty. Requests for better mattresses are ignored by the managerial staff; the hotel bills you for incidentals without your knowledge or without submitting the list of incidentals they are billing you for to you in advance (my daughter and her son were substantially overbilled for mini-bar charges they did not incur). In my own mini-bar, I discovered an opened, half-drunken bottle of white wine - which, while I reported it, has not been removed or replaced in over 3 weeks! Dirty moldy interiors, worn-out bedding, unresponsive management, and sloppy billing - check in at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: nolaguest
Reviews.Content: We were guests this past weekend, in a "Junior Suite" at $229.00 per night. Check-in was very slow and cumbersome. The Front Desk clerk stated they were not expecting anyone in their "Junior Suites" over the weekend so he would have to send housekeeping to a suite and check on the condition (I was very surprised by this considering we had a reservation for a Junior Suite). It took half an hour to obtain entrance to the room. The room was classic "Victorian" in decor. However, there were flaws. The couch was worn, the carpet was split, and the bed was extremely soft. All-in-all the room was "musty." There was an atmosphere of "old world charm" but the condition of the room did not meet the rate. Dinner in the hotel restaurant was memorable because it felt like a walk-in freezer! All guests were complaining about the temperature. The food was "OK" ... not great, not bad ... but did not rise to the $97.00 bill for Dinner (two entrees, two soft drinks, two bowls of soup). Drinks served in the hotel lounge were well mixed and comparable to the pricing. The much-advertised peanut butter and jelly sandwich with hot chocolate and milk offering at 10:00PM was interesting.
