We walked into the lobby at 10:10PM to find 80% of the sandwiches gone, only skim milk served in pint cartons available, and barely enough hot chocolate in the container to pour one drink. It's a great idea and nice touch but at least don't run out of everything in ten minutes (on a night when the hotel's staff told me they were running about 40% occupancy). The Breakfast buffet was tasty and well prepared. And at $18.00 per person it should have been. All-in-all I'm glad we stayed, it was a unique experience, but I doubt we'll be back due to the apparent decline of the property. I highly suggest the owners invest in new carpeting and bedding in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: krbonil
Reviews.Content: I don't look for much in a hotel room in New Orleans because we tend to spend most of our time in the city as opposed to in the hotel. However, even with that in mind, I wouldn't return here. The lobby is beautiful but the room itself was disappointing. The bedding and carpet were musty, the phone did not work, nor did the hairdryer. The staff was polite and happy to see people returning to the city, but I couldn't help but feel annoyed when waiting and waiting (and waiting) for the valet to retrieve our car. Which I could see from the hotel steps. Parked in the lot next to the hotel. There are some good online deals from time to time, but for people looking to stay in or near the Quarter, I'd recommend looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jecrensh
Reviews.Content: One of the more recent reviews suggests Le Pavillon displays what may be called pretend elegance. Well, sometimes it's fun to pretend! Le Pavillon is historic, it looks great, and provides amenities beyond the norm. It makes it easy to feel like you are experiencing luxury. Also, all the staff seemed to have been very happy to work there and were proud of their hotel. Their positive attitude came across in what appeared to be a genuine desire to make our stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pokerman
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in mid-June. Location is excellent, just a few blocks from the N.O. Aquarium, Harrah's Casino, French Quarter and the Riverwalk Mall. Staff was competent and friendly. Room was clean. Pool on top of roof was refreshing but the area surrounding it (cabanas, seats, decking, carpet, etc.) was a bit worn and needs an update. As far as the city is concerned, it is what is is (and always has been). It's hot, dirty and crime ridden. We go for the shopping, restaurants and to visit distant family and know to stay in the hotel after a certain hour and not go to certain areas at any time.

Reviews.Title: “In Terms of Luxury, Le Pavillon Falls Short of the Mark”
Reviews.Author: J_Thornhill
Reviews.Content: The uniformly glowing reviews of this property make me even more regretful that my own visit was not nearly as enjoyable. I visited in March of 2005, on my first visit to New Orleans. To be fair, it should be stated that I checked in at the Pavillon after more than a week at the Maison Orleans, arguably one of the finest hotels in the south, owned and operated by the adjacent Ritz-Carlton. Nonetheless, I had been seduced by the gorgeous website and with a few more days in the city, I was hopeful that the Pavillon would offer a change of scenery. It certainly did. The hotelâ€™s exterior is nothing less than breathtaking, especially at night, standing in sharp contrast to the relatively modern buildings of the business district. Unfortunately, the exterior is where my happy memories of this hotel end. The lobby might be described as grand if one has little experience with grandeur. Yes, there was plenty of marble and several chandeliers, yet these things alone do not define luxury. Close inspection of nearly any area reveals the use of inexpensive materials and a lack of attention to detail â€“ tell-tale signs of a renovation budget spread painfully thin. It may have been thought charming and no doubt economical to retain the ancient and disarming check-in â€œcageâ€�, but the installation of a more modern and welcoming reception area would have proven a much wiser investment. The check-in process itself was a decidedly dull affair, not unlike a visit to the DMV, with the agent exhibiting only the barest modicum of hospitality. Carrying my own bags to my room, the elevator opened onto a poorly-lit and dingy hallway which had apparently been overlooked during the recent â€œmulti-million dollar renovationsâ€� touted in the brochures. Gaudy murals could not hide the obvious neglect. Not surprisingly, the room itself perfectly met each of my already low expectations. Red and green jewel tones dominated the dÃ©cor revealing an even more futile attempt at â€œold-worldâ€� opulence. The Pavillon has obviously yet to learn the lesson that true luxury cannot be mass-produced. Try to imagine a â€œTreasures from Old New Orleansâ€� hour on the Home Shopping Network, and you will begin to understand my disappointment. The staff was as attentive and professional as one might expect them to be without proper training. Most seemed to go about their duties with an air of awkward confusion; inoffensive, but not terribly helpful. I recall some bewilderment regarding my ability to take breakfast in the main dining room. Some misguided young couple had apparently decided to celebrate the happiest day of their lives in that room, and paying guests were being re-routed to the bar area for breakfast in preparation for the event. I and several other guests naturally refused, and remained in limbo for about fifteen minutes before finally being allowed inside. The staff in the dining room were friendly, though subject to a rather unorthodox ranking system which provided some servers with â€œassistantsâ€�; a situation I have yet to encounter again. I would note however, that the breakfast itself was quite good. My only consolation for the â€œPavillon Affairâ€� (as I now refer to it) is that my overall experience in the beautiful Crescent City was enjoyable due to the warm, welcoming and wonderful people who live there. In terms of accommodations, the city is filled with any number of delightful hotels and B&Bâ€™s. To make your visit to New Orleans the delight it ought to be, I would recommend staying somewhere other than Le Pavillon.

Reviews.Title: “Neat experience!”
Reviews.Author: sjblackman
Reviews.Content: First trip to NOLA; did a lot of research before booking. Thought pictures looked beautiful - was not disappointed. It was in walking distance to many things; a $5 cab ride will get you to the French Quarter. The staff was extremely friendly and interested in our stay. I was a little concerned when I walked in with my two small children (2 and 3 yrs old) because the place is like a muesem! But no one seemed to care that I had two munchkins in tow - in fact, many people stopped to talk to both of them. Housekeeping staff was very friendly! Always asked me how things were when I saw them. Hotel room was the typical setup, but with plenty of crown molding and other nice touches that made it seem more like a bed and breakfast. The breakfast buffet, although pricey, was nice. I was full until late afternoon. At least go look at the dining room - it is lovely. Pool was beautiful. It might be considered a little small, but it was only myself and one other family, so it was plenty of space. My kids LOVED the peanut butter reception. Was a nice, quaint touch in such an R rated city. Everyone mingled around feel-good sandwiches and hot chocolate. Again, made it seem like a B&B. Negatives - VERY expensive food in mini-bar. Don't even tough it b/c it's monitered by infared lasers. My husband found a spider the size of Mount Everest in the sink. Otherwise, very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, although a bit slow...”
Reviews.Author: Karacg
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful. The rooms are nice, nothing extraordinary...but they are clean and the turn-down service is great. We were celebrating our anniversary so they upgraded us, and sent up a bottle of champagne and a fruit basket along with a nice note from management. These little details are what make a hotel exceptional in my opinion. Breakfast was excellent. We got a sandwich in the bar and it took for-e-ver. But, the staff is all so friendly and accomodating you forgive them their laissez-faire attitude. The hotel is a little further from the French Quarter than I would like, but when the streetcar is back up and running it will be fine, as the garden district will be easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Not as impressed as others...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip back to New Orleans after evacuating the Saturday before Katrina. I chose to stay at Le Pavillon because of the rave reviews. Maybe I caught them on a bad weekend because I was not that impressed. The hotel lobby IS beautiful, the room was nice, but the decorative pillows on the beds were worn and torn. Our bathroom was not cleaned well after our first night (of four). We took our 3 month old son for his first swim in the rooftop pool (which is small but lovely) and there were no towels. I called the front desk and was told they would bring them right up; 45 minutes later we had to wrap our shivering infant in a hotel robe because there still were no towels. The hot chocolate was delicious (much better than the peanut butter and jelly sandwiches on slightly stale bread and bruised apples served with it), but hot chocolate does not a quality hotel make in my opinion. They also charged us for valet service we did not use (this was cleared right up). I expected much more for $150/night. I will try another hotel on our next visit as we try to get set to start our lives over in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: sfwasabi
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay at Le Pavillon twice the week before the hurricane, once on our way to Oklahoma and once on our way back. The hotel was absolutely beautiful and clean. The staff was friendly. For our second stay they had a bottle of chilled sparkling water waiting for us thanking us for choosing them again. A class act. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon: Grand Lobby/ Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at Le Pavillon on Expedia not sure how we would find the hotel or the City of New Orleans 6 months after Katrina. We're happy to report that the hotel suffered no ill effects from the storm and the city is rallying. The hotel is beautiful and offers the perfect balance of grandeur and treating everyone like an honored guest. My family, including 2 kids (11 and 13) arrived in New Orleans early Saturday, March 25, and went directly to a neighborhood cleanup effort. We arrived at the hotel looking a little hot and scruffy in sweats, jeans and caps. Despite our appearance, we were welcomed like royalty. The lobby, halls and rooms are beautiful and the service here -- and throughout the city -- was incredibly warm and welcoming. If we sensed anything, it was a lingering worry and weariness over Katrina, but the City is definitely coming back. Do not hesitate to come to New Orleans and you can't go wrong at Le Pavillon.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Pavillion recently on business. My firm usually stays at the Ritz but due to storm damage the Ritz is still closed for repairs. I was pleasantly surprised, more than pleasantly actually at this hotel. My room was large, nicely decorated and very comfortable--especially the bed and pillows. The lobby was beautiful and the pool and hot tub were very nice with a rooftop view that I enjoyed. The staff was friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay with them again!

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: FranneOnLongIsland
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I stayed here for 4 days following a cruise. I chose the hotel for it's location based on the map, turned out to be perfect: walk to the french quarter, very nice area, felt very comfortable walking at night. The hotel itself is outstanding! I found the staff to be wonderful, especially our concierge. He worked to get dinner reservations at top restaurants, got us booked on a tour with about 20 minutes notice, and made many recommendations that turned out to be right on the money. Our room was lovely and the turndown service was quite a pleasant surprise. Not only would I highly recommend La Pavillon, but I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Higly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Pavillon Hotel the weekend when Hurricane Katrina hit. You would not find a better place to wait out the storm. We had a hot breakfast, on Monday morning on August 29th, when the winds outside were about 100mph. The staff was fantastic, they handled hurricane situation very professionally. Every member of the staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was built about 100 years ago, has a solid structure, the damage from hurricane was a few broken windows. If we decide to visit New Orleans, without any doubt we would stay at the Le Pavillon Hotel. HIGLY recommend this beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Ornate Hotel, But a Few Caveats”
Reviews.Author: torontotravellers5
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 4-night stay immensely. As others have said, it is an exceptionally well-decorated hotel. In fact, we were informed by numerous locals that even they go there to enjoy the ambience. It was an excellent value (just over $100/night) because we were willing to suffer through the summer heat in New Orleans. (yeah, its pretty bad) For our price, we were completely satisfied with our stay- its now a memorable part of our trip. However, I don't think I would pay full price for the following reasons: Its not that close to the French Quarter (20 minute walk...at least), small rooms (and even smaller bathroom), expensive parking (yeah, its a big city, but when you see how insecure their lot is and when you realize that you're going to have to cab to the French Quarter fairly frequently, you'll get a little annoyed) Still, a remarkable hotel that truly spoils its clients and gives them a taste of New Orleans history....just consider the above caveats.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment i put the step on the hotel it was great. from the bellman to the reception, housekepping, and everything. The food is great, great waffles and eggs benedict!!! Emilia, the room service girl was very nice, and told us a lot about the city (she was not from there either) The waiter was very nice and the room was, although not so big, very warm and greatly decorated. the only I should complain is the cold bar and the singer taht is not so good!!! I CAN HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but inconsistent hotel”
Reviews.Author: irvoc_78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Le Pavillon the weekend before Katrina hit New Orleans (Aug 26th-28th) - booked off of the hotel's website for a very good rate of $109/night. The hotel lobby was beautiful and immaculate, the previous reviewer was not kidding in saying it was the coldest room in New Orleans (and trust me, that's a good thing!). Perhaps I dealt with staff in all the off times, but I wasn't particularly impressed with the service anywhere in the hotel. It took almost 20 minutes for the valet to park my car upon check-in, it was 1 am and there practically a line of cars waiting. For $28/night you could do better, also note from what I saw the parking was outside. I'd at least expect the cars to be parked in a structure. However, the room was beautiful with high ceilings, a nice ceiling fan and crown molding. Bed was comfortable, but the bedding itself was not, a little stratchy from what I can remember. Also the previous reviewer said the bathroom was small...boy were they not kidding. I am not a big person by any means and I felt clausterphobic in there! And the shower/tub drain didn't work right, if I took any longer than a 10 minute shower the tub was almost half full of water! Also for a hotel of this caliber I was surprised to find shampoo/conditioner combo bottle. On the plus side, the gym while small is nicely stocked with fruit, water and sports beverages and the machines are adequate enough for a decent workout (albeit the equipment is a little old). The rooftop pool is a nice touch, with great views of the city. The pool could use some work though...some of the tiles have fallen off the pool. Unfortunately I wasn't there for the peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, must admit that is a nice touch. Check-out was a bit hectic to say the least...the valet brought out the wrong rental car and the front desk staff was abrupt and curt at best. Given the situation on Sunday morning (hurricane hit on Monday) I would let any establishment slide. Probably wouldn't stay at Le Pavillon again although I wish the hotel and the rest of New Orleans the best of luck and would like to say that it is a wonderful city and would love to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Taste of New Orleans!!!”
Reviews.Author: JAHwd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel 2 years ago for one night before I went on a Carnival cruise. The hotel is beautiful and everyone there was so nice! I have worked at a hotel in Wisconsin for 10 years and was quite impressed with this hotel. The entire hotel is emaculate, the room was cozy and nicely decorated, the restaurant was excellant. I really loved the rooftop pool area!! You don't see that in Wisconsin. I would just like to say my prayers are with everyone in New Orleans and the entire Gulf Coast. I cannot imagine what they must have had to endure over this past week. New Orleans what a magnificent city and I know it will be that way again- the people and spirit of New Orleans are stronger than anything Mother Nature could ever dish out. God Bless New Orleans and the Gulf Coast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Southern hospitality at it's best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Due to flight delays, my wife and I arived after midnight and in unpleasant if not outright foul moods. Our first impression of the hotel was quite good with elaborate decor throughout the hotel. Check in was quick and efficient. The only bad thing to report was we arived only slightly before hurricane Katrina did. As soon as we knew she was on her way, we moved our flights up to the earliest available. Unfortunately, these were cancelled and we rode the storm out in the hotel. The staff were attentive and did their best to keep us comfortable and informed. One of the hotel employees was actually responsible for getting my wife and I safely out of town (Thanks Rolando).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!! Beautiful hotel but glad we left b4 Katrina”
Reviews.Author: cust_svc_required
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at La Pav and left two days before Katrina hit. Our doorman, Rolando, was amazing, always there, helpful, and so very nice. I hope he is OK. Our initial room that we were given had air conditoning trouble, and it took 36 hours to move us, but once we were in another room - in which the AC worked fantastic by the way - everything was peachy. The air conditining in the lobby is the coldest in New Orleans I think! Which is good when it is SO hot outside... The rooms were beautifully appointed (we had the deluxe) and always cleaned well. When we first arrived, Housekeeping came to our initial room at 9pm to clean the entire tub & bathroom area just because there was an unwrapped peice of soap left in the tub. It obviously just fell out of the previous maid's hands or whatever, but it was there just the same. They did a fantastic job. The desk personnel were VERY helpful, and we called them several times. They sent engineering up to check out our air conditioning within a few hours of our check in, and attempted to fix it. They thought it was fixed but when it didn't cool the next day they moved us with no problem. They even provided an ozone/air cleaner machine for my athsma! How great was that? Room service was prompt and very professional, even late night snacks were there rapidly. The late night Peanut Butter & Jelly sandwiches are such a great touch. Even with days at 100 degrees outside, the hot chocolate was STILL the best I've had in a long time. Fresh whipped cream and fresh fruit with plenty for everyone. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to EVERYONE coming to the Big Easy...once they get back up and running that is. And once N.O is back open for business, you know we are going back just to support town and the La Pavillon hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All except front desk staff was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everyone here was wonderful - all the staff very friendly & attentive - gorgeous rooms and fast service - lots of freash towels at the pool... fruit & water in the gym fridge for everyone... BUT many of the front desk staff were snippy and rude.. but they were the exception...all in all a wonderful time & a very special hotel.

Reviews.Title: “thought it was great”
Reviews.Author: TonyJH
Reviews.Content: a lovely hotel, excellent service, very friendly staff - and peanut butter and jelly sandwiches served at 10.00pm - not something us British are used to - but i thought it was a great touch. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: fircrest1
Reviews.Content: Clean, well appointed hotel in great location. Love the rooftop pool and room decor. Spent three night there, with average cost of $120 a night. Great value and not a disappointment. Followed tht up wth one night at Hotel Provincial, which was a huge disappointment, despite a good location. I would return to Hotel Pavillion; it's a lot more than great sandwiches and free coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved Le Pavilion”
Reviews.Author: Moosegirl
Reviews.Content: After watching Samantha Brown feature this hotel on the Travel Channel, my boyfriend and I decided to stay here for my first visit to New Orleans. It went beyond my expectations! Customer service by the staff was top-notch, the rooms were extremely clean and beautifully decorated and the rooftop pool/spa was a great place to relax! Its close proximity to the French Quarter made it even more special as we could walk back and forth without getting too tired. The PB & J sandwiches were the best! We will definitely stay here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got through staying the night here. A little disappointed after reading the great reviews. It is a very ornate hotel, and the pbj sandwiches and hot cocoa at night are charming. But the rooms are so small. Our bathroom had a shower with a 1/3 the normal size of a tub. If you can call it a tub. Only one person can fit into the shower or pretty much the whole bathroom at a time. I found one outlet that was not hard to get to, and thankfully I only had my computer and camcorder to plug in. Because the other outlet was located underneath the middle of our bed. And no coffeemaker. If you want to gamble or go to bourbon street you can stay at the intercontinental hotel for about the same price. It had larger rooms and coffee makers. Also it's fitness center was huge. I got it on priceline for $65. I was trying to get this hotel because we had already paid for one night, and decided to start our vacation a day earlier and priceline has the le pavillion and intercontinental as it's 4* in the CBD. Fortunately we got the intercontinental even though at the time I was upset because of the bad reviews. All in all, unless you want to attend the spa or have them come to your room for a massage, or need a heated pool, and are not on a honeymoon, I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Smiles, and Snacks”
Reviews.Author: wakegirl1967
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend getaway to New Orleans. We booked our package with Expedia and we were concerned that we might not be treated as well as someone who booked with the hotel directly. I called two weeks in advance to order flowers for my sweetie. Ms. Lou, the Concierge, said that we should order them the day before arrival to ensure that everything went smoothly. She took down my number and called me by 9 a.m. just as promised. When we arrived, after a "thrilling" cab ride from the airport (If you get an ex professional soccer player from Guatamala buckle up FAST), we were greeted by the valet and escorted into the hotel to the reception desk. We were upgraded from a room with a queen bed to a king bed! Our bell hop, Naheed, always greeted us and asked us how our stay was going. He was a wealth of information for things to do off the beaten path and for great local restaurants to eat at. The room was beautifully decorated and had adequate space for our needs. Yes the bathroom counter was small but I easily was able to put my belongings there without worry. Besides exactly how much time do you really spend in the bathroom? The safe was locked so we couldn't use it right away so we called down to the front desk and within a minute someone was at our door to fix it for us. We then went to have a cocktail before our balmy walk to dinner. Definitely request turndown service. Not only will you get a bedtime snack and a bottle of Abita Springs water (great for after an evening of a few too many cocktails)j but the maid will replace any used towels and replenish your shampoo, body lotion, and soap. Also make sure to have the late evening snack of PB & J's from 10 - 11. There were plenty of fixings to make your own sandwich plus fruit, superb hot chocolate, and ice cold milk. The Concierge, Ms. Lou was always helpful and can get you a reservation anywhere in town even on short notice! Also speak with any of the valets or bell hops they also have a good pulse on the city and can steer you in the right direction for a funky little place to eat or listen to wonderful music. My husband is a triatha-geek. So he found the workout facilities adequate for his needs. The pantry in the workout room is always stocked with sports drinks, bottled water and fresh fruit. Even if you don't use the facility you can go in for a snack in the m iddle of the afternoon to hold you over until dinner. The pool was small still refreshing after a hot day. YES, the elevators are slow but try to remember that the hotel was built in 1907. I'm sure part of what attracted to you to the property is the fact it is a historic property. If you want a faster elevator go to one of the newer chain hotels in the city. YES, it is a short walk to the Quarter but I would much rather take a walk to the Quarter or $5 cab ride so I could get a good nights sleep and not hear drunk people pounding up and down the halls all night long. Or to hear police sirens on Canal. It is a beautifully restored hotel whos charm is not only in the decor but the people who work there. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. p.s. The suite near room 728 has one of Napoleon Bonaparte's marble bathtubs. The people who were staying in there were kind enough to let us see the suite.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: LaurieChris
Reviews.Content: Spent a girls weekend away at Le Pavillion Aug 12 - 14th 2005. The staff was awesome. They took excellent care of everyone. The piano bar was cozy and fun for even families. I have visited N.O. many times and this is my favorite hotel yet. It is not that bad of a walk from the quarter and on a weekend night 3 girls felt safe. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “service charm style at Le Pavillion”
Reviews.Author: travelfromric
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two 2-day stays at Le Pavillion. What a lovely property! The lobby and downstairs is quite grand but elegant, and the rooftop pool is just stunning (fitness center is small, but nice, as well). There is obviously quite a bit of attention to detail here. The service was great--we gave the concierge staff a workout and they did a fine job for us, following up on a number of requests. The room (we had a deluxe room both times, on different floors, one w/ king, one w/ 2 queens) is quite nice. I particularly liked the painted ceiling (subtle, but charming). The bathrooms are small but very well-appointed, my only quibble being no place to hang the towel except a hook on the back of the door. During summer, this was excellent price for value as well. We found the location to be great for both the FQ and the warehouse district--you can get to both easily from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comparable to the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Tigerpaw01
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to New Orleans, we had decided to stay at the Le Pavillion Hotel. One of the first things that struck me was the professionalism and friendliness of the ENTIRE hotel staff. If you made eye contact they would smile, and greet you. They had a sense of pride about their hotel and were very quick to tell all kinds of information and stories about it. Whatever our needs were they were quickly met. The rooms were very well furnished, and the bathrooms with marble floors and sinks made you think you were in a palace. The rooms while very nice and comfortable, were a bit small, but so are many other comparable hotels. I was able to use the high speed internet with no problems at all. We didn't like some of the resturants we went to in town, so one night we had ordered room service. The food was better than some of the resturants on Bourbon street, and the price was cheaper, so we had room service for the rest of our time there. I very stongly recommend ordering breakfast. This was our second trip to New Orleans, our first stay was at the Ritz. I can honestly say that our experiance at the Le Pavillion was comparable to that of the Ritz. The Le Pavillion is way more economical than the Ritz, making it more appealing and a better bargin than the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel made my whole trip”
Reviews.Author: Sam C
Reviews.Content: I loved the Le Pavillion. Even now, I would give anything to be there. The hotel is beautiful, the rooftop pool is fantastic and the workout facilities were great. They even supplied free bottles of water and fruit in the workout room. We had a standard room and it was beautiful. Slightly small, but beautiful. Every member of the staff greeted us as we past by them. Do Not Miss the PB&J! You will regret it. Also, ask for the turndown service. The cookies they leave on your pillow are unbelievable. The hotel was close to the French Quarter and close to the Riverfront area.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: irishjig69b
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the la pavillion in july of this year and i can honestly say the hotel and staff were top class everything was as it should be for this hotel and would highly recommenf the hotel to any body going to new orleans it was centraly located 10 minutes walk to burbon street and everywhere u would want to be, the pool was a bit small but very nice in deed on top of the hotel and its open till 1am wich was very welcome to av a swim late at nite, the staff were second to none and the concergie justin was very very helpful as was paula in the reception and mainly all the staff i would highly recomend this hotel to anybody we stayed their for 10 nites on our holidays from dublin ireland the only downside of the hotel was their was no tea or coffe making facilities in the room but as i did not drink either of these drinks i was not to bothered my wife did but with a coffe shop just outside on a side street it was not a problem all in all the la pavillion was a beautiful hotel and if ur going u will av a wonderful time in the 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned last night from NO. We spent three nights here. It was so beautiful on the inside! The service was excellent as well. It is a small walk to the French Quarter, but it isn't far, although after about 10:00 we took a cab back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GinaDRacine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful place to stay in the cess pool of downtown New Orleans. It's an older hotel that has spent untold dollars to ensure luxury at an affordable price. The rooms are somewhat small, but not uncomfortable. The decor is beautiful and the shower was the best I've ever experienced. The shower head dumps loads of water that feels similar to standing under a waterfall. (not stinging; pouring). The bath area is all marble and the swinging glass shower door is very unusual. The concierge is extremely helpful and gives tourist advice, brochures, and good directions. The breakfast buffet is high priced, but well worth it. (about $17). The restaurant (The Crystal Room) is beautiful, but expensive. I would highly recommend at least one meal during your stay. They serve excellent food. The rooftop pool and hot tub are nice, but small. The workout area is very nice. They even have a small fridge full of water and sports drinks, and a basket of fresh fruit (all free) for hotel guests who use the facility. The tradition of serving free peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, hot chocolate, fruit, and milk in the lobby every night is great! We really enjoyed our stay. Parking costs $28 per night (typical in New Orleans), and the valet parking service is ccontracted out by the hotel. The first night we were there, the valet parked our rental car by a wall and put a huge scratch on it. I would recommend parking your car yourself.

Reviews.Title: “More a preview than a review”
Reviews.Author: Solobay
Reviews.Content: Not arriving till late August - Halloween week, and the service here has already been outstanding. Reception and booking was a dream - outlined all the options and took only a few minutes to get confirmation email. Justin, Guest Services Manager, if he's an indication of the service and hospitality of this hotel five stars will not be enough!! Poor guy has been email stalked by me for suggestions, restuarant bookings, limo bookings etc etc and it's been an outstanding service he has provided. Can't wait to shake his hand!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again - very nice”
Reviews.Author: nekko95
Reviews.Content: We were visiting from WI and booked a stay for one-night. Excellent service, very clean, wonderful time. The rooms are very nice. Be sure to read the hotel's web-site before staying; I noted the items of interest, i.e., art work, the old Chicago saloon, stairwell history - it was really cool to look for these items while browsing the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Cardinalsfan44
Reviews.Content: We moved from the Chateau Sonesta to Le Pavillon after a brass band played under our window until 1:00 am in the Canal Street facing room at the Sonesta. Well, I am actually glad that Chateau Sonesta didn't work out for us since it gave us a chance to experience the elegance and friendliness of Le Pavillon. We stayed 5 nites in a deluxe king room which was spotless, had valet parking and their sinfully good breakfast every morning. All this was part of their summer getaway package which was 170.00 per nite before taxes. Any requests were immediatly granted and their nightly tradition of cocoa and PBJ sandwiches (which I know sounds a bit odd) was very classy. I can't think of anything that they could have done one bit better.

Reviews.Title: “OMG incredible!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was moving my girl friend from Florida to Las Vegas in a moving truck and we decided to stop and spend a couple of nights in New Orleans. We booked a room at Le Pavillon and had an incredible stay. We were worried that the truck would be so big that we wouldn't be able to park it, no worries, they handelled it. The lobby is so beautiful!!!! We got to the room and yes it is small but not so small that you feel crowded (unless you're 6'8 & 450lbs). The room was clean. We had one of our dinners brought to us room service and it was awsome. It was nice to eat this wonderful meal next to the window over looking New Orleans. My girl friend hit the pool late one night and said she liked it (I didnt make it up there). We were able to walk to the French Quarter no problem, and felt completly safe, even stumpling in drunk at 4:00am (we missed the PP&Js). We will most certainly stay there again. Everthing was wonderful, and the price really wasnt bad for a hotel near the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at Le Pav!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A collegue and I spent three nights at Le Pavillon for a conference, and were delighted at the staff's eagerness to serve, advise, etc., as well as with our surroundings. Although I am a regular visitor to nola, it was my first stay at Le Pav. The hotel's entire staff was polite, helpful, and fun. We got to know our doorman and our concierge. The woman answering the phone for room service got to know us, and on our second morning anticipated our our morning call for cappuccino and cranberry juice. On our way back to the room one afternoon we told the concierge our TV was fuzzy, and the repair guy almost beat us to the room. I got the feeling that their guests' comfort is their first concern.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here in June 2005. The kids loved the pool on the roof, and thought the doorbell for our room was the greatest. The room was beautiful and quiet. We slept great. Another favorite was the peanut butter and jelly sandwiches served at 10:00. That is something they will always remember. Our stay was excellent. Staff was kind and helpful. Would recommend this hotel to everyone, and will stay there again if ever in the New Orleans area.

Reviews.Title: “a little more insight to La Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: shout86
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Pavillon for 3 days with 2 kids. The hotel is beautiful, very lush. The rooms are small, bathrooms even smaller yet everything is very very clean. I would much rather have a small room yet clean than a suite where I cant take my shoes off. The pool is extremely small(dont let the pics on the website fool you) Roof top is fun but all you see are more buildings. Service is exceptional and everyone is very nice. The peanut butter and jelly sandwiches with milk and hot chocolate were by far the biggest hit. Would stay there again if pool weren't so important to the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, loved it”
Reviews.Author: Freqtrav2
Reviews.Content: Had a convention in New Orleans and all the convention hotels were $160+ a night. Found this on Hotwire at $90/night. Beautiful building. Peanut butter and jelly sandwiches for afternoon tea, hot chocolate too. Very nice staff, lovely lobby. Nice room with marble counters and nice furniture. Definitely walkable to convention center. Would stay here again in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Service, Rooms, breakfast buffet, all was first class.. Would recommend to anyone! The service was great, most staff members have been there for 20+ years and know how to treat you! For Breakfast must try the waffles with ice cream!~ What a treat~ The room are recently updated and very nicely done. Black marble bathroom, Turn down service available (Would recommend for the cookie) The roof is wonderful for watching the sunset. A few blocks from Bourbon street, but we walked it day and night with no problems

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter Le Pavillon you feel the ellegance and luxury of the place. The decor is terrific and most of the staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. Our room was delightful and each night the turndown service was completed with a little gift of a cookie and bottles of water. The food was excellent with complimentary coffee in the breakfast room for all guests to use. We found the bar to be a very freindly place, if a little expensive. The rush for the evening sandwiches was a little off putting but that was the guests not the fault of the hotel. The location was, for us, just right. A ten minute stroll to the French Quarter through safe streets. The French Quarter is great but very noisy and this hotel, just a stroll away, was perfect. This hotel was one of the best we stayed in during our trip to the USA. Absolutely Great!

Reviews.Title: “Our Fave, For Lots of Reasons”
Reviews.Author: Bimini Twist
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, and I often stay in New Orleans when visiting family nearby. Over the years, we've lodged in many hotels in the Big Easy...and Le Pavillon, a small, European-style luxury hotel in the Central Business District, continues to be our favorite. The location on Poydras is ultra-convenient, close to the French Quarter, Garden District, and Interstate 10. The European decor is elegant and luxurious (the dining room is billed as the most beautiful room in New Orleans, and that's not much of an overstatement...high praise in a city full of beautiful rooms). As with most close-in New Orleans hotels, standard rooms tend to be on the small side, but the beds are comfy, the linens soft, the marble baths clean and well-stocked, and the central air conditioning reliable (a must, at least six months of the year, in N.O.!). There's also a rooftop workout room, pool and Jacuzzi. We've found the employees to be unfailingly courteous and professional, and the concierge staff are some of the best in town. And while we rarely eat in any New Orleans hotel (not that they're bad, it's just that New Orleans has some of the best restaurants in America), we do recommend the breakfast buffet at Le Pav...it's quick and convenient for hotel guests, and Chef Pat's Bananas Foster waffles are unique and the ultimate brunch indulgence. Chef Pat is a one-of-a-kind lady as well. We recommend you check out Le Pav...and if you're on a budget, note that unlike some New Orleans luxury hotels, Le Pav often has Internet or seasonal specials.

Reviews.Title: “poor service at Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: DMH50
Reviews.Content: Would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: relaxnstyle
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to New Orleans for a long relaxing weekend. I go to New Orleans at least twice a year and have stayed at many hotels. I had not heard of Le Pavillon before this trip. It is an exquisite hotel, beautifully decorated, and the staff is so friendly. Our room was very spacious and very clean. This hotel is walking distance from Bourbon St. about two blocks. I felt very safe walking to and from Bourbon St. at night. However, if you are looking for a hotel with a loud, party atmosphere, this is not the place for you. It is a very quiet, relaxing place...a nice escape from the craziness of Bourbon St. My friend and I were treated like royalty and we loved our little mini break. I highly recommend Le Pavillon!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spend about half of my life in a hotel; so the friendliness of the staff makes a big difference. I have to say that this hotel had some of the nicest people working there and after about an afternoon there you felt like it was your home away from home. The peanut butter & jelly sandwiches in the lobby at night help create that feeling - it was my husbands favorite part!! The location was great also - about a 10 minute walk to the French Quarter or if you would rather not walk it is located in a great spot to catch the streetcar either to the French Quarter or the Garden District. Also, the rooms were very nice & the beds were very comfortable....

Reviews.Title: “LePav Is Great”
Reviews.Author: caserbin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at LePav in early June and overall enjoyed our time there. One of the elevators was broken the entire time we were there so it made getting to and from our room a bit tedious, we often took the stairs as it was much faster than waiting. Our room was decorated beautifully but was smaller than I had expected. We had a deluxe queen. If you are used to room sizes at large, new hotels this will seem small. Everything in the room was clean and the evening turn down service was great. Even left us complimentary bottled water and cookies. The gym area is good with decent equipment. The pool area was less impressive. The photographs on the website are taken at night because in the day you would see how teeny tiny it is. It is a very small pool and there were only about ten lounge chairs. The staff at LePav was wonderful, very helpful and great about making recommendations. We frequently walked to the French Quarter and felt safe in the neighborhood. We are typically Marriott patrons but enjoyed the LePav as a nice diversion.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! Best hotel in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best place to stay in NOLA. Close to the Quarter, Riverwalk, Casino. Short streetcar ride to the Garden District. The staff was friendly, helpful. The held our bags and let us have an early check in. Breakfast in the Crystal Room was great. The staff is attentive and accommodating. Will stay there again, can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon is Great”
Reviews.Author: amarch
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Pavillon for 3 nights last week in May. My husband and 14 year old son just loved it. This was our first trip to New Orleans and we enjoyed every minute of it. Le Pavillon was everything I expected, very elegant and full of art and beautiful furnishings, did not feel like a bull in a china shop at all. My husband thought it was funny because I just wanted to stay in the bathroom, the rain shower was so nice and I just enjoyed the black tile with gold specks ambiance. The pool is excellent, went up after a long day walking the FQ. The jacuzzi was an added treat. And don't forget the peanut butter and hot chocolate everynight at 10 pm. Staff were courteous and made our stay enjoyable. Would of loved to stay longer but wanted the Bourbon experience and stayed at the Royal Sonesta another 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Always A Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: schnauzerlady
Reviews.Content: The staff was incredibly helpful. We got great restaurant tips --and reservations; the maids respected the "Privacy Please" signs; the breakfasts and lunches --prepared for a group-- were well above average. My only complaint is that the WiFi did not extend above the fifth floor (although we were assured that it worked in each and every room -- it worked for none of our group); and the ethernet was out of commission for almost our entire stay. Also, the elevators are incredibly slow; and there are occasions when one is aware of what is transpiring in the room next door. Still, the drawbacks are minor compared with the joy of staying in a beautifully restored, landmark hotel. This is our second stay at Le Pavillion; we have recommended that our group again select the hotel for its conference.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just completed a five day stay at Le Pavillon in New Orleans, Louisiana. The hotel's decor is grand, yet comfortable. The rooms are exquisite, clean and very comfortable. We used the rooftop fitness center, hot tub and pool on a daily basis. Fruit , water and various rehydration drinks are available in the fitness center free of charge. The hotel also provides a bedtime snack of peanut butter sandwiches, fruit, hot chocolate with marshmallows and fresh whipped cream, lemonade in the lobby free of charge for its guests. The service was exceptional. I would highly recommend this hotel and would happily stay in this hotel should I return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “great stay with our two-year-old at Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With our two-year-old son, we recently took the train from Washington, DC to New Orleans and stayed at Le Pavillon. The hotel was wonderful. First of all, it's very centrally located in a nice area. We didn't rent a car, so we walked everywhere very easily. It's even just a 15-minute walk from the train station, so we never needed to bring a car seat. My husband strolled our son to the hotel while I took a taxi with our luggage. Our son got a fever the first day, and we called the concierge to get the name of a children's clinic. The concierge gave us the name of a clinic, along with the name and number of the hotel's house doctor. Their house doctor came to our room and checked out our son. What a luxury it was to have a doctor come to us, especially in an unfamiliar city! The room service staff was always friendly and prompt. Our son likes warm milk, and when we called to order it, the staff took extra steps to ensure that the milk arrived at our room at the right temperature! The restaurant staff went out of their way to make our meals there comfortable, as did all the staff. One day, our son was crying in the restaurant, so we strolled him around the lobby. We returned to the restaurant when, all of a sudden, a staff member who saw us in the lobby appeared with a big, blue balloon! We immediately had a happy, smiling child! Every night around 10 p.m., the hotel has a tradition of serving peanut butter and jelly sandwiches. It's beautifully done on silver platters, with various kinds of bread, jellies, peanut butter, hot chocolate, milk, coffee, etc. It's a fun thing to look forward to in the evening! We highly recommend Le Pavillon!

Reviews.Title: “Wowed by La Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WOW was about the only thing my wife could say as we entered the lobby of La Pavillon Hotel. My wife and I were in New Orleans only for the night since we were leaving on a 5 day Carribean cruise the next afternoon. As we entered we were greeted by the doorman, a extremely polite young man, that remembered our names every time we saw him. Upon check-in we were informed our standard room was being upgraded at no extra charge to a suite. Again my wife was WOWed by the generousity of the Hotel. As the Bellman took our luggage and escorted us up to the 7th floor he gave us a nice overview of the history and layout of the Hotel. During the elevator ride up he asked us if we were on our honeymoon which we answered no but maybe you could count it as a second honeymoon because of the cruise. He said our suite is usually referred to as the Honeymoon Suite. As we came to the end of the hallway with my wife continually scanning the doors to find our room she realized the large set of french doors at the end were actually the entry into our suite, the Napoleon Suite. The word suite does not do justice to majesty and expansive this mini-apartment has to offer. The suite has its own foyer, sitting area w/fireplace, huge king size canopy bed w/curtains, magnificent bath area. I highly suggest and encourage everyone to stay at this beautiful hotel. The people enhance the feel and quality of your stay even as much as the hotel itself. We'll stay here everytime we come to New Orleans. Do yourself a favor and go to the La Pavillon website and see for yourself ther majesty and beauty of this gorgeous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Pavillon in April 2005 and loved it. It is a beautiful hotel both inside and out. The pool/hot tub area on the roof is especially nice. Even the elevators and hallways are nicely decorated! When we arrived after a LONG day of travel we were pleasantly surprised to hear that we had been upgraded to a suite, which was very spacious and beautiful. We were travelling with our one year old and in his crib we found a gift pack of baby supplies (shampoo, lotion, etc.) -- a very thoughtful touch. The pb&j at night was fun--don't miss it if you stay there. All of the staff was friendly and pleasant. It is about a 10 minute walk to the French Quarter and a short cab ride to the port (we went on a cruise). We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “new orleans truth”
Reviews.Author: vegasblk
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night in new orleans may 15-16, 2005. When you stay in or around the French Quarter/CBD, you know what to expect: high prices, one-way streets, cajun food, street performers, and lots of places to spend your money. This hotel is rated as #2 here and although it's a nice place in a nice location (street over from Canal St.), it does not deserve this high of a ranking. Why? The hotel has a 19th-century feel and building to match. For 99$/night I would have preferred the luxury of say the W hotel right down the street. We really didnt stay in the hotel very much except to sleep and did not explore it at all, but pictures can lie folks. Parking at the hotel was the standard $25/night, but there are plenty of cheaper parking garages close by. Harrah's casino, Emeril's and the Quarter are all very close. The room we had was small but clean. The lobby was big and pretty. Not the fabulous, plush, pleasure palace I expected but I didn't come for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: yaya77
Reviews.Content: From the moment the doorman greeted us until the moment we checked out the service was exceptional. We were always welcomed with a smile - this is New Orleans, laissez les bon temps rouler! We were also upgraded to a large room upon our arrival at no extra cost - during Jazzfest no less! The lobby is grand and the rooftop pool is beautiful, lovely views at night. The PB&J service in the lobby is great, who doesn't love a little comfort food at the end of the day? It shocking to me how someone could criticize this hospitable touch, or think the staff was less than pleasant, but I suppose if you are looking for something to complain about, you can certainly find it! Our room was tastefully decorated, and the room service was efficient. Try the gumbo and banana bread pudding! Our cab driver recommended it as some of the best in the city and he was right! The housekeeping was great and we felt very taken care of. Our only concern was that we had a slow draining tub, not fun! But everything else was so above average, we didn't let something like that ruin our fun. We'll definitely be staying at Le Pavillon again!

Reviews.Title: “2 Stars on a good day!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 2 Stars on a good day. Upon entering the facility with my rental car I waited in front for almost 10 minutes until I was received by a parking attendant. After entering the hotel I was told in a rather rude manner that I would not be able to get into my room until 3pm. 3pm is a typical check-in time and I am fine with that, however the manner in which the clerk stated this to me was offensive. I went to lunch and returned at 2pm to find that a room was available so I checked in. I was told that I would be unable to obtain a key since the machine was not working and that the bellman would have to let me into my room. I found the room dark and musty, in fact an aerosol can sat next to the bed, along with miscellaneous cleaning supplies. There was a partially consumed bottle of soda in the fridge and the lock on the bathroom door was broken. After having an in-room spa treatment, I attempted to log onto the internet to find that the wireless signal was too weak to log onto, and the LAN connection was not working properly. I contacted the front desk who had an engineering clerk verify the problem. I was then transferred to another room. While packing my goods the clerk from the front desk rang to provide my new keys. No apology was provided and neither was a bellboy to help me transfer my luggage. The new room was not only smaller, but lacks the rain shower-head, has no handles on the shower doors, and the bed is terrible. The A/C filter was covered with dirt and falling from the ceiling. All in all my experience here in New Orleans has not been made pleasant by the Pavillon Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice very quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a very nice hotel just three short and safe blocks off bourbon street and the river. The lobby and pool/spa area were very nice and elegant. The room was as advertised big, roomy with a wet bar and a spacious bathroom. The pool/spa was very nice to relax in after a long day on your feet. I would highly recommend this hotel to all who want a classy stay and be out of the noise of bourbon street.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: spiketop
Reviews.Content: My wife, 9 year old son & I enjoyed our week long stay. The lobby is beautiful and welcoming. All our room requests were honored. Although we have stayed in larger rooms at other hotels, our room was nicely appointed and cozy enough. The free high speed internet access was useful. We enjoyed the rooftop pool and its views of the city skyline. The 10 - 11 PM hot chocolate, fruit, and pb&j sandwich set-up in the lobby was a nice way to finish each day and chat with the staff and other guests. The staff was nice and helpful. If you're looking to stay a few blocks out of the French Quarter (as we were) but still be walking distance to all attractions this is the perfect hotel. The place truly has the personality of New Orleans and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “an amazing hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WOW this was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in!!!! I went with a friend of mine and we are poor au pairs! so when we saw such a great deal on hotwire we went for it!!!! $300 each with flights and two nights in this amazing hotel!!!! i had a pretty bad morning as i had my mp3 stolen at the airport so when we arrived i couldnt believe my eyes the entrance is massive and the man with the black hat at the front entrance is really nice sight to see!!!! unfotunatley we couldnt check in till 3pm so we had to leave but let me tell you it is worth the wait! the rooms are sooooooo big and the decor is just to die for, made me feel like i was a princess. the bathroom was to die for and the pool on the roof top was soooooooooo pretty. and just to let you into a little secret you get a complimentry picnic between 10 and 11pm so for all you penut butter and jelly sandwich lovers and hot chocolate fans i totally recomend this hotel for you i just wish i had a longer time there but someone has to take care of the kids!!!!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were told that this was a five star hotel. We were very disappointed in the customer service and our rooms. The room had a short in the electrical system. The lights and clock shorted out. The furniture was old dated and the lamps were rusted. Not what we were accustomed to at all. I could not wait to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: patShreveport_LA
Reviews.Content: April 4, 2005: For the second time in the last four months I had to spend a day in New Orleans in conncection with an early morning appearance at the US Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals. The first time my 25 year old daughter accompanied me. This time my husband and 17 year old daughter accompanied me. Both times provided us all with wonderful experiences. The rooms were lovely with beautiful furnishings and everything in perfect working order. There were far too many little details for me to take time to mention here which made me feel so welcome and appreciated. I must mention one...the business cards with my name on them as a guest at the LePavillon. How easy to share with other counsel who were staying at other hotels! The meal in the Crystal Dining Room last December was most enjoyable. My companions this time said they had a lot of fun at the peanut butter and jelly gathering late in the evening while I was still upstairs preparing for court. The room was so very quiet for me while my companions were out sightseeing around New Orleans. The internet hook-up was a nice surprise. All in all, Le Pavillon will be the first place I call if I head down to the Fifth Circuit again. It is a short walk there from a fantastic hotel where I can prepare and get a good night sleep. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel. Mediocre Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Zydecat
Reviews.Content: This Southern style hotel is just beautiful. They serve peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and hot chocolate in the lobby every night from 10 pm to 11 pm. Nice way for guests to meet each other. The staff is below par and lets you know they are working for tips, not for you. But the beautiful decor, excellent restaurant and quiet location make it well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Three stars on a good day!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was aloof, seemed bothered to assist a guest. Upon check-in we were not greeted with a welcome, "so nice to have you"....we have had better service in many 3 diamond establishments. The room was OK, but the street noise and elevator were constant. The food was mediocre and the wait staff seemed to have someplace to go. The room service staff was super! I would not recommentd this hotel to anyone traveling to New Orleans. I would suggest the management and staff enroll in a Ritz class! When we checked out we had to wait for our car and load our own luggage. So much for Southern Charm!

Reviews.Title: “AORN Convention”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that is close enough to Bourbon St (3 blocks), but far enough away so you don't get that craziness. Service and hospitality of staff was excellent, and very accomadating. With the great weather, was able to enjoy the pool on the roof. Very relaxing. Rooms were not too large, but very well set up. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okm but overrated...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading everthing on here I thought this was going to be the nicest hotel ever! I was wrong! I found hair in the bathroom, and dust behind evry piece of furniture. The bedspread smelled sour and the staff never smiled except at check in and out. It also took 20 minutes to get my car. Nothing to cry about but for the money, I would have expected better!

Reviews.Title: “Charming historic hotel, Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From my stay March 3-7, 2005: Le Pavillon is a charming hotel with excellent service in the business district of New Orleans. The service at the hotel is warm, welcoming, and professional. Staying there was a delight. When I am in New Orleans again I will choose to stay at this hotel. As someone who is not from the South, I really felt it was worth it to stay at a hotel that has a feel of southern history and hospitality. Much Much Much better than staying somewhere ordinary and generic. Look for good deals from their website! It is short walk away from the lovely Frech Quarter and the debauched- tourist infected Bourban Street (look elsewhere for good music). *Possibly there are not enough elevators if the hotel is at full capacity- but as this is an historic hotel, this sort of thing didn't bother me. *beautiful roof-top pool *evening snack of peanut butter and hot chocolate, fruit etc was sweet and fun

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon is New Orleans at its best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We live close to New Orleans and go for the weekend a few times a year. We always love staying at Le Pavllon because it really is New Orleans at its finest. The staff epitomize southern hospitality and the rooms are wonderfully luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: easw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this marvelous hotel for four nights in early March. Valet parking in the lot next door was lighted and very safe. The bellboy and door man were efficient and friendly, as were all the staff we interacted with. At check-in my husband jokingly mentioned an upgrade, and to our surprise we were given one. Our deluxe queen/queen room on the 5th floor was small but the high ceilings made it feel larger. Lots of interesting details in the room--framed prints of local plantations hung by gold cord on the walls, black granite countertops in the bathroom, a ceiling fan, plush curtains (that really blocked the morning daylight), lots of decorative pillows piled on each bed and a doorbell outside each door on this floor. Other amenities were also impressive. The 32-inch TV in the armoire was unexpected. The bathroom, while small, was nicely done with plenty of towels and a heater fan to warm the chill. The closet had plenty of room, as well as a fair-sized safe. The beds were moderately firm and comfortable, with double-sheeted blankets. The gym on the top floor had the customary endurance machines as well as weight training. The fridge there was stocked with Powerade and water, and there was a large basket with complimentary apples and bananas on top of the fridge. The rooftop pool area overlooking the city was very nice, with a small heated pool, hot tub and cabanas. We did not eat in the restaurant while we were there, but we did order room service for breakfast one morning. My eggs benedict was found to have quite a bit of egg shells in one half, but this replaced quickly after one call to dining, and the new dish was excellent. We did the PB&J one night, and thought it fun and quirky. Turn down service was prompt and included a complimentary PB&J cookie and bottle of water. Although the hotel decor (especially the lobby) is very ornate, we never felt out of place on those days we were wearing casual clothes. The hotel is withing walking distance to the French Quarter (Bourbon Street is three blocks away) and a bit more of a hike to Riverwalk and other nearby attractions. There is a Garden District streetcar stop a block-and-a-half away. Our receipt at check-out reflected accurate charges and was a great deal (special internet rates), considering all the amenities we enjoyed. We would not hesitate to stay at Le Pavillon again.

Reviews.Title: “can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: shoutyman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Pavillion for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon trip. On arrival we had our room upgraded automatically. I've stayed in some very nice hotels and I can honestly say that this is as good as I've seen. The staff were very helpful and the location is ideal..only 5-10 mins from Bourbon Street on foot. We never sampled the food..far too many other places in New Orleans for that but in all other respects, this is a fine establishment in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: gazza53
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Pavillon for 4 days in early Feb 2005. I had expected great things but have to say the experience was generally disappointing from the minute I arrived. Although there were a number of bell staff around there was no offer of help with bags etc. Then had to play guess the window at reception - they were all too busy having a chat to check me in! The room itself was OK although extremely dark - it also had an unusual odour which was also noticeable along the corridor (I was on the 3rd floor). Breakfast was ok - but dinner was very disappointing (try Smith & Wollensky - 2 blocks up Poydras - a much better option). I met some business contacts and we tried to have a quiet drink in the bar - however this proved impossible as within minutes the "entertainment" began - consisting of a lady playing piano and singing very LOUDLY! I know New Orleans is famed for its music but could really have done without this. I also understand that the PB&J is a bit of a tradition but it seemed rather a waste of time and money to me- the only time I was actually in the Hotel at 10pm there were very few takers - most people still being out on the town (this is New Orleans after all!) Final straw was at check out where I was accused of having emptied the mini bar of snacks and candies - which I hadn't actually touched . Nevertheless took some persuasion to get it taken off the bill. Overall the hotel's supposed "belle epoch" character didn't gell with the reality of staying there - it was ok but for the money I'll try soemwhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely hotel in August of 2003 and it was great, my favorite place to stay in NOLA. Nice quiet location but only a short walk to the French Quarter. There is also a street car stop very close by. Perhaps one of the best things about this hotel though is that starting around 6pm on Friday until Monday morning, there is an abundance of free and safe parking on the street behind/beside the hotel. We could see our vehicle from our hotel room and it was perfectly safe all weekend...for FREE, no $15 - 25 a night fee. The staff was also great (was a staff member who let us know about the great free parking!) and the room while on the small side was extremely cozy and quite lux with a nice padded armchair and beautiful furniture (even decorative throw pillows for the bed). New Orleans is my favorite weekend getaway spot, I get there at least once a year and Le Pavillon is best place I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “I was expecting more”
Reviews.Author: herleiness
Reviews.Content: We found a dirty toilet paper upon using the bathroom. The walls are too thin that you can hear the people in the hallway. There was false alarm at 3 am. The hotel did not even compensate for that disturbance. Staff is helpful, some are snooty. Housekeeping was great. The bellman are very helpful. The pool view is nice and romantic. Good distance to to Bourbon street and other tourist sites. I would like to try another 4 star hotel in New Orleans if ever.

Reviews.Title: “le pavillon was marvelous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the atmosphere was lovely & the staff members were warm and accomodating-highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “worked for us”
Reviews.Author: johnpen
Reviews.Content: Was at LePavillon in September of '02, no problems, got a great rate online, would stay there again in a heartbeat (hopefully sept 05)

Reviews.Title: “JUST SO-SO”
Reviews.Author: larlar
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would have to say that our stay at Le Pavillon was rather disappointing. For a hotel of its standards, I was hoping for a grand and spectacular experience, but a few instances made it less than ordinary. Upon our arrival, there was no doorman to greet us, open the door and assist with our luggage. We were greeted in a tepid manner by the front desk. We were made to wear annoying, lime green bracelets that we had to keep on for four days (it reminded me of some wild college spring break when bracelets are handed out at bars for unlimited drinks). Our room was rather small; the space provided did not create the feeling of luxury that the hotel boasted. Our toiletries were crammed onto the sink. We wanted to have a small meal at the Gallery Lounge, and the waiter was very delayed in his service. We were seated, and we waited to place our order while the waiter ran around serving others. He completely forgot about us, especially when a busload of tourists arrived to order drinks at the bar. It was obvious that he was not going to get around to taking our orders anytime soon, so we left our table completely disturbed by the experience, and we could not help but let it negatively affect our perception of the hotel--where was the hospitality that Le Pavillon boasted of?????? AND, he had the nerve to look annoyed when he finally noticed us leaving our table. Also, I was inquiring about the times when luncheon was being served at the front desk, and the woman was very brusque about her response, and once again I felt completely put off by the lack of hospitality. Housekeeping was not very thorough in cleaning the rooms--I found an apple core underneath the bed that housekeeping had failed to clean up! Two factors do stand out with regards to a more positive experience at this hotel--the late night snack hour and the turn down service. The chef was very open and friendly, and the late night snacks a delight. The nightly turn down service was very charming and gave me the feel of luxury. However, with the aforementioned negative events, I will not be returning to this hotel for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for luxury!”
Reviews.Author: DCSocialWorker
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending Mardi Gras at this hotel. Rate for this special event was a bargain at $219/night (booked in October.) Beautiful historic hotel (reminded me of the Plaza in New York.) Good service, nice rooms (we were upgraded to a king room.) Bathroom was black marble and gold fixtures. The only draw back to this hotel is the location - which was a mixed blessing. Far enough away from the craziness of the French Quarter to ensure a peaceful refuge, but too far from anything convenient. The city needs to develop the area around the hotel. We ended up eating twice in the hotel (which I usually avoid because of the increased cost) because we were just to tired to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Olde World Charm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Pavillon in October 2004. Building is breathtaking and all staff were more than helpful. Had a room on the nineth floor which was well appointed. Pool and deck area on roof was beautiful. Walking distance to Superdome and Bourbon Street. If you are going to have breakfast downstairs in the ballroom allow yourself plenty of time to savour the surroundings and the great buffet breakfast. Great pub nearby in Baronne Street, Cajun Mike's, great place for a few drinks and a chat with the locals (and the friendlist barman/manager in New Orleans). Would definately stay again and hope to get back there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights Jan31-Feb4 at Le Pavillon. It was by far the best hotel we have ever stayed at. Centrally located, way comfortable beds and the best staff ever encountered anywhere. We walked to the Riverfront, D-day Museum, Bourbon Street and Emeril's. A short walk to Canal St. to catch the streetcar to the New Orleans Museum of Art was the only public transportation we needed. The nearby nightly parades were so much fun and we brought back so many beads our luggage was overweight. PB& J sandwiches served with milk and such between 10-11 pm were great after all the nightly activities. I would highly recommend this hotel and the delicious food served at the restaurant's breakfast buffet was an excellent way to start the day. Can't wait to go back to Le Pavillon!

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: elizabethc523
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon is an excellent hotel in a great location -- close to the French Quarter, Riverfront Park, Warehouse District, etc. Our room was comfortable and quiet - a truly enjoyable hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Le Pavillon and had a fantastic experience with the hotel. The staff was thorough, professional, and genuinely friendly - particularly the bell staff who got to know us immediately and chatted with us each day as we entered and left. The hotel was lovely and very well kept. The rooms were modest in size, but very comfortable and absolutely beautiful (I especially thought the bathroom was lovely). The rooms were impeckably maintained and cleaned. Best of all was the peanut butter sandwich nightcap served in the lobby each evening - totally yummy! Definitely make a point to swing by for the delicious hot chocolate!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a good time in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Seb_In_Kansas
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed 4 nigths in the Pavillon Hotel fron Jan 5 to 9, 2005. This hotel is really nice, it is an Historic Hotel. Once you enter this Hotel you know you are going to be pampered there. The service was great, from minute one everybody was very helpful. The decor was really nice (painted ceilling in the bedroom, Grand Chandelier in the loby, mirror and gold everywhere, Marble in the bathrooms). One little thing is: we had a room with a king bed and the room was just a bit small for this size bed, but we still had room to move around. The room was very quiet, we never heard anything from the surrounding rooms (even if they were occupied) or the street (we were on the 3rd floor). We ate at the Crystal room (the hotel restaurant) for breakfast and had their special buffet. The food was very tasty and I wiil advise you to try their Bananas Foster Waffles. We enjoyed their roof top Heated pool and Hot tub everyday. Even the decor around these area was great (statues, gas lamp at nigth). We did not use their gym, but we checked it ou, it look very well equiped and with good quality cardio machines and lot of free weigths. They offer water, Gatorade, towel at the gym it was surrounded with windows on the roof of the hotel, there were a good ligth in it. We also loved the free HIGH SPEED INTERNET and the snack of hot chocolate, peanut butter and jelly snadwiches, fruits, milk, orange juice, cookies they have available at 10:00 pm. The location of the hotel is great, in between the French Quarter (5-10 minutes walk) and the garden district, only one block from St Charles trolley line and two blocks from Canal street trolley line. It is a great location to discover what New Orleans has to offer. We also felt secure walking in the area even at nigth. There is also all around the hotel plenty of nice restaurants, like Herbsaint (my Favorite). We'll go back there on my next trip to New Orleans. We choose this hotel in the first place because their rates for what they offer were great, we'll come back there just for their service.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon fabulous as always”
Reviews.Author: SMMCWILL
Reviews.Content: My wife and our wedding party stayed at this hotel when we got married in New Orleans in 1996. We went back for the Sugar Bowl in January 2005 and were even more impressed this time. We thorougly enjoyed the entire stay along with the wonderful cocktail lounge, personable & accomodationg staff, the newly renovated rooms that are VERY nice, the wonderful evening turndown service and the peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and milk/hot chocolate in the lobby each evening at 10pm. The rooftop workout room and pool are also wonderful. This hotel certainly EXCEEDED our expectations again at a very reasonable rate and is clearly tops in New Orleans. We lived there for 4 years and have tried most of the nicest hotels and will never stay anywhere else. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: y2flu
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels I've sayed at in New Orleans (and I've stayed at many), this is the best. A breathtaking lobby, as well as plush, well-decorated rooms. Rooftop pool & hot tub, and peanut butter & jelly sandwiches as a late-night-snack, are added bonuses. For the price, this hotel is a steal.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Pacifica_traveler
