Reviews.Content: We booked this room for New Year's week based on the reviews we saw here and we were not disappointed. The price was right, the appointments grand, and our "standard" room was huge, Las Vegas room huge. We would not have needed an upgraded room at all. The concierge staff were very helpful and friendly. You are close enough to walk to the French Quarter (and believe me, you'll have to if you stay during New Year's/Sugar Bowl). The only thing stopping me from giving it 5 stars is the bathroom. Yes, it was new, but whoever installed the sink fixtures installed them backwards, so that you have to turn the opposite direction to turn them on and off. And the shower stall was weird, there's a glass door on only part of the shower, and the shower head is at the very top of the stall and makes it difficult to shower properly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Pavillon before Christmas. This is a beautiful old hotel with a lot of charm. It's a few blocks away from Bourbon Street and the French Quarter, but if you want to keep a safe distance from the drunken insanity, this is a great option. I would stay again anytime, and it was very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay Christmas Week”
Reviews.Author: solar47
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our visit during Christmas.Everyone that we came in contact with during our stay made us feel welcome.The entire staff was gracious,friendly,and accomodating.The hotel was extremely clean and oppulent and beautiful.It was the perfect place to spend a "white" Christmas. We loved the peanut butter and jelly sandwiches,the hot chocolate and the fresh fruit at 10 PM. The breakfast buffet was fantastic and ms.Pat was a goddess.The piano bar was great and even the piano player treated us like family.The gumbo and Po boy sandwiches were as good as you can find anywhere. Our room was upgraded at no additional charge when we checked in. Our room was beautiful ,the bed was very comfortable and the linen was pristine. We will certainly stay at La Pavillion again and will recommend it to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that this hotel had any bad reviews! Our stay was great and well worth the price! Our reservations were quickly handled over the phone and the hotel promptly honored their lowest price guarantee. Upon check-in the staff was friendly and professional. They were able to answer all of our questions and offer pertinent information about NO. The bell staff was great! They were friendly, jovial and prompt. The room was beautiful. I had heard that their rooms were small however I did not find this to be the case. Their standard room is between 350-450 square feet. If this is not large enough for you they have a deluxe room that is 500 square feet as well as the junior suite and suite, the largest being 1500 square feet. The counter top in the bathroom was a little small but this was not a problem â€“ it might have been if I were planning to move inâ€¦ Oh, there is not a coffee maker in the room. Room service was also good and the prices were equivalent to those of any restaurant in NO. One thing you donâ€™t need to miss is the peanut butter and jelly sandwiches! This was a lot of fun and the sandwiches were great. They are served between 10pm and 11pm in the lobby of the hotel. Parking at the hotel is $25 per night. I thought this was a reasonable price considering their was an attendant in the lot 24/7 and this included valet parking (except tip). The only problem that I ran across was contacting the concierge before our arrival. I tried to contact the concierge for 7 days before I finally got a response by then I no longer needed their service as I had made the arrangements myself using outside catering services and floral shops. Next time I stay at the hotel, I will be more adamant about reaching the concierge. (Donâ€™t bother leaving a message or emailing â€“ stay on hold until they are forced to answer the phone.) I will definitely return to this hotel! Mary Lynne Williams

Reviews.Title: “just great!!”
Reviews.Author: ljerald
Reviews.Content: just returned from a cruise, and the stay at the hotel was great...my wife loved the old world charm...large rooms, helpful staff. a bit out of the way if you want to visit the French Quarters to eat/listen to jazz. but we took the trolley..get an all day pass and you can travel to the Garden District/French Quarters/RiverWalk and NO Art Museum.

Reviews.Title: “True Southern Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We discovered the Le Pavillon Hotel a few years ago. It is a small, unique luxury hotel in downtown New Oleans. It epitomizes southern hospitality of early 1900's. It has become our home away from home when in New Orleans. The staff is most accommodating and gracious. The Crystal Room is fine dining at it most elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon was a great place to stay. The place was beautiful and had alot of character and charm. When I initially booked the room through a website, we were given one queen bed but when I arrived with my friend and requested double beds it was not to be a problem at all. The hotel staff was prompt and courteous. Very friendly hotel staff and they made me feel welcome considering it was my first time to New Orleans. The rooms were very spacious and clean. I would definitely stay here again. Great hotel and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Historical”
Reviews.Author: peace through travel
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and got a good rate in sabre (no travel agent discount just a published rate of 129/night) The agency is a member of the Giants (Ensemble) consortium and I checked the Giants hotel book to see if this hotel was in it (this is usually an indicator of a superior hotel and offer added amenities)- it was. The procedure to set up the added amenities is given and a description of these amenities is on their website. The added amenities for the Le Pavillon for clients of Giants agencies is 'upgraded room, early check in, late check out and a fruit basket with a bottle of water'. I emailed the hotel a few days before arrival from home and told them that we would be celebrating our 25th anniversary. When we arrived we were upgraded to one of the rooms that had been recently renovated (I am unsure if they were renting the non-renovated rooms at all at that time). In our room was a card in the fruit basket saying 'congratulations on your 25th anniversary'. We asked to stay later on our departure as we had a late flight (we were told we would have to pay for a half day). When I asked reception about the Giants amenity, she said she had never heard of Giants. I asked her to ask Mr. Morin - he let us stay for free until 3:30. To make a long story short I was amazed that they had the audacity to imply that the upgraded room, and late check out were for our anniversary when they were contracted through Giants. The concierge was not friendly and would not permit my husband to take one of the magazines she had set out on the desk in front of her, saying 'you have one of those in your room'. When we got to the room we did not have one. The hallway became full of furniture on day two - a weird smell was about - were they fumigating? The location is good, the rooms are large, the city is wonderful. Would I stay again? No.

Reviews.Title: “La Pavillon is a GREAT place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: WineBuffinMN
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to New Orleans, my husband and I took the advice of many websites and decided to stay at Le Pavillon Hotel. It was a wonderful experience from start to finish! The staff consistently called us by name and were very very friendly; whether it was greeting us back to the hotel, setting up tours for us or helping us with directions around the city. Le Pavillon is a short walk to the French Quarter and the Central Business District--so you're close to some of the major sites. The hotel is very well kept and CLEAN; something that we very much appreciated since we were in the Big Easy. Our room was a standard, run of the mill one, but nonetheless, it was beautiful, just like the rest of the hotel. Le Pavillon has a nice exercise room with complimentary fruit and sports drinks, in addition to a relaxing pool and whirlpool on the roof of the hotel. They also serve peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, milk and fruit every night at 10:00PM--something that many of the guests took part in! I highly recommend La Pavillon Hotel as a place to stay if this is your first or 50th time to New Orleans. Without the staff at Le Pavillon, our trip wouldn't have been as fun!!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Le Pavillon in New Orleans during Thanksgiving week. We chose this hotel mainly from reading the many good reviews on Trip Advisor and researching the best hotel for the best price. It is centrally located in the city and within walking distance to many tourist areas and street cars. Our family reserved three rooms, one of which was a handicapped accessible room because my mother is in a wheelchair. This room has excellent accommodations--large roll/walk in shower, raised toilet, high sitting chairs. All three rooms were lovely. I can't say enough about the friendliness and kindness of the staff, from the maids to the management. The food in the hotel restaurant was excellent. The hot chocolate served with the late night snack is the best we've had! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and plan to stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel on Hotwire and it was far cheaper than anything else of comparable class. When we checked in the hotel had signs and buttons on the staff promoting upgraded rooms, which made me suspicious. However, the room, although small, was comfortably furnished. Housekeeping shows up early in the morning, about 9 a.m. so make sure to put the "privacy please" card in the lock, but they did a nice job. The room was not ready until the 3 p.m. check-in time, although they knew we were waiting, which was somewhat annoying, but the staff was pleasant. The location is a short walk from the French Quarter and the Canal St. trolley which is convenient, but it may not be a safe walk late at night. Overall, a pleasant experience. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Terrible experiance. Room was not ready by 4:00 PM. Toilet leaked, AC did not get cold. Door lock would jam and not unlock. Changed rooms and thought all was well. Then I got a call from my bank about a charge on my credit card - they thought it was fraudent. It seems that this hotel authorizes $65 PER DAY for "incidentals" on your credit card. There 7 days - that is $450. NO WARNING. Nightmare experiance. Yes hotel looked and acted "customer service oriented" - but it seemed both pretentious, their policies are a farce, and I got the distinct opinion they did not care about their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: giggles2218
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week Oct. 10th for my honeymoon. The hotel was beautiful. All of the staff was very friendly. They would open doors and even push the elevator button when they saw you coming. The peanut butter & jelly was a nice touch. The hot chocolate and whipped cream was very good. The roof top pool area was very nice as well. It was was within walking distance to the French Quarter. No need for a car. It was a very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon exceeds my expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Pavillon for one night before leaving on a cruise for our honeymoon. My expectations for Le Pavillon were very high, based on the reviews I read on tripadvisor.com. The hotel exceeded my already high expectations. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. The bellhop was very courteous despite the fact that we had 7 days worth of luggage (for our cruise) and were only staying in the hotel one night. We ordered room service for breakfast and were very pleased. The service was prompt, the food was delicious and presented well, and the portions were HUGE. My only complaint is that one of the elevators smelled like vomit. The elevator seemed to have been cleaned thoroughly, but the smell remained. But, it is New Orleans, so I'm sure things like that happen from time to time.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Pavillon hotel during our honeymoon for a couple of days. The hotel was beautiful and in a great location close to Bourbon street. We could walk just about anywhere in the French Quarter and beyond, which was a great benefit. The staff was very friendly. Parking at the hotel was expensive ($25/day) and we were dissapointed in the rooms. While our room was well decorated and clean, it was extremely cramped to the point that it was hard to move around in. We went down to the front desk and asked for an upgrade, which they immediately accomodated, and the new room was slightly larger. Yet, for the price we paid, and in comparing it to the several other hotels we stayed in during our vacation, it was a bit of a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance - but for a price.”
Reviews.Author: choatejr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Pavillon on October 2nd for one night. The room was small, but very nicely furnished. The bed sheets were a little rough, but the bed was comfortable. Check-in and check-out were easy, and the service was good, but nothing special. I paid $259 for one Saturday night, but the Friday night rate for the same room was $129??? It seemed a little expensive for what you really get. The room had no real view of the city. The peanut butter sandwiches were a nice touch, and the rooftop pool was cool. All-in-all a good experience, but I think you can get more for the price.

Reviews.Title: “luxury and southern hospitality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Incredibly friendly staff. Grand old world charm. Nighttime inviting with homemade sandwiches and turndown service. Pool on roof magnificent! Hot jacuzzi overlooking skyline. Classic elegance and Southern Hospitality. Beautifully kept with the period of its design. Must have breakfast in dining room! Can hear next door occupants if too loud such as children but this is more of an Adult hotel with all the antiques and finery. Everyone is treated like most important guest.

Reviews.Title: “not happy”
Reviews.Author: memfizgirl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Le Pavillon Hotel for a birthday celebration trip and I have to say I am not at all impressed. First the bad things - we booked through the hotel and took advantage of their lowest rate guarantee (if you find their hotel cheaper on another site, they will give you a rate 10% less than the rate you found). We found a cheaper rate and emailed them, recieving a prompt response and an offer of 10% less than the rate we found. But when we arrived to check in, the front desk was uniformed of the rate change or the entire concept of the lowest rate guarantee. Not only ignorant, but RUDE!!! They acted as if we made this up to try and get a better rate unfairly, and did nothing to verify what we (THE CUSTOMERS ) were telling them. The standard double room has a tiny bathroom with no counter space for your toiletries, a useless hair dryer, and you have to ASK for a coffee machine (which didn't work well). The rooftop pool and spa area was admittedly beautiful but the spa was set at such a high tempeture (with no noticeable controls anywhere to be found) that it scalded us - we were literally bright red from our knees down , all that we could tolerate. All of the employees we encountered (other than those above) were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The room service late night snack we had after exploring Bourbon Street was HORRID!! The pizza was cardboard like and greasy, with an unpleasant taste. The deli sandwiches were just average. This was certainly not worth the $46 dollars we spent on a snack we didn't/couldn't finish. All in all, I think that my money would have been better spent elsewhere - this is not at all the first time I have visited New Orleans but the first time I felt compelled to write a review.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was incredible! I saw a lot of reviews on here of people complaining that the rooms were small - I didn't feel that way at all. It was perfect for my husband and I. The rooftop pool was beautiful - especially at night. The staff was so friendly. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit NO every year and after trying many of the big chain hotels we found the LePavillion. Now we won't go if we can't get a room there! The first time I passed this hotel I noticed how beautiful the lobby was so I went in for a look. I thought that it was one of those places where if you had to ask how much it cost to stay, you couldn't afford to stay there. Was I surprised at how affordable it was! The personnel goes out of their way to ensure you have an enjoyable stay, and Pamela in the lounge makes the best Hurricane in town! Dining in the Crystal room is memorable, and the rooftop swimming pool is an excellent way to end a day of walking miles and eating all those wonderful NO meals!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for an economical price. The staff go well out of their way to make sure the stay is comfortable. The restaurant is outstanding. I strongly recommend the buffet lunch with a pasta course.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon - A Most Memorable Experience!”
Reviews.Author: FredWestHartford_CT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited New Orleans last October to celebrate our 20th anniversary. I'm regretfully late w/ this review, but since we think often about our fantastic trip it's easy to recall the details! Le Pavillon was certainly one of the reasons we enjoyed our trip so much. The friendly staff, unexpected upgrade to a jr. suite, champagne & goodies on arrival, amenties (e.g., rooftop pool & hot tub)...and all for an unbelieveably reasonable price, made our visit just that much more special. It's just a few short blocks from the Quarter and right near the street car line. In my opinion, you can't go wrong w/ Le Pavillon. Mix in Mother's for breakfast, Johnny's for Po' Boy sandwiches, G.W. Fins for amazing seafood, and the Funky Butt for fabulous jazz and your visit will be complete. Thanks Le Pavillon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel!!! I have stayed throughout the world at some of the niciest hotels. This one is at the top of the list! The people working there are the friendliest and most helpful. The lobby was beautiful as are the rooms(upgrade to the deluxe king for $20, it's worth it!) The breakfast buffet in the Crystal Room was great. I was able to check in early (11 a.m.), no problem! The best thing about N.O. was the food (Acme Oyster Co.) and this hotel. Hats off to great hotel for a great price!!

Reviews.Title: “An A+ hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Le Pavillon yesterday and have to truly admit it was the best hotel stay ever! Traveling alone, I did not know what to expect but I felt very comfortable and safe at this hotel. From the moment I pulled up and was welcomed and helped by the door men and valet parkers until when I left the next day and received the same service leaving. The room was beautiful...small like everyone else comments....but hey for one (or two) people, it's just the right size. Besides, who stays in their hotel while you're in New Orleans, anyway? The room service was quick and I recommend the gumbo which was delicious...but don't make the mistake of coming in around 3:30 a.m. and ordering the pepperoni pizza. I was very disappointed with the pizza, but I guess at that time of the night who's up rolling fresh dough and slicing fresh meat and veggies? The pool area was beautiful, nice and breezy, the jacuzzi was awesome and the cabana area was very relaxing. If anyone has any questions about this place, you may e-mail me and I'll be glad to answer. I highly recommend Le Pavillon and hopefully can stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “exceded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: lindoor
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze. The bed was very comfortable. Location is plenty close to the french quarter. Staff much better than the marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: PattyWoodTx
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in to Le Pavillion, we were treated like family. The service, rooms and genuine friendly atmosphere made this a very enjoyable weekend. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Longwood Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second time at the end of June for a conference. We had a great time the first time we were here and the second time was not disappointing. Our room was not huge (but we did opt for a very low rate standard room) but it was clean and well appointed. Within easy walking distance of the French Quarter and taxis were always available when we needed them to get to the convention center. Lobby is elegant and service was very good when we needed it. This is a very good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant but not pretentious”
Reviews.Author: bruceannarbor
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans on business in late May, and stayed at La Pavillion. I have stayed in many wonderful hotels, both in North America and Asia, and would count La Pavillion as among the top 5. The room was spacious and had many amenities. The staff were friendly and very professional. The location is easy walking distance to the Quarter, or the streetcar headed to the Garden District. The rooftop pool is a special treat, with the old-world alabaster statues against a backdrop of ultra-modern buildings. A very elegant but unpretentious hotel, not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled with Service at Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: philippakelly
Reviews.Content: My friend and I are from Australia, and wanted to have a few days' holiday in New Orleans. We booked Le Pavillon on hotels.com, not knowing anything about the hotel other than what was provided on the website. We couldn't have been happier. We got a wonderful, large, recently-renovated room for a great price; the service was incredibly polite, the amenities were first-rate, and, all in all, neither of us had ever experienced better value for money in a hotel. (Please note: this is not one of those bogus reviews submitted by a hotel staff member)

Reviews.Title: “They try hard, but fall somewhat short”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, but the overall impression I get is of an establishment trying very hard to be posh and falling somewhat short. The decor is pleasant, but not perfectly maintained. The housekeeping was questionable - I had to hunt for certain articles that would disappear under the bed during cleaning and, during one of these hunting expeditions, found a strange pair of women's underwear! Turndown service varies from night to night, and was missed altogether on certain nights. The walls are thin and sounds from the hallway can be instrusive. Do ask for one of the renovated rooms - the bathrooms are much nicer. Calls are expensive, local or otherwise. Overall it was a pleasant stay, it was just lacking in some of the features associated with hotels of the calibre it is striving for.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pathetic Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a total letdown! Cramped room, mildewy shower, worn facilities, insolent staff, etc., etc. Frankly, we're amazed at the glowing accolades posted on this site. Did we stay at the same place? Nothing about this hotel made us want to return--but be sure to eat at Uglesich's on Baronne Street.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Gas Lamp, Beautiful Lobby, nice room, though a little small”
Reviews.Author: DWL2112
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights last Summer with my wife and nephew. I was really impressed by the lobby, which is on par with the Peabody in Memphis, though smaller. It was very much in the same vein of an older, fancy (though not super-luxury) hotel. The lobby had a nice Frenchy-New Orleans look. The rooms were kind of small, but not as bad as the Peabody. The decor in the rooms was not on par with the lobby, though that is true of most hotels. If you are looking for a charming room in New Orleans for about the same price, I would recommend the Josephine Guest House in the Garden District. My nephew really was looking forward to the peanut butter and jelly buffet in the lobby, so we went and enjoyed it very much. It is a bit of a walk to the French Quarter, which I was a bit wary of at first. With the tighter policing in New Orleans recently, I felt safe. I would not have stayed there a few years ago though, especially with children.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Ritz”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read all of the rave reviews about this place and couldn't believe the low rates, so I booked one night at Le Pavillon before a conference. After reading all of the reviews, I expected true luxury, and attentive service, but I was disappointed. The lobby of the hotel is nice and the rooms are ok, but the hotel is old. It had a musty smell. The location was also a problem, it was pretty far from most things as it is in the business district. Cabs were hard to get at night and the doormen were not that helpful. The pool is nice, but the equipment in the fitness center was pretty old. Fresh fruit and bottled water was a nice touch though. The pb & j at night was cute. It is definitely a unique and historic place to stay, but don't expect the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. While we were in town, we scoped out other hotels that we remembered from looking at them on the internet. We were really glad that we picked this one. The beds were great and the lobby was elegant. The hotel staff was very warm and always willing to help. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is also in a good location. We did not rent a car during our stay--we didn't have to. Everything is within walking distance. I cannot think of anything negative to comment on.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm and old fashioned service prevail here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not fond of flying, and especially amidst the raising of terrorism alert to orange, I didn't sleep x-mas eve; I was set to fly to New Orleans on Christmas Day 2003 and bound for Le Pavillon Hotel. Check-in was painless and courteous, which was great since I hadn't slept a wink the night before and had a migraine to boot from the tension. As soon as I checked into the room I was rewarded by cleanliness and old world charm. I even took pictures of the ceilings, which sported crown moldings and hand-painted flowers! Within minutes of checking in I relaxed to the point of having my migraine vanish. I had made reservations for x-mas dinner that evening at the restaurant inside the hotel. The only glitch was when I showed up at the restaurant and they didn't have my name down for the reservation, even though I had confirmed it upon arrival. Despite this, Christmas Dinner was spectacular. Also, the hotel didn't have a shuttle (free or otherwise) to the French Quarter. However, that was fine with me since I didn't enjoy the drinking scene so much. Even though I left generous tips daily for the maid service, they got chintzy with the bath products after my second day. Also, my room was right up against the stairwell, not a good idea if you don't want to hear the staffâ€™s early morning hall traffic. Thatâ€™s IT for complaints. I don't stay at a hotel anymore without checking out reviews at www.tripadvisor.com. Only Le Pavillon was one of the few with so many (well-deserved) positive reviews. That's the main reason I stayed there. I felt perfectly safe there and in the surrounding neighborhood, which I often walked around, as far as The French Quarter. The walk is great because you get to experience the little artsy shops along the way. Right around the corner of hotel I found a little convenience store and a Subway. There is also a lovely casino about 10 blocks away. Two charming points of the hotel were: the peanut butter and jelly sandwiches with hot cocoa in the lobby every evening. However, somewhere on the internet site it said it was at midnight. It was more like at 10:00 p.m. (can't remember now). One late night I came in from the cold to the welcoming, warm, and beautifully decorated x-mas lobby with this little feast laid out so beautifully. Charming!!! To boot, this little soirÃ©e was free and it also provided an opportunity to meet fellow guests (met some cool people there). Another charming, albeit strange claim to fame of this hotel (for you "sensitives" out there) is that the hotel is one of the most haunted in New Orleans. Trust me, it was, but nothing scary, just another aspect of its charm! The bonus of my trip (thanks to the shuttle driver from the airport) was the Egyptian traveling antiquities exhibition at the New Orleans Museum of Art (www.noma.org) called "The Quest for Immortality". It ended Feb. 2004, but this museum is well worth exploring, they have a rich and diversified collection from all over the world. This was the highlight of my trip. Don't worry, I did manage to get a drink in at the oldest bar, LaFitteâ€™s (sp?) Blacksmith's Shop the day of departure. I was happily surprised with the turndown service. The room was cleaned, bed turned down with two generous, delectable cookies, soft music, and a dimmed spotlight bathing the painting above the bed, a relaxing prelude to a good night's sleep. My stay here was great and I would do it again in a heartbeat. Highly recommend to the woman traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “thankfully not a franchise hotel”
Reviews.Author: yatmeh
Reviews.Content: my wife and i spent last thanksgiving here. what a treat!!! there really is a "grande dame" feel to the place. absolutely stunning lobby with crystal chandeliers beyond belief. the rooms were not huge but were furnished with deep pockets. loved the marble bathroom. numerous staff members asked if we were enjoying our stay-from housekeeping to doormen to f & b manager. this level of interest was not forced and felt quite genuine. we felt quite welcome there. definitely not your cookie cutter franchise hotel at all and why we look beyond the marriotts and the westins to find beds with personalityies.

Reviews.Title: “Average, at best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sunday April 25, 2004 Just returned today from a two night stay. Arrived late on 4/23. No doorman or bellman. Eventually a security guard arrived to help. Received a smoking room even though we requested non-smoking. Room nicely furnished but smelled of smoke. Had a shower and bizarre half size tub. No in room movies. Valet parking is $25/day (more than the daily rental cost!). On checkout, receptionist was eating a danish as we were checked out. When our car was not ready and informed of our time press to get to airport, I was instructed to "settle down". OK property (restaurant had good food with friendly service), over priced lodging rate whose good years are behind it.

Reviews.Title: “Drip, Drip, Drip”
Reviews.Author: PMattLA
Reviews.Content: Talk about unfulfilled promise! Le Pavillon has a quaint lobby, friendly staff (at least upon check-in), a panoranic city view from the rooftop pool/spa area and a decent, picturesque restaurant. However, our heightened expectations were thoroughly dashed by the dingy room, leaky ceiling (which no one could fix despite our repeated requests), unresponsive management and shady billing practices. The downstairs public areas feel grand, which was in direct contrast to the shabby, unkempt private quarters. There are many better choices in the area, and some of the characters strolling the immediate area after midnight were downright menacing. Look into the JW Marriott, W and Monaco and pass by Le Pavillon. Really.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Loved the Le Pavillon!”
Reviews.Author: MKNV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Pavillon for one weekend night and loved it! We made reservations on their website and had a smooth check-in. From the moment we arrived, it was clear that we were guests. The doorman, valet, and front desk personnel went out of their way to ensure we had a hassle-free arrival. All the employees made sure we were taken care of, even if it was just pushing the elevator button for us! The room is a bit smaller than most, but plenty of room for two. However, a family of four might be cramped. The room is impeccably clean and was beautifully decorated. The rooftop pool at night is gorgeous! Oh, and the perfect spot for a morning cup of coffee. It is a hike to the river, but not very far from Bourbon Street and most of the French Quarter. At night, we always took a cab because, well, we were two women and didn't feel comfortable walking alone. We did not take advantage of the turn-down service and missed the peanut butter sandwiches, but we did order cookies and milk as a late night snack. Great hotel, great stay - we will most definitely return to the Le Pavillon.

Reviews.Title: “Not an ordinary hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PilotJenn
Reviews.Content: From the second my husband and I arrived at Le Pavillon we knew that we were in for an incredible stay in New Orleans! The staff was outstanding and extremely helpful! The rooms had a warm cozy feel to them and the rooftop swimming pool was also an extra treat. We were visiting for my husbands birthday, so we asked the concierge Justin for a recommendation for a restaurant. He made reservations for us, and after we left, he called the restaurant back to tell them that it was his birthday. On arrival, they had complimentary champagne waiting! It was magnificent! The hotel is also in an excellent location. Easy access to the streetcars and buses, and it is also an easy walk to the river and Bourbon street. I have recommended this hotel to all my family and friends and I will continue to recommend it to anybody travelling to New Orleans. I know on my visit back I will again choose Le Pavillon!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We went with another couple who suggested it because of a previous stay. The rooftop pool is magnificent. The breakfast is delicious and the location is great. The room was a bit small but this hotel is so charming it is worth being a bit cramped. The decor is rich and plush. We've been to some beautiful hotels but this is definitely one of our favorites! They even offer a midnight snack buffet (but it gets crowded so get there a little early).

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillion's breach of contract”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon, while a beautiful hotel with lots of charm, really has problems with it's staff and catering people, as well as their upper management.Our company booked a meeting to be held April 29th & 30th 2004. After sending our contract requirement to their catering director Gwen DeFraites, our meeting was accepted and booked. We had stated in our contract requirements that any deposits needed would be due two weeks before the event.Now, today, March 15th 2004, the hotel demanded all deposits or the event would be cancelled. After trying to speak with the catering director supervisor, we were basically told tough luck, and they cancelled our meeting there. This is after having advertised the meeting at this hotel and having people register there.This is costing our company large sums of money.Be careful with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Pavillion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We go to New Orleans frequently for business and for pleasure. This was the first time that we had stayed at Le Pavillion. It was wonderful! The staff was personable and professional. The room was a little small, but if you are in New Orleans you are not in your room that much. I can definitely say that Le Pavillion will be our hotel of choice from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. Very plush and friendly staff. We stayed in the middle of Mardi Gras and they managed to operate very smoothly. Massive TV in the room and the hot chocholate, milk, peanut butter and jam sandwhiches from 10-11pm in the lobby were a nice touch. Mini bar is expensive but i guess they always are. For $140 a night it was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New Orleans and our stay at Le Pavillon made our trip memorable and perfect. The entire staff went out of their way to make us feel special. It was the most beautiful place I have ever stepped into. Our room was fantastic, the bed was incredible. The food was first class, as was the service. We will be going back to New Orleans and will definitely be staying at Le Pavillon again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jnfr28
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed here in August 2002. The walk is a bit of a hike to the French Quarter but it is very quiet. Rooms are great, bathrooms beautiful with marble. We spent at least an hour every night downstairs in the bar where my husband smoked cigars that he had bought in all the cigars shops in town and the bartenders were very attentive to us and chit chatted with us. The breakfast buffet is the BEST buffet I have ever had and Pat the omlet maker makes the best omlets ever. Nice service from Georgie in the dining room too. We loved this hotel and would definately stay here again. August is too hot though, so go when it is a bit cooler.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went down for Mardi Gras this year and could not be more displeased with the service. First off, the hotel smells like an old sock. Maybe it's the old "belle" charm but I did not enjoy that. I wonder why the windows don't open or alteast they should get a better ventilation system. Also the service was terrible. First off, they made the people staying there wear ugly green wrist bands and if they ever lost them, they would charge an additional twenty dollars, I felt like a criminal whenever I left my room. They added so many extra charges to my stay it more than doubled my hotel price! I couldn't have been happier when I finally left. Hey, the lobby was nice! But everything else was very sub par.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel, 1 Star Service!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, let me say, I am NOT one of those people that just looks for something negative to say. We travel quite a bit, at different types of lodging and I use tripadvisor EVERY time. I don't know what happened while we were at Le Pavillon 2/17-2/20, but EVERYTHING went wrong! We ordered room service and didn't get the right beverages, TWICE! Our wakeup calls were 10 minutes late, and it took FOREVER to get our car out of parking, and it's only just a lot on the opposite corner. We put a "TURN DOWN SERVICE" sign in our door when we went out, and when we got back, someone had been in the room, put the "TURN DOWN SERVICE" sign back in the room, but hadn't done anything. Why were they in the room then? We called the Front Desk, once, to say, very nicely, that we had had a few problems, they didn't inquire any further and they didn't do anything to make it up to us. I have never complained at a hotel and we didn't push this any further. If you stay there, I hope you have better luck.P.S. Le Pavillon IS very lovely to look at and I didn't think the location was too bad, it's away from the French Quarter, but well within walking distance, just a few blocks. Although, I won't ever stay there again because of the service. I booked this room through AAA and I wonder if we got discount service because of it. I hope that is not the case, but maybe they only cater to the full-paying guests.

Reviews.Title: “Best **** hotel in the world with the best staff!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on tripadvisor.com for months prior to our 4th anniversary excursion to New Orleans. Every week a new review would come up on Le Pavillon and not one negative word was ever written. I must say I was somewhat nervous about getting my expectations up too high and being let down by a staff or hotel that didn't met my standards. NOTHING could be farther from the truth!! We spent three wonderful but rainy days in New Orleans and besides eating at Emeril's (best restaurant aside from the Mansion on Turtle Creek in Dallas) the hotel made our trip the best we've taken in years. Justin, the concierge, was marvelous. I sent him a very lengthy email prior to the trip and he responded in a prompt manner with great ideas! Upon arrival, the hotel sent up a basket of fruit for our anniversary (which I'm still not sure how they found out that's why we were there). The room was spacious and had a very new and crisp feel to it. If you do go to this hotel, make sure you request the "Turn down service" at night. Not only was the bed perfectly turned down the hotel staff left shortbread peanut butter and jelly cookies on our nightstand with the recipe to go along. I'M STILL BLOWN AWAY! As others have said, the Peanut butter and jelly sandwiches with the hot chocolate at 10:00PM every evening were the perfect snack before heading off to bed! I'm never been more confident about referring a hotel to anyone! Stay here, you won't be sorry!!

Reviews.Title: “I really was imporessed with Le Pavillion.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a very beautiful historic hotel. I came in with very little expectations, and it they completely blew me away. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Anythign I needed, they were glad to respond. The rooms were very large and spacious.Overall, the stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not so great location”
Reviews.Author: WineAndAntiques
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon is everything other reviewers have said. It is beautiful and elegant and the service is top notch. We were looking for a place to stay away from the noise of the French Quarter and we found it. No one told us, however, that the hotel is located in a deserted area where you really should not be walking around. You are 4 solid blocks to Canal St. Cabs are essential at night. I also agree with the comment that the basic room is cramped and needs improved noise insulation. The decor is lovely, though.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon - "Le Excellent"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My brother & I had to make a last minute trip to New Orleans because our 94 year old Nana was in the Cardiac Care ward of Ocshners Hospital. My experience at Le Pavillon began at the front door when I was greeted like an old friend instead of just another hotel visitor. The staff at Le Pavillon were very coridal and professional when they thought we were on holiday, and went even above and beyond when they knew our visit held potential for great sadness. Two of my three favorite people I never even met face to face. The ladies answering the phone in Room Service. Amazing. I spend most of my time in hotels in South East Asia and other parts of the world, so I can tell you these ladies were fabulous. The food was served in the time frame they stated, and was wonderful. From oatmeal to their house specialty beouf bourguignon, I recommend it all. Our other favorite was their very talented singer/piano player. What an incredible voice, and a personality to draw you out of any sadness. The entire staff shouldn't be forgotten, everything was imaculate and so much southern charm! I must admit, my brother and I really got a kick out of the Peanut Butter & Jelly Sandwich bar with Hot Chocolate at night. We had never heard of such thing, but what a crowd pleaser. Imagine standing in an elegant lobby with everyone gathering between 10pm - 11pm making PB&J sandwiches... my brother of course, put too much jelly on his and spilled all over the nice carpet... even in our mid 40's he is still a little boy. SO, book a stay at the hotel and enjoy the experience, the rooms were nice & the beds comfortable. My brother & I look forward to going back for a happy occassion and taking our spouses for the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay somewhere nice in New Orleans for our 30th wedding anniversary so we selected Le Pavillon after visiting their website and reading reviews in TripAdvisor. The hotel was great. It's close enough to all the attractions without being in the middle of all the noise of the French Quarter. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The room was comfortable and the lobby, dining and lounge area were all beautiful. We look forward to staying there again the next time we go to New Orleans and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “OMG!! Its beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vanilla1217
Reviews.Content: This is the most beautiful hotel I've ever stayed in!!! It was comfortable and the service was wonderful!! The food is awesome and they have great bartenders that make the best drinks I've ever had. (just don't get a room next to the elevator, its kindof loud.) Otherwise, its wonderful. I'll never stay anywhere else in New Orleans and I've learned this the hard way.

Reviews.Title: “Every hotel should be so enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Pavillon for our marriage in New Orleans & it was wonderful -- from the courteous, competent & knowledgeable staff to the small details like the heated mirrors - it truly was one of the highlights of the city. Paula, at the check-in desk, went above & beyond and was so sincerely cheerful she could brighten any damp day. Now there's only one place to stay when we return to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Old World charm and elegance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel had old world class and elegance that you don't find in most hotels. I travel about 35 weeks a year and you don't find hotels like this very often. The room was very large and extremely clean. Everything was well appointed, even the packaging of the soaps and shower cap. The staff was very pleasant and accomodating. At night when they serve Peanut and Jelly sandwiches and hot chocolate it gives you a feeling that you got when your Mother served you this comfort food. Everyone should experience a hotel like this at least once. I have sent extra brochures to my traveling friends so they can have this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful! The service was excellent. We enjoyed our stay and will go back when planning a trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillion greatly exceeded our expectations when we visited in late December 2003. Many guidebooks embellish hotel quality and character--so we are always dubious. However, we were totally floored by the uniqueness of Le Pavillion--absolutely gorgeous room, wonderful/helpful/courteous staff, conveniently located to the Quarter and the Warehouse (art) district, and you won't find the peanut butter and jelly sandwhich nightcap anywhere else! It's also very easy to find if you are driving in from the airport, if that is important to you. We usually like to stay in different hotels on repeated trips, but we loved Le Pavillion so much we will probably make that our standard lodging when visiting New Orleans from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous!”
Reviews.Author: ashley0115
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in January 2004 and it was marvelous. The staff is very gracious and friendly. The room was magnificent and the complimentary nightly turn down service was amazing. Not only was our bed turned down, but we were left cookies and a note with the weather for the next day. When we returned the lights were dimmed and jazz music was playing. Also, the room was very clean (it was a little small, however!) I felt like a queen! I would definitely stay here again and again and again...

Reviews.Title: “Will stay at La Pavillon every time I'm in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The La Pavillon hotel is spectacular!!! It's beautiful and classy. The beds... Plush and wonderful. I think I had the best night of sleep ever! The fitness facilities were great and how can you beat a pool on the roof. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. I have told everyone who heads to New Orleans to stay there! It's an incredible deal too! Don't miss the peanut butter and jelly sandwiches at 10pm! What a fun late night snack!!

Reviews.Title: “LePavillon-worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: LePavillon is a beautiful hotel with character that showcases a classy ambience. In addition to the beauty of the hotel, the staff was very always helpful and informative - delivering great service.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon is a hit with us!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our one-night stay at this hotel was the highlight of our trip. The entire staff was the most welcoming and cordial of our entire trip, in spite of the fact that our visit occurred during a high capacity time. Everything was excellent, and the hotel is the most beautiful you can imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Love Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Pavillon and had a wonderful time. The hotel is very close to the French Quarters and has the beautiful architecture seen in most of New Orleans. The service was impeccable and we were especially impressed in the knowledge and expertise of the hotel's concierge. The staff had created a list of "things to see and do" in New Orleans that included places in and out of the French Quarters -- allowing us to see more of New Orleans than we probably would have. Our hotel room was luxurious and the halls and lounge area of the hotel were filled with beautiful paintings and furniture. The complimentary peanut butter and jelly sandwiches in the lobby at 11 were just an additional perk. We will definitely stay at the Le Pavillon the next time we come to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer at Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My coworkers and I spent one night at LePavillon. Since we were returning guests, we were treated to special amenities. How nice to be remembered! The hotel restaurant is a wonderful combination of old world charm and down home southern hospitality. I loved the details--a fruit basket in my room with a thank you note for choosing their hotel, peanut butter and jelly and hot chocolate for a late night snack, business cards showing us as "guests in residence," and the valet with a top hat and tuxedo. My only regret is that we had to leave so soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great People make a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From December 13 to 21 I have been staying at Le Pavillon Hotel and everyone just made my stay "a lovely gift before Christmas": everything was just great because everyone at Le Pavillon has a way to make one feels at home. And as I was there for professionnal reason, I felt like working at home and wish you all to experience the same feeling. This hotel is UNIQUE and has a truly UNIQUE way to take care of the guests. Thank you all: you were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous but be cautious..”
Reviews.Author: dananyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a fantastic stay at Le Pavillon. We chose this hotel because of all the great reviews and were so happy we did. If you've read some of them, you know all the good stuff (it's true!) already. I just wanted to let you know that there was a guest walking back to the hotel last week who was killed for no reason (he was right across the street). It was only 10:30 at night and nobody knows why. I DO encourage you to stay here, but DEFINITELY take taxis after dark as New Orleans is very sketchy. Even if you are only going a few blocks away, it is worth the four or five bucks. Keep in mind that Le Pavillon is in the business district so the streets are pretty empty after 6pm. We live in NYC and feel much safer here than in NO. Having said that, we felt the hotel was first class in every way and the staff was very helpful and offered great recommendations. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent accommodations. Staff is very helpful and pleasant. Beautiful dining room and excellent food and service. I would highly recommend this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service,ambience, food, but terrible bed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to knock off a point because the bed was so hard and the pillows so limp that my partner and I had three awful night's sleep, which is important to imsomniacs like ourselves. The breakfast buffet was fantastic, and next time I'm in town I'd consider visiting for that but not staying there. All the people there were very friendly and the common rooms gorgeous. Our room had a lot of atmosphere and was very nice, though very small. Also, street traffic (tons of buses, shuttles, and trucks!!) and lots of doors slamming as the maids cleaned very morning also made for a crap night's sleep. I think one night I only got 3 hrs!! Our fourth night, which was an unexpected surprise due to weather back home, we moved a few blocks down to the Sheraton on Canal St. and slept phenomenally.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon was very elegant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Presidential Suite at the Le Pavillon Hotel in New Orleans. It was the most beautiful room we had ever stayed in. The 2 bedrooms were large & decorated with beautiful furniture. This suite has a dining room, den and living room w/a fire place. Needless to say, we did not want to leave the next morning. You will not be disappointed in this hotel. Sherry J.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xgamer1411
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many New Orleans hotels over the past 20 years and Le Pavillon is my all time favorite. The rooftop gym and pool are fantastic, the rooms are extra luxurious and the staff is always pleasant without being phony. An incredible value so close to the French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ! Terrific ! Fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First class all the way. Makes you feel very welcome and comfortable -- exceptional service and staff. Great location, too. Thank YOU, Le Pav !!

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon -- truly the best of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon, only a short couple of blocks from the French Quarter, is a fantastic oasis away from the wonderful madness of Bourbon Street. It is a magnificent hotel with service and amenities to match. It will be the only place I will consider upon a return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “This place will make you feel special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at La Pavillion and would definitely stay there again on my next trip to New Orleans. The hotel is quite glamorous and extremely clean. My room was top notch. The meeting facilities were very comfortable and the restaurant was exceptional (!) and amazingly affordable. However, what really blew me away at this hotel is the excellent customer service. The staff demonstrate exemplary customer service at all times. It was incredible how friendly, attentive, and professional the staff were. This facility would be a great example to study in college management classes. You just don't find this kind of customer service anymore. Highly Recommended!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Virtues of LePavillon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There is no place else I would stay but at LePavillon in New Orleans. The personnel is not only superb but they are homey with their evident desire to assist you with any need that arises. I felt their concern when the shuttle didn't arrive to transport me. They went out of their way to relay messages that made my stay unencumbered and carefree. Even the bartender was a female joy. I cannot stress enough what you are missing if you fail an opportunity to be a guest with LePavillon. What a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon is the Best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days at Le Pavillon for our honeymoon in early October. We loved this place!!! All of the staff was so courteous and friendly. Both my husband and I have travelled extensively for work and we found Le Pavillon to be one of our favorite hotels we have ever stayed in. You won't be disappointed!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: dallentravels
Reviews.Content: As this was our first time to travel into Louisana, we were pleasantly surprised by Le Pavillon. The Hotel itself was absolutely beautiful. The service was top notch, from our arrival to our departure. no matter the question we may have had, the desk always had the answer. The location was also very good. A short walk would get you anywhere you needed to go. Be it the French quarter, the river walk, or the business district. A big plus was that it was just far enough away from the quarter to be peaceful. I would definately return, should I find myself going back into New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-Places
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on the Internet before deciding on Le Pavillon for a two day visit in Sept. 2003. This was our first trip to New Orleans to celebrate an anniversary and I wanted it to be special for my wife and I. I read all the reviews of this hotel that I could find, mostly good and a few not so good. I highly recommend Le Pavillon. The property is beautiful, the accomodations, service and food were all excellent. Our experience confirmed all the good things said in the GOOD reviews that I had seen during my reseach.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay I have had”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service and ammenities at Le Pavillon were outstanding. The hotel was elegant and first class and yet the staff was incredibly down to earth, friendly and accomodating. I felt very comfortable there. I loved the beautiful roof deck pool and courtyard area. It was magical to spend time there at night. Every request was met with prompt attention. I felt very catered to and pampered in my stay there. I will definitely return to Le Pavillon if I am in New Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Royalty for a Week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Get ready to be impressed. The Le Pavillion is the ONLY place in the Big Easy to be considered for your hotel choice. We were more than impressed by the ambiance, the maintainence and the extremely friendly attitude of the staff. The Housekeeping staff went out of thier way to greet us on a daily basis. The front desk staff members were more than helpful and the whole atitude of everyone that we encountered was extremely positive and plesant. Our room was well appointed, neat and extremely clean. All of our needs were exceeded. An exceptionally nice touch was the head of housekeeping coming by to see if everything was to our satisfaction. Give yourself a treat next time you are in New Orleans. Stay at the Le Pavillion.

Reviews.Title: “Loved loved loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JanelleRJones
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the Labor Day weekend at Le Pavillon and we had a WONDERFUL time and a FABULOUS experience at the hotel. We loved the pb&j at night and found everyone at the hotel to be most friendly and helpful. The dining room is breathtaking and the buffet breakfast was terrific! The hotel itself is gorgeous - every detail of the room was beautiful and the bathroom was first class - right down to the soaps and lotions! We were both training for the Chicago marathon, so the workout room with it's treadmills, free Powerade, water and fresh fruit was especially appreciated! It was just a short walk to the French Quarter, but far enough away that we enjoyed many hours of good sleep. We won't even consider staying anywhere else next time we visit the Big Easy!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Why do people complain?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a Hotel School student in Lausanne, I was amazingly pleased to have had the opportunity to stay in such a grandiose hotel for over 2 weeks. Before going any further I wanted to share what I have learned here in my Hotel School In Lausanne: Types of Complainers Passives: no complaint, no negative wom, no third-party action Voicers: actively compain but less likely to negative wom (i.e. service providers best friend) Irates: negative wom, likely to switch (feel alienated from the marketplace) Activists: above average propensitiy to complain on all dimensionsWhat Customers expect when they complain: fair treatment Outcome fairness: customers expect ompensation that would match the level of their dissatisfaction, punishment should fit the crime (e.g. money, apology, future free service) Procedural fairness: in terms of policies, rules and timeliness of the complaint process Interaction fairness: expect to be treated politely and honestly People voicing their thoughts on this site are of course activists such as I am and really do want to be heard. When faced with problems in the hotel (which happened very occasionally) such as down-service slightly delayed during high occupancy periods, or a room service meal arriving slightly colder than expected or a problem with the contents, they were always ready to offer complimentary delights. Fair treatment, mixed with great respect and breathtaking service is what you can expect from such a hotel. Thank you le Pavillon for all you have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: liberak
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary at Le Pavillon and had a fantastic time. It is a wonderful hotel with a great atmosphere. How can you go wrong with peanut butter and jelly sandwiches every night?

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Elegance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at Le Pavillon! The lobby was beautiful and I found the staff to be most helpful, right down to the man at the door who not only opened the door for me, but also took my hand to help me up and down the steps! The roof top pool and hot tub were also beautiful with fountains and statues and extra towels so you don't have to use the ones from your room. Our room was very nice with mattresses and pillows that were more comfortable than any hotel I've ever stayed in and almost more comfortable than my own bed at home! The towels were thicker than any hotel towel I've ever used and the bathrobes were another nice bonus. Little details like this is what made my stay at Le Pavillon so wonderful. The peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and hot chocolate at night were the perfect before bed snack. While my stay would have been far too expensive for me without my conference discount and sharing a room with 3 other people, I would still find a way to stay here again. The people at the front desk were very nice about taking off parking charges for 3 days that we were not parked in their lot. No arguments at all! I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence at Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: TracyN185
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon was an excellent choice for me and my traveling companion. We enjoyed the atmosphere, the staff was tremendous and we did not have one problem with anything at the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who loves to be waited on and expects luxury when traveling. I was impressed by the courtesy and knowledge of the staff. I will stay there everytime I visit New Orleans. I have never stayed in a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days here and we were treated like royalty and The Rooms were like a B&B but with so much more class. I give the Le Pavillon a 5 Star

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely top-notch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our eighth trip to New Orleans, our first staying at La Pavillon. We got a tremendous rate for our room (early September is a very slow season for tourism); the accommodations were world-class, dining room was fabulous (we were given free desserts and comped drinks). Their rooftop swimming pool was great!! I can't say enough about the hotel. The only down-side was the concierge--didn't know where to purchase transit passes (they were supposed to be available at the hotel). As far as the previous review from someone who said that there were no ice machines--I don't what hotel they were staying at!! I'd stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “An elegant and gracious hotel”
Reviews.Author: honestabeCt
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at LePavillon. It is an elegant and gracious hotel. Our room was newly decorated and immaculate. The staff was so warm, friendly and helpful......they wanted to please each and every guest. Every request was greeted with a smile and handled promptly. We loved the easy location and will return to this establishment again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were given an anniversary gift to New Orleans and a stay at this hotel. Although we had been to New Orleans several times, never to this hotel. We arrived just when the dining room had closed. But because it was our anniversary, the kitchen staff let us in to dine. It was so romantic just the two of us. The staff did not seemed to mine. That's what I call service beyond the call of duty. The hotel stay was excellent and staff treated us like royalty. Definitely a place for anyone to "getaway".

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Pavillon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon is the perfect place to stay while in New Orleans. A short walk to everything, yet far enough removed from the action that you don't get the noise. We felt it was the perfect place to have a relaxing, peaceful vacation, while at the same time remain close to the party atmosphere that makes New Orleans famous. The suites are absolutely lovely and quite romantic. Everything was immaculately clean. The evening "turn down" service was awesome. We loved the pool and workout room. All the staff members were friendly and went out of their way to see that our stay was enjoyable. We'll stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort with Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon is a hotel with great staff and nice rooms. I am a frequent business traveler. I stayed for a week of business and was pleased to find a terrific, medium sized hotel. Located easy walking distance to the 1/4, trolley stop and MOTHER'S plus FREE HI Speed internet. Super staff with strong local knowledge.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the peanut butter & jelly sandwich!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e & I really enjoyed our stay at Le Pavillon. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and bathroom had plenty of towels. I also liked the "late night snack (pb&j)." We had one minor issue: the blankets. It was a little old.Otherwise, this is a great hotel for your next New Orleans visit. It's within walking distance from Bourbon St., French Quarter & casino.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable stay at Le Pavillion Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful stay at the Le Pavillon hotel this last July. The hotel is beautifully decorated with a mixture of both modern and antique decors. Our room has two nice queen beds and all the soft, featherly pillows and comforters. The open deck swimming pool on the top floor, even though small, offers a great view of the city at night. We really enjoyed our swim at night and the city lights. Our two little boys always looked forward to the evening complimentary "peanut butter and jelly sandwiches". But best of all, is the wonderful hotel staff. Everybody was going out of their way to make our stay one of the the most enjoyable hotel experiences we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon - The VERY best in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: LePavillon is one of, if not the best, the premiere places to stay while in New Orleans. The service is the best I have ever seen. The staff is always very courteous and accommodating. The food is wonderful. This was our first stay at Le Pavillon, but it will not be our last.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Grand Style”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Le Pavillon. The hotel has a wonderful atmosphere with a friendly, efficient staff. The room was handsomely decorated. We also enjoyed the wonderful peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and hot cocoa "evening snack". What Southern hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I want to say the Le Pavillon hotel in New Orleans takes service to the next level. I felt at home from the time I set foot in the front door, until the valet thanked me as I drove away. No let me thank the Le Pavillon hotel and their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillon's The Greatest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Le Pavillon is the greatest. We spend at least two weekends a year in downtown New Orleans for business and pleasure. The staff goes out of there way to make us feel welcome, as they do with all the guests. We had a recent emergency on our last stay and the staff was concerned not only for us but for our family. They not only helped us, but took care of our other guests who were also staying there. We have never had a problem which was not corrected by the management in a prompt and courteous manner.This Hotel is where you want to be in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at LaPavillon. The hotel is beautiful and attention to detail is great. Can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “best ever stay in this wonderful hotel in the heart of the french quarter”
Reviews.Author: eddiej6
Reviews.Content: the staff was very helpful and friendly.the room and the bed were one of the best i have ever slept in. this hotel is not the cookie cutter hotel we are used to .this one is special.love all the marble decor.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Pavillion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful place the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. I give this five stars in all areas.

Reviews.Title: “Clearly outstanding place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can say is, "wow!" Le Pavillion is a wonderful place to stay. The staff are courteous and friendly, the accomodations are superb, and the atmosphere makes it all worthwhile. I strongly urge anyone who is planning on a trip to NO to stay at LP. It's well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at Le Pavillon. It's pretty well located about 4 blocks from Canal and Bourbon. No downsides. Reasonably well outfitted fitness center, helpful concierges. Beautiful room, lobby and restauant. Free high speed internet!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at Le Pavillon was wonderful. It reminded me of the Brown Hotel or the Sealbach. The nightly bedtime snack was fun and tastey! The roof-top pool and sauna were very much appreciated at the end of long warm days of meetings and shopping. Vist and enjoy the prompt and curteous staff, the ambiance and the southern hospitality of New Orleans! Don't forget to try a hurricane.

Reviews.Title: “History...missed opportunity”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a lovely day at Le Pavillon for my Birthday in January and to my surprise...the Hotel Staff sent me a lovely bottle of water(looks like champagne) and a plate of the most delicious fruit I've ever tasted! My Evening was an especially memorable one and this Hotel made it even the more special! A great addition to my treasure chest of memories! Sincerely, GSU

Reviews.Title: “Great New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Only had the opportunity to spend one night at the Le Pavillon but had an outstanding experience. The hotel is classic older hotel in supurb condition. The ambience is formal and ornate, and the staff could not have been more accomodating or friendly. While the rooms might be slightly smaller than some newer hotels, they are beautifully furnished, and very comfortable. We had dinner at the restaurant within the hotel and found the food to be excellent and the wait staff first class. If you are looking for a memorable and unique experience that is removed from the cookie cutter chain hotel experience, Le Pavillon beautifully reflects the grandeur and hospitality that New Orleans is famous for.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful romantic experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at Le Pavillon was a remarkable, romantic experience that was the centerpiece of my proposal to my soon to be wife. The entire staff at the hotel made sure that the entire night went smoothly. I have made many enjoyable trips to New Orleans but this was by far my most memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with real Southern charm!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Probably the most wonderful, friendly place I have ever stayed! The folks there treated me like I have known them for years, facility was extremly clean, food excellent! Definatly earns its name as BELLE OF THE SOUTH! Would recommend to everyone when traveling to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever at a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had such a great stay, almost didn't want to leave the room. Had breakfast on the day of departure in the main dining room and had one of the best breakfast you could have, with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “The High-Light of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We travel quite a bit, so we have a lot of hotels to compare with Le Pavillon . In our opinion, Le Pavillon rank as one of the very best we have stayed in. The rooms were great and the hotel has a helpful and friendly staff. We are nobody special but we felt special at Le Pavillon Hotel. If we ever go back to New Orleans, we will certainly stay at Le Pavillon (if there is room). Thanks again for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon sit eh most enjoyable hotel I have stayed at in years. I kid you not. I was there for a conference, and I was amazed at the beauty of the antique furnishings. The entranceway is so grand, and the staff so welcoming. Since I was not there with my family, I was a little concerned about being alone. I felt very safe and taken care of. The room was large and decorated within the style of the hotel. The houskeeping staff were so professional, that I didn't even know they had cleaned the room until I returned from a class to see a perfect job done! The pool on the rooftop made me feel like I was whisked to another place in time. I was so relaxed. I would bring my drink up there and just sit and look at the sun and sky - and the stars at night. I want to go back with my family. and have breakfast in the gorgeous ballroom with the staff, and have peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and cocoa at 10:00 PM! Really..

Reviews.Title: “We felt like Royalty at Le Pavillion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one memorable night in New Orleans on our way to Pensacola Beach. Le Pavillion was gorgous! Doormen, Bellman, conceirge, outstanding decor..... Our room was one with bay windows. There was a raised, decorated ceiling with a ceiling fan. The beds were covered with beautiful decorative pillows. The furnishings, linens and room decor were quite fancy. The bathroom was unbelievable! Wonderful shower, beautiful sink, and black tile floors. They even provide comfortable bath robes to use in the room. My children were extremely impressed! We all went for a midnight swim in the rooftop pool. It was an experience I think my kids will always remember fondly. We walked to the French Quarter. It is not far and we never felt threatened, but it may be safer to take a taxi. Our children are 3, 10 and 13. Valet parking is required and I believe it cost $25 per night. It is billed directly to the room. Most, if not all hotels in the French quarter area charge for parking. The cheapest hotel parking we saw was $10. We got the beautiful room at Le Pavillion for such a great price that we could afford to park too. Note: I recommend you have your own sodas, etc. They are quite pricey at the hotel. **We found that there is complementary bottled water, sport drinks, and fruit in the workout room. We would definately stay there again if we could get the room for such a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfect -- couldn't have asked for more. Luxurious rooms, a wonderful staff, and great location all for a more than reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a "Belle"”
Reviews.Author: Global_Critic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true gem for the those who want an authentic New Orleans experience. The decor is the most lavish I have seen outside of 5 star European hotel. Our room was beautifully decorated and the bathroom was very ornate. Le Pavillon excelled at providing us with a great location and excellent service. We especially liked the roof top pool overlooking the skyline of the city. Beautiful at night. We'll stay again, no question!

Reviews.Title: “OK, I guess”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a few days at this hotel. We found it to be a nice place if you are the type of person that like antiques and historic hotels. The staff was very nice and efficient and the decor was impressive , however this hotel is in major NEED of some upkeep. Perhaps a newer hotel would be in better shape. F.Y.I. Valet parking at this hotels is $23.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Le Pavillion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 evenings at the hotel. Our room was more than comfortable and the people were the friendliest ever. The service was great and I would definately choose Le Pavillion once again. The "turn down" service was a great touch and we especially enjoyed the 10 oclock peanut butter and jelly sandwhiches as bedtime snack.

Reviews.Title: “A Fench Pastry”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to find this wonderful hotel in the business section of New Orleans. The hotel was within walking distance to all tourist areas. The staff was not only pleasant but helpful with all of our needs. In the evening they serve cocoa and peanut butter sandwiches! What a treat! The room was very french influenced with marble floors in the restrooms and drapes around the bed.I really enjoyed my stay at Le Pavillion and know you will too!!
